And the king said unto him, Go in peace. So he arose, and went to Hebron.	Tak onu ka ñw u kakini, Lo ke, i ra we̩ kpo̩o̩. Abe̩le̩ i kwane̩, oñ i le tu He̩bro̩n.
and six branches going out of the sides thereof; three branches of the candlestick out of the one side thereof, and three branches of the candlestick out of the other side thereof:	E̩to̩-wñ ki ta dufu akolo-wñ mejeji chʼe̩fa, e̩to̩ akete le̩ me̩ta kado akolo-wñ o̩wo̩ʼka, e̩to̩ me̩ta omune̩ la kado akolo akete le̩ o̩wo̩ ekeji;

Simon answered and said, I suppose that	Saimo̩n la dohi kakini, Eju-mi e̩ne̩ kʼi chʼe ele tule. Oñ Jisus ka ñw u kakini, O̩kpakpa-wñ e̩ ka-i.
All this have I seen, and applied my heart unto every work that is done under the sun:	U fʼe̩wñ-i du li, oñ u dʼe̩do̩ tʼuko̩lo̩ du ku ma che o̩gane̩ olu-i. I che̩nʼe̩gba kʼone̩ anʼo̩da e̩ne̩ omune̩ ki abie̩ne̩ ñw u.
Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then shall every man have praise of God. Wherefore the rather, brethren, give diligence to make your calling and election sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never fall:	Todule̩, amo̩maye, me̩ ki che̩do̩chacha tule ku me̩ che kʼedo̩ ku ma do̩ me̩ kpai echi ku ma chi me̩ ki lonyane̩ waa, todu me̩ jʼef e̩wñ le̩ ache i anʼugbo du ku me̩ aro̩ko̩ibu gbogbo alo n;

yet hath he not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, by and by he is offended.	I la nʼili o̩to̩to̩la-wñ n, i muda chʼo̩fe̩fe̩le̩; oñ e̩gba kʼo̩bata lewʼo̩la-wñ, abe̩ku amone̩ chane̩ edoli-wñ tod o̩la le̩, ababale̩ i fʼowñ dahi.

There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name	E̩ne̩ʼka dʼane̩ Uz ku ma dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Job. E̩ne̩ le̩ mufu, i la chʼe̩no̩kpakpa, e̩ne̩ ki arailo O̩jo̩ i che, kʼi la dʼubi gbʼe̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩.

And this	Oñ e̩wñ ki achʼujiwe-wñ ñwu me̩ de̩ kakini, Me̩ ali o̩me̩kpa ku ma kʼukpo wenyʼo̩la kʼi la dachi ef akpati uje̩wñ ame̩wño̩re̩.

And when I saw that ye delivered	Tak e̩gba kʼu li ka kʼame̩ jʼagba mi n, u mʼoji-mi du tinyo̩, oñ u mudaba akobʼamo̩ma Amo̩n, taku Jihofa mʼuma ko nyʼumi o̩wo̩; todule̩ e̩wñ chi ku me̩ wa ugbo mi eñini ku me̩ kʼuja ba mi ta?
There is one	I nʼe̩ne̩ kʼowñ kate dago, i la nʼekeji n, i la nʼo̩ma n, i nʼo̩maye n; i chaka dabe̩le̩ akanya uko̩lo̩-wñ la nʼuda n; e̩wñ anana-wñ la bʼeju-wñ jo̩ n; i la atene kakini, Tod e̩ne̩ oñ u nachʼakanya e̩wñ-i, kʼomi aje̩ ñw ofu e̩wñ e̩nyo̩ ki bʼonugo-mi taa? Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether it be to the king, as supreme;	Me̩ ki fʼo̩la-me̩ kamuhite̩ ñw o̩da e-one̩ du tod Ondu: dagba kʼi chʼonu kʼi tʼo̩gba,

but hast walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and hast made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to go a whoring, like to the whoredoms of the house of Ahab, and also hast slain thy brethren of thy father's house,	kʼe̩ muda lule̩ o̩na o̩na amonu Israe̩l, kʼe̩ la je̩ ñwu Juda kpʼabo ku ma dodo Je̩rusale̩m ku ma tʼachʼe̩wñ abutabu alu kʼabo unyi Ehab tʼachʼe̩wñ abutabu le, kʼe̩ laño̩ fʼamo̩maye-we̩ ku ma chʼabo unyi ata-we̩ ku ma la nyo̩ tʼuwe̩ le kpa:

And the	Ama Jihofa ka ñwu Defid, ata-mi, kakini, Abu kʼi dʼef e̩do̩-we̩ kʼe̩ kʼunyi tod odu-mi le̩, o̩me̩me̩le̩ e̩ che todubu kʼi dʼe̩do̩-we̩ le̩.

And Saul pitched in the hill of Hachilah, which	Oñ So̩l lewa ruru jo̩ uwo Hakila, kʼi dʼo̩gba aje̩tachi ej o̩na o̩mo̩. Defid la gugu ef aje̩tachi, oñ i li abu ku So̩l atʼo̩ ubi ef aje̩tachi le̩.
For, lo, as soon as the voice of thy salutation sounded in mine ears, the babe leaped in my womb for joy.	Todu go, abu kʼomu ugwa-we̩ muta tʼumi eti, o̩ma muro̩ kpu ef efu-mi noj uyo̩,
and rent the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it thee: and	kʼu la fʼojane̩ le̩ ge̩ bʼabo unyi Defid te̩, kʼu mʼu du ñw e̩; uwe̩ la muda dab alu kʼadu-mi Defid de̩ n, kʼowñ le̩ fʼuko̩ uko̩-mi de, oñ i tʼumi ubi kpʼe̩do̩-wñ chaka, e̩wñ ki chʼo̩kpakpa eju-mi kate i nache.
And the beeves	Amokuno̩ la chʼicham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ugbo ogue̩gwa nyoke me̩fa; kwef e-le̩ e̩wñ are̩ Jihofa chʼe̩te̩gwa nyoke meji,
(who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him;) and many other women which came up with him unto Jerusalem.	ama le̩ tʼowñ ubi achʼe̩wñ ñw u, e̩gba kʼi de̩ Galili; kpai abobule̩ omune̩ wewe kʼama kpai owñ kpe̩re̩ wa Je̩rusale̩m.
For the scripture saith, Whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.	Todu O̩takada O̩la O̩jo̩ kakini, Anyo̩ amu e̩ne̩ du ki ake̩do̩nʼowñ n.
So I got a girdle according to the word of the	Abe̩le̩, u fʼukpo ulago la, alu kʼo̩la ki Jihofa ka, oñ u mʼu ko lʼago-mi.
These	Be̩naya, o̩ma Jiho̩yada, fʼe̩wñ le̩ che, oñ i nʼodu ef amagbiti me̩ta le̩.
And he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.	Tak i nyʼugbo ma ef o̩ko̩; afu le̩ muda; tak ibe ef uma mukpatuka ololo ololo.
And after these things he went forth, and saw a publican, named Levi, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him,	Tak ubi e̩wñ kide̩-i i kwodufu oñ i li agbo̩kane̩ʼka kʼodu-wñ ko̩ Lifai, i gugu ugbo ku ma gba o̩kane̩, tak i ka ñw u kakini, Tʼumi ubi.
Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.	Taku So̩l kwane̩, oñ i gwo̩ru nyʼaje̩tachi Zif o̩mo̩, aboke̩le̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko me̩ta kʼi chi kwef abo Israe̩l jʼugbo-wñ ku ma tene Defid ef aje̩tachi Zif le̩.
Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamps to burn continually.	E̩ nañwa ñw amo̩ma Israe̩l ku ma kʼekpo o̩lif hiolo e-ku ma de̩ wa ñw e̩ tod agege le̩, kʼi je̩ ñw ugane̩ mʼane̩ ne̩ o̩ko̩ko̩lo̩.
Yea, all the people of the land shall bury	Ochochi, o̩chaka abo ane̩-i ako ma ji; oñ i amud e̩wñ uwohi ñwu ma o̩jo̩ kʼu fʼojima-mi ne̩, Ondu Jihofa ka-i.
And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became David's servants. Thus the	Tak i kʼabo ide jo̩ Ido̩m; oñ abo Ido̩m chaka mud amadu ñwu Defid, Jihofa la jadu Defid ugbo du kʼi nyi.
For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor things present, nor things to come,	Todu e̩do̩-mi mugba kakini, Tʼuku, tʼiñmi, tʼamonuche̩ O̩jo̩, tʼamagboji, tʼe̩wñ ki jo̩-i, tʼe̩wñ ki ache ki wa, tʼamukpahiu,
neither filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.	e̩wñ mugu mugu kpai o̩la ibe̩te̩, abe̩k o̩la iye̩ye̩-eka e-le̩ du chʼeju-wñ n; chai ugwa egwa ki koji e-le̩.
They have set her a bed in the midst of the slain with all her multitude: her graves	Ma fʼate̩ nadala te̩ ñw u alumeji abo ku ma kpa, manyʼo̩wo̩ one̩-wñ chaka; ojinoji-wñ jo̩ lʼo̩ daka; o̩chaka-ma chʼabo e̩pi odukulu kʼo̩kwo̩chageli kpa ma; todu ailo-ma la ba oj ane̩ abo ku ma deju, oñ anyo̩-ma mu ma manyʼabo ku ma gwo̩ru nyʼef o̩lo̩ulu. And as soon as we had heard	Oñ abu kʼa gbo̩, ababale̩ e̩do̩-wa muyo̩ efu-wa, une̩do̩ ño̩ bo̩ efu e̩ne̩ du ge̩ n, todu me̩; todu Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩ chʼO̩jo̩ efojale ate̩, kpai ile̩ o̩gane̩-i.

that I will break the Assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains tread him under foot: then shall his yoke depart from off them, and his burden depart from off their shoulders.	ka kʼu nagu e̩ne̩ Asiria le̩ che̩ oj ane̩-mi,

Arise, and go down to the potter's house, and there I will cause thee to hear my words.	Kwane̩, kʼe̩ gwo̩ru nyʼunyi abucha le̩, o̩mo̩ tak u naje̩ ñw e̩ gbʼo̩la-mi.
he took not away the pillar of the cloud by day, nor the pillar of fire by night,	akpa ki dago waala o̩ro̩ka le̩ kpai una ki dago waala odu la kwo bʼamone̩ le̩ o̩gba te̩ n.

And Omri went up from Gibbethon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged Tirzah.	Tak O̩mri kwo Gibe̩to̩n te̩gu alo, abo Israe̩l chaka la le bʼo̩, oñ ma kwokpala nyu Tirza.
Do they not err that devise evil?	I chela oñ abo ku ma ñw ibe e̩bie̩ne̩ ala-i n?
Whatsoever shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when there is sprinkled of the blood thereof upon any garment, thou shalt wash that whereon it was sprinkled in the holy place.	E̩wñ du ki kado e̩la-wñ afo̩; e̩gba kʼe̩bie̩ le̩ ta nyʼe̩wñ o̩laʼka, e̩ ki fʼe̩wñ kʼi ta nyʼu le̩ gwe̩ ef uña ki afo̩.

And he said, Peaceably: I am come to sacrifice unto the	Tak i kakini, Ure̩do̩ i che; u wa kʼu fʼiche̩bo̩ che ñwu Jihofa; me̩ gwʼo̩la-me̩ rinyo̩ ku me̩ fo̩, ku me̩ lebʼumi nyʼoko iche̩bo̩ le̩. Tak i fu Je̩si kpai amo̩ma-wñ o̩la gwo rinyo̩ ku ma fo̩, oñ i do̩ ma wʼugbo iche̩bo̩ le̩.
and Parmashta, and Arisai, and Aridai, and Vajezatha,	kpai Parmashta kpai Arisai kpai Aridai kpai Faizata.

and Aram begat Aminadab; and Aminadab begat Naasson; and Naasson begat Salmon;	Ram la bi Aminadab. Aminadab la bi Naasho̩n. Naasho̩n la bi Salmo̩n.

So Hannah rose up after they had eaten in Shiloh, and after they had drunk. Now Eli the priest sat upon a seat by a post of the temple of the	Oñ abu ku ma fʼe̩wñ je̩ ku ma la ñmo̩ Shailo o̩mo̩, Hana kwane̩. (Ilai, atama la gugu oji e̩wñ ugbo oli alugbo̩na unyi Jihofa.)

And there they left their images, and David and his men burned them.	Oñ ma tʼojibo ojibo-ma no̩ jʼomo, taku Defid kpʼabo-wñ mʼu ko kwʼo̩mo̩.

And they that found him gathering sticks brought him unto Moses and Aaron, and unto all the congregation.	Oñ abo ku ma fʼu li abu kʼi achʼiji mʼowñ du wʼugbo Mose̩s kpai Aro̩n kpai ugbo abo̩gbadu le̩ chaka.

Command the children of Israel, that they give unto the Levites of the inheritance of their possession cities to dwell in; and ye shall give	E̩ ki ñwa ñw amo̩ma Israe̩l ku ma ki kʼewo ewo kwef e̩wñ ogu e-ma ñw abo Lifai ku ma dodo; me̩ ki ño̩ kʼane̩ ije̩ ki lʼewo ewo-ma daka ñw abo Lifai ge̩.

In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years over all Israel and Judah.	I fʼo̩fe̩ Juda o̩do̩ mebie kpai ochu me̩fa je̩ He̩bro̩n o̩mo̩; tak i fʼo̩fe̩ abo Israe̩l kpai abo Juda chaka je̩ o̩do̩ ogue̩gwa nyoke me̩ta Je̩rusale̩m ge̩.

and the hangings of the court, and the hanging for the door of the gate of the court, which	kpai ukpo ku ma du bʼologbo kpai ukpo tod alo̩na ologbo ki lʼuña ugugu kpai ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ daka, kpai iku-wñ kpai ane̩ uko̩lo̩-wñ chaka; e̩wñ du ku ma che ugbo ane̩ uko̩lo̩ le̩, ama ache,
Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the	Tak amo̩maye-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpʼamo̩maye-wñ onobule̩ kpʼabo du kʼi ma ma akwoubi, wʼugbo-wñ, oñ ma bʼo̩ jʼuje̩wñ ef unyi-wñ; oñ ma jʼachʼiwo̩-wñ, ma nyʼu e̩do̩ tod e̩bie̩ne̩ du ku Jihofa ko wa abʼo ma le̩. Zenan, and Hadashah, and Migdal-gad,	Zenan kpai Hadasha kpai Midgal-gad
And in these days came prophets from Jerusalem unto Antioch.	Adiko le̩ amakache̩ iche̩ka la kwo Je̩rusale̩m gwo̩ru nyʼAntio̩k.

Nevertheless what saith the scripture? Cast out the bondwoman and her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son of the freewoman.	AbʼO̩takada O̩la O̩jo̩ muda ka ta? I kakini, Me̩ fʼimo̩to̩ uko̩lo̩ le̩ kpai o̩ma-wñ ne dufu: todu i nʼugbo du kʼo̩ma imo̩to̩ uko̩lo̩ aje̩ e̩wñ ogu manyʼo̩ma o̩mone̩ le̩ n.
And if by grace, then	I la che̩wñ kʼi chʼufe̩de̩nyo̩ che, mak i ño̩ kwef uko̩lo̩ eche ge̩ n; cho̩kpo̩ni ufe̩de̩nyo̩ ma ño̩ chʼufe̩de̩nyo̩ ge̩ n.
Neither say they in their heart, Let us now fear the	Ma la ka ef e̩do̩-ma kakini,
And Moses said, Wherefore now do ye transgress the commandment of the	Taku Mose̩s kakini, E̩wñ chi ku me̩ jʼadaba o̩la ku Jihofa nʼalu-wñ ka le̩ fai ke? I anʼoji n.
And no sin offering, whereof	Ma muda aje̩ e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ adure du ku ma dʼe̩bie̩-wñ wʼef unyabo ujeju ku ma ne̩ che e̩wñ e̩boma ef uña ki afo̩ le̩ n; ma anʼuna gu e-le̩ jo.
Then said Saul unto his armourbearer, Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through, and abuse me. But his armourbearer would not; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took a sword, and fell upon it.	Taku So̩l ka ñw e̩ne̩ kʼi anʼane̩ ogu-wñ kakini, Mʼugbada-we̩ wo̩ kʼe̩ du gwunyʼumi, tode̩gba kʼabo e̩pi odukulu-i awa dʼu gwunyʼumi, ku ma gwʼumi uke̩. Ama e̩ne̩ kʼi anʼane̩ o̩gu-wñ le̩ je̩ che n; todu i achokpo nana. Todule̩ So̩l mʼugbada-wñ du, oñ i lewane̩ abʼo ma.
On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, prince of the children of Dan,	O̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwa-wñ chʼAhieze̩r o̩ma Amishadai, kʼi chʼidachi abo Dan:
And Moses said unto Aaron, Go unto the altar, and offer thy sin offering, and thy burnt offering, and make an atonement for thyself, and for the people: and offer the offering of the people, and make an atonement for them; as the	Taku Mose̩s ka ñw Aro̩n kakini, Te̩ me̩ru ugbo ubo̩ iche̩bo̩-i kʼe̩ fʼiche̩bo̩ adure-we̩ kpai iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo-we̩ che, kʼe̩ la fʼe̩wñ e̩boma che tod o̩la-we̩ kpai todu amone̩-i; tak e̩ mʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩ e-amone̩-i kowa kʼe̩ che e̩wñ e̩boma todu ma; alu ki Jihofa ñwate̩.
And the families of Kirjath-jearim; the Ithrites, and the Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zareathites, and the Eshtaulites.	O̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu Kiriat-jearim la che abo Itrai, kpai abo Piu-hai kpai abo Shumat kpai abo Mishra; ama chʼe̩te̩ abo Zara kpai abo E̩shteul.
Then there went	Tak abo iche̩ka nyʼaka ñwu Defid alu ku ma che abo-wñ, oñ i fʼone̩ kpe̩ ledo ma; todu abo le̩ chanyo̩ gbali. Tak onu kakini, Me̩ jo̩ Je̩riko gbogbo tak ilagba-me̩ ki gwe̩, taku me̩ dabiwa.
Behold, God	Go, O̩jo̩ chʼujadu-mi;
Thy testimonies also	O̩la ibenu-we̩ chʼuyo̩-mi,
And thou shalt make two cherubims	Uwe̩ ki la nʼo̩jamalia che amiche̩rub meji; eruru oñ e̩ gwu, ma ajo̩ iba ugugu unye̩do̩ le̩ mejeji.
	Tak onu mʼohi-wñ du kpuche̩ ru Rehum, agboji amatohio̩la, kpai Shimshai, ako̩takada le̩, kpai abo umana-ma ku ma dodo Samaria, kpai ugbo ki-bo̩ ejudaba ohimini le̩ kakini, I ra ñw me̩ kpoo̩, abe̩le̩, abe̩le̩.
As the thief is ashamed when he is found, so is the house of Israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests, and their prophets,	Alu kʼanyo̩ amu ajoji e̩gba kʼamone̩ fʼu li,
But now, because	Fa-i, ukpe̩ kʼO̩jo̩ ma wa fejudʼe̩ ef uwe̩do̩ n,
Doth God pervert judgment?	O̩jo̩ arʼoji ajo̩ o̩kpakpa da?
They hatch cockatrice' eggs, and weave the spider's web: he that eateth of their eggs dieth, and that which is crushed breaketh out into a viper.	Ma kpa e̩ge̩ o̩fanuñwa,
And Jephthah said unto the elders of Gilead, Did not ye hate me, and expel me out of my father's house? and why are ye come unto me now when ye are in distress?	Taku Je̩fta ka ñw abogijo Gilead kakini, I chʼulaka-mi me̩ che oñ me̩ ne mi bʼunyi ata-mi te̩ n? E̩wñ chi ku me̩ gbe̩re̩ mi abu ku ma kobʼume̩-i?
And they burnt the house of God, and brake down the wall of Jerusalem, and burnt all the palaces thereof with fire, and destroyed all the goodly vessels thereof.	Taku ma fʼunyi O̩jo̩ gujo rinyo̩, oñ ma fʼaku Je̩rusale̩m gulo̩ wane̩, ma la fʼuna tʼunyi alifia-wñ chaka agujo rinyo̩, oñ ma fʼe̩wñ eku-wñ e-o̩me̩me̩le̩ chaka kpabie̩ rinyo̩.
And he said, Thou hast asked a hard thing:	Tak i kakini, E̩wñ ki gbiti e̩ tene le̩; iche̩wñ kʼuwe̩ ali mi abu ku ma adʼumi bʼe̩ te̩, mak i adʼabe̩le̩ ñw e̩; e̩ ma muda li n, i adʼabe̩le̩ n.
And he said to Gehazi his servant, Call this Shunammite. And when he had called her, she stood before him.	Tak i ka ñw Ge̩hezai, imo̩to̩-wñ, kakini, Dʼe̩ne̩ Shune̩m-i wa. Oñʼe̩gba kʼi fʼu do̩ i lewa dago o̩gba-wñ.
The firstfruit	Uwe̩ ako ejo̩ga oka-we̩ kpai e-omi achiwebe̩te̩ma-we̩ e-etito̩ kpai e-ekpo-we̩ kpai ejo̩ga edudu ame̩wño̩re̩-we̩ egini ku ma ja ñw u.
And David and all Israel played before God with all	Oñ Defid kpʼabo Israe̩l chaka chiya alu du kʼukpahiu-ma de̩ o̩gba Jihofa, ma nʼeli ako̩ kpʼokugulu kpʼumolo anu, kpai ubo̩ kpai eicha kpai oke kpai o̩kakachi.
Now concerning the collection for the saints, as I have given order to the churches of Galatia, even so do ye.	Oñ ugbo o̩la o̩ko̩ ete̩ tod abo kiafo̩ le̩, dabalu kʼu ñwa ñw ujeju abudo̩ Ondu Galatia, abe̩le̩ ame̩ ki ño̩ che ge̩.
But those riches perish by evil travail: and he begetteth a son, and	e̩wñ anana le̩ la alenyo̩ rʼo̩wo̩ lʼugbo e̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ kʼi adʼu che. I la che̩wñ kʼi fʼo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi e̩wñ abo̩ o̩wo̩-wñ n.
that make a man an offender for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth in the gate, and turn aside the just for a thing of nought.	ku ma kpʼone̩ abi tod o̩la ki fʼo̩ alu,
Then Joshua called the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh,	Taku Jo̩shua fʼabo Rube̩n kpai abo Gad kpai ukpe̩reji abo o̩lo̩pu Manasa le̩ do̩ wa,
Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, saying, This	E̩ ki ka ñw Aro̩n kpai amo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kakini, E̩wñ ki la chʼuko̩-o̩la e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ adure de̩. Ugbo ku ma kpa e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo, o̩mo̩ ma akpa e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ adure o̩gba Jihofa; e̩wñ kiafo̩ e-efo̩ i che.
And ye shall circumcise the flesh of your foreskin; and it shall be a token of the covenant betwixt me and you.	Me̩ la ada o̩re̩la e-año̩ ki bʼo̩gba-me̩ ma le̩, oñ e-le̩ achʼujiwe alo ki tʼagbagba omi kpai ame̩.
Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters unto Tobiah, and	Anoji e-le̩ ge̩, iko le̩ abojima amaJu ko̩ o̩takada wewe kpuche̩ru Tobaya. O̩takada e-Tobaya la wʼugbo e-ma.
Thine, O	Uwe̩, O Jihofa nʼunana-wñ kpʼukpahiu-wñ kpʼojima-wñ kpʼugbiñmi-wñ, kpʼe̩gahi-wñ inaina, todu uwe̩, ne̩ e̩wñ du ki jʼefojale kpʼane̩-ile̩; o̩da ojane̩-wñ uwe̩ ne̩, O Jihofa, oñ uwe̩ dʼatate̩ ñw e̩wñ du kʼe̩ chʼoji.
Moreover the soul that shall touch any unclean	I la che̩wñ kʼe̩wñ e̩daji kwokadʼone̩, dagba kʼi chʼe̩daji e-one̩ dagba kʼi chʼe̩daji e-e̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩, abe̩k e̩wñ elifo̩ kʼi chʼe̩wñ e̩do̩fulu du ki achʼone̩ ire̩, tak i fʼe̩la iche̩bo̩ ure̩do̩ e-Jihofa je̩, ma akʼonugo e̩ne̩ le̩ da bʼabo-wñ te̩.

and he shall have it, and his seed after him,	oñ i ado̩mo̩ ñw owñ kpai amugbe̩-wñ ubi owñ, owñ chʼalo uko̩lo̩ atama eche o̩gbegbele̩, todabu kʼi jogu tod O̩jo̩-wñ, kʼi la fʼe̩wñ e̩boma che tod abo Israe̩l.
And when these lepers came to the uttermost part of the camp, they went into one tent, and did eat and drink, and carried thence silver, and gold, and raiment, and went and hid	Tak e̩gba kʼaboga ikpemute le̩ lewa nʼuru le̩, ma le tʼef unyaboʼka, ma la fʼe̩wñ je̩ ma la ñmo̩, taku ma kʼajifa kwʼo̩mo̩ kpʼo̩jamalia kpʼe̩wñ o̩la, oñ ma mʼu ko maja; taku ma mu dabi, oñ ma mugudu tʼef unyabo omune̩, oñ ma mʼe̩wñ ko kwʼo̩mo̩ ge̩, ma laño̩ mʼu ko wa maja.

Micah the Morasthite prophesied in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and spake to all the people of Judah, saying, Thus saith the	Maika e̩ne̩ Mo̩reshe̩t le̩ kache̩ iko He̩ze̩kaya, onu Juda, oñ i ka ñw amone̩ Juda chaka kakini, Abu ki Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du aka de̩, kakini,
And the king of Assyria brought	Tak onu Asiria kʼamone̩ kwo Babilo̩n wa, kpai kwo Kuta, kpai kwo Afa, kpai kwo Hemat, kpai Se̩farfe wa, oñ i mʼuma ko jʼef ewo ewo Samaria koji amo̩ma Israe̩l; tak ama gbʼane̩ Samaria nyʼo̩wo̩, oñ ma kwododo ef ewo ewo-wñ.
Then was our mouth filled with laughter,	E̩gbale̩ alu-wa chʼanyi,
O	O, Jihofa, uwe̩ chʼO̩jo̩-mi;
Therefore I counsel that all Israel be generally gathered unto thee, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, as the sand that	Ama e-ku li de̩ kakini, Kʼama ki kʼabo Israe̩l chaka jo̩ ugbo we̩, akwo Dan gbogbo wa Birshiba, ku ma wewe dab e̩lanyi ohimini; kʼeju-we̩ onugo ki dʼane̩ ef ogu le̩.
Then Achish gave him Ziklag that day: wherefore Ziklag pertaineth unto the kings of Judah unto this day.	Tak Akish mu Ziklag du ñw u o̩jo̩ le̩. Todule̩ o̩wo̩ amonu Juda ne̩ Ziklag gbogbo tʼeñini.
and let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:	a ki nadibete̩ omune̩ kʼa kʼomune̩ e̩che̩ tef ufe̩do̩ kpʼuko̩lo̩ o̩me̩me̩le̩ e̩che̩,
And they answered, We will willingly give	Taku ma dohi kakini, A ko ñw e̩ kpai e̩do̩ʼka. Taku ma fʼukpo̩ʼka nadala te̩, oñ e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ kʼake̩ti ki dʼef e̩wñ kʼogu kʼi je̩ nyʼefu-wñ.
Moab	Moab chʼukpachi ugwo̩la-mi;
Every man of the children of Israel shall pitch by his own standard, with the ensign of their father's house: far off about the tabernacle of the congregation shall they pitch.	E̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ abo Israe̩l du afa unyabo-wñ ugbo agaliga e-wñ, kpenyʼe̩wñ ujiwe abunyi amata-ma; ama afa unyabo-ma jo̩ akpejurʼunyabo ujeju alʼo daka.

and said	i kakini, E̩wñ dʼume̩ e̩do̩ ku me̩ du ñwu mi, tak omi adʼu ñwu me̩? Taku ma mʼajifa ogue̩gwa ko jʼoj e̩bo̩ ñw u.
At that time did Hezekiah cut off	Iko le̩ He̩ze̩kaya mʼe-ki jʼalugbana unyi Jihofa ko̩da wane̩ kpai akwo o̩la oli ugbogaga-wñ, owñ chʼe-ku He̩ze̩kaya onu Juda ko wenyʼu le̩, oñ i mʼu ko ñw onu Asiria.
let a little water, I pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves under the tree:	E̩ je̩ ñwu ma che omiofo wa pe̩, ku me̩ gwe̩ e̩re̩-me̩, ku me̩ ñmi ofʼoli-i.
And his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.	Amako̩che̩-wñ la rewa ka kʼi che̩ko̩tane̩ kakini, E̩do̩-mi ki tʼunyi-we̩ akʼumi e̩che̩.
Dig thou through the wall in their sight, and carry out thereby.	Fʼo̩do̩ gwa gudu eju-ma, kʼe̩ kʼane̩-we̩ lʼo̩mo̩ dufu.
And David commanded his young men, and they slew them, and cut off their hands and their feet, and hanged	Taku Defid ñwa ñw abokolobia-wñ, oñ ma mu ma ko kpa, ma la kʼuma o̩wo̩ kpai e̩re̩ da, taku ma kʼoku-ma lo̩ko̩li o̩wo̩ʼka abukpe omi He̩bro̩n. Ma muda mʼoji Ishbo̩she̩t du, oñ ma mʼu du ji ef oji Abina He̩bro̩n o̩mo̩.
and by their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceeding grace of God in you.	Oñ ef o̩ko̩ kʼama gba bʼO̩jo̩ todu me̩ ma añeju-me̩, tod ufe̩de̩nyo̩ O̩jo̩ ki tabale ki dʼugbo me̩.
If therefore the whole church be come together into one place, and all speak with tongues, and there come in	Todule̩ iche̩wñ kʼo̩gbo̩ ujeju abudo̩ Ondu du wajugbo kate, kʼo̩chaka-ma ako̩la alʼichi ichi, oñ amo̩talaka abe̩k abo ku ma ma ke̩do̩no n mugudu wʼo̩mo̩, ama aka ku me̩ ko̩la dab ahimu n?
And I heard a man's voice between	Oñ u gbo̩ omuko̩la one̩ aji Ulai, e-le̩ dudo̩, oñ i kakini, Gebrie̩l, e̩ che kʼe̩ne̩-i ki moji ane̩ kʼi go le̩.
grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.	ufe̩de̩nyo̩ kpʼure̩do̩ ki dʼugbo me̩ kwʼugbo O̩jo̩ Ata kpʼOndu Jisus Kraisti.

Even so it is not the will of your Father which is in heaven, that one of these little ones should perish.	Abe̩le̩ i la dʼAta-me̩ ki dʼefojale e̩do̩ todu kʼabo egini-iʼka kʼi lenyo̩ n.

and cinnamon, and odours, and ointments, and frankincense, and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and wheat, and beasts, and sheep, and horses, and chariots, and slaves, and souls of men.	kpai sinamo̩n kpʼe̩wñ ido̩ro̩ kpʼotulale kpʼekpo ku ma du kurʼo̩la kpai frankinse̩ns kpʼomi achiwebe̩te̩ma kpʼekpo kpʼomu te̩ke̩ te̩ke̩ kpʼo̩ka wit kpʼamokuno̩ kpʼamala, kpʼamanya, kpʼo̩ko̩ kʼanya afo̩ kpʼaño̩la one̩, kpʼamonugo amone̩.
He only	Owñ kate chʼokuta-mi kpai ujadu-mi,
Then Asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasures of the house of the	Tak Esa mʼajifa kpʼo̩jamalia ko kwef e̩wñ akoko unyi O̩jo̩ kpʼe-unyi onu, oñ i kʼo kpuche̩ ru Be̩n-hedad onu Siria, kʼi gugu Damaskus, kakini,
And the men of Israel, beside Benjamin, were numbered four hundred thousand men that drew sword: all these	Oñ aboke̩le̩ Israe̩l, ku ma chʼojoji ñw abo Be̩njamin ku ma kaluka le̩ chʼaboke̩le̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ulo̩ko̩ ku ma bʼugbada ewo jo̩; aboke̩le̩-i chaka chʼame̩nogu.
For the cherubims spread forth	Todu amiche̩rub nʼika-ma dala oji uña akpati le̩, oñ amiche̩rub le̩ bʼoji akpati le̩ kpai oli ugbo̩lo̩-wñ ate̩ ma.
And the drink offering thereof	Oñ iche̩bo̩ omi-wñ achʼukpe̩le̩ hinʼka tod o̩malaʼka; uwe̩ ki du o̩te̩ una wa da jʼane̩ ñwu Jihofa ef uña kiafo̩ le̩.
Thirty and two years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years, and departed without being desired. Howbeit they buried him in the city of David, but not in the sepulchres of the kings.	O̩do̩-wñ chʼogue̩gwa nyoke meji e̩gba kʼi chane̩ ejʼonu, oñ i jonu Je̩rusale̩m o̩do̩ me̩jo̩; uku-wñ la wʼe̩ne̩ du eju n. Ma mʼu du ji ef ewo Defid, i muda chʼef ulo̩ja amonu n.
But	1 muda chʼe-abo ki rʼuma e̩do̩ ku ma lule̩ tʼe̩wñ-ma ki akʼone̩ e̩do̩fulu ire̩ kpʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩-ma ubi, nadʼakoji e̩wñ ku ma che le̩ wa abʼuma onugo oji ma, Ondu Jihofa ka-i.
And he came and found them asleep again: for their eyes were heavy.	Tak abu kʼi ño̩ mudabi wa, i fʼuma li abu ku ma jʼalolu, todu igbegbeneju-ma woji ñw olu.
And he wrote in the letter, saying, Set ye Uriah in the forefront of the hottest battle, and retire ye from him, that he may be smitten, and die.	I ko̩ nyʼef o̩takada le̩ kakini, DʼUraya-i dago o̩gba ogu ugbo kʼi kpuna tule, tak e̩ te̩ ubi bʼo̩ te̩, ku ma mʼu du kpa.
Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du, ki chʼO̩jo̩ Israe̩l, aka de̩, kakini, Ame̩ li e̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ du kʼu kowa abi Je̩rusale̩m kpai ewo ewo Juda du ma; e̩ la go, egbili e̩lanyi kpʼokuta i che eñini-i, e̩ne̩ du la gugu o̩mo̩ n.
I should have been as though I had not been;	omi ma de̩ dabe̩ne̩ kʼomi ma de̩ mama ta n,
And the cedar of the house within	Oli sida ki bʼejefu unyi le̩ ma chʼe̩kina dab e̩rʼugba kpai ododo; oli sida i che chaka; ma li okuta-wñ du n.
To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the Holy One.	Mak e̩ne̩ me̩ adʼumi wawe-wñ
I and	Omi kpai Ata chʼoka.
The Lord at thy right hand	Ondu kʼi dʼowe̩ awo̩to̩-we̩ le̩,

His servants therefore took him out of that chariot, and put him in the second chariot that he had; and they brought him to Jerusalem, and he died, and was buried in	Abe̩le̩ abuko̩lo̩-wñ mʼu du kwef okogu le̩ oñ ma mʼu du tef o̩kogu ekeji kʼi ne̩, taku ma mʼu du wa Je̩rusale̩m; i la leku, oñ ma mʼu du ji ef ojinoji amata-wñ. And Jehu drew a bow with his full strength, and smote Jehoram between his arms, and the arrow went out at his heart, and he sunk down in his chariot.	Taku Jihiu mʼo̩o̩do̩-wñ du nʼo̩wo̩, oñ i ta amu Joram agbade o̩papata ojika-wñ meji, oñ o̩fa-wñ mutu e̩do̩-wñ kpakpa, oñ i nyiwo̩lo̩ wʼane̩ ef oko ogu-wñ.
Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoever I command you.	Ame̩ chʼamonuku-mi, iche̩wñ ku me̩ chʼe̩wñ kʼomi tuko̩ ñwu me̩.
But as the days of Noe	Oñ alu ki de̩ o̩kpanachi Noa, abe̩le̩ ewa O̩ma One̩ ade̩.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s egbili Moab o̩la Jo̩rdan odenideni Je̩riko le̩ kakini,
And the heathen shall know that I the	Tak abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi ama ka kʼomi, Jihofa, ache ñw abo Israe̩l ku ma fo̩, owñ chʼe̩gba kʼuña-mi kiafo̩ adʼalumeji-ma o̩gbegbele̩.
And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem, and men of Judah, judge, I pray you, betwixt me and my vineyard.	Oñ fa-i, ame̩ ku me̩ dodo Je̩rusale̩m kpai aboke̩le̩ Juda, nagbo̩ko̩bʼume̩ ku me̩ dale agbagba-mi
but I will send a fire on the wall of Tyrus, which shall devour the palaces thereof.	Omi la dʼuna kpuche̩ wa abʼo̩lo̩do̩ Taya ma,
for that	todu e̩wñ kate kʼi ne̩ bʼo̩la ma de̩, e̩wñ kʼi adu bʼaño̩la-wñ ma i che; e̩wñ i adʼu bʼo̩la ma adachi? Oñ i awatu e̩gba kʼi araku do̩ mi, nagbo̩, todu e̩ne̩ kʼi ali one̩ eju omi che.
partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.	o̩wo̩ʼka-wñ chʼabu ku ma mʼume̩ ko jo̩ ñw ina kpʼo̩bata ku me̩ chʼe̩wñ igo; o̩wo̩ ekeji-wñ owñ ño̩ chʼabu ku me̩ mud abo ku ma tuta kpʼabo ku ma che ma abe̩le̩.
And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.	E̩wñ omune̩ wewe ku Jisus che la ño̩ do̩mo̩ ge̩; iche̩wñ ku ma fʼe̩wñ le̩ ko̩ rʼef o̩takada okoka, eju-mi ile̩-i ma anʼuña bʼo̩takada ku ma ko̩ le̩ jo̩ n.
shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, Woe to him that increaseth	Abo-i du akpʼita rʼo̩ oji n? ku ma achʼo uke̩ kakini,
After these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed he	Ubi e̩wñ kide̩ Jisus dabi dʼo̩la-wñ tejugede ñw amako̩che̩-wñ o̩l ohimini Taiberias: abu kʼi dʼu tejugede la de̩:

whiles by the experiment of this ministration they glorify God for your professed subjection unto the gospel of Christ, and for	Lef eñwa ku ma ñwa e̩wñ ku me̩ che ñw one̩ go, ma jʼadʼojima ñw O̩jo̩ abu ku me̩ fʼo̩la-me̩, kamuhi teju alu ku me̩ gbalu Uche̩nyo̩ Kraisti, kpʼo̩wo̩ ku me̩ chi ñwone̩ ef uta kʼame̩ ta kpʼama kpʼamone̩ du-i.

He slew of Edom in the valley of salt ten thousand, and took Selah by war, and called the name of it Joktheel unto this day.	I fʼabo Ido̩m icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩gwa kpa ef o̩go̩ Omu, i ño̩ gba Sela ef ogu, tak i dʼodu o̩mo̩ ko̩ Jo̩ktie̩l, gbogbo tʼeñini.

praying always with all prayer and supplication in the Spirit, and watching thereunto with all perseverance and supplication for all saints;	Lef adua kpai o̩ko̩ e̩gbabʼo du; me̩ nachadua iko tʼiko du ef Afu, me̩ ki la gwe̩ke̩ adide-wñ, me̩ fejugbiti alu du ku me̩ gbo̩ko̩bo̩ tod abo kiafo̩ du,
But when Peter was come to Antioch, I withstood him to the face, because he was to be blamed.	Ama e̩gba ku Kifas lewa Antio̩k, eju-wñ u ko̩ nyʼo̩wo̩, todu i dʼugbo kʼi akpʼo̩la-wñ abi.
Moreover whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom he called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also glorified.	oñ abo kʼi fʼuma date̩ tane̩, abo le̩ oñ i fʼuma do̩; abo kʼi fʼuma do̩ le̩, abo le̩ oñ i dale ñwu ma; abo kʼi fʼale da ñwu ma le̩, abo le̩ oñ i dʼojima ñwu ma.

Howbeit he refused to turn aside: wherefore Abner with the hinder end of the spear smote him under the fifth	I muda ko̩ ena tʼo̩wo̩ʼka; todule̩ Abina mʼofe o̩kwo̩-wñ du gwunyʼu o̩la. and with him ten princes, of each chief house a prince throughout all the tribes of Israel; and each one	ma fʼamidachi me̩gwa kpe̩ lebʼo̩, idachiʼka kwef unyi e̩ne̩fe̩nyiʼka todu o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu abo Israe̩l okoke; e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-ma la chʼe̩nuto̩gba unyi ata-wñ kʼi nʼo̩da akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi abo Israe̩l chaka.

thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers, and	todule̩ i ma dukpe̩ kʼe̩ mʼo̩ko̩-mi ko ñw abo ku ma dʼo̩ko̩ ta, tak omi ma wa agba e̩wñ-mi manyʼile oji-wñ.

And Balaam answered and said unto the servants of Balak, If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the word of the	Belam muda dohi ñw amadu Bele̩k kakini, Dagba Bele̩k mʼajifa kpai o̩jamalia e̩ko̩ unyi-wñ ko ñwu mi, u neke le gu o̩la Jihofa O̩jo̩-mi du, kʼu nache e-ki nya abe̩k e-ki tule n.

Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,	Ehaz o̩ma-wñ. He̩ze̩kaya o̩ma-wñ Manasa o̩ma-wñ,

And whosoever shall give to drink unto one of these little ones a cup of cold	Oñ e̩ne̩ du kʼi che kʼi dʼago omi urudo̩do̩ ñw abo o-kekele-iʼka kʼi ñmo̩ ukpe̩ kʼi ma ka kʼako̩che̩ de̩ kate— Ami, naka ñwu me̩ kakini, I nʼugbo du kʼuro̩me̩-wñ alenyo̩ n.
For what the law could not do, in that it was weak through the flesh, God sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh, and for sin, condemned sin in the flesh:	Todu e̩wñ kʼo̩lo̩da ma neke che n, ef e̩gbo̩ kʼi ne̩ lef o̩re̩la, abu kʼO̩jo̩ fʼO̩ma e-wñ onugo kpuche̩ wa ef e̩wñ ki bi o̩re̩la e-adure kʼi chi udu adure, i kpʼadure ef o̩re̩la abi,
Woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of knowledge: ye entered not in yourselves, and them that were entering in ye hindered.	Atogwo ki chʼe-me̩, amam oli-o̩lo̩da! todabu kʼame̩ mʼigede uma-e̩wñ du: ame̩ onugo la gudu tʼejefu n, oñ me̩ fʼo̩na kpanyʼabo ku ma jʼagudu.
Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of the	O̩do̩ meji ajo̩ tak u nakʼe̩wñ eku unyi Jihofa dabi wa jʼuña-i n, owñ chʼe-ki Ne̩biukadne̩za, onu Babilo̩n, ko kwʼuña-i nyi Babilo̩n le̩.
As for the wheels, it was cried unto them in my hearing, O wheel.	I chʼe-o̩da o̩da le̩, u gbo̩ abu ku ma do̩ ma ko̩ o̩da o̩da ki arida bilibilibili.
Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.	Me̩ lewa, kʼa mugwo̩ru nyʼo̩mo kʼa fʼalu ichi-ma gwuji, todu kʼama ki we egbʼoji o̩la omune̩.
Thy wickedness	E̩wñ bibi-we̩ neke chʼone̩ e̩go̩-we̩,
But if the unbelieving depart, let him depart. A brother or a sister is not under bondage in such	I la che̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ ki ma ke̩do̩nʼOndu n kwo bʼo̩ te̩, i ki kwo ke. O̩maye e-e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ abe̩k o̩maye e-onobule̩ le̩ mud adu ef e̩wñ abe̩le̩ n. O̩jo̩ la fʼuwa do̩ ef ure̩do̩.
But they rebelled against me, and would not hearken unto me: they did not every man cast away the abominations of their eyes, neither did they forsake the idols of Egypt: then I said, I will pour out my fury upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.	Ma muda lañu rʼumi oñ ma ko̩ ene-tirʼumi; e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-ma la kʼe̩wñ ki akʼone̩ e̩do̩fulu ire̩ eju-wñ ro̩ tinyo̩ n, ma la hi ode ode Ijipti tinyo̩ n.
Then Daniel answered with counsel and wisdom to Arioch the captain of the king's guard, which was gone forth to slay the wise	Taku Danie̩l dabi dohi ibe ibe ñw Erio̩k, kʼi chʼagboji abo ide onu kʼi dufu kʼi kpa amanibe Babilo̩n;
But Jonathan Saul's son delighted much in David: and Jonathan told David, saying, Saul my father seeketh to kill thee: now therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself until the morning, and abide in a secret place, and hide thyself:	Taku Jo̩natan ka ñwu Defid kakini, So̩l, ata-mi, afeju kʼi dʼuwe̩ kpa; todule̩ narodubʼe̩ kʼe̩ fʼo̩la-we̩ de odudu, kʼe̩ kwogugu ugbo o̩fio̩lifio̩, kʼe̩ dʼo̩la-we̩ maja:
For after this manner in the old time the holy women also, who trusted in God, adorned themselves, being in subjection unto their own husbands:	Todu abe̩le̩ abobule̩ kiafo̩ ku ma kibenʼO̩jo̩ akwoubi le̩ chʼijaga e-ma ge̩, ma fʼo̩la-ma kamuhite̩ ñw amo̩ko̩ e-ma

but glory, honour, and peace, to every man that worketh good, to the Jew first, and also to the Gentile:	Ama ojima kpʼubumo̩ kpʼure̩do̩ muda ado̩mo̩ ñw e̩ne̩ du ki achʼuko̩lo̩ e̩nyo̩, tʼe̩ne̩ Ju ejodudu kpʼe̩ne̩ Grik ge̩;

Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa, Agbʼe̩ tane̩ te̩,
For by thy words thou shalt be justified, and by thy words thou shalt be condemned.	Todu ef o̩la alu-we̩ ma adale ñw e̩, oñ ef o̩la alu-we̩ ma la akpʼuwe̩ abi.
And he cast four rings for the four ends of the grate of brass,	I nʼebijeikpa fʼelika me̩le̩ da todu uka me̩le̩ ebijeikpa kpataka le̩, kʼi chʼugbo ku ma ko ugbo̩lo̩ oli le̩ tunyʼu;

Now the rest of the acts of Jehu, and all that he did, and all his might,	Oñ inabali e̩wñ ki bo̩ ki Jihiu che, kpʼe̩wñ du kʼi che, e-le̩ che̩ko̩ rʼef o̩takada Iko E̩wñ kʼAmonu Israe̩l Che n?
Know ye not what I and my fathers have done unto all the people of	Ame̩ ma e̩wñ kʼomi kpʼamata-mi che abo ane̩ du n? I nugbo du kʼamo̩jo̩ abuche̩ichi ane̩ ane̩ kibo̩ neke gbʼane̩-ma tane̩ bʼo̩wo̩-mi te̩?

And the king of the south shall be strong, and	Oñ onu o̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩ kʼi chʼagboji-wñ oka agbiti, e̩nomune̩ muda agbiti tʼowñ le, e-le̩ anʼo̩da, o̩da-wñ la achʼo̩da lile.

And he said unto me, Son of man, go, get thee unto the house of Israel, and speak with my words unto them.	Oñ i ka ñwu mi kakini, O̩ma one̩, lo kʼe̩ nyʼunyi abo Israe̩l, kʼe̩ kʼo̩la-mi ñwu ma.

who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.	ama mube̩be̩ lʼo̩woʼka Ochochi le̩, ma ka kʼudajikwane̩ leale me̩, oñ ma jʼakʼe̩do̩ ekono abo iche̩ka adafo.

After these things, and the establishment thereof, Sennacherib king of Assyria came, and entered into Judah, and encamped against the fenced cities, and thought to win them for himself. And I perceived that the portions of the Levites had not been given	Tak u li ka kʼama te̩takʼukpe̩ abo Lifai ñwu ma n; todabe̩le̩ abo Lifai kpai amakeli ku ma chʼuko̩lo̩ le̩, e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-ma ra tʼoj oko-wñ.

For he is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down the middle wall of partition	Todu owñ chʼure̩do̩-wa, owñ ki kʼawa mejeji chʼokate le̩, kʼi laño̩ fʼo̩kaga o̩do̩ owñ chʼulaka, ki dʼagbagba-wa le̩ gulo̩,
And Zacchæus stood, and said unto the Lord; Behold, Lord, the half of my goods I give to the poor; and if I have taken any thing from any man by false accusation, I restore	Oñ Zakio̩s kwodago, i ka ñw Ondu kakini, Go, Ondu, ukpeji idu-mi nako ñw ame̩nale; i la che̩wñ kʼu gba e̩wñʼka lef uji ugbo e̩ne̩ du nadabi rʼo̩me̩-wñ ugbo me̩le̩.
Now therefore beware, I pray thee, and drink not wine nor strong drink, and eat not any unclean	Todule̩ e̩ nago, agba, e̩ ki la ñmo̩ omi achiwebe̩te̩ma n, kpai o̩te̩ una n, e̩ ki la je̩ e̩wñ du ki ma de̩hiolo n,
The words of wise	O̩la anibe ku ma gbo ye̩e̩ la nyo̩ tʼogu kʼe̩ne̩ ki nʼo̩da ef amake̩do̩nola-ma akpa le.
Then sang Moses and the children of Israel this song unto the	Taku Mose̩s kpai amo̩ma Israe̩l kʼeli-i do̩ Jihofa, ma kakini,
but in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest unto the land, a sabbath for the	o̩do̩ e̩kebie-wñ muda chʼo̩do̩ uñmi e-uñmi tod ane̩ le̩, eñmi ñwu Jihofa i che; e̩ ki gbe̩ e̩wñ oko-we̩ n, e̩ ki la ño̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma-we̩ n.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini,
So that contrariwise ye	todabe̩le̩ i nyo̩ tule ku me̩ murida anʼo ku me̩ mudu chʼowñ ele-ufe̩de̩nyo̩, ku me̩ dʼugbe̩do̩ ñw u, tode̩gba kʼe̩do̩dudu ololololo amʼe̩ne̩ abe̩le̩ du mi.
how he went into the house of God, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to them that were with him; which it is not lawful to eat but for the priests alone?	alu kʼi gudu tef unyi O̩jo̩ kʼi la mʼakala ku ma ko te̩ jʼo̩mo̩ gba je̩, kʼi laño̩ ko ñw abo ku ma jʼugbo-wñ ge̩; owñ chʼe-kʼo̩da ma je̩ ñw one̩ je̩ n, chai amatama O̩jo̩ kate?
Geber the son of Uri	Gebe̩r o̩ma Uri nʼojane̩ Gilead, owñ chʼane̩ Siho̩n, onu abo Amo̩r, kpai e-O̩g, onu Beshan; ma chi owñ kate dago ojane̩ le̩.
And if thy oblation	I la che̩wñ kʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩-we̩ chʼe̩wñ ele ku ma de̩ ef anade, i ki chʼomu te̩ke̩te̩ke̩ kʼo̩jo̩wu ma do̩ n kʼekpo chʼekpe̩gwanyu.
All these	Ma kʼokuta kʼalaja-wñ chʼe̩kpuna ne e̩wñ-i du, owñ chʼokuta ku ma da, e-ku ma fuñwa ojoji ojoji, ma nʼiso̩ le, tʼejefu, tʼejo̩do̩da-wñ, akwo e̩re̩-wñ gbogbo kad okuta ki kpʼoji-wñ ate̩; abe̩le̩ i de̩ ejo̩do̩da ge̩ gbogbo wa ologbo lile.
I say unto you, Though he will not rise and give him, because he is his friend, yet because of his importunity he will rise and give him as many as he needeth.	Naka ñwu me̩ kakini, I ma chaka chʼe-onuku-wñ adʼu kwane̩ kʼi ko ñw u n, tod ebi o̩lafi kʼi abi i la akwane̩ kʼi kʼo ñw u alu du kʼi nʼeku-wñ.
Hear, O	O Jihofa, gbo̩, kʼe̩ li mi eju!
For what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches, except	Todu e̩wñ do̩mo̩ kʼujeju ujeju abudo̩ Ondu ki bo̩ fʼume̩ du ef uwñ taa? Ukani i chʼe-kʼomi ma dachi no me̩ n? Me̩ mʼuji kide̩ du chʼumi ele!
I saw by night, and behold a man riding upon a red horse, and he stood among the myrtle trees that	U fuli odu, e̩ la go, e̩ne̩ʼka tanʼanya ekpikpa! I dago ef ujo̩ oli me̩rte̩l ef o̩go̩ le̩; amanya ekpikpa kpai acha kpai efufu la jʼubi-wñ.
And, behold, there came a man of God out of Judah by the word of the	Me̩ la go, o̩la Jihofa je̩ ñw e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ʼka kwo Juda wa Be̩te̩l. Je̩ro̩boam la dago kpenyʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ kʼi gu otulale jo.
For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.	Tod e-kide̩ one̩ akwo bʼata-wñ kpʼiye-wñ te̩, kʼi la amanyʼo̩ya-wñ; oñ amameji le̩ achʼo̩re̩laʼka.
The word that Jeremiah the prophet spake unto Baruch the son of Neriah, when he had written these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, saying,	O̩la ku Je̩re̩maya akache̩ ka ñwu Baruk, o̩ma Ne̩raya, e̩gba kʼi kʼo̩la-i nyʼef ubuku abu ku Je̩re̩maya aka ñw u kpʼalu-wñ, o̩do̩ e̩ke̩le̩ ku Jiho̩yakim, o̩ma Josaya, jʼonu Juda le̩ de̩, kakini,
ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift	Ame̩ onugo ki bʼo̩ chuko̩lo̩ todu wa ef o̩ko̩ e̩gbabʼO̩jo̩, todu kʼamone̩ wewe ki fʼu gwa nyo̩nyo̩ todu wa, tod ele ufe̩de̩nyo̩ ki wugbo wa le̩.
Then I saw,	Tak u go, oñ u kwokpibe nyo̩nyo̩;
But the God of all grace, who hath called us unto his eternal glory by Christ Jesus, after that ye have suffered a while, make you perfect, stablish, strengthen, settle	Oñ abu ku me̩ jo̩ ku me̩ fʼuwa li pe̩, O̩jo̩ e-ufe̩de̩nyo̩ chaka, e-kʼi do̩ me̩ tef ojima-wñ e-ogbegbele̩ le̩ efu Kraisti, owñ onugo ache me̩ teju-wñ kpa, i adʼe̩re̩-me̩ nyan e̩, i adʼugbiti ñwu me̩.
He that abideth in this city shall die by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence: but he that goeth out, and falleth to the Chaldeans that besiege you, he shall live, and his life shall be unto him for a prey.	E̩ne̩ ki guane̩ ef ewo-i aku ñw o̩kwo̩chageli, kpai o̩kpo̩ta, kpai e̩wñ ibi le̩; e̩ne̩ ki muda le dufu kʼi ñwa tef o̩wo̩ abo Kaldia ku ma kpala nyʼume̩-i adeju; oji o̩la-wñ chʼe̩wñ uro̩me̩ kʼi ane̩ kwʼef ogu-i.
Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips	I chʼe-uko̩lo̩ amone̩, lugbo o̩la uko-we̩
For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves sufficiently, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.	Todu ma neke de iko le̩ n, todabu kʼamatama ku ma fʼo̩la-ma che ki fo̩ wewe bo̩jo̩ ta n, amone̩ la kʼo̩la-ma jeju Je̩rusale̩m ta n.
And he said,	Oñ i kakini, Me̩ nyʼef ewo ugbo e̩ne̩ abe̩-i ku me̩ ka ñw u kakini, Akone̩ e̩wñ le̩ kakini, Iko-mi me̩rʼo̩wo̩ me̩; ugbo we̩ oñ nachʼElaloji manyʼamako̩che̩-mi.
nor height, nor depth, nor any other creature, shall be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord.	tʼo̩gba, tʼunefu, tʼe̩wñ ojoji omune̩ du kʼO̩jo̩ nyi nekʼada wa kpʼufe̩do̩ O̩jo̩ ki dʼefu Kraisti Jisus Ondu-wa ru n.
Therefore thus saith the	Todule̩ abu ki Jihofa ka de̩, kakini, Go, omi adʼewo-i tʼo̩wo̩ abo Kaldia, kpai tʼo̩wo̩ Ne̩biukadre̩za, onu Babilo̩n, owñ la adʼu.
The Lord shall laugh at him:	Ondu muda anyanyi-wñ,
For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.	Todu amone̩ wewe awa ef odu-mi, ma kakini, Omi Kraisti le̩ de̩; ma la aje̩ ñw amone̩ wewe la.
For the Father loveth the Son, and sheweth him all things that himself doeth: and he will shew him greater works than these, that ye may marvel.	Todu Ata ache̩do̩ O̩ma; i adʼe̩wñ du kʼi ache ñʼo̩; i adʼuko̩lo̩ ki tʼe-i le i ñʼo̩ ge̩, todu kʼame̩ ki yaye.
He that planted the ear, shall he not hear?	Owñ ki dʼeti gbe̩, agbʼo̩la n?
And Samuel said to all the people, See ye him whom the	Taku Samiue̩l ka ñw amone̩ le̩ chaka kakini, Me̩ li e̩ne̩ ku Jihofa chi-i, kʼe̩ne̩ du ma dab owñ ef amone̩-i n? Tak amone̩ le̩ du fʼo̩ga chi, oñ ma kakini, Oji onu ki gbo kala kala!
And Jesus said unto them,	Taku Jisus ka ñwu ma kakini, Omi la aka ef o̩da e̩wñ kʼu nache e̩wñ-i ñwu me̩ ni ge̩.
and that lord answered the man of God, and said, Now, behold,	kʼagboji le̩ dohi ñw e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ kakini, E̩ la go ta, iche̩wñ ki Jihofa abi ope te̩ ef efojale, e̩wñ le̩ neke che? Tak i kakini, Go, uwe̩ aliʼi kpai eju-we̩, e̩ muda aje̩ n.
Then came there two women,	Tak abobule̩ meji ku ma chʼamajo̩ko̩ lewa ugbo onu, oñ ma kwodago o̩gba-wñ.
that I will give	mak owñ adʼomi ojale ane̩-me̩ wa iko-wñ, owñ chʼomi ojo̩do̩ kpai omi otitala; kʼuwe̩ ki kʼo̩ka-we̩ kpai omi achiwebe̩te̩ma-we̩ etito̩ kpai ekpo-we̩ wa unyi.
And John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.	Jo̩n ka ñw u, kakini, Akone̩wñ, a li abu kʼe̩ne̩ʼka ane̩ amebili dufu ef odu-we̩; tak a fʼu naba, todabu kʼi ma tʼuwa ubi n.
Likewise, ye wives,	Abe̩le̩ ge̩, ame̩ amo̩ya, me̩ nafʼo̩la-me̩ kamuhite̩ ñw amo̩ko̩ e-me̩; todu, dagba e̩ne̩ʼka chaka ma gba O̩la le̩ gbo̩ n, lef e̩wñ kʼamo̩ya-ma jo̩mo̩ ache, dagba ma ma ne̩ O̩la le̩ n, me̩ ne̩kʼaje̩ ma;
He trusted in God; let him deliver him now, if he will have him: for he said, I am the Son of God.	I te̩take̩do̩nʼO̩jo̩, i chʼe̩ne̩ ki dʼO̩jo̩ e̩do̩ i che, i ki mʼu gba fai ke, todu i ka kakini, O̩ma O̩jo̩ owñ che.
And as Esaias said before,	I ñʼadʼalu kʼAizaya ka o̩gbo̩gba le̩ kakini,
I	Omi che Jihofa, O̩jo̩-me̩ kʼi ko me̩ kwʼoj ane̩ Ijipti dufu, kʼu dʼane̩ Kenan ñwu me̩, kʼu ño̩ chʼO̩jo̩-me̩.
But, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing unto him. Do the rulers know indeed that this is the very Christ?	Me̩ la go, i ako̩la ejo̩ja, ma la kʼabu du ñw owñ n. I neke chʼeka kʼamagboji chema ochochi ka kʼowñ le̩ che Kraisti le̩ de̩?
	Jihofa, gbogbo wʼe̩gba oñ ame̩ne̩bibi,
Of the tribe of Juda	Kwef o̩lo̩pu Juda ma fʼone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩gweji hiuko̩; kwef o̩lo̩pu Rube̩n ma fʼone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩gweji hiuko̩; kwef o̩lo̩pu Gad ma fʼone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩gweji hiuko̩;
For there are set thrones of judgment,	Todu ede ede jʼo̩mo̩ tod ajo̩,
Deliver me from all my transgressions:	Mʼumi gba bʼada du kʼu je̩ te̩.
Be not carried about with divers and strange doctrines. For	Me̩ ki je̩ ñw uko̩ o̩la ojoji ojoji kpʼe-ejaduña ki ko me̩ alo n; todu i chʼo̩me̩me̩le̩ kʼufe̩de̩nyo̩ ki fʼe̩do̩-me̩ lonyane̩; i ki chʼuje̩wñ, e-ki ma nʼile ñw abo ku ma tale ef uwñ n in.
He was not that Light, but	I chʼowñ chʼugane̩ le̩ n, chai todu kʼi gba ugane̩ le̩ ibenu.
And when he was disposed to pass into Achaia, the brethren wrote, exhorting the disciples to receive him: who, when he was come, helped them much which had believed through grace:	Oñ abu ki neku elalegudu nyʼAkaya amo̩maye le̩ kʼowñ e̩che, ma kʼo̩takada rʼamako̩che̩ ku ma yo̩ ñw u: oñ abu kʼi lewa o̩mo̩ i bʼabo ku ma ke̩do̩no lef ufe̩de̩-nyo̩ che nana;
They that forsake the law praise the wicked:	Abo ku ma hi uko̩-o̩la tinyo̩ aje̩nyu ñw ame̩ne̩bibi,
They are all hot as an oven, and have devoured their judges; all their kings are fallen:	O̩chaka-ma kpuna dab igbeli,
And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the	E̩gba ku me̩ kpa e̩wñ ugwa ñwu Jihofa, me̩ ki kpa alu kʼi arʼo̩ e̩do̩.
Israel then shall dwell in safety alone:	Abe̩le̩ Israe̩l kwogugu yo̩o̩,
I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly:	Omi ka ñw abo ku ma je̩nyʼo̩la-ma kakini, Me̩ ki che e̩wñ uba abe̩le̩ n,
one young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:	o̩mokuno̩ o̩ko̩ʼka, okoloʼka, okolo o̩mo̩do̩ʼka, kʼi chʼutod iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo;
So he went another way, and returned not by the way that he came to Beth-el.	Abe̩le̩ i le o̩na omune̩, i ño̩ dabi le o̩na e-kʼi le nyi Be̩te̩l le̩ n.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, Fero anyʼuwe̩ eti n; todu kʼe̩wñ uno̩-mi ki wewe nyo̩gba oj ane̩ Ijipti.
Brethren, be followers together of me, and mark them which walk so as ye have us for an ensample.	Amo̩maye, me̩ ki mud abo ku ma bʼomune̩ wʼumi che, me̩ nafʼeju gwanyi abo ku ma tale abe̩le̩, owñ chʼalu ku me̩ ne̩ wa chʼe̩wñ ku me̩ wo̩li-wñ.
At the same time came the disciples unto Jesus, saying, Who is the greatest in the kingdom of heaven?	Iko le̩ amako̩che̩ te̩wʼugbo Jisus, ma kakini, Mak e̩ne̩ tule ojane̩ e-efojale?
And they set them up images and groves in every high hill, and under every green tree:	ma la kʼojibo kpai Ashe̩rim gugu oj uwo du ki gbʼo̩gba, kpai of oli emimi chaka;
And they did so, and made them all sit down.	Oñ ma fʼabe̩le̩ che, ma je̩ ñw o̩chaka-ma chekukane̩.
For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye	Todu me̩ hika je̩ kpʼame̩nidada, abu ku me̩ chʼamanibe.
And he said unto him, Fear not: for the hand of Saul my father shall not find thee; and thou shalt be king over Israel, and I shall be next unto thee; and that also Saul my father knoweth.	I ka ñw u kakini, E̩ ki railo n; todu o̩wo̩ So̩l ata-mi ahimʼuwe̩ n; uwe̩ la aje̩ onu Israe̩l, oñ omi achʼe̩ne̩ ki aro̩nʼuwe̩; ata-mi, So̩l, ño̩ chema e-le̩.
Then one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and dwelt in Beth-el, and taught them how they should fear the	Abe̩le̩ atamaʼka e-ku ma ño̩ kwo Samaria le̩ lewa dodo Be̩te̩l, oñ i ko̩ ma alu ku ma che ku ma railo Jihofa.
Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity.	Me̩ nʼukalu e-ufe̩do̩ gwʼomune̩.
Neither their silver nor their gold shall be able to deliver them in the day of the	Ajifa-ma kpʼo̩jamalia
And Laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give the younger before the firstborn.	Oñ Leban kakini, I chʼabe̩le̩ oñ a che o̩ja-wa n, awa dʼe-kekele kpʼo̩ko̩ dʼo̩gba ñw o̩mo̩gba n.
And they came to Jericho: and as he went out of Jericho with his disciples and a great number of people, blind Bartimæus, the son of Timæus, sat by the highway side begging.	Oñ ma lewa ewo Je̩riko; tak abu kʼowñ manyʼamako̩che̩-wñ kpai o̩wo̩ amone̩ o̩temeje kwo Je̩riko dufu, o̩ma Timio̩s, kʼodu-wñ ko̩ Bartimio̩s ki chʼafeju ki abiebi, gugu et o̩na.
And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.	E̩wñ kʼi li kpai e̩wñ kʼi gbo̩ e̩wñ le̩ i agbʼibenu-wñ; e̩ne̩ du la ado̩ ibenu-wñ kʼi gba rʼochochi n.
And of the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hasenuah,	Amo̩ma Be̩njamin ku ma jʼef uma la che Salu o̩ma Me̩shulam, o̩ma Ho̩dafaya, o̩ma Hase̩nua
All the fowls of heaven made their nests in his boughs, and under his branches did all the beasts of the field bring forth their young, and under his shadow dwelt all great nations.	Ame̩we̩ ojale chaka
The simple inherit folly:	Ame̩nemo̩ aje̩ idada e̩wñ ogu,
Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be to you an holy day, a sabbath of rest to the	O̩jo̩ me̩fa ma achʼuko̩lo̩ kade, o̩jo̩ e̩kebie-wñ muda chʼo̩jo̩ ki afo̩ ñwu me̩, o̩jo̩ uñmi e-uñmi ñwu Jihofa, i che; e̩ne̩ du ki achʼuko̩lo̩ o̩jo̩ le̩ ekpa ma akpa.
And my temptation which was in my flesh ye despised not, nor rejected; but received me as an angel of God,	oñ e̩wñ ef o̩re̩la-mi kʼi jʼume̩ ma le̩ me̩ dʼo̩ ribe̩te̩ n, me̩ la chihie̩ne̩ owñ n; me̩ muda gba mi dabe̩ne̩ kʼu che onuche̩ O̩jo̩, dabe̩ne̩ ku Kraist Jisus.
Riches profit not in the day of wrath:	E̩wñ ene̩ nana nʼile o̩jo̩ uwe̩do̩ n,
and	e̩gbale̩ tak i akwo bʼuwe̩ te̩, tʼowñ, tʼamo̩ma-wñ manyʼu, oñ i adabi nyʼakwo̩ra unyi e-wñ, ugbo ane̩ amata-wñ oñ i adabi tu.
The earth is given into the hand of the wicked:	Ma mʼile̩-i du tʼef o̩wo̩ ame̩ne̩bibi me̩;
Because thou servedst not the	Tod abu kʼe̩ ma re̩ Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ kpai uyo̩ kpai e̩do̩ e̩bo̩ n, tod e̩wñ du ki jo̩ ñw e̩ ololo le̩,
And there appeared unto them cloven tongues like as of fire, and it sat upon each of them.	Tak ukpalu ki chʼe̩kpana meji eji, dabe̩ne̩ kʼe-una, kwotejugede ñwu ma. I la kwogugu oji-ma okoke.
The vessels also that are given thee for the service of the house of thy God,	Oñ e̩wñ eku ku ma ako ñw e̩ todu e̩wñ ucholo unyi O̩jo̩-we̩ le̩, e-le̩ e̩ nakowa jo̩ o̩gba O̩jo̩ e-Je̩rusale̩m.
	Todule̩, e̩gba du ku me̩ li e̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ e-alache̩, ku ma ka o̩la-wñ lefu Danie̩l akache̩ le̩, kʼi dago ef uña kiafo̩ (e̩ne̩ ki acho̩kalatu-i kʼi namʼoji-wñ),
I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me:	Naraku dʼuwe̩, e̩ la dohi ñw mi n;
The	Jihofa chʼagbiti ogu;
to make their land desolate,	ku ma je̩ ñw ane̩-ma mud e̩wñ ugoju,
And they said unto him, Wherefore saith my lord these words? God forbid that thy servants should do according to this thing:	Oñ ma ka ñw u kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼodu-mi akʼo̩la abe̩i? Eche e̩wñ abe̩i che̩jijiru amadu-we̩-i!
and hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.	E̩ la che̩nʼe̩do̩ elichi, kʼe̩ la nʼadu-wñ tod odu e-mi; uhia la hiʼuwe̩ n.
Then I consulted with myself, and I rebuked the nobles, and the rulers, and said unto them, Ye exact usury, every one of his brother. And I set a great assembly against them.	Oñ u kwonyojuju, u la kobʼabo ojima kpai amachimo̩la igo̩bina, oñ u ka ñwu ma kakini, E̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-me̩ agbʼo̩ko̩ ugwo̩la ef o̩wo̩ o̩maye-wñ; tak ufʼujeju lile da nyʼuma o̩la.
Thus hath the Lord	Abu ki Jihofa ña mi de̩: e̩ la go, agba e̩roli o̩lo̩ji te̩.
And it came to pass, that after three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the doctors, both hearing them, and asking them questions.	Oñ i lea tu abu kʼo̩jo̩ me̩ta jo̩ taku ma fʼu li ef unyi O̩jo̩ abu kʼi gugu alumeji amakone̩wñ anetiru o̩la-ma kpai ene enʼuma ge̩.
I have not written unto you because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.	U kʼo̩takada rʼume̩, ukpe̩ ku me̩ ma ma ochochi le̩ ni n, chai todabu ku me̩ chemʼo̩, kpai todabu kʼochochi le̩ ma chʼe̩te̩ olemi du n.
the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;	onu Afe̩k chʼoka; onu Lasharo̩n chʼoka;
The merciful man doeth good to his own soul:	E̩ne̩ ki amo̩la achʼe̩nyo̩ ñw onugo o̩la-wñ,
Yet the children of thy people say, The way of the Lord is not equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.	Amo̩ma abo-we̩ muda aka kakini, O̩na Ondu chʼokujo n: i muda chʼe-ma, o̩na e-ma chʼokujo n.
And ye shall teach them your children, speaking of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.	Me̩ ki la dʼu ko̩ amo̩ma-me̩, e̩ ki nʼoluka-wñ ache e̩gba kʼe̩ gugu ef unyi-we̩ kpai e̩gba kʼe̩ dʼej o̩na alule̩ kpai e̩gba kʼe̩ dachi kpai e̩gba kʼe̩ kwane̩.
Woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkards of Ephraim, whose glorious beauty	Atogwo ñw ike̩be̩ uba e-amañmo̩te̩ Ifraim,
For he that is not against us is on our part.	Todu e̩ne̩ ki ma chʼe̩nagwunyʼuwa n, e̩ne̩-wa i che.
And it shall come to pass, when many evils and troubles are befallen them, that this song shall testify against them as a witness; for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they go about, even now, before I have brought them into the land which I sware.	Tak e̩gba kʼe̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ kpai o̩pe̩cha wewe ke̩re̩bʼuma, mak eli-i achʼe̩nibenu ki agbibenu nyʼuma (todu alu amugbe̩-ma agbenyo̩ n); todu u chema ibe ku ma ñwa ef e̩do̩-ma eñini-i o̩gba tak u ko ma wʼoj ane̩ kʼomi go̩ le̩.
And I took the little book out of the angel's hand, and ate it up; and it was in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.	Tak u mʼibuku kekele le̩ gba kwef o̩wo̩ onuche̩ le̩, oñ u mʼu du je̩; oñ i rinyo̩ dab iño̩ ef alu-mi; e̩gba kʼu fʼu je̩, i je̩ ñw efu-mi lukoko.
And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, and set him before Pharaoh: and Jacob blessed Pharaoh.	Taku Jose̩f mu Jeko̩b ata-wñ duwa, oñ i mʼu du gugu o̩gba Fero; taku Jeko̩b kadua ñwu Fero.

and the ass saw me, and turned from me these three times: unless she had turned from me, surely now also I had slain thee, and saved her alive.	o̩ke̩ke̩te̩ la fʼumi li, i muna bʼumi o̩gba te̩ onu me̩ta-i. I ma na rʼo̩wo̩ʼka o̩gba-mi le̩ n, omi ma fʼe̩ kpa fai me̩ ku la mʼowñ gba kʼi deju chuu.
Nevertheless my lovingkindness will I not utterly take from him,	u muda agbʼufe̩de̩nyo̩-mi bʼo̩ o̩wo̩ te̩ hioko n,

In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.	O̩do̩ Peka o̩ma Re̩malaya e̩ke̩gwebie̩, Ehaz o̩ma Jotam onu Juda chane̩ ejʼonu-wñ.
And it was told Joshua, saying, The five kings are found hid in a cave at Makkedah.	Taku ma mudu ka ñwu Jo̩shua kakini, Ma fʼamonu me̩lu le̩ li abu ku ma maja ef owo Makeda.
for the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, whereof ye heard before in the word of the truth of the gospel;	todu e̩wñ ukibeno ku ma du ne ñwu me̩ efojale, owñ chʼe-ku me̩ gbʼinabali-wñ tane̩ ef o̩la ochochi e-Uche̩nyo̩
And among the sons of the priests there were found that had taken strange wives:	Oñ ma fʼamo̩ma amatama iche̩ka ku ma nʼabobule̩ ononojo chʼo̩ya li: e-amo̩ma Je̩shua ki chʼo̩ma Jo̩zadak, kpai amo̩maye-wñ che, Maaseya kpʼE̩lieza kpai Jarib kpai Ge̩dalaya.
O	O Jihofa, uwe̩ O̩jo̩ ki anache̩, uwe̩ O̩jo̩ ki anache̩, ta dufu!
For the	todu Jihofa agbʼomu-ma ka,
From the cry of Heshbon	Akwo ukwa He̩shbo̩n gbogbo wa Eleale, gbogbo wa Jahaz ma nʼomu dala, akwo Zoar gbogbo wa Horona, wa Eglat-shilishiya; todu omi omi Nimrim ñʼagbe̩ kʼo̩mo̩ ki mud alache̩.
Now when they had gone throughout Phrygia and the region of Galatia, and were forbidden of the Holy Ghost to preach the word in Asia,	Oñ ma lale gu ef ane̩ Frigia kpai Galatia du ofo, abu kʼAfu Kiafo̩ kpo̩nanyʼuma ku ma we eko̩la Esia;
Josiah	O̩do̩ Josaya chʼe̩jo̩ e̩gba kʼi chane̩ ejʼonu-wñ; i la jʼonu Je̩rusale̩m o̩do̩ ogue̩gwa nyokeʼka. Odu iye-wñ la ko̩ Jidaida o̩ma Adia e-Bo̩zkat.
for, behold, we	todu me̩ go, awa jʼoko aji oti o̩ka, oñ go, oti-mi kwane̩, i kwodago kpakpa; me̩ la go, oti e-me̩ donyʼu, oñ ma dʼoji le̩ agwa oti e-mi.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, E̩ ka ñw Aro̩n kakini, Nʼo̩wo̩-we̩ kʼo̩kpa-we̩ dʼo̩ le̩ dala nʼohimini ohimini kpai nʼaji aji kpai noji oduda oduda omi, kʼe̩ la je̩ ñw amo̩bana lewa abʼane̩ Ijipti ma!
the chains, and the bracelets, and the mufflers,	uko̩lo̩ ku ma du tʼo̩fa kpʼiyagba-ma kpʼugbogbo ku ma wenyʼo̩fa;

and I went out after him, and smote him, and delivered	omi dufu atʼo̩ ubi, u la mʼu du kpa, oñ u mʼu gba bʼo̩ alu te̩. E̩gba kʼi kwane̩ akobʼumi u gwo̩nyʼilagba-wñ, u fʼe̩wñ nʼu, u mʼu du kpa.
Therefore thus saith the Lord	Todule̩ abu kʼOndu Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Todabu kʼe̩ hi o̩la-we̩ ne ef e̩gba kʼe̩ gba kʼi la mʼoji-wñ du tunyʼakpa, oñ i fʼe̩do̩-wñ hi ne ef o̩gba-wñ le̩;
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father's brother, thou shalt not approach to his wife: she	E̩ ki la tʼo̩maye ata-we̩ e-e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ ago ofo n, e̩ ki te̩me̩rʼoya-wñ n; iye-we̩ de̩.
Notwithstanding they would not hear, but hardened their necks, like to the neck of their fathers, that did not believe in the	I chaka dʼabe̩le̩ ma ko̩ egbo̩; ma la fʼo̩lo̩-ma lo̩ dabe̩ne̩ kʼo̩lo̩ amata-ma, ku ma ma dʼo̩lo̩ Jihofa O̩jo̩-ma rʼochochi n.
forasmuch as ye are	abu ki kwotejugede, kak ame̩ chʼo̩takada e-Kraist, e-kʼa ne̩ che e̩wñ ñw one̩, e-ki ma chʼomi ejiji ma du ko n, chai Afu e-O̩jo̩ ki nʼiñmi; i la chʼef alo okuta n, chai ef alo ki chʼe̩do̩ o̩re̩la.

Or despisest thou the riches of his goodness and forbearance and longsuffering; not knowing that the goodness of God leadeth thee to repentance?	Abe̩k uwe̩ adʼunana umo̩la-wñ kpai o̩wo̩ kʼi damʼuwe̩ kpai e̩do̩-wñ kʼi je̩ rʼo̩che̩ke̩ne̩? E̩ ma ka kʼumo̩la O̩jo̩ anʼuwe̩ nyʼugbo uribeda n?
For	Todu amo̩jo̩-me̩ wewe alu kʼewo ewo-me̩ wewe, O Juda. Oñ ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ku me̩ ne ñw e̩wñ anyo̩ la wewe alu kʼo̩na o̩na Je̩rusale̩m wewe, owñ chʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ugbo ku me̩ agu otulale jo ñwu Beal le̩.
And he smote Moab, and measured them with a line, casting them down to the ground; even with two lines measured he to put to death, and with one full line to keep alive. And	Tak i fʼabo Moab kpa, oñ i nʼiku ñwa ma; i je̩ ñwu ma dachi ane̩pe̩te̩; tak i fʼiku meji ñwa kʼi fʼuma kpa, oñ i fʼiku odukuluka ñwa tod abo kʼi aje̩ ñwu ma deju. And some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hands on him.	I la du aboʼka ef uma e̩do̩ ku ma fʼu mu, e̩ne̩ du muda hi e̩wo̩ mʼo̩ n.

for a friend of mine in his journey is come to me, and I have nothing to set before him?	todabu kʼonuku-miʼka kwo ule̩ wʼugbo mi, u la nʼe̩wñ kʼu nadʼu gu o̩gba-wñ kʼi je̩ n;

Then Hazael king of Syria went up, and fought against Gath, and took it: and Hazael set his face to go up to Jerusalem.	Oñ Hazae̩l, onu Siria, mute̩gu nyʼakogu bo̩ Gat, oñ i fʼu du; taku Hazae̩l kpejuru ete̩gu nyi Je̩rusale̩m.

And the fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him was given the key of the bottomless pit.	Tak onuche̩ e̩ke̩lu fʼo̩kakachi-wñ, oñ u li awo ki kwʼefojale wʼane̩ ile̩, ma la mʼomigede ura o̩lo̩ulu du ñw u.
For her house inclineth unto death,	todu unyi-wñ chʼagwo̩ru nyʼef uku,
And there was set	Taku ma dʼuje̩wñ gugu o̩gba-wñ kʼi je̩; ama i kakini, U je̩ ta n, i chʼe̩gba kʼu fʼuche̩-mi je̩ru me̩ ta. Oñ i kakini, Kwoka ke n.
Thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor do after their works: but thou shalt utterly overthrow them, and quite break down their images.	E̩ ki dojikane̩ ñw amo̩jo̩ e-ma n, e̩ ki re̩ ma n, e̩ ki la che likpa uko̩lo̩-ma n, e̩ ki muda gu uma lo̩ hioko, kʼe̩ la kʼojibo-ma kpo̩fo̩ ye̩ge̩ye̩ge̩.
And he went unto his father's house at Ophrah, and slew his brethren the sons of Jerubbaal,	Tak i le tʼunyi ata-wñ Ofra le̩, oñ i fʼamo̩maye-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ amo̩ma Je̩rubeal e̩te̩gwa le̩ kpa oj okutaʼka; Jo̩tam, udabi Je̩rubeal, muda bo̩ todu i ra maja.
Behold, I know your thoughts,	Go, u chema ibe ki dʼefu-me̩,
Howbeit the king of the children of Ammon hearkened not unto the words of Jephthah which he sent him.	I chaka ka abe̩le̩ onu amo̩ma Amo̩n le̩ la nyʼo̩la ki Je̩fta kpʼonuche̩ rʼu eti n.
But cursed	Ama ki fʼe̩ne̩ ki chʼO̩jo̩ e̩la mu, owñ chʼe̩ne̩ ki nʼo̩kʼe̩la ef ujo̩ ame̩wño̩re̩-wñ tak i doji, tak i dʼe̩wñ e̩kpabie̩ wa chʼiche̩bo̩ ñw Ondu; todu Onu inaina omi che, Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du ka-i; oñ odu-mi abailo ef abo uche̩ichi.
And there shall be no leavened bread seen with thee in all thy coast seven days; neither shall there	Ama ki la li o̩jo̩wu ugbo we̩ ejefu alo̩me̩ ane̩-we̩ du gbogbo wʼo̩jo̩ mebie le̩ n; e̩la du kʼe̩ du kpa e̩gba ane̩ o̩jo̩ ejodudu le̩, abo̩ gbogbo nyʼodudu n.
And God said, This	Oñ O̩jo̩ kakini, E-kide̩ chʼujiwe alo kʼu nakpe̩ ki dʼagbagba omi kpai ame̩ onugo kpai ame̩wñ iñmi du ki jʼugbo-me̩ le̩, tod abo o̩gba nʼo̩gba gbogbo alo:
Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they	Go, i awa kpʼakpa ojale oñ eju e̩ne̩ du ali owñ, kpʼabo ku ma dʼe̩wñ gwunyʼu, o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu du ane̩ ile̩-i la adʼo̩wo̩ fiʼe̩do̩ tod uwñ. I-i, Ami.
Neither did Ephraim drive out the Canaanites that dwelt in Gezer; but the Canaanites dwelt in Gezer among them.	Ifraim la nʼabo Kenan ku ma dodo Geze̩r dufu n; abo Kenan le̩ la gugu efu-ma Geze̩r le̩.
Then I sent unto him, saying, There are no such things done as thou sayest, but thou feignest them out of thine own heart.	Tak u fʼuche̩ kpe̩ rʼu kakini, I nʼe̩ne̩ du kʼi ache e̩wñ kʼuwe̩ aka le̩ n. E-le̩ chʼakpaine̩ ibe efu-we̩ oñ e̩ ka le̩.
O	O Jihofa, O̩jo̩-wa,
The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel;	Ita, ita ki So̩lo̩mo̩n, o̩ma Defid, onu Israe̩l kpa de̩:
Now therefore, behold, the cry of the children of Israel is come unto me: and I have also seen the oppression wherewith the Egyptians oppress them.	Ifai, go, ukwa amo̩ma Israe̩l lewa ugbo mi me̩, u laño̩ li ekpama kʼabo Ijipti fʼuma kpama le̩.
It is the spirit that quickeneth; the flesh profiteth nothing: the words that I speak unto you,	Afu chʼe-ki adʼiñmi ñw e̩wñ, o̩re̩la nʼile du n; o̩la kʼomi ka ñwu me̩ le̩, afu i che, iñmi i laño̩ che ge̩.
So	Abe̩le̩ o̩na o̩na e̩ne̩ du kʼi ajakpa e̩wñ de̩;
They, and all that	Abe̩le̩ ama kpai e̩wñ du ku ma ne̩, gwo̩ru nyʼef o̩jegu udeju udeju; tak ane̩ hi alu de nyʼuma, oñ ma lenyo̩ rʼalumeji ujeju le̩.
And Moses said, We will go with our young and with our old, with our sons and with our daughters, with our flocks and with our herds will we go; for we	Taku Mose̩s kakini, A alo, tʼimo̩to̩-wa, tʼogijo-wa; awa kpai amo̩ma-wa e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai amo̩ma-wa onobule̩ kpai ame̩wño̩re̩-wa egini kpai amokuno̩-wa alo; todu awa ahi uje̩wñ uyo̩ ñwu Jihofa tila.
And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her two sons and her husband.	Taku Malo̩n kpai Chilio̩n, ejeji-ma, leku. Abe̩le̩ amo̩ma-wñ meji kpai o̩ko̩-wñ leku bʼonobule̩ le̩ te̩.
Now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching Jesus, saw the earthquake, and those things that were done, they feared greatly, saying, Truly this was the Son of God.	Oñ abu kʼagboji amisoja ogume̩lu le̩ kpai abo ku ma manyʼowñ adejute̩ Jisus le̩, li ane̩ ki amiejo kpai e̩wñ ki wache le̩, ma railo nana; ma kakini, Ochochi, e̩ne̩-i chʼỌma e-O̩jo̩.
and Jaresiah, and Eliah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.	kpai Jaare̩shaya kpai Ilaija kpai Zikrai chʼamo̩ma Je̩roham.

And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all	Taku ma le wʼugbo Jo̩n, oñ ma ka ñw u kakini, Rabai, e̩ne̩ ki dʼugbo we̩ ejudaba Jo̩rdan, e̩ne̩ kʼuwe̩ gbʼo̩ ibenu le̩, go, owñ le̩ achʼone̩ baptism amone̩ du la wʼugbo-wñ.

Malluch, Harim, Baanah.	kpai Maluk kpai Harim kpai Beana.
If	I chʼe-ukpahiu, go, agbiti i che!
And Adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattle by the stone of Zoheleth, which	Tak Adonija fʼame̩wño̩re̩ egini kpʼamokuno̩ kpʼame̩la ki yoyo kpa ugbo okuta Zohele̩t ki dʼo̩wo̩ʼka E̩nroge̩l; oñ i fʼamo̩maye-wñ du, ku ma chʼamo̩ma onu, do̩ wa kpʼaboke̩le̩ Juda du ku ma chʼame̩nuko̩lo̩ onu.
Therefore hearken not unto the words of the prophets that speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serve the king of Babylon: for they prophesy a lie unto you.	Me̩ ki la netirʼo̩la amakache̩ n ku ma ka ñwu me̩ kakini, Ame̩ arʼonu Babilo̩n in. Todu ache̩ olemi ma ka ñwu me̩ le̩.

And he said, Be it far from me, O	Oñ i kakini, E-le̩ ki jiji rʼumi, O Jihofa, todu kʼu che-i. Omi añmʼe̩bie̩ aboke̩le̩ ku ma dʼoji-ma nʼo̩wo̩ ale? Todule̩ i ma je̩ ñmo̩ n. E̩wñ kʼame̩nugbiti me̩ta le̩ che de̩.

And he said, What	Tak i kakini, E̩wñ i ko̩la-wñ ñw e̩? Agba, e̩ ki dʼu maja ñwu mi n. O̩jo̩ ki chʼabe̩le̩ ñw e̩, kpʼe-kʼi tule, iche̩wñ kʼe̩ dʼe̩wñ kate ef e̩wñ du kʼi kañwe̩ le̩ maja ñwu mi.
The	Jihofa kwotejugede ñw mi kwʼo̩najiji.
For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.	Todu abo ku ma fʼuko̩lo̩ e̩wñ eche ñw one̩ che o̩me̩me̩le̩ fʼuña o̩me̩me̩le̩ mu ñw o̩la-ma, kpai eju e̩gbo nana ef e̩do̩ ekono e-ki dʼefu Kraisti Jisus.

when she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.	abu kʼi la gbo̩ inabali Jisus, i lef amone̩ ki tinyo̩ le̩ wa ubi-wñ, oñ i do̩wo̩kado afe̩-wñ.
By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth:	U tejane̩ e̩ne̩ kʼonugo-mi afe̩do̩ le̩ oj ate̩-mi odu;

And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was free born.	Oñ onu-ogu le̩ dohi kakini, O̩ko̩ lile oñ omi ne̩ fʼo̩da o̩mane̩ la. Taku Po̩l kakini, Ebi ma la bi omi.

and ye shall dispossess	tak ame̩ ki gbʼane̩ le̩ ku me̩ ne̩ ku me̩ dodo jʼo̩mo̩, todu omi mʼane̩ le̩ du ñwu me̩ ku me̩ ne̩.

Do ye look on things after the outward appearance? If any man trust to himself that he is Christ's, let him of himself think this again, that, as he	Alu kʼe̩wñ de̩ eju oñ me̩ go. And Rebekah took goodly raiment of her eldest son Esau, which	Taku Ribe̩ka mʼe̩wñ o̩la Iso̩ o̩ma o̩gba-wñ le̩ e-ki nyo̩ ko, owñ chʼe-ki jʼugbo-wñ ef unyi, oñ i mudu tʼo̩la Jeko̩b, o̩ma-wñ kekele;

And after they had passed throughout Pisidia, they came to Pamphylia.	Tak uma legu ef Pisidia du oñ ma lewa Pamfilia.
Howbeit the	I chaka dʼabe̩le̩, Jihofa O̩jo̩ abo Israe̩l fʼumi chi kwef abo unyi ata-mi chaka kʼu chʼonu ki anʼo̩da Israe̩l ogbegbele̩. Todu i fu Juda chi todu kʼi chʼe̩nuto̩gba; oñ ef unyi abo Juda, ef unyi ata-mi, ef amo̩ma ata-mi omi nyʼo̩ eju kʼi dʼumi jʼonu abo Israe̩l chaka.
I will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy:	E̩do̩-mi bo̩ oñ nayo̩ ef ufe̩de̩nyo̩-we̩,
And thou shalt make a vail	Uwe̩ ki la nʼukpo odufa kpai odufa ekpikpa kpai ekpikpa kpai ukpo line̩n ku ma hi reju kʼowu-wñ chʼe̩da bie̩ che ukpo ugbeju unyi; abo ku ma chʼo̩ka uko̩lo̩-wñ ache kʼamiche̩rub ki jʼo̩la-wñ;
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord:	O̩jo̩ o̩pe̩cha-mi u kwo̩te̩jane̩ Ondu;
And the fourth angel sounded, and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars; so as the third part of them was darkened, and the day shone not for a third part of it, and the night likewise.	Tak onuche̩ e̩ke̩le̩ fʼo̩kakachi-wñ: oñ ma fʼukpe̩ e̩ke̩ta e-olu kpa, kpʼukpe̩ e̩ke̩ta ochu kpʼukpe̩ e̩ke̩ta awo awo; todu kʼukpe̩ e̩ke̩ta-wñ ki chubi, todu kʼukpe̩ e̩ke̩ta o̩ro̩ka ki we etejugede, kpʼodu abe̩le̩ ge̩.
Therefore I am full of the fury of the	Todule̩ e̩do̩fulu Jihofa che̩ko̩ efumi;
Then said Jesus unto his disciples,	Oñ Jisus ka ñw amako̩che̩-wñ kakini, Ami, naka ñwu me̩, ka kʼakanya i che ñw anana tak i agudu tʼojane̩ e-efojale.
And because he saw it pleased the Jews, he proceeded further to take Peter also. (Then were the days of unleavened bread.)	Tak abu kʼi li ka kʼe-le̩ chenyo̩ amaJu eju, i ño̩ gbo̩gba gwo̩nyu Pita ge̩. (E̩gbale̩ la chʼo̩jo̩ uje̩wñ ku ma ma dʼo̩jo̩wu tʼo̩ n.)
therefore prophesy and say, Thus saith the Lord	todule̩ e̩ nakache̩ kʼe̩ kakini, Abu kʼOndu Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Todu, owñ chʼutodu ku ma fʼume̩ gwʼalache̩, ku ma la kʼame̩ mi o̩wo̩ tʼo̩wo̩ du, ku me̩ ki mud e̩wñ kʼe̩bobo abo uche̩ichi ane̩, kʼamako̩la la mʼume̩ ko nʼalu aka, ku me̩ mud inabali e̩bie̩ne̩ ugbo amone̩;

And he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.	Tak i fʼuma mu, oñ i fʼo̩la-i ka ñwu ma.

for the Holy Ghost shall teach you in the same hour what ye ought to say.	todu Afu Kiafo̩ ako̩ me̩ e̩wñ ki dukpe̩ ku me̩ ka iko le̩ kpakpa.

And the seventh year Jehoiada sent and fetched the rulers over hundreds, with the captains and the guard, and brought them to him into the house of the	Tak o̩do̩ e̩kebie-wñ Jiho̩yada fʼonuche̩ kpe̩ kʼi ko amagboji one̩ ogu-me̩lu ogume̩lu ku ma nʼo̩da abide wa, kpai amonuche̩, oñ i mʼuma ko wʼugbo-wñ ef unyi Jihofa; tak i fʼalo kpe̩ kpai ama, oñ i je̩ ñwu ma go̩ ñw u ef unyi Jihofa le̩, tak i dʼo̩ma onu ña ma.
And they gave them the city of Arba the father of Anak, which	Oñ ma mu Kiriat-arba, oj ane̩ uwo Juda, manyu ane̩ ije̩ ki lʼowñ daka ko ñwu ma. Arba le̩ chʼata Anak le̩, (owñ che He̩bro̩n).
Now therefore, O	Todule̩ fai, O Jihofa, O̩jo̩ Israe̩l, e̩ nafʼe̩wñ kʼe̩ katane̩ ñw adu-we̩ Defid, ata-mi, de ñw u, e-kʼe̩ kakini, O̩ne̩ ki a gugu oj ede Israe̩l eju-mi añʼuwe̩ n, chai e-le̩ kate: amo̩ma-we̩ ki fʼo̩la-ma de̩, ku ma lule̩ ef uko̩-o̩la-mi dabalu kʼuwe̩ te̩talule̩ o̩gba-mi le̩.

All those that were numbered of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron and the chief of Israel numbered, after their families, and after the house of their fathers,	O̩chaka one̩ ku ma kaluka ef abo Lifai, e-ku Mose̩s kpai Aro̩n kpai amidachi Israe̩l kaluka akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi-ma, kpai ikpo unyi ikpo unyi amata-ma,

for kings, and	todu amonu kpʼabo du ku ma jʼef uña ki dago; todu kʼa ki jo̩ to̩ko̩o̩ ache e̩wñ yo̩o̩ kʼa akpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩ kʼa che e̩wñ ki nyo̩ du kʼo̩kone̩ ache.

In those days I Daniel was mourning three full weeks.	Iko le̩, omi Danie̩l, nʼeku ade̩ o̩jo̩ mebie ebie me̩ta.
And I have given you a land for which ye did not labour, and cities which ye built not, and ye dwell in them; of the vineyards and oliveyards which ye planted not do ye eat.	Tak u mʼane̩ ki ma chʼame̩ chʼakanya-wñ n du ñwu me̩ kpai ewo ewo e-ki ma chʼame̩ ko̩ n, oñ me̩ dodo jʼo̩mo̩; me̩ jʼaje̩ e̩ro achiwebe̩te̩ma kpai oli o̩lif e-ki ma chʼame̩ ne n.
For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken even that which he hath.	Todu e̩ne̩ ki nʼe̩wñ, ma adʼu manyʼu ñw u; e̩ne̩ ki ma ne̩ n, I chaka chʼe̩wñ kʼi ne̩, ma abʼo̩ gba.

And the king of Egypt put him down at Jerusalem, and condemned the land in an hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.	Tak onu Ijipti mʼu yo̩ tane̩ Je̩rusale̩m, oñ i fʼo̩ko bu ñw abo oj ane̩ le̩; ajifa-wñ chʼalu tale̩nt ogume̩lu, o̩jamalia-wñ la che tale̩nt oka.

And it came to pass as they came, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women came out of all cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet king Saul, with tabrets, with joy, and with instruments of musick.	Oñ i lewatu abu ku ma jʼej o̩na awa, e̩gba ku Defid doji kwʼoko ekpa e̩ne̩ Filistia le̩, kʼabobule̩ nʼeli eko̩ kpai ido eta kwef ewo ewo Israe̩l chaka awa, aledo onu So̩l kpʼeicha kpai uyo̩ kpai e̩wñ ido.
Then was king Belshazzar greatly troubled, and his countenance was changed in him, and his lords were astonied.	Tak e̩do̩ onu Be̩lshaza mukpabie̩ tabale, alu kʼeju-wñ de̩ murida, oñ ibe abojima onu mudajugu nyʼomune̩.
When I shall make the land of Egypt desolate, and the country shall be destitute of that whereof it was full, when I shall smite all them that dwell therein, then shall they know that I	E̩gba kʼu na Iʼane̩ Ijipti chʼalache̩ te̩
So the king of Israel went, and the king of Judah, and the king of Edom: and they fetched a compass of seven days' journey: and there was no water for the host, and for the cattle that followed them. from Ekron even unto the sea, all that	akwo E̩kro̩n gbogbo wa ohimini abadi, e-du ki jʼakolo̩ Ashdo̩d, manyu ikpo unyi ikpo unyi-ma.

By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make	Todabu kʼone̩ ete̩mane̩ chʼo̩gbe̩nugbe̩ amone̩ jʼakwa;

and the land which I gave Abraham and Isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thy seed after thee will I give the land.	Ane̩ kʼomi du ñw Ebraham kpai Aise̩k, uwe̩ nadʼu ñw u, naño̩ dʼane̩ kide̩ ñw ugbe̩-we̩ ubi-we̩ ge̩.
And Joseph also went up from Galilee, out of the city of Nazareth, into Judæa, unto the city of David, which is called Bethlehem; (because he was of the house and lineage of David:)	Oñ Jose̩f mute̩gu kwʼojane̩ Galili kwʼewo Nazare̩t nyi ewo Defid ku ma do̩ ko̩ Be̩tle̩he̩m ane̩ Judia, todu kʼe̩te̩-wñ chʼo̩lo̩pu abo akwo̩ra unyi Defid,

saying	i kakini, Go, awa anyi Je̩rusale̩m; ma la adʼO̩ma One̩ ñw amagboji amatama kpai amako̩takada mu, ma akpʼo̩ abi kʼi ku, ma adʼu ñw abo uche̩ichi;
And that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye burn with fire.	Oñ e̩la-wñ kpai akala ki bo̩bo̩ me̩ ki muko gujo ef una.
Absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every man which hath any suit or cause might come unto me, and I would do him justice!	Absalom ño̩ ka kakini, O ma ma du mi chʼakajo̩ ane̩-i, kʼe̩ne̩ du kʼi nʼo̩la abe̩k ajo̩ kʼi nawʼugbo-mi, tak omi ma dale o̩kpakpa!
And of the priests: the children of Habaiah, the children of Koz, the children of Barzillai, which took	E-amatama la de̩: amo̩ma Habaya, amo̩ma Hakos, amo̩ma Barzilai, owñ chʼe̩ne̩ ki nʼo̩ma Barzilai, e̩ne̩ Ge̩liad le̩ oka chʼo̩ya, tak amone̩ chane̩ e̩dʼo̩ odu o̩lo̩pu o̩ya-wñ.
So I turned and came down from the mount, and the mount burned with fire: and the two tables of the covenant	Abe̩le̩ u murida, oñ u gwo̩ru kwoj uwo le̩ wane̩, uwo le̩ najo una; alo okuta meji kʼo̩la alo kʼi kpe̩ chʼe̩ko̩ nyʼo̩la-wñ la jʼef o̩wo̩-mi meji.
And David sent forth a third part of the people under the hand of Joab, and a third part under the hand of Abishai the son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, and a third part under the hand of Ittai the Gittite. And the king said unto the people, I will surely go forth with you myself also.	Taku Defid je̩ ñw amone̩ ledufu, ukpe̩re̩ta-ma jʼef o̩wo̩ Joab, ukpe̩re̩ta-ma la jʼef o̩wo̩ Abishai, o̩ma Ze̩ruaya o̩maye Joab le̩, oñ ukpe̩re̩ta-ma la jʼef o̩wo̩ Itai e̩ne̩ Gat le̩. Tak onu ka ñw amone̩ le̩ kakini, Omi onugo ñʼadufu kpʼame̩ ge̩.
And he said unto the disciples,	Oñ i ka ñw amako̩che̩ le̩ kakini, O̩jo̩-wñ awa, e̩gba kʼe̩ño̩ o̩jo̩ʼka e-O̩ma One̩-i eli ache me, me̩ la aliʼu n.
And	Amone̩ le̩ tale ayajo̩, oñ ma fʼu no̩ oj okuta, cho̩kpo̩ni ma gwu ef agu, taku ma fʼu hi ef ucha, oñ ma dʼu chʼakala; e̩ dʼu tʼalu i la dab akala ku ma nʼekpo etito̩ che.
For mine eyes	Todu eju-mi tʼo̩na o̩na-ma du; ama maja ñw eju mi n, udu kʼama fe̩ la maja ñw eju-mi n.
that thou hast slain my children, and delivered them to cause them to pass through	kʼe̩ ño̩ fʼamo̩ma-mi kpa kʼe̩ la mʼuma ko rinyo̩ ugbo kʼe̩ je̩ ñwu ma lale gu ef una du nyʼugbo ma?
For length of days, and long life,	todu e-le̩ abutʼojolugbo-we̩
Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies;	Uwe̩ je̩ ñw ame̩nebi-mi mʼubi dagbʼomi,
which also were accounted giants, as the Anakims; but the Moabites call them Emims.	ma ño̩ fʼabo le̩ lo rʼef abo Refaim alu ku ma che abo Anak; abo Moab muda do̩ ma ko Emim.
In the dark they dig through houses,	Ane̩ chubi ma gwʼura tef unyi;
and satest upon a stately bed, and a table prepared before it, whereupon thou hast set mine incense and mine oil.	oñe̩kwogugu oj ate̩ ojima, e̩wñ te̩rʼoj itebulu o̩gba-wñ, oñ otulale-mi kpʼekpo-mi jʼoji-wñ.
He that dasheth in pieces is come up before thy face: keep the munition, watch the way, make	E̩ne̩ kʼi akpʼe̩wñ fo̩ rʼane̩ lewa kʼi akobʼe̩.
But it came to pass, when Ahab was dead, that the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.	Ama i lewatu e̩gba kʼEhab leku, onu Moab le̩ fʼe̩re̩ ubi ro ñw onu Israe̩l.
And when the wife of Uriah heard that Uriah her husband was dead, she mourned for her husband.	E̩gba kʼo̩ya Uraya le̩ gbo̩ ka kʼUraya o̩ko̩-wñ leku, i la deku o̩ko-wñ.
And they that passed by reviled him, wagging their heads,	Oñ abo ku ma alale chʼakpabie̩-wñ, ma miʼoji-ma ejo,
So the Levites and all Judah did according to all things that Jehoiada the priest had commanded, and took every man his men that were to come in on the sabbath, with them that were to go	Abe̩le̩ abo Lifai kpʼabo Juda chaka che alu du ku Jihoyada atama ñwate̩. E̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ la mʼabo-wñ ko mʼe̩do̩, owñ chʼabo kʼi dʼukpe̩ ku ma gudu wa o̩jo̩ uñmi, manyʼabo ki dʼukpe̩ ku ma dufu o̩jo̩ uñmi; todu Jiho̩yada tʼuche̩ du no̩ ku ma nyʼunyi n.
But if they	Iche̩wñ kʼama chʼamakache̩ kʼo̩la Jihofa la dʼugbo-ma ochochi, mak ama ki chologu bo̩ Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du kʼe̩wñ eku ki bo̩ jʼef unyi Jihofa, kpai ef unyi onu Juda, kpʼefu Je̩rusale̩m, ki we enyi Babilo̩n.
And Moses said unto Joshua, Choose us out men, and go out, fight with Amalek: to morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the rod of God in mine hand.	Taku Mose̩s ka ñwu Jo̩shua kakini, Fʼaboke̩le̩ chi ñw a kʼe̩ dufu nyʼajogu kpai Amale̩k; nadago oj uwo-i o̩na, o̩kpa O̩jo̩ adʼef o̩wo̩-mi.
And Joab returned from following Abner: and when he had gathered all the people together, there lacked of David's servants nineteen men and Asahel.	Joab mudabi bʼetʼAbina ubi te̩; oñ e̩gba kʼi f ʼamone̩ le̩ chaka do̩ jeju, abo kʼi chi kwef amadu Defid chʼone̩ me̩gwe̩la manyʼAsahe̩l.
They spend their days in wealth,	Ma jo̩ ajʼura o̩jo̩ du,
No lion shall be there, nor	Idu du adʼo̩mo̩ n,
And when they had gone through the isle unto Paphos, they found a certain sorcerer, a false prophet, a Jew, whose name	Oñ abu ku ma lale gu ef ala le̩ du gbogbo wa Pafo̩s, ma fʼachifamuʼka kʼi chʼakache̩ olemi li, e̩ne̩ Ju kʼodu-wñ ko̩ Barjisus i che.
Restore unto me the joy of thy salvation;	Dʼuyo̩ ujadu-we̩ dabi wa ñw mi,
And it came to pass after these things, that Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the	Tak i lewatu anubi e̩wñ-i, ki Jo̩shua o̩ma Nun, adu Jihofa le̩, leku, o̩do̩-wñ la chʼogume̩lu nyoke me̩gwa.
Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people, and go from them! for they	O, omi ma nʼuru abelo̩na
He hath given meat unto them that fear him:	I mʼuje̩wñ ko ñw abo ku ma railo-wñ me̩;
And the idols he shall utterly abolish.	Ode ode du la atakpa rʼeju hioko.
