And David said to Abigail, Blessed	Taku Defid ka ñw Abige̩l kakini, Jihofa ki nʼele, owñ chʼO̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l kʼi fʼuwe̩ kpuche̩ kʼe̩ ledo mi eñini-i!
But now having no more place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come unto you;	ama fai, abu kʼu ma nʼuña ugbo-i ge̩ n, abu kʼo̩do̩ kʼeju che mi kʼu wʼugbo me̩ chewewe me̩,
Blessed	O̩jo̩ kʼi ño̩ chʼAta Ondu-wa Jisus Kraist ki nele, owñ chʼAta ejumomi eli kpʼO̩jo̩ ki nʼugbe̩do̩ chaka edu ñw one̩,
I have set the point of the sword against all their gates, that	Omi mʼo̩kwo̩chageli kʼi afo̩ko̩ ma le̩ du te̩ akpejurʼalaku alaku-ma chaka kʼe̩do̩ du ki muyo̩, kʼe̩wñ uke̩re̩ ki wewe nyo̩gba; aa, i ada dab o̩mamanya, alu-wñ la chʼe̩dule̩ te̩ tod one̩ ekpa.
and saw him saying unto me,	tak u li abu kʼi aka ñw mi kakini, Hika che ke, kʼe̩ kwo Je̩rusale̩m alo piopio, todu ma je̩ gba ibenu kʼe̩ gba mi n.
brought beds, and basons, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and flour, and parched	abo le̩ kʼate kpai ucha kpai o̩ka wit kpai barli kpʼomu, kpʼakakpa e̩ro, kpʼe̩gwa, kpʼirere, kpʼe̩wñ omune̩,
Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the	E̩ ki fʼe̩do̩ ne̩, kʼa fʼe̩ne̩ke̩le̩ che tod abo-wa, kpai tod ewo ewo O̩jo̩-wa. Jihofa ki nache e̩wñ ki nyo̩ eju-wñ.
Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Pharez the son of Judah.	Utai o̩ma Amihud, o̩ma O̩mri, o̩ma Imrai, o̩ma Benai ef amo̩ma Pe̩re̩z, o̩ma Juda le̩.
For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful,	Todu i ño̩ nʼe̩gba kʼawa onugo ma nʼibe n me̩, a la gbo̩lagbo̩ n, ma ko wa la, a jo̩ achʼadu e̩ño̩ e̩wñ kpʼe̩wñ ube̩do̩ ojoji ojoji, oñ a jo̩ ef e̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ eche kpai ule̩na, e̩wñ ulaka a che, a laño̩ nʼulaka omune̩ ache.
And he said unto them,	Tak i ka ñw ma kakini, Owñ chʼe̩wñ? Oñ ma ka ñw u ka kʼo̩la e-Jisus abo Nazare̩t e-kʼi chʼakache̩ kʼi nʼukpahiu ef uko̩lo̩ kpʼo̩la eju O̩jo̩ kpai eju amone̩ chaka;
grace	Ufe̩de̩nyo̩ kpʼure̩do̩ kwugbo O̩jo̩ Ata-wa kpʼOndu Jisus Kraist ki dʼugbo me̩.
and I will lay sinews upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live; and ye shall know that I	Nako ili nyʼume̩, u la ñʼakʼo̩re̩la wa abʼume̩ ma, oñ nadʼaño̩ bʼume̩ ma, kʼu nadʼafu tʼume̩ efu, tak ame̩ adeju; oñ ame̩ ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩.

And he went and joined himself to a citizen of that country; and he sent him into his fields to feed swine.	Tak i le nafʼo̩la mʼabo ane̩ le̩ʼka o̩la, oñ e̩ne̩ le̩ fʼowñ kpe̩ tʼoko-wñ kʼi kʼe̩wñ ñw amoko je̩.
I have heard the murmurings of the children of Israel: speak unto them, saying, At even ye shall eat flesh, and in the morning ye shall be filled with bread; and ye shall know that I	Omi gbo̩ eñmini amo̩ma Israe̩l me̩; e̩ naka ñwu ma kakini, E̩gba kʼo̩jo̩ adu bulu-bulu ame̩ aje̩ e̩la, efu-me̩ la ako̩ ñw uje̩wñ odudu, tak ame̩ ama ka kʼomi che Jihofa, O̩jo̩-me̩.

And the	Taku Jihofa fʼudala udala abo Kaldia kpai udala udala abo Siria kpai udala udala abo Moab kpai udala udala amo̩ma Amo̩n, kpuche̩ wa akobʼo̩. I la kpʼuma uche̩ wa akobo̩ Juda kʼi lenyo̩ bʼane̩ te̩, teju alu kʼo̩la Jihofa de̩ e-kʼi ka lugbo amadu-wñ amakache̩.
and he spake unto them, saying, Return with much riches unto your tents, and with very much cattle, with silver, and with gold, and with brass, and with iron, and with very much raiment: divide the spoil of your enemies with your brethren.	i ka ñwu ma kakini, Me̩ kʼe̩wñ anana elile kpai ame̩wñukpa nana kpai ajifa kpai o̩jamalia kpai ebije ikpa kpai ebije kpai e̩wñ o̩la nana nana dabi tʼunyabo-me̩; me̩ fʼe̩wñ ame̩ne̩bi-me̩ kʼogu je̩ le̩ kpe̩ kpai amo̩maye-me̩.
for Mahlah, Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married unto their father's brothers' sons:	todu Mala kpai Tirza kpai Ho̩gla kpai Milka kpai Noa, amo̩ma onobule̩ Ze̩lo̩fe̩had le̩, nʼamo̩ma amo̩maye atama chʼo̩ko̩-ma.

and twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom.	Oñ amidu me̩gweji dago jʼo̩wo̩ʼka kpʼo̩wo̩ ekeji oj ubo̩ me̩fe̩fa le̩; ma che e̩go̩-wñ oj ane̩ du n.
Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall ye diminish	Ame̩ ki butʼo̩la kʼu ñwa ñwu me̩-i n, me̩ ki la bu wane̩ n; kʼame̩ ki de uko̩ Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩ e-kʼu nañwa ñwu me̩.

And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.	Oñ i lewatʼo̩jo̩ñwa-wñ e̩gba kʼabo Filistia wa ku ma ñʼane̩ bʼo̩la abo ki ku le̩ te̩, ma fu So̩l kpʼamo̩ma-wñ li abu ku ma wane̩ jʼoj uwo Gilboa le̩.

For now should I have lain still and been quiet,	Todu, fai omi ma dachi ye̩e̩;

Of Merari	Me̩rari chʼe̩te̩ akwo̩ra unyi abo Mali kpai akwo̩ra unyi abo Mushi: abo le̩ chʼakwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi Me̩rari.
Arise, O	Kwane̩, O Jihofa! gbʼo̩ oji, kʼe̩ mʼu du fiane̩!
And thou shalt observe the feast of weeks, of the firstfruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of ingathering at the year's end.	Uwe̩ ki la fejutʼuje̩wñ uyo̩ e-o̩jo̩ mebie o̩jo̩ mebie le̩ kpai ejo̩ga o̩ka wit kʼe̩ ko wʼunyi kpai uje̩wñ uyo̩ e-e̩wñ eko wʼunyi oj o̩do̩ le̩.
And Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not suffer any to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.	Beasha onu Israe̩l kobo̩ Juda, kʼi la fu Rama ko̩, kʼi che kʼi je̩ ñw e̩ne̩ du we edufu kpai egudu nyʼugbo Esa onu Juda.
By thee have I been holden up from the womb:	Uwe̩ oñ omi dachino kwef uwile̩;
But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.	Ama e̩ne̩ ki agudu lʼalugbana, chʼadide amala.
The children of Kirjath-arim, Chephirah, and Beeroth, seven hundred and forty and three.	Amo̩ma Kiriat-arim, kpai Chifaira kpai Biro̩t che ulo̩gwa nyʼo̩gbo̩ mebie nyoke me̩ta.
Now therefore give not your daughters unto their sons, neither take their daughters unto your sons, nor seek their peace or their wealth for ever: that ye may be strong, and eat the good of the land, and leave	Todule̩ fa-i, ame̩ ki kʼamo̩ma-me̩ onobule̩ ñw amo̩ma-ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ n, me̩ ki la kʼamo̩ma-ma onobule̩ ñw amo̩ma-me̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ n, me̩ ki tene ure̩do̩-ma n, me̩ ki la tene kʼe̩wñ ki ra ñwu ma ogbegbele̩ n; kʼame̩ ki gbiti ku me̩ jʼe̩nyo̩ ane̩ le̩, kʼi mud e̩wñ ogu amo̩ma-me̩ ogbegbele̩.
And he did	I laño̩ fʼe̩wñ ki bie̩ne̩ eju Jihofa che, teju e̩wñ du kʼata-wñ che.
Yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from his wickedness, nor from his wicked way, he shall die in his iniquity; but thou hast delivered thy soul.	I muda che̩wñ kʼe̩ fʼuka je̩ ñw e̩ne̩bibi, kʼi ma la rida bʼe̩wñ bibi-wñ te̩ n, kpai kwo bʼo̩na bibi-wñ le̩ te̩ n, i aku ef abi-wñ kʼi je̩, uwe̩ muda fʼoji o̩la-we̩ jadu me̩.
the land of Egypt	Ane̩ Ijipti te̩ ñw e̩-i; ugbo kʼane̩ nyo̩ tule e̩ dʼata-we̩ kpai amo̩maye-we̩ gugu; je̩ ñwu ma gugu ane̩ Goshe̩n; i la che̩wñ kʼe̩ ma abo ki le efu-ma, mak e̩ ko ma chʼamagboji abo ku ma de ame̩wñ ukpa e-mi.
I the	Omi, Jihofa, ka me̩, e̩wñ le̩ nache abo o̩gbadu e̩bie̩ne̩ ku ma jeju nyu mi o̩la-i chuu: ma alenyo̩ rʼeju ef aje̩tachi-i, o̩mo̩ ma la aku.

and shall make him of quick understanding in the fear of the	Uyo̩-wñ la adʼef ailo Jihofa era.

Behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the Lord	Go, omi adʼailoʼka wa abʼuwe̩ oji ma,
And it came to pass, when he saw the earring and bracelets upon his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, Thus spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and, behold, he stood by the camels at the well.	Oñ i lewatu e̩gba kʼi fʼelika le̩ li kpai ude̩ o̩wo̩ ki jʼo̩wo̩ o̩maye-wñ, kʼi ño̩ gbʼo̩la Ribe̩ka o̩maye-wñ, ka kʼabe̩le̩ e̩ne̩ le̩ ka ñwu mi, i la wʼugbo e̩ne̩ le̩; me̩ go, i dago ugbo aminyakulumi alu e̩bi omi le̩.
And thou shalt put it before the vail that	Tak e̩ mʼu du dago o̩gba ukpo ugbeju e-kʼi dʼugbo akpati ibenu le̩, o̩gba ugugu unye̩-do̩ kʼi bʼoji e̩wñ ibenu le̩ ma, ugbo kʼomi ade kpai uwe̩.
Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.	I nʼe̩ne̩ ki ali uwa e̩bie̩ne̩ ef ume̩? I ki chʼadua. I nʼe̩ne̩ kʼe̩do̩-wñ bo̩? I ki kʼeli dʼO̩jo̩.
Now in the eighteenth year of king Jeroboam the son of Nebat reigned Abijam over Judah.	Oñ Abijam chane̩ ejʼonu Juda o̩do̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩jo̩ Je̩ro̩boam, onu, o̩ma Nebat le̩.
Brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are spiritual, restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering thyself, lest thou also be tempted.	Amo̩maye, dagba e̩wñ uñwanane̩ ʼka gbʼe̩ne̩ʼka o̩gba kʼi muñwanane̩, ame̩ ku me̩ mʼo̩la-me̩ ko ñw Afu Kiafo̩ me̩ nañwʼe̩ne̩ e̩go̩-i che te̩gu-wñ ef afu o̩chikimi, e̩ nafʼeju tʼo̩la e-we̩ tode̩gba ku ma ño̩ jʼuwe̩ onugo ma ge̩.
And it shall come to pass, if they will not believe also these two signs, neither hearken unto thy voice, that thou shalt take of the water of the river, and pour	I la che̩wñ kʼama ma do̩ ujiwe meji-i rʼochochi n, ku ma ma agbʼomu-we̩ n, mak e̩ mʼomi Naye̩l du kʼe̩ mʼu du dajʼane̩ e̩gbe̩; tak omi kʼe̩ kpa kwefu Naye̩l le̩ amud e̩bie̩ tʼane̩ e̩gbe̩ le̩.
For I will rise up against them, saith the	Nakwane̩ tʼuma o̩la, Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du aka-i, nakʼodu eko̩ kpai e̩bo̩bo̩ one̩ kpai o̩ma kpai aaju da bi Babilo̩n te̩, Jihofa ka-i.
Mine heart within me is broken because of the prophets; all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine hath overcome, because of the	I chʼe-amakache̩:
The	Jihofa ki de̩nyo̩ ñw e̩, kʼi la fʼuwe̩ de:
Now at the end of the days that the king had said he should bring them in, then the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.	Tak e̩gba kʼo̩jo̩ kʼonu bu ñwu ma taku ma ako ma wa jo̩, agboji amonoji le̩ mʼuma ko wʼejefu o̩gba Ne̩biukadne̩za.
And here men that die receive tithes; but there he	I la chʼemi, amone̩ ku ma aku agba ukpe̩ e̩ke̩gwa le̩; o̩mo̩ e̩ne̩ ku ma gbʼo̩ ibenu ka kʼi deju agba.
and finding a ship sailing over unto Phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.	oñ abu kʼa fʼo̩ko̩ kʼi adaba nyi Fonisia li, kʼa la tʼo, a kwane̩ ule̩-wa.
And he commanded us to preach unto the people, and to testify that it is he which was ordained of God	Tak i ka ñw a kʼa takoya ñw amone̩, kʼa la fʼibenu gba nyo̩nyo̩ kakini, Owñ le̩ chʼe̩ne̩ kʼO̩jo̩ fudate̩ kʼi chʼakajo̩ abo ki deju kpʼabo ki ku.
And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.	Amone̩ wewe la gugu kpenyʼu, oñ ma ka ñw u kakini, Go, iye-we̩ kpai amo̩maye-we̩ jʼo̩do̩da afeju we̩.
The	Jihofa ki kpo̩na, o̩wo̩-mi edu dufu chʼagwunyʼe̩ne̩ ku Jihofa fʼekpo ba tʼo̩ oji; ama fa-i nagbo̩ko̩bʼuwe̩ kʼe̩ mʼo̩kwo̩ kʼi dʼugbo oji-wñ du, kpai o̩cha omi-wñ, kʼa lo wa.
Remove out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the he goats before the flocks.	Me̩ ra bʼalumeji Babilo̩n te̩, me̩ ki la kwo oj ane̩ abo Kaldia dufu, ku me̩ dab amobuko̩ ku ma tʼame̩wño̩re̩ egini o̩gba.
But since ye say, The burden of the	I muda che̩wñ ku me̩ kakini, Adu Jihofa de̩, abu ki Jihofa ka de̩ kakini, Todabu ku me̩ kʼo̩la le̩ kakini, Adu Jihofa de̩, kʼu la fʼuche̩ kpe̩ rʼume̩ kakini, Ame̩ ki we eka kakini, Adu Jihofa de̩,
And Jesus went about all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing all manner of sickness and all manner of disease among the people.	Taku Jisus fʼo̩gbo̩ ane̩ Galili du le ako̩ ma e̩wñ ef unyi ujeju-ma. I la nʼakoya Uche̩nyo̩ Ojane̩ ata, kpʼo̩ga du kpʼe̩gbo du ef amone̩ le̩ ache kpa.
Now God had brought Daniel into favour and tender love with the prince of the eunuchs.	O̩jo̩ la je̩ ñw agboji amonoji ki li Danie̩l eju kʼi mo̩la ñw u kʼi no̩ liʼu ejumomi.
And Solomon loved the	So̩lo̩mo̩n la fe̩do̩ Jihofa, i nalule̩ teju e̩wñ uhio̩me̩ Defid, ata-wñ; i muda nʼiche̩bo̩ ache kpai otulale agujo oj otete otete le̩.
And all the oxen for the sacrifice of the peace offerings	o̩chaka amokuno̩ ku ma kpa tod iche̩bo̩ ure̩do̩ la chʼo̩kokuno̩ ogu nyoke me̩le̩, amokolo-wñ chʼo̩gbo̩ me̩ta, amobuko̩-wñ chʼo̩gbo̩ me̩ta, amala e-o̩mo̩do̩ʼka chʼo̩gbo̩ me̩ta. Abo e-le̩ chʼe̩wñ ele ku ma ko wa ku ma dʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ le̩ te̩ ñw O̩jo̩ abu ku ma fʼekpo fia nyʼu o̩la.
And the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of that which is torn with beasts, may be used in any other use: but ye shall in no wise eat of it.	Me̩ neke dʼula e̩la ki leku, kpai ula e̩la kʼame̩la fufana, che e̩wñ omune̩ ojoji du; i muda nʼugbo du ku me̩ aje̩ n.
For this cause we also, since the day we heard	Lef e-le̩, akwʼo̩jo̩ kʼa gbo̩, awa ño̩ we echadua todu me̩ n. A la abiʼi ebi todu kʼema e̩wñ ki dʼowñ e̩do̩ o̩gbolo ki che̩ko̩ ef ume̩, ef ibe kpai oji e̩wñ e-afu du ema,
therefore said I, The Philistines will come down now upon me to Gilgal, and I have not made supplication unto the	todule̩ u kakini, Fai abo Filistia agwo̩ru wa Gilgal abʼumi ma, u la gbo̩ko̩bo̩ Jihofa kʼi li mi eju ta n. Todule̩ u fʼeju kpolo che, oñ u fʼiche̩bo̩ e̩gujo che.
He will not regard any ransom;	E̩wñ akoji du awʼowñ eju n,
For the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although they were yet alive: for the vision	Todu e̩ne̩ ki ta e̩wñ ñʼadabi nyʼugbo e̩wñ kʼi ta n dagba ma chaka deju ta. Todu ane̩ ego-wñ kad o̩wo̩ one̩ chaka; e̩ne̩ du adabi n; e̩ne̩ du la anʼugbite̩re̩-wñ dejutʼoji o̩la-wñ n.
And the	Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ la ako abo uche̩ichi le̩ ro̩ rinyo̩ bʼuwe̩ o̩gba te̩ pe̩pe̩pe̩pe̩; uwe̩ aneke fʼuma liye̩ e̩gbakate n, tode̩gba kʼame̩wñ iñmi oko awewe bʼuwe̩ ma.
Ho, every one that thirsteth, come ye to the waters, and he that hath no money; come ye, buy, and eat; yea, come, buy wine and milk without money and without price.	Uwe̩, e̩ne̩ du kʼolugbe̩ akpʼo̩,
Meshezabeel, Zadok, Jaddua,	kpai Me̩she̩zabel kpai Zedo̩k kpai Ja-dua
and Ahijah, Hanan, Anan,	kpʼAhiya kpai Hanan kpʼAnan
Again the word of the	O̩la Jihofa ño̩ wʼugbo mi kakini,
Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof:	Ohimini abadi ki chekuku, kpʼe̩wñ du ki jʼef uwñ,
I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.	Todule̩ u chenʼuba kʼu naba efu Kraisti Jisus ugbo e̩wñ e-O̩jo̩.
Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa aka de̩ kakini:
But our God	O̩jo̩-wa dʼefojale efojale;
The Pharisees heard that the people murmured such things concerning him; and the Pharisees and the chief priests sent officers to take him.	AmaFarisi gbo̩ abu kʼo̩wo̩-amone̩ dʼo̩la-wñ te̩ ajeñmini, abe̩-i; tak amagboji amatama kpai amaFarisi fʼabimo̩to̩ kpe̩ wa ku ma fʼu mu.
And ye shall wash your clothes on the seventh day, and ye shall be clean, and afterward ye shall come into the camp.	Me̩ ki gwe̩ e̩wñ o̩la-me̩ o̩jo̩ e̩kebie-wñ, tak ame̩ afe̩; ubi le̩ taku me̩ agudu wʼef uru-i.
because that, when they knew God, they glorified	Todu abu ku ma chema O̩jo̩ ma bʼukpe̩ ojima e-O̩jo̩ mʼo̩ n; ma la gwʼo̩ ugwa n; chai ibe ma kpe̩ tinyo̩ ofofo, oñ e̩do̩-ma ki ma nʼeju ene̩ n kwochubi.
Then these men assembled unto the king, and said unto the king, Know, O king, that the law of the Medes and Persians	Tak abo le̩ kʼo̩la-ma jeju wʼugbo onu, oñ ma ka ñw onu kakini, O onu, uwe̩ ki ma ka kʼi chʼo̩lo̩da abo Me̩dia kpai abo Pe̩rsia, ka kʼaba kʼonu ne kpai o̩me̩ kʼi hi kʼi fʼu lonyane̩ arida n.
Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.	Ami, naka ñwu me̩ kakini, I nʼugbo du kʼabo o̩gba kide̩ alale rinyo̩ gbogbo tak e̩wñ-i du wache n.
Hear, ye	Ame̩ ku me̩ jʼo̩najiji, me̩ gbo̩ e̩wñ kʼu che-i;
These likewise cast lots over against their brethren the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, and Ahimelech, and the chief of the fathers of the priests and Levites, even the principal fathers over against their younger brethren.	Abo-i ño̩ fʼanya ro̩ alu kʼamo̩maye-ma amo̩ma Aro̩n le̩ ro̩ eju Defid, onu, kpai eju Zedo̩k kpai Ahime̩le̩k, kpʼabo ku ma dʼoji dufu ef amata amatama, kpʼabo Lifai ge̩. Abo ku ma dʼoji dufu ef amata che alu kʼamo-kekele-ma de̩ ge̩.
Keep therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.	Todule̩ me̩ ki de o̩la alo-i, ku me̩ che tʼeju-wñ, ki ra ñwu me̩ ef e̩wñ du ku me̩ che.
Then said he also to him that bade him,	Oñ i ño̩ ka ñw e̩ne̩ ki dʼo̩ wa le̩ kakini, E̩gba kʼe̩ hi o̩je̩ ñwu ma, abe̩k e̩ kʼe̩wñ ñw one̩ kʼi kpucho̩, e̩ ki do̩ amonuku-we̩ kpʼamo̩maye-we̩ kpʼamefu-we̩ kpʼamekeji-we̩ ku ma chʼamanana n, tode̩gba ku ma dabi do̩ we̩ koji, kʼe-le̩ la amud akoji-wñ ñw e̩.
But as for me, this secret is not revealed to me for	I muda chʼe-mi e̩wñ ki maja le̩ tejugede ñwu mi tod ibeʼka kʼu ne̩ tʼabo ki bo̩ ku ma deju le n, chai todu kʼonu ki mʼofe-wñ kʼuwe̩ ki la ma ibe ki wʼef uwe̩ le̩.
And when it was day, he called	Tak e̩gba kʼo̩jo̩ muñwa, i fʼamako̩che̩-wñ do̩ wa; oñ i fʼone̩ me̩gweji chi efu ma; i ño̩ dʼodu abo le̩ ko ame̩nukpuche̩.
Now they have known that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are of thee.	Fa-i ma chema ka kʼe̩wñ du kʼe̩ ko ñwu mi, ugbo we̩ i kwo.
and the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the Lord shall raise him up; and if he have committed sins, they shall be forgiven him.	Adua e-e̩do̩ ekono la ajadu e̩ne̩ kʼo̩la-wñ muda le̩, tak Ondu adʼu kwane̩. I la che̩wñ ki chʼa dure i ta ño̩ ta le̩, ma ato̩no̩ ñw u.
And when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.	Oñ abu kʼi alo tef o̩ko̩, e̩ne̩ kʼi nʼebili akwoubi le̩ gbo̩ko̩bʼo̩ kʼi lebʼo̩.
But thou hast saved us from our enemies,	E̩ muda fʼuwa jadu bʼabo ku ma chʼuwa o̩pe̩cha te̩ me̩,
But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the	Siho̩n, onu He̩shbo̩n, muda je̩ ñw a lale gu owñ du n; todu Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ je̩ ñw e̩do̩-wñ no̩, oñ i dʼe̩do̩ e̩gbiti ñw u, todu kʼi mʼowñ du tʼuwe̩ o̩wo̩ alu ki de̩ eñini-i.
Behold also the ships, which though	Me̩ ño̩ gʼo̩ko̩ ge̩; dagba i chaka nana kʼafu ki gbiti ako, oche ki nya añʼo̩ o̩na kʼi le ugbo du kʼe̩do̩ onu o̩ko̩ neku.
The mountains quake at him, and the hills melt, and the earth is burned at his presence, yea, the world, and all that dwell therein.	Uwo uwo naga o̩gba-wñ,
Let these sayings sink down into your ears: for the Son of man shall be delivered into the hands of men.	O̩la-i ki natunyʼume̩ eti; todu ma ache ku ma dʼO̩ma One̩ tef o̩wo̩ amone̩.
In that day, saith the	Iko le̩, Jihofa aka-i,
So they poured out for the men to eat. And it came to pass, as they were eating of the pottage, that they cried out, and said, O	Abe̩le̩ ma mʼu ko dajo̩ kʼaboke̩le̩ le̩ ki je̩. Oñ i lewatʼabu ku ma jo̩ ajuje̩wñ le̩, kʼama kwa kakini, O uwe̩ e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩-i, uku dʼef ucha-i. Ma la neke je̩ n.
for we are sold, I and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. But if we had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen, I had held my tongue, although the enemy could not countervail the king's damage.	Todu ma mʼuwa ko ta me̩, tʼomi, tʼabo-mi, ku ma kpa wa bie̩, ku ma fʼuwa kpa rinyo̩, kʼa lenyo̩. I la che̩wñ ku ma ma mʼuwa ko ta kʼa mud adu aboke̩le̩ kpai abobule̩, omi ma chechi; ama e̩ne̩ ki akobʼuwa le̩ la neke dʼakoji ofu ki ma bʼonu-i ñw u n.
Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead?	Uwe̩ achʼe̩wñ aye ñw abo ki ku?
and see the land, what it	ku me̩ go ane̩ le̩ alu kʼi de̩, kpai amone̩ ku ma dodo jʼo̩mo̩, abe̩ku ma chʼe̩ne̩ ukpahiu abe̩ku ma chʼe̩gbo, abe̩ku ma wewe abe̩ku ma wewe n;
Then said Jesus,	Oñ Jisus kakini, Ata-mi, to̩no̩ ñwu ma, todu ma ma e̩wñ ku ma ache-i n. Taku ma fʼe̩wñ o̩la-wñ kpe̩ ñw o̩la-ma, ma muko ato̩ko̩.
I said, I shall not see the	U kakini, Nali Jihofa
And Isaac said unto his son, How	Ama Aise̩k ka ñw o̩ma-wñ kakini, Ab i le kʼe̩ hika li piopio abe̩i, o̩ma-mi? Oñ i kakini, Todabu ki Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ je̩ ñwu mi kʼu hika hiane̩.
And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that	Tak Absalom lewa gbajiko kpʼabuko̩lo̩ Defid. Oñ Absalom tanʼimiulu-wñ alo, tak imiulu lʼofe ugbo kʼe̩to̩ oli ok lile gwuji te̩, oji Absalom la gbaji tʼoli ok, oñ i lo̩ko̩li agbagba ojale kpai ane̩ o̩mo̩; imiulu kʼi tanʼo la le owñ.
Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee,	E̩fa jʼache e̩wñ ñw e̩?
After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, (but he	Ubi le̩ Se̩nake̩rib fʼabuko̩lo̩-wñ kpuche̩ nyi Je̩rusale̩m (owñ onugo la dʼo̩gba Lakish, ukpahiu-wñ du la jʼugbo-wñ), oñ i fʼuche̩ kpe̩ ru He̩ze̩kaya onu Juda kpʼabo Juda du ku ma jo̩ Je̩rusale̩m, kakini,
And lo Zadok also, and all the Levites	Me̩ la go, Zedo̩k ño̩ lewa, oñ abo Lifai chaka jʼugbo-wñ, ma la nʼakpati alo O̩jo̩, oñ ma mʼakpati O̩jo̩ du gugu ane̩. Tak Abayata mute̩gu wʼo̩mo̩ gbogbo tak amone̩ lale kwef ewo le̩ chaka.
For it pleased	Todu, i rʼO̩jo̩ e̩do̩ kʼe̩wñ ukefu le̩ du kʼi dodo ef uwñ,
of Jashub, the family of the Jashubites: of Shimron, the family of the Shimronites.	e-Jashub, akwo̩ra unyi abo Jashub; e-Shimro̩n, akwo̩ra unyi abo Shimro̩n.
And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.	Abo uche̩ichi la we̩do̩, oñ uwe̩do̩-we̩ lewa,
and he slew an Egyptian, a goodly man: and the Egyptian had a spear in his hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.	I laño̩ fʼe̩ne̩ Ijiptiʼka kpa, eju e̩ne̩ le̩ chefe̩ rʼeju. E̩ne̩ Ijipti le̩ la nʼo̩kwo̩ o̩wo̩; oñ i nʼugbolo oli gwo̩ru nyʼugbo-wñ, i la mʼo̩kwo̩ gba gbulu bʼo̩wo̩ e̩ne̩ Ijipti le̩ te̩, oñ i nʼo̩kwo̩ e̩ne̩ le̩ gbage̩de̩ fʼu kpa.
Then Ahimelech answered the king, and said, And who	Tak Ahime̩le̩k dohi ñw onu kakini, E̩ne̩ la dʼef abuko̩lo̩-we̩ chaka kʼi chʼe̩ne̩-we̩ kpaka dabu Defid? Kʼowñ chʼana onu, kʼe̩ la chi efu ñw u chaka, kʼi laño̩ chenʼojima ef unyi-we̩?
Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa aka de̩ kakini:
O thou that hearest prayer,	O uwe̩ kʼe̩ gbʼadua le̩!
And Moses spake to the children of Israel, that they should bring forth him that had cursed out of the camp, and stone him with stones. And the children of Israel did as the	Taku Mose̩s ka ñw amo̩ma Israe̩l; oñ ma mʼe̩ne̩ kʼi bina le̩ du kwef uru dufu, ma la kʼokuta ro̩ dʼo. Abe̩le̩ amo̩ma Israe̩l la che alu ku Jihofa ñwa ñwu Mose̩s.
And they rose early in the morning, and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, Hear me, O Judah, and ye inhabitants of Jerusalem; Believe in the	Taku ma takpa kwane̩ odudu, oñ ma le dufu nyʼaje̩tachi Te̩koa: oñ abu ku ma dufu alo, Jiho̩shafat kwane̩ dago, i kakini, Me̩ gbʼomu-mi, O Juda, kpʼame̩ ku me̩ dodo Je̩rusale̩m: me̩ ki dʼo̩la Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩ rʼochochi, tak ame̩ adago kpaka; me̩ ki dʼo̩la amakache̩-wñ rʼochochi tak i ara ñwu me̩.
The	Jihofa añwa amone̩ du go;
He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father's which sent me.	E̩ne̩ ki ma fe̩do̩ mi n adejutʼo̩la-mi n; o̩la ku me̩ gbo̩-i la chʼe-mi n, chai e-Ata ki kpe̩ mi wa.
Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.	Tak eju amafeju achi,
If the world hate you, ye know that it hated me before	Iche̩wñ kʼile̩-i achulaka me̩, me̩ ma ka kʼulaka e-mi oñ i che o̩gba e-me̩.
and Lebaoth, and Shilhim, and Ain, and Rimmon: all the cities	kpai Le-bao̩t kpai Shilhim kpai Ain kpai Rimo̩n: o̩chaka ewo le̩ che ogu nyoke me̩la, manyu ikpo unyi ikpo unyi-ma ge̩.
and I will lay it waste: it shall not be pruned, nor digged; but there shall come up briers and thorns: I will also command the clouds that they rain no rain upon it.	Nache kʼi mud ikpo te̩;
If the priest that is anointed do sin according to the sin of the people; then let him bring for his sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish unto the	i la che̩wñ kʼi chʼatama ku ma bʼekpo tʼoji kʼi dure, kʼi fʼudu fa wa abʼoji amone̩ le̩ ma, e̩gbale̩, i ki dʼo̩mo̩kokuno̩ kʼi mufu, wa ñwu Jihofa kʼi mud e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ adure tod edure kʼi dure le̩.
I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning,	Ma dʼumi dago kwʼigbelegbele,
For thou didst separate them from among all the people of the earth,	Todu uwe̩ fʼuma date̩ bʼabo ile̩ du te̩, kʼama ki mud e̩wñ ogu-we̩, alu kʼe̩ ka lugbo Mose̩s adu-we̩, e̩gba kʼe̩ kʼamata-wa kwʼIjipti dufu wa le̩, O Ondu Jihofa.
And Leah said, Happy am I, for the daughters will call me blessed: and she called his name Asher.	Oñ Lea kakini, E̩do̩-mi bo̩ me̩! Todu amo̩ma onobule̩ ado̩ mi kʼe̩ne̩ ki gbede; oñ i dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Ashe̩r.
They gave money also unto the masons, and to the carpenters; and meat, and drink, and oil, unto them of Zidon, and to them of Tyre, to bring cedar trees from Lebanon to the sea of Joppa, according to the grant that they had of Cyrus king of Persia.	Ma ño̩ kʼo̩ko̩ ñw abo ku ma ne kpai abo ku ma fʼoli; kpʼuje̩wñ kpai omi kpai ekpo ñw abo Saido̩n kpai abo̩ Taya, todu ku ma ko oli sidar kwʼoko Le̩bano̩n wʼo̩la ohimini Jo̩pa, alu ki Sairo̩s, onu Pe̩rsia le̩, bu ñwu ma.
and Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins, putting them upon the head of the goat, and shall send	tak Aro̩n akʼo̩wo̩-wñ meji noji o̩mewo ki deju le̩, kʼi agbalu o̩chaka udu kʼamo̩ma Israe̩l fe̩ kpai echada-ma oji-wñ, owñ chʼo̩chaka adure-ma; i la akʼo noji o̩mewo le̩, kʼi dʼu kpuche̩ tef aje̩tachi lʼo̩wo̩ e̩ne̩ kʼi fʼo̩la mu tane̩.
and he had prepared for him a great chamber, where aforetime they laid the meat offerings, the frankincense, and the vessels, and the tithes of the corn, the new wine, and the oil, which was commanded	i fʼef unyi lile le̩ʼka ñwo̩che ñw u, owñ chʼef unyi ugbo ku ma te̩te̩ ko e̩wñ ele, kpai frankinse̩ns kpai e̩wñ eku kpai ukpe̩ e̩ke̩gwa e̩wñ e̩yo̩ kpai e-omi achiwebe̩te̩ma etito̩ kpai e-ekpo̩ jo̩, owñ chʼe-ku ma fʼuko̩-wñ te̩ ñwu ma ku ma kowa tod abo Lifai kpai amakeli kpai amadalo̩na; manyʼe̩wñ eko ne ate̩ tod amatama ge̩.
Which things are an allegory: for these are the two covenants; the one from the mount Sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is Agar.	E̩wñ meji-i chʼujiwe o̩la; todu abo-i chʼalo-ekpe̩ meji; oka kwo oj uwo Sainai, kʼi abi amo̩ma rʼef adu, owñ che Hagar.
in the mountains, and in the valleys, and in the plains, and in the springs, and in the wilderness, and in the south country; the Hittites, the Amorites, and the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites:	ane̩ uwo kpai ane̩ o̩go̩ kpai oj ane̩ Araba kpai ane̩ ate̩gu uwo kpai ane̩ ef aje̩tachi kpai o̩pata o̩wo̩ o̩gane̩; ane̩ abo He̩t kpai abo Amo̩r kpai abo Kenan kpai abo Pe̩re̩z kpai abo Hifai kpai abo Je̩bius):
I will consume man and beast; I will consume the fowls of the heaven, and the fishes of the sea, and the stumblingblocks with the wicked; and I will cut off man from off the land, saith the	Nagbʼone̩ kpʼe̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ rinyo̩;
whose fan	O̩fe̩fe̩ ufo̩ka-wñ dʼef o̩wo̩-wñ me̩, i la ache kʼajita ugwo̩ka-wñ ki fe̩ hiolo. Tak i ayʼo̩ka-wñ nyʼaka; i muda anʼuna ki ma jʼalu n gu igbogbo-wñ jo.
And Jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek the	Taku Jiho̩shafat kworailo, oñ i fʼe̩do̩ kparu e̩tene Jihofa; tak i fʼo̩jo̩ alu eji da ugbo du oj ane̩ Juda.
And when even was	Tak e̩gba ki mud iko adarane̩, amako̩che̩-wñ gwo̩ru nyʼo̩lʼohimini.
Whatsoever parteth the hoof, and is clovenfooted,	E̩wñ du kʼe̩re̩-wñ chʼe̩kpana, kʼi la chʼabetikpa, kʼi atije̩, kʼi jʼef ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ e-le̩ me̩ aje̩.
But when the time of the promise drew nigh, which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,	Ama abu kʼiko ukatane̩ e-kʼO̩jo̩ gbalu ñw Ebraham le̩ ame̩rʼo̩wo̩ amone̩ le̩ nawewe nyʼo̩gba, oñ ma chane̩ ewewe otemeje ojane̩ Ijipti.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini,
The sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.	Amo̩ma Pe̩re̩z che; He̩zro̩n kpai Hamul.
In their setting of their threshold by my thresholds, and their post by my posts, and the wall between me and them, they have even defiled my holy name by their abominations that they have committed: wherefore I have consumed them in mine anger.	Owñ chʼugbo ku ma fʼajita alugbo̩na-ma che kpenyʼajita alugbo̩na e-mi, ku ma la kʼoli ona-ma gwanyi kpenyʼoli o̩na e-mi kʼo̩do okate tʼagbagba mi kpʼama; ma la nʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩-ma ku ma che fʼodu-mi kiafo̩ daji; todule̩ oñ omi fʼuma lie̩ ef uwe̩do̩-mi.
The	Jihofa la che teju o̩la-wñ kʼi ka le̩ me̩; oñ omi kwane̩ e̩gu Defid, ata-mi, u la gugu oj ede Israe̩l alu ki Jihofa katane̩ le̩ oñ u la fʼunyi-i ko̩ tod odu Jihofa O̩jo̩ Israe̩l.
His countenance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow:	E̩ go i dab o̩mamanya eju, e̩wñ kʼi la ko bʼo̩la ma chʼefufu dabu sno.
But ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he hath served with me in the gospel.	Ama ame̩ chema ijali-wñ kakini, Alu kʼo̩ma are̩ ata-wñ, alu le̩ oñ i bʼumi chuko̩lo̩ adu ef Uche̩nyo̩.
Hear instruction, and be wise,	Me̩ gbʼo̩la ku ma kʼone̩, ku me̩ nʼibe,
And the people, when they knew	Ama abu kʼo̩wo̩-amone̩ le̩ fʼu ma, ma tʼo̩ ubi; i la yo̩ ñwu ma, i ko̩la e̩wñ ojane̩ O̩jo̩ ñwu ma, oñ i fʼo̩ga abo kʼeku o̩ga eche aku ma chekpa.
And seven days were fulfilled, after that the	Tak abu ku Jihofa fu Naye̩l gwo le̩, i ño̩ jʼo̩jo̩ mebie.
And the weight of the golden earrings that he requested was a thousand and seven hundred	Uwoji aketi o̩jamalia kʼi bi le̩ che she̩ke̩l o̩jamalia icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ o̩gume̩lu mebie; manyʼuko̩lo̩ ki dab ochu le̩ kpai e̩wñ ijaga-ma kpai otogbo odufa ekpikpa ki jʼo̩la amonu Midian le̩, kpai ahika ki jʼo̩fa aminyakulumi-ma.
And the	Jihofa muda ko̩la ñwu Mose̩s kpai Aro̩n, oñ i ñwañwu ma alu ku ma aka ñw amo̩ma Israe̩l kpai alu ku ma aka ñwu Fero, onu Ijipti, ku ma kʼamo̩ma Israe̩l kwo bʼane̩ Ijipti te̩.
the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.	o̩ma Izhar, o̩ma Kohat, o̩ma Lifai, o̩ma Israe̩l.
And among the cities which ye shall give unto the Levites	Oñ ewo ewo ku me̩ ako ñw abo Lifai le̩ achʼewo oke̩ko̩ me̩fa le̩, e-kʼame̩ adate̩ ñw e̩ne̩ kʼi kpʼone̩ kʼi ra nyʼefu-wñ; ame̩ ñʼakʼewo o̩gbo̩ meji nyoke meji ñwu ma manyʼu ge̩.
And when the Syrians saw that they were smitten before Israel, they gathered themselves together.	Oñ e̩gba kʼabo Siria li kʼabo Israe̩l akpa ma, ma fʼo̩la-ma do̩ jeju.
And they gave him audience unto this word, and	Oñ ma gbʼo̩ gbogbo wa kadʼo̩la kide̩, taku ma dʼomu-ma dago kakini, Mʼe̩ne̩ e̩go̩-i du bʼile̩ te̩! todu i dukpe̩ kʼi adeju n.
but as he which hath called you is holy, so be ye holy in all manner of conversation;	ame̩ ki la mud abo kiafo̩ ef e̩wñ du ku me̩ jo̩ ache, alu kʼe̩ne̩ kʼi do̩ me̩ afo̩ le̩.
He was a mighty hunter before the	I chʼagbiti o̩de̩ eju Jihofa; todule̩ ma kakini, Dabu Nimro̩d kʼi chʼagbiti o̩de̩ ede̩ eju Jihofa.
They shall run like mighty men; they shall climb the wall like men of war; and they shall march every one on his ways, and they shall not break their ranks:	Ma gwo̩ko̩ wa dabe̩ne̩ kʼamagbiti,
But some	Ama e̩ne̩ʼka akakini, Abile ku ma akʼabo ki ku kwane̩? año̩la e̩wñ oñ ma ane̩ wa?
All the days that he separateth	O̩jo̩ du kʼi fʼo̩la-wñ date̩ ñwu Jihofa kade le̩, i ñʼate̩ me̩ru oku e̩wñ n.
And as Jesus passed forth from thence, he saw a man, named Matthew, sitting at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him,	Tak abu ki Jisus kwʼo̩mo̩ alale, i li e̩ne̩ʼka kʼi gugu unyi ugbo ku ma gbʼo̩kane̩, odu-wñ ko̩ Matiu. Oñ i ka ñw u kakini, Tʼumi ubi. Tak i kwane̩ atʼo̩ ubi.

And he said, Thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed virgin, daughter of Zidon: arise, pass over to Chittim; there also shalt thou have no rest.	Oñ i kakini:
But if the priest's daughter be a widow, or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto her father's house, as in her youth, she shall eat of her father's meat: but there shall no stranger eat thereof.	Ama iche̩wñ kʼo̩ma atama muda o̩yaukuo̩ko̩ abe̩k o̩ko̩-wñ kʼo̩, kʼi ma la nʼo̩ma n, kʼi mudabi tʼunyi ata-wñ alu kʼi de̩ o̩jo̩ imo̩to̩-wñ, onobule̩ le̩ aje̩ uje̩wñ e-ata-wñ; e̩ne̩ ejaduña du muda aje̩ n.
The earth is utterly broken down, the earth is clean dissolved, the earth is moved exceedingly.	Ile̩-i mukpo̩fo̩ kpa,
And, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lying on a bed: and Jesus seeing their faith said unto the sick of the palsy;	Me̩ la go, ma mʼe̩no̩ga ekuto̩la kʼi dachi oj ate̩ du wʼugbo-wñ; oñ abu ku Jisus li e̩do̩ ekono-ma, i ka ñw e̩no̩ga ekuto̩la le̩ kakini, O̩ma-mi, fʼe̩do̩ ne̩ ke; ma tʼadure-we̩ no̩ ñw e̩ me̩.
And she said unto him, My father,	Tak i ka ñw u kakini, Ata-mi, e̩ mʼalu-we̩ chi ñwu Jihofa me̩, e̩ che mi alu ki kwef alu-we̩ dufu le̩, todabu ki Jihofa fʼache̩-we̩ na abʼoji ame̩nebi-we̩ ma, owñ chʼamo̩ma Amo̩n le̩.
and he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests: and he shall take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar,	kʼi la adʼu wʼugbo amo̩ma Aro̩n, amatama le̩, oñ i abʼomu te̩ke̩te̩ke̩ kpai ekpo-wñ nyʼo̩wo̩ e̩ko̩ kpai frankinse̩ns-wñ chaka; tak atama agu e-le̩ jo oj ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ kʼi chʼukpe̩ urewa-wñ. the Syrians before, and the Philistines behind; and they shall devour Israel with open mouth. For all this his anger is not turned away, but his hand	Abo Siria ajʼolodudu, abo Filistia la ajʼolane̩

And the voice of harpers, and musicians, and of pipers, and trumpeters, shall be heard no more at all in thee; and no craftsman, of whatsoever craft	Oñ i nugbo du ku ma ñʼagbo̩ omuko̩la abo ku ma nʼumolo,

Dan, and Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.	Dan kpai Naftali kpai Gad kpai Ashe̩r.
The song of songs, which	Eli e-eli ki chʼe-So̩lo̩mo̩n de̩.
And if any man's seed of copulation go out from him, then he shall wash all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.	I la che̩wñ kʼato̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ du kwefu-wñ dufu, e̩gbale̩ i agwʼo̩la-wñ chaka ef omiofo, i la adaji gbogbo tak olu ki tunyʼane̩.
and said, If Esau come to the one company, and smite it, then the other company which is left shall escape.	oñ i kakini, Iche̩wñ kʼIso̩ lewʼugbo ujo̩ʼka kʼi fʼuma kpa, mak ujo̩ ekeji afʼo̩ o̩wo̩.
Then said Jeremiah unto them, Thus shall ye say to Zedekiah:	Taku Je̩re̩maya ka ñwu ma kakini, Abu ku me̩ aka ñwu Ze̩de̩kaya de̩ kakini,
Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa ka de̩ kakini:
And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.	Tak u li ede efufu lile kpʼe̩ne̩ ki gugu oji-wñ, e-kʼane̩-ile̩ kpʼefojale ra bʼeju-wñ te̩; ma ño̩ li uña todu ma ge̩ n.
And when we came to Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard: but Paul was suffered to dwell by himself with a soldier that kept him.	Oñ e̩gba kʼa mugudu tef ewo Rom agboji amisoja ogume̩lu le̩ je̩ ñw Po̩l kʼi gugu e-wñ ojoji kpʼisoja kʼi adide owñ.
And they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to the king of Babylon: they brought him into holds, that his voice should no more be heard upon the mountains of Israel.	Taku ma dʼo̩bo̩go̩li ta tʼelika iñmo̩-wñ adʼu tef akpati ebije,
that they all might be damned who believed not the truth, but had pleasure in unrighteousness.	todu ku ma ki kpa o̩chaka abo ku ma ma ke̩do̩nʼochochi n, kʼuji muda rʼuma e̩do̩ abi.
Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth	Ewo ewo-wñ mud e̩wñ awuwu te̩,
and the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.	Tak onu Babilo̩n ko ma kpa, i la fʼuma kpa ku Ribla oj ane̩ Hemat. Abe̩le̩ ma mu abo Juda, oñ ma mʼuma ño̩ lelo bʼoj ane̩-ma te̩.
Then shall the virgin rejoice in the dance, both young men and old together: for I will turn their mourning into joy, and will comfort them, and make them rejoice from their sorrow.	E̩gbale̩ amigbe̩le̩ ku ma ma mʼe̩ne̩ke̩le̩ n ayo̩ ef ido,
And the slain of the	Oñ abo ki Jihofa akpa o̩jo̩ le̩ ate̩ kwʼukpoji ile̩ o̩wo̩ʼka gbogbo tʼukpoji ile̩ o̩wo̩ ekeji. Ma adeku ma n, ma ayʼoku-ma jo̩ n, ma la ako ma ji n; ma amud echu bʼej ane̩ ma.
Then answered Jesus and said unto them,	Todule̩ Jisus dohi ñwu ma kakini, Ami, ami naka ñwu me̩ kakini, O̩ma neke chʼe̩wñ du kpai ojika o̩la-wñ n, chai e̩wñ kʼi li kʼAta ache; todu e̩wñ du kʼe̩ne̩ le̩ ache, e̩wñ le̩ oñ O̩ma ñʼache abe̩le̩ ge̩.
And the	Taku Jihofa dʼo̩laʼka tunyu Belam alu, oñ i kakini, Mudabi nyʼugbo Bele̩k, kʼe̩ fʼabe̩le̩ ka ñw u.
because they have not hearkened to my words, saith the	Todabu ku ma ma nyʼo̩la-mi eti n, Jihofa ka-i, owñ chʼe-kʼomi takpa kwane̩ ko kpuche̩ rʼuma lʼo̩wo̩ amadu-mi amakache̩ le̩. Ame̩ muda ko̩ enye̩ti, Jihofa ka-i.
	Amajo̩me̩ meji do̩mo̩ ku ma je̩ ato̩ko̩ʼka o̩me̩; oka nʼo̩ o̩me̩ olia oli mebie, e-ekeji la chʼolia ogue̩gwa nyoke me̩ta.
And I will punish him and his seed and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring upon them, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and upon the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them; but they hearkened not.	Omi la abʼudu ñw u kpʼugbe̩-wñ kpʼabuko̩lo̩-wñ todu udu ku ma fe̩. Omi la ako e̩bie̩ne̩ du kʼu ka nyʼuma o̩la ku ma ma gbo̩ n le̩ wa abʼama kpʼabʼabo ku ma dodo Je̩rusale̩m kpʼabʼaboke̩le̩ Juda oji ma.
Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.	Todule̩ nagbo̩ko̩bʼume̩, me̩ ki mud abo ki awʼumi che.
For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,	Todu e̩gbale̩ amone̩ ache̩do̩ o̩la-ma, ma ache̩do̩ o̩ko̩, ma abuba, ma ake, ma achakpabie̩ one̩, ma ako̩ egbʼo̩la abo ki bi ma, ma agwʼone̩ n, o̩la-ma afe̩ n,
For I rejoiced greatly, when the brethren came and testified of the truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.	Todu u yo̩ tabale abu kʼamo̩maye iche̩ka lewa gba ochochi-we̩ ibenu, alu kʼuwe̩ tale ef ochochi.
And Saul died, and Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.	Taku Sho̩l leku, oñ Beal-hanan, o̩ma Akbo̩r e-e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, jʼonu koji-wñ.
and if I also ask	Dagba u tʼume̩ ene, i nʼugbo du ku me̩ jʼadohi n.
all the valiant men arose, and went all night, and took the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons from the wall of Beth-shan, and came to Jabesh, and burnt them there.	aboke̩le̩ du ku ma nʼe̩do̩ kwane̩, oñ ma le odu gbogbo ñw o̩jo̩, ma la mʼoku So̩l kpʼe-amo̩ma-wñ ko bʼo̩lo̩do̩ Be̩t-shan te̩; oñ ma lewa Je̩be̩sh afʼoku-ma gujo o̩mo̩.
And, behold, there was a certain man before him which had the dropsy.	Me̩ la go, e̩no̩ga uñwefuʼka do̩mo̩ o̩gba-wñ.
Thus will I magnify myself, and sanctify myself; and I will be known in the eyes of many nations, and they shall know that I	Tak u nache kʼomi onugo anana eju-ma, kʼu ño̩ fo̩, oñ naje̩ ñwu ma fʼumi ma eju abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi wewe; tak ama ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩.
And Elijah said unto the prophets of Baal, Choose you one bullock for yourselves, and dress	Tak E̩laija ka ñw amakache̩ Beal kakini, Me̩ gʼo̩kokuno̩ ku me̩ adu tod o̩la-me̩, ku me̩ fʼu kwu ejodudu, todu ame̩ chʼewewe. Tak ame̩ ki kwado̩ odu o̩jo̩ e-me̩, me̩ ki muda dʼuna tʼo̩ n.
I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all	U ka ef e̩do̩-mi kakini, Go, u mud e̩ne̩ lile me̩, u ño̩ fʼibe ne̩ tʼabo du ku ma nʼo̩da Je̩rusale̩m o̩gba-mi le. I-i, e̩do̩-mi la fʼe̩wñ ibe kpʼe̩wñ ema li ololo.
And one of them that stood by drew a sword, and smote a servant of the high priest, and cut off his ear.	Ama e̩ne̩ʼka ef abo ku ma dago o̩mo̩ mʼugbada wo̩, oñ i fʼadu agboji amatama da, i la mʼowñ eti la.

And Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Beth-el with the towns thereof, and Jeshanah with the towns thereof, and Ephrain with the towns thereof.	Oñ Abaija rano Je̩roboam; i la mʼewo ewo gba bʼo̩ o̩wo̩ te̩, Be̩te̩l manyʼadogbe-wñ kpai Je̩shena manyʼadogbe-wñ kpʼIfro̩n manyʼadogbe-wñ.
And if thy brother	I la che̩wñ kʼo̩maye-we̩ le̩ ma me̩ru we̩ n, kʼe̩ ma la mʼo̩ n, e̩gbale̩ e̩ ki mʼu du wʼunyi e-we̩, oñ i adugbo we̩ gbogbo tak o̩maye-we̩ wa tene-wñ, tak uwe̩ ki mʼu du dabi wa ñw u.
saying to a stock, Thou	ku ma la ka ñw oli kakini, Ata-mi e̩ che,
Therefore shall ye lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul, and bind them for a sign upon your hand, that they may be as frontlets between your eyes.	Todule̩ ame̩ ki ko o̩la-mi-i jo̩ ef e̩do̩-me̩ kpai ef onugo-me̩; me̩ ki la fʼu ji manyʼo̩wo̩-me̩ ki chʼujiwe, i ki mud e̩wñ o̩gba oji-me̩ agbagba igbegbeneju-me̩.
The	Jihofa adʼuwe̩ kpai onu e-kʼuwe̩ adʼu gugu kʼi nʼuwe̩ wugbo abo uche̩ichi kʼe̩ ma ma ma n, tʼuwe̩ tʼamata-we̩ ma ma n; o̩mo̩ tak uwe̩ are̩ amo̩jo̩ omune̩ kʼi chʼoli kpai okuta.
since we heard of your faith in Christ Jesus, and of the love	abu kʼa gbʼinabali e̩do̩-ekono-me̩ efu Kraisti Jisusi, kpai inabali ufe̩do̩ ku me̩ ne̩ fe̩do̩ abo kiafo̩ du,
There remaineth therefore a rest to the people of God.	Mak o̩jo̩ uñmiʼka chebo̩ tod amone̩ O̩jo̩.

in the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.	O̩jo̩ kʼO̩jo̩ akajo̩ e̩wñ umaja e-amone̩ lefu Jisus Kraisti likpa alu kʼUche̩nyo̩-mi ka.

(	(abo Saido̩n la do̩ He̩rmo̩n le̩ ko̩ Sirion, oñ abo Amo̩r dʼo̩ ko̩ Senir),
And he wrote in the king Ahasuerus' name, and sealed	Oñ i fʼu ko̩ ef odu onu Ahasurus, tak i nʼelika onu fʼu hiuko̩, i la mʼu ko kpuche̩ lʼo̩wo̩ abo ku ma nʼanya, ku ma tanʼame̩la ki afule o̩me̩me̩le̩, ku ma ne̩ ache uko̩lo̩ onu, e-kʼo̩ko anya onu kpʼiye-ma.
Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.	Abu kʼe̩do̩-mi mugba ka kʼe̩ gbʼo̩la-mi gbo̩, oñ nako̩takada rʼuwe̩-i; u chema ka kʼe̩ ñʼache tʼalu kʼu ka-i le̩ ge̩.
And he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the company of his disciples, and a great multitude of people out of all Judæa and Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon, which came to hear him, and to be healed of their diseases;	Tak owñ kpʼama mugwo̩ru wa, oñ i kwodago ugbo ki de̩ te̩e̩le̩, tak o̩wo̩ amako̩che̩-wñ lile kpai ugwe̩ko̩ amone̩ wewe ki kwo Judia du kpai Je̩rusale̩m kpʼo̩lʼomi ane̩ Taya kpai Saido̩n ku ma wa ku ma gbʼo̩la-wñ, todu kʼi ño̩ fʼuma o̩ga chekpa.
How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master's servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?	I dʼabe̩-i fa? ab e̩ le kʼuwe̩ aneke rʼeju agbojiʼka ki nya ef amadu odu-mi da, kʼe̩ la ke̩do̩nʼabo Ijipti tod o̩kogu kpai amananya?
It is	O̩la ku ma ke̩do̩no i che kakini,
So that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom,	kʼe̩ la hi eti-we̩ wane̩ ñw ibe
and the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be defiled: or if the spirit of jealousy come upon him, and he be jealous of his wife, and she be not defiled;	kʼe̩do̩ achʼe̩ko̩-wñ ñwe̩ñwe̩le̩, kʼi chane̩ etejane̩ o̩ya-wñ kʼi mudaji le̩; abe̩k e̩gba kʼe̩do̩-wñ achʼo ñwe̩ñwe̩le̩, kʼi atejane̩ o̩ya-wñ, kʼi ma la dʼo̩la ji n;
Behold, while thou yet talkest there with the king, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy words.	Go, abu kʼe̩ dago o̩mo̩ akʼo̩la ñw onu, omi la atʼuwe̩ ubi wa agbʼuwe̩ ibenu.
And of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblation	Ab i fʼabe̩i che i adʼo̩ko̩ke̩ kwef e̩wñ O̩jo̩ okoke kʼi ko wa le̩ chʼe̩wñ edu nyʼate̩ ñwu Jihofa; atama kʼi afiʼe̩bie̩ e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ ure̩do̩ anʼe-le̩.
So they gathered themselves together at Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.	Abe̩le̩ ma kʼo̩la-ma jeju jo̩ Je̩rusale̩m ochu e̩ke̩ta o̩do̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩lu kʼEsa jʼonu.
For I have caused my terror in the land of the living: and he shall be laid in the midst of the uncircumcised with	Todu u mʼailo du te̩ oj ane̩ abo ku ma deju; ma la amʼowñ du dachi alumeji abo e̩pi odukulu manyʼabo kʼo̩kwo̩chageli kpa ma; owñ che Fero kpʼo̩wo̩ one̩-wñ chaka, Ondu Jihofa ka-i.
The light of the righteous rejoiceth:	Ugane̩ e̩no̩kpakpa ayo̩,
Blessed	E̩ne̩ kʼukpahiu-wñ chʼe̩f uwe̩, gbede,
And Moses gathered all the congregation of the children of Israel together, and said unto them, These	Taku Mose̩s fʼo̩gbadu amo̩ma Israe̩l chaka do̩ jeju, oñ i ka ñwu ma kakini, O̩la-i chʼo̩la ki Jihofa ñwa ñwu me̩ ku me̩ che.
Thus will I make mount Seir most desolate, and cut off from it him that passeth out and him that returneth.	Abe̩le̩ omi ache kʼuwo Seir ki mud alache̩ e-alache̩; oñ nakʼe̩ne̩ ki alale gu ef uwñ du kpai e̩ne̩ kʼi adabiwa da rinyo̩ bʼo̩ te̩.
For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.	Todu i rʼabo Masidonia kpai abo Akaya e̩do̩ ku ma tuta kpai ame̩nale ku ma jʼef abo kiafo̩ Je̩rusale̩m.
Assur also is joined with them:	Asiria laño̩ manyʼuma ge̩;
Now	Ukpe̩ru amo̩ma Aro̩n la jo̩-i: Amo̩ma Aro̩n e-e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ la che Nedab kpʼAbaihiu, E̩leaza kpʼItamar.
According to	owñ chʼo̩la kʼu kpalo kpʼame̩ e̩gba kʼame̩ kwʼIjipti wa le̩, abe̩le̩ Afu-mi dʼef ume̩; me̩ ki railo n.
And Abimelech said unto Abraham, What sawest thou, that thou hast done this thing?	Tak Abime̩le̩k ka ñw Ebraham kakini, Ibe e̩wñ dʼefu-we̩ kʼe̩ che e̩wñ-i?
And when ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars, be ye not troubled: for	E̩gba ku me̩ agbʼiche̩ ogu kpai inabali ogu, me̩ ki dutu n; e̩wñ-i awache tila; i muda chʼukpoji-wñ de̩ ta n.
And at the second	Tak onu ekeji-wñ ma je̩ ñw amo̩maye-wñ ma Jose̩f. Abe̩le̩ o̩lo̩pu Jose̩f lewa kwotejugede ñw Fero.
the merchandise of gold, and silver, and precious stones, and of pearls, and fine linen, and purple, and silk, and scarlet, and all thyine wood, and all manner vessels of ivory, and all manner vessels of most precious wood, and of brass, and iron, and marble,	adu e̩wñ aja-ma chʼo̩jamalia kpʼajifa kpʼokuta akoko kpai pure̩l kpʼukpo line̩n ki nyo̩ kpʼe-odufa ekpikpa kpʼisiliki, kpʼekpikpa, kpʼoli taine chaka, kpʼe̩wñ eku du ku ma nʼenyi adagba che, kpʼe̩wñ eku du ku ma nʼoli o̩me̩me̩le̩ che, kpʼe-udo̩ kpʼe-ebije, kpʼe-marbe̩l
And with these sayings scarce restrained they the people, that they had not done sacrifice unto them.	E̩wñ ku ma ka le̩ du i chakanya taku ma ba o̩wo̩ amone̩ le̩, ku ma we eche ma.
if	iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩bibi dʼe̩wñ ku ma du nyʼo̩wo̩ dabi wa ñw e̩ne̩ kʼi du ñw u, kʼi la mʼe̩wñ one̩ kʼi dinya dʼu dabi, kʼi alule̩ teju e̩wñ uhio̩me̩ e-iñmi, kʼi ma fʼudu du n; edeju i adeju chuu, i aku n.
	Egugu ako unyi o̩wo̩ʼka me̩
but the land, whither ye go to possess it,	ama ane̩ ugbo ku me̩ daba agba le̩ chʼane̩ uwo kpai o̩go̩, i añmo̩ omi kwef omi ojale,
And the stones	Okuta le̩ la jo̩ alu kʼodu odu amo̩ma Israe̩l de̩, e̩gwe̩ji i che, alu kʼodu-ma de̩; i chʼe̩ko̩ nyʼu dab e̩wñ uhiuko̩, e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ dʼalu kʼodu-wñ de̩, todu o̩lo̩pu me̩gweji le̩.
And, behold, I will send a lad,	E̩ la go, nafʼimo̩to̩-mi kpe̩, oñ naka ñw u kakini, Lo kʼe̩ tene o̩fa le̩ wa. Iche̩wñ kʼu naka ñw imo̩to̩ okolobia le̩ kakini, Go, o̩fa le̩ dʼejemi ñw e̩, mak e̩ mʼu du kʼe̩ lewa; todu ure̩do̩ i che ñw e̩, i nʼo̩la n, oji Jihofa.
And Abraham reproved Abimelech because of a well of water, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away.	Tak Ebraham dʼo̩la biu Abime̩le̩k todu omi obuga, owñ chʼe-kʼamadu Abime̩le̩k bʼo̩ gba afuma.
Then Manoah intreated the	Taku Manoa gbo̩ko̩bo̩ Jihofa kakini, O, Ondu, o̩ko̩ nagba bʼe̩, e̩ je̩ ñw e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ kʼe̩ kpuche̩ wa le̩ kʼi ño̩ dabi wʼugbo wa ge̩, kʼi ko̩ wa alu kʼa ache kpai o̩ma ku ma abi le̩.
but when	ama e̩gba kʼo̩la le̩ lewʼo̩gba onu, i fuñwa ñwu ma lef o̩takada kʼe̩wñ bie̩ne̩ kʼi ñwa nyʼamaJu le̩ ki mudabi abʼoji-wñ onugo ma, ku ma ño̩ mʼowñ kpai amo̩ma-wñ ko kpa oku.
And she said unto them, Thus saith the	Tak i ka ñwu ma kakini, Abu ki Jihofa O̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l aka de̩ kakini, Me̩ ka ñw e̩ne̩ kʼi kpe̩ me̩ wʼugbo mi le̩ kakini,
unto a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou	E̩ ki mute̩gu nyʼane̩ ugbo kʼomi e̩nya kpai iño̩ acha; omi muda atʼalumeji-we̩ te̩gu alo n, tode̩gba kʼu fʼe̩ lie̩ ej o̩na le̩, todu uwe̩ chʼamone̩ kʼo̩lo̩-we̩ lo dago.
and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all that oppressed you, and drave them out from before you, and gave you their land;	oñ u mʼume̩ gba bʼo̩wo̩ abo Ijipti te̩, kpai bʼo̩wo̩ abo du ku ma fʼume̩ dema te̩, u fʼuma ne bʼume̩ o̩gba te̩, oñ u mʼane̩-ma ko ñwu me̩.
And if a man will at all redeem	I la che̩wñ kʼone̩ neku egba ukpe̩gwa e̩wñ owñ le̩ tane̩ tila, mak i adʼukpe̩lu omune̩ wa manyʼo̩ko̩-wñ.
Moreover the	Jihofa ño̩ ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini,
yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him	Ochochi, i nʼukpahiu tʼonuche̩ O̩jo̩ le oñ i fʼu du,
But Nineveh	Nine̩fa la te̩te̩ do̩mo̩ kwʼigbelegbele
But the Lord said unto him,	Oñ Ondu ka ñw u kakini, Nalo ke, todu e̩ne̩ kide̩ chʼe̩wñ eku kʼomi du kʼi ane̩ odu-mi o̩gba abo uche̩ichi kpai amonu kpai amo̩ma Israe̩l;
Then a spirit passed before my face;	Tak afuʼka lale gu o̩gba-mi du;
Doth not wisdom cry?	I chʼibe adudo̩-i n?
And they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to the house of their fathers, for every gate.	oñ ma fʼanya ro̩, tʼabo e-kekele tʼabo elile, alu kʼunyi unyi amata-ma de̩, alaku du nʼoka oka.
I pray thee, forgive the trespass of thine handmaid: for the	Agba, o̩ko̩ nagbabʼe̩ kʼe̩ mʼada kʼadu-we̩ onobule̩-i je̩ le̩ du chʼe ele: todu Jihofa ache kʼunyi odu-mi ki chʼunyi o̩kpaka chuu, todabu kʼodu-mi nʼogu Jihofa aja; ma ñʼali e̩bie̩ne̩ ef uwe̩ gbogbo mʼo̩jo̩ uku-we̩ n.
All the hangings of the court round about	Ukpo du ku ma ko bʼologbo le̩ daka chʼukpo line̩n ku ma hi reju.
they have built also the high places of Baal, to burn their sons with fire	Ma laño̩ fʼotete otete Beal du jo̩ ku ma gu amo̩ma-ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ jo ef una ku ma mud e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo ñwu Beal, e-kʼomi ma ñwa ñwu ma n, u la ka n, i wʼewʼef ibe-mi n;
either his uncle, or his uncle's son, may redeem him, or	o̩maye ata-wñ abe̩k o̩mʼo̩maye ata-wñ neke gbʼo̩ tane̩, abe̩k e̩ne̩ du kʼi chʼefu-wñ pio̩o̩ ef akwo̩ra unyi ata-wñ ño̩ neke gbʼo̩ tane̩; i la che̩wñ kʼo̩wo̩ e-wñ onugo tu mak i neke gbʼo̩la-wñ tane̩.
You only have I known of all the families of the earth: therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.	Ame̩ kate oñ omi ma ef abo unyi unyi abo ile̩-i;
And Hilkiah, and	Abe̩le̩ Hilkaya kpʼabo kʼonu ka ñwu ma le̩, nyʼugbo Ho̩lda, akache̩ onobule̩, kʼi chʼo̩ya Shalum, o̩ma Tokhat o̩ma Hasra, adalo̩na unyi e̩wñ ku ma ko nyʼo̩la, (onobule̩ le̩ la gugu Je̩rusale̩m ikpo unyi ekeji); taku ma bʼo̩ chʼoluka abe̩le̩.
He was oppressed, and he was afflicted, yet he opened not his mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before her shearers is dumb, so he openeth not his mouth.	Ma fʼu chʼo̩bata, ma fʼu chukata,
Then Jesus six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was which had been dead, whom he raised from the dead.	Todule̩ Jisus lewa Be̩tani o̩jo̩ me̩fa tak Elaloji wane̩, owñ chʼugbo ku Lazaro̩s e-ku Jisus dʼu kwane̩ kwef abo ki ku le̩ de̩.
But Job answered and said,	Taku Job dohi kakini:
And that which is left of the meat offering	Tak e̩wñ kibo̩ kwef e̩wñ ele omu ku ma duwa le̩ achʼe-Aro̩n kpai amo̩ma-wñ; e̩wñ efo̩ e-efo̩ ef e̩wñ ku ma ko wa ñwu Jihofa lef una i che.
	Iche̩wñ kʼanibe tʼukana kpai e̩nidada,
And the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.	Abe̩le̩ ma kpala nyʼewo le̩ gbogbo wʼo̩do̩ e̩ke̩gwaka ku Ze̩de̩kaya jʼonu.
And Joseph returned into Egypt, he, and his brethren, and all that went up with him to bury his father, after he had buried his father.	Taku abu ku Jose̩f fʼata-wñ ji, owñ kpai amo̩maye-wñ mudabi nyʼIjipti, kpai abo du ku ma le bʼowñ nyʼaji ata-wñ.
Thou	Uwe̩ chʼalifia, e̩no̩wo̩-mi, alifia we̩ dabu Tirza,
For he saith to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.	Todu i ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, E̩ne̩ kʼu li ejumomi-wñ, owñ nali ejumomi-wñ, e̩ne̩ kʼu mo̩la ñw u, owñ namo̩ia ñw u.
He shall abide before God for ever:	I agugu o̩gba O̩jo̩ ogbegbele̩;
And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.	Omi ñʼagbʼuwe̩ kpʼewo-i kwef o̩wo̩ onu Asiria, oñ nahie̩do̩ bʼewo-i ma.
Of the children of Manasseh, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;	E-amo̩ma Manasa o̩gba o̩gba-ma, akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi-ma, ikpo unyi ikpo unyi amata-ma, likpa aluka odu-ma ku ma ko̩, akwʼo̩do̩ ogu nyʼate̩to̩gba-wñ, abo du ku ma bʼoko ogu enyi jo̩:
Oh that my people had hearkened unto me,	O amone̩-mi ma jʼanetiru mi,
And when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that he so cried out, and gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.	E̩gba kʼagboji amisoja ogume̩lu kʼi dago akpejurʼu li ka kʼi mʼiñmi da abe̩le̩, i kakini, Ochochi, e̩ne̩-i chʼO̩ma O̩jo̩.
But the centurion, willing to save Paul, kept them from	Agboji amiso̩ja ogume̩lu le̩ muda neku kʼi fu Po̩l jadu i fʼo̩na kpanyʼibe ku ma lo le̩; oñ i je̩ ñw abo ku ma meju egwʼomi ku ma kʼo̩la-ma ro̩ rʼomi ku ma nyʼane̩pe̩te̩ ejodudu.
And nation was destroyed of nation, and city of city: for God did vex them with all adversity.	Ma fʼabo uche̩ ichiʼka kpo̩fo̩ rʼabo uche̩ ichi omune̩, ewo laño̩ kpo̩fo̩ rʼewo omune̩; todu O̩jo̩ nʼo̩pe̩cha ojoji ojoji du fʼuma kpo̩fo̩.
Hast thou faith? have	E̩do̩ ekono kʼe̩ ne̩ e̩ ki ne̩ ñw o̩la-we̩ eju O̩jo̩. E̩ne̩ ki fʼe̩wñ ñwa rʼe̩nyo̩ kʼi ma dabi agwʼajo̩ nʼo̩la-wñ ef uwñ n, gbede!
And it came to pass, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed: and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.	Oñ i lewatu e̩gba du ku Mose̩s dʼo̩wo̩-wñ dago ukpahiu Israe̩l tule, e̩gba du kʼi tʼo̩wo̩-wñ no̩ wane̩, ukpahiu Amale̩k tule.
beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth all things.	i agbʼe̩wñ du nyʼe̩do̩, i adʼe̩wñ du rʼochochi, i akibeno e̩wñ du, i afʼe̩do̩ lichi ugbe e̩wñ du.
And he called him, and said unto him, How is it that I hear this of thee? give an account of thy stewardship; for thou mayest be no longer steward.	Tak i fʼu do̩ wa, i ka ñw u kakini, E̩wñ chʼo̩la-we̩ kʼu nagbo̩-i taa? E̩ ki fʼo̩la igede-we̩ kʼe̩ de choli jane̩ ñwu mi; todu uwe̩ neke ño̩ chʼadigede ge̩ n.
His foundation	Unyane̩-wñ dʼoj uwo uwo kiafo̩;
The throne had six steps, and the top of the throne	Ubo̩-wñ kʼi ate̩gu le tʼoj ede-wñ chʼe̩fa, ejubi oj ede le̩ chʼokokolo; i nʼuko̩wo̩no eju meji ugbo kʼi agugu, amidu meji dago akolo uko̩wo̩no meji le̩.
Howbeit we speak wisdom among them that are perfect: yet not the wisdom of this world, nor of the princes of this world, that come to nought:	A muda ako̩la ofili ef amo̩kone̩: i muda chʼofili e-o̩kpanachi kide̩ n, i la chʼe-amagboji o̩kpanuchi-i ku ma fʼu gbogili te̩-i n:
Now therefore stand still, that I may reason with you before the	Todule̩ me̩ kwodago yo̩o̩ fai ta, kʼu nagbo̩ko̩bʼume̩ eju Jihofa, lugbo e̩wñ o̩kpakpa du ki Jihofa che, owñ chʼe-kʼi che ñw ame̩ kpai amata-me̩.
According to the number that ye shall prepare, so shall ye do to every one according to their number.	Alu kʼaluka-wñ kʼe̩ ñwo̩che de̩ abe̩le̩ uwe̩ ache ñw okoke-wñ du.
therefore, behold, I will open the side of Moab from the cities, from his cities	todule̩, go, omi abi akolo Moab akwo ewo ewo-wñ, akwʼewo-wñ ki jʼalo̩me̩ ane̩-wñ, owñ chʼojima ojane̩ le̩: Be̩t-je̩shimot kpai Bealmeo̩n kpai Kiriataim manyʼamo̩ma Amo̩n,
For they themselves shew of us what manner of entering in we had unto you, and how ye turned to God from idols to serve the living and true God;	Todu ama onugo dʼo̩la-wa ka e̩go̩ alu kʼegudu kʼa gudu wʼugbo me̩ de̩, kpai alu ku me̩ rida tʼugbo O̩jo̩ bʼode te̩ ku me̩ chʼadu ñw O̩jo̩ kʼi deju kpʼe-ogbolo;
For whosoever will save his life shall lose it: but whosoever will lose his life for my sake, the same shall save it.	Todu e̩ne̩ du kʼi dʼowñ e̩do̩ kʼi jadu oji o̩la-wñ adʼu tinyo̩; e̩ne̩ du ki la adʼoji o̩la-wñ tinyo̩ todu mi, e̩ne̩ le̩ ajadu-wñ.
For he testifieth,	todu ma gbʼo̩ ibenu kakini,
And Paul	Tak abu ki Po̩l ño̩ nʼo̩jo̩ je̩ o̩mo̩ wewe, i chʼamo̩maye le̩ agbo, oñ i kwotʼo̩ko̩ alo tu Siria, Prisila kpʼAkwila le bʼowñ (i fʼoji-wñ ja Se̩nkria; todu i fʼoji da).
So the chief captain	Todule̩ onu ogu ka ñw okolobia le̩ kakini, E̩ ki ka ñw e̩ne̩ du ka kʼe̩ mʼinabali kide̩ du ñw mi n, oñ i tʼo̩ no̩ kʼi lo.
And they went from Kehelathah, and pitched in mount Shapher.	Taku ma kwo Kehelata oñ ma lewa ru e̩re̩ uwo Shefer.
but his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on the altar,	i muda anʼomiofo gwe̩ ifi-wñ kpai e̩re̩-wñ. Tak atama agu o̩gbo̩dudu-wñ jo oj ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ le̩, kʼi chʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo, owñ chʼe̩wñ ku ma duwa lʼugbo una kʼi akpo ru Jihofa.
This	E-le̩ chʼe̩wñ ogu abo o̩lo̩pu Ashe̩r alu kʼakwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi-ma de̩: owñ chʼewo ewo-i manyu ikpo unyi ikpo unyi-ma.
For he knoweth our frame;	Todu owñ chema e̩wñ ku ma ne̩ bo̩ wa;
that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.	todu kʼe̩ne̩ du kʼi ake̩do̩no kʼi nʼiñmi ogbegbeie̩ ef uwñ.
Egypt shall be a desolation, and Edom shall be a desolate wilderness, for the violence	Ijipti achʼalache̩ te̩
And the ten horns which thou sawest upon the beast, these shall hate the whore, and shall make her desolate and naked, and shall eat her flesh, and burn her with fire.	Oñ igba me̩gwa kpʼe̩la kʼe̩ li le̩, abo-i achulaka ajo̩ko̩ le̩ oñ ma achʼo kʼi mud alache̩ kpʼe̩nago̩fo, oñ ma akʼo̩re̩la-wñ je̩, taku ina anʼuna fʼowñ onugo lie,
Then said I, Whither goest thou? And he said unto me, To measure Jerusalem, to see what	Tak u kakini, Ugbo e̩ nyi? Oñ i ka ñwu mi kakini, Nanyʼañwa Je̩rusale̩m, kʼu ma unabe̩-wñ kpai ujiji-wñ.
For if any be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like unto a man beholding his natural face in a glass:	Todu iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ʼka chʼagbo o̩la le̩, kʼi ma la chʼache n, e̩ne̩ le̩ dab e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kʼi ago eju-wñ ef ogigo alu kʼi de̩ ku ma bi u.
And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rab-shakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great host against Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which	Tak onu Asiria fu Tartan kpai Rabsaris kpai Rabshake̩ kpe̩ kwo Lakish nyʼugbo onu He̩ze̩kaya, ma kʼabogu wewe wa Je̩rusale̩m. Oñ ma mute̩gu lewa Je̩rusale̩m. Tak e̩gba ku ma mute̩gu wa kpa, ma lewa dago ugbo o̩cha omi abukpe omi e-ate̩ le̩, oñ chʼe-ki dʼej o̩na oko agwukpo.
And the singers the sons of Asaph	Oñ amakeli, amo̩ma Esaf le̩, jʼuña e-ma alu ku Defid kpai Esaf kpai Heman kpai Jedutun, agane̩ onu le̩ fʼuko̩-wñ te̩; amadʼalo̩na la jʼalaku alaku okoke du; i nʼugbo ku ma kwo bʼoj uko̩lo-ma te̩ n todu amo̩maye-ma, abo Lifai, fʼu ñwo̩che ñwu ma.
And the	Jihofa la gbʼomu o̩la-me̩, e̩gba ku me̩ ko̩la ñwu mi le̩; taku Jihofa ka ñwu mi kakini, Omi fʼomu o̩la kʼamone̩-i ka ñw e̩ gbo̩ me̩; e̩wñ du ku ma ka, o̩me̩me̩le̩ ma ka le̩.
and Joshua said unto them, Pass over before the ark of the	oñ Jo̩shua ka ñwu ma kakini, Me̩ ki dʼo̩gba akpati Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩ le̩ lale rʼalumeji Jo̩rdan kʼe̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-me̩ kʼi mʼokuta du nʼika-wñ, likpa alu kʼuwewe o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu abo Israe̩l de̩,
then let them which be in Judæa flee into the mountains:	e̩gba le̩ abo ku ma jo̩ Judia ki nara tʼoj uwo oj uwo.
Truly God	Ochochi O̩jo̩ che nyo̩ ñw abo Israe̩l,

For the king will hear, to deliver his handmaid out of the hand of the man	Todu onu agbo̩, kʼi gba adu-wñ kwef o̩wo̩ e̩ne̩ kʼi neku ekpa omi kpai o̩ma-mi bie̩ bʼef e̩wñ ogu O̩jo̩ te̩.
And he trembling and astonished said, Lord, what wilt thou have me to do? And the Lord	E̩ muda kwane̩ kʼe̩ gudu nyef ewo-i, taku ma aka ñw e̩ e̩wñ otila kʼe̩ che.
Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father's sister: she	E̩ ki fʼo̩maye ata-we̩ onobule̩ tago ofo n; efu ata-we̩ pio̩o̩ de̩.

and he laid his hands upon him, and gave him a charge, as the	tak i mʼo̩wo̩ ko nʼo oji, oñ i fʼuko̩ te̩ ñw u alu ku Jihofa ka lefu Mose̩s le̩.
And the king made of the almug trees pillars for the house of the	Tak onu nʼoli almug le̩ che oli urane̩ todu unyi Jihofa, kpai todu unyi onu, kpʼumolo kpʼubo̩ todu amakeli ge̩: oli almug e̩gʼe-le̩ ño̩ wa ge̩ n; e̩ne̩ du li e̩go̩-wñ gbogbo tʼeñini n.
And he that shall swear by heaven, sweareth by the throne of God, and by him that sitteth thereon.	Oñ e̩ne̩ ki fʼefojale kpenʼo̩la-wñ, mak ede O̩jo̩ kpai e̩ne̩ ki gugu oji-wñ oñ i kpenʼo̩la-wñ le̩.
And thou shalt speak unto him, and put words in his mouth: and I will be with thy mouth, and with his mouth, and will teach you what ye shall do.	Uwe̩ la ako̩la ñw u, kʼe̩ dʼo̩la tef alu-wñ; omi la adʼugbo alu-we̩ kpʼalu e-wñ, oñ nakʼuwe̩ e̩wñ kʼame̩ ache.
Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the	Taku He̩ze̩kaya mʼeju-wñ rida tʼo̩do̩, oñ i kwogbo̩ko̩bo̩ Jihofa,
And he communed with them, saying, If it be your mind that I should bury my dead out of my sight; hear me, and intreat for me to Ephron the son of Zohar,	Oñ i ko̩la ñwu ma kakini, Iche̩wñ ki du me̩ e̩do̩ kʼu naji e̩ne̩-mi ki ku bʼeju-mi te̩, me̩ gbʼomu-mi, ku me̩ chologu bʼIfro̩n o̩ma Zohar ñwu mi,
that the	Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, Omi Jihofa de̩; o̩la du kʼu naka ñw e̩-i, e̩ naka ñwu Fero, onu Ijipti.
And when Asa heard these words, and the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage, and put away the abominable idols out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and out of the cities which he had taken from mount Ephraim, and renewed the altar of the	Tak e̩gba kʼEsa gbʼo̩la-i, kpʼache̩ ku Ode̩d akache̩ ka le̩, i fʼe̩do̩ ne̩, oñ i mʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ ko bʼoj ane̩ Juda kpai Be̩njamin du te̩, kpai kwʼef ewo, ewo kʼi gba oj ane̩ uwo Ifraim; i la fʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ kʼi dʼo̩gba agbaru Jihofa le̩ ñwo̩che etito̩.

And they said unto him, There came a man up to meet us, and said unto us, Go, turn again unto the king that sent you, and say unto him, Thus saith the	Oñ ma ka ñw u kakini, E̩ne̩ʼka te̩gu ledo wa, oñ i ka ñw a kakini, Me̩ lo, me̩ mudabi nyʼugbo onu ki kpʼume̩ uche̩ le̩, ku me̩ ka ñw u kakini, Abu ki Jihofa ka de̩ kakini, Ukpe̩ kʼO̩jo̩ du ma dʼIsrae̩l in, oñ uwe̩, akpuche̩ atene ugbo Bee̩l-zebub, o̩jo̩ E̩kro̩n? Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the chief of the fathers of the children of Israel, unto Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of the	Taku So̩lo̩mo̩n kʼabo ki dʼoji dufu Israe̩l kpʼamagboji o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu owñ chʼamidachi ef abogijo amo̩ma Israe̩l, wa jeju Je̩rusale̩m, ku ma dʼakpati alo Jihofa kwʼef ewo Defid, ki che Zayo̩n le̩, te̩gu wa.

And the heathen shall know that the house of Israel went into captivity for their iniquity: because they trespassed against me, therefore hid I my face from them, and gave them into the hand of their enemies: so fell they all by the sword.	Tak abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi ama ka kʼabo unyi Israe̩l nyʼef amu tod udu ku ma fe̩; todabu ku ma fʼada-mi je̩, kʼu la meju-mi du maja bʼuma te̩; abe̩le̩ omi mʼuma ko jʼef o̩wo̩ ame̩no̩la-ma. Therefore mine heart shall sound for Moab like pipes, and mine heart shall sound like pipes for the men of Kir-heres: because the riches	Todule̩ e̩do̩-mi afifi todu Moab dabe̩ne̩ kʼo̩kpana, oñ e̩do̩-mi la afifi dab o̩kpana tod aboke̩le̩ Kir-he̩re̩s, todu e̩wñ kʼi yajo̩ e̩kute̩ le̩ lenyo̩.

I was eyes to the blind,	Omi chʼeju ñw amafeju,
therefore thus saith the Lord	Todule̩ abu kʼOndu Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Go, omi chʼe̩nagwunyu-we̩, O Taya, oñ naje̩ ñw abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi ojoji ojoji wewe wa akobʼuwe̩, alu kʼohimini abadi akʼakpoli-wñ wa.

Therefore shall his calamity come suddenly;	todule̩ uchobi-wñ awa bʼo ma achi-gili;

the same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.	owñ le̩ wʼugbo Jisus odu, oñ i ka ñw u kakini, Rabai, a chema kʼuwe̩ chʼakone̩wñ ki kwugbo O̩jo̩ wa; todu e̩ne̩ du neke che ujiwe kʼuwe̩ ache-i n, chai e̩gba kʼO̩jo̩ dʼubi wñ.

And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the people which stand by I said	Omi muda ma kʼe̩ netirʼo̩la-mi e̩gba du; ama todu o̩wo̩ amone̩ ku ma dago jo̩-i oñ u ka le̩, todu ku ma ki ke̩do̩no ka kʼuwe̩ kpe̩ mi wa-i.
Who hath taken this counsel against Tyre, the crowning	E̩ne̩ ñwʼibe-i nyu Taya taa?

of Zerah, the family of the Zarhites: of Shaul, the family of the Shaulites.	e-Ze̩ra, abo akwo̩ra unyi abo Zera; e-Sho̩l, abo akwo̩ra unyi abo Sho̩l;

God forbid:	Tak amone̩ le̩ ka ñwu So̩l kakini, Jo̩natan, kʼi fʼujadu inaina che ef Israe̩l-i aku ge̩? He that overcometh, the same shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, but I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.	Abe̩le̩ ma akʼe̩wñ o̩la efufu bʼo̩la e̩ne̩ kʼi adu ma, i la nʼugbo du kʼu nakpʼodu-wñ lu bʼef ibuku iñmi te̩ n, oñ nagbalu odu-wñ o̩gba Ata-mi kpʼo̩gba amonuche̩-wñ.

What hath my beloved to do in mine house,	Todu ugbo e̩ne̩ kʼomi afe̩do̩ le̩ nʼo̩na kʼi atʼef unyi-mi, abu kʼi fʼe̩wñ omefa-i che? O̩re̩la kiafo̩ le̩ neke kpʼo̩na nyʼo̩bata-we̩ ki awa? Uwe̩ neke gwoye e̩gba le̩ ge̩?

and he said, Let me go, I pray thee; for our family hath a sacrifice in the city; and my brother, he hath commanded me	i la kakini, Nagbo̩ko̩bʼe̩, kʼe̩ je̩ ñwu mi lo, todu abunyi-wa chenʼiche̩bo̩ ku ma che ef ewo le̩; o̩maye-mi la fʼuko̩ te̩ ñwu mi. And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him, Prophesy: and the servants did strike him with the palms of their hands.	Tak iche̩ka ef uma chane̩ efito̩rʼowñ o̩la, ma la kʼe̩wñ bʼeju-wñ ma, ma ro̩kpo̩ ñw u, ma ka ñw u kakini, Kache̩; tak abimo̩to̩ le̩ mʼu gba kpai igbe ekpa.
And when the man rose up to depart, he, and his concubine, and his servant, his father in law, the damsel's father, said unto him, Behold, now the day draweth toward evening, I pray you tarry all night: behold, the day groweth to an end, lodge here, that thine heart may be merry; and to morrow get you early on your way, that thou mayest go home.	Tak e̩gba kʼe̩ne̩ le̩ kpai abadu-wñ kpai adu-wñ kwane̩ ku ma lo, ana-wñ, ata igbe̩le̩ le̩, ka ñw u kakini, Go, olu alo me̩; agba, e̩ le̩ gbʼodudu ta. Go, o̩jo̩ adu; ru emi, kʼe̩do̩-we̩ ki bo̩; tak e̩ takpa kwane̩ kʼe̩ nyʼunyi-we̩ o̩na.
And he returned unto his brethren, and said, The child	Tak i mudabi wʼugbo amo̩maye-wñ, i kakini, Imo̩to̩ le̩ do̩mo̩ ge̩ n; abʼomi ale ke?
And he begat of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,	Taku Hode̩sh o̩ya-wñ fu Jobab kpai Zaibia kpai Misha kpai Malkam,

And the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee: nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.	Eju la neke ka ñw o̩wo̩ kakini, Eku-we̩ aku mi n in: oji la neke ka ñw e̩re̩ kakini, Eku-we̩ aku mi n in;
and a curse, if ye will not obey the commandments of the	i muda che̩wñ kʼame̩ ma gbʼuko̩ uko̩ Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩ gbo̩ n, kʼame̩ la muna bʼo̩na kʼu nañwa ñwu me̩ eñini-i te̩, ku me̩ tʼamo̩jo̩ omune̩ kʼame̩ ma mʼo̩ n ubi, mak ama i che ñwu me̩.

the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,	Bilga je̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩lu, Ime̩r je̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩fa.
My root	ili-mi ta gbogbo kad omi,
And ye shall measure from without the city on the east side two thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand cubits; and the city	Tak ame̩ añwa ohibo̩wo̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ meji ejo̩do̩da ewo le̩ o̩wo̩ olodudu-wñ, oñ o̩wo̩ o̩pata-wñ o̩gane̩ ño̩ chʼohibo̩wo̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ meji, o̩wo̩ o̩lane̩-wñ la chʼo̩hibo̩wo̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ meji, o̩wo̩ o̩pata ate̩-wñ laño̩ chʼo̩hibo̩wo̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ meji ge̩, ewo le̩ ki dʼalumeji. E-le̩ la chʼane̩ ije̩ ki lʼewo ewo le̩ daka ñwu ma.
then I will establish the throne of thy kingdom upon Israel for ever, as I promised to David thy father, saying, There shall not fail thee a man upon the throne of Israel.	mak u nache kʼede ojane̩-we̩ ki lonyane̩ kʼamugbe̩-we̩ ki gugu oji-wñ ku ma nʼo̩da Israe̩l ogbegbele̩ teju alu kʼu katane̩ ñwu Defid, ata-we̩, kakini, E̩ne̩ kʼi agugu oj ede Israe̩l añʼuwe̩ n.
For this Agar is mount Sinai in Arabia, and answereth to Jerusalem which now is, and is in bondage with her children.	Oñ Hagar kide̩ chʼuwo Sainai ef ane̩ Arabia, oñ i dʼoj o̩gbaʼka kpai Je̩rusale̩m ki do̩mo̩ fai; todu owñ dʼef adu manyʼamo̩ma-wñ.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, Mʼo̩kpa Aro̩n du dabi tʼo̩gba e̩wñ ibenu le̩ ku ma fʼide-wñ de kʼi chʼujiwe ñw amo̩ma ku ma fʼe̩re̩ ubi ro̩-i; kʼe̩ che kʼeñmini ku ma ka nyu mi o̩la ki muda, kʼama ki we eku.
And they said unto him, Hold thy peace, lay thine hand upon thy mouth, and go with us, and be to us a father and a priest:	Oñ ma ka ñw u kakini, Chechi, fʼo̩wo̩ bʼalu-we̩ ma kʼe̩ lebʼuwa, kʼe̩ chʼata kpai atama ñw a. I nyo̩ tule ñw e̩ kʼe̩ chʼatama abo unyi e̩ne̩ʼka, abe̩k e̩ chʼatama ñw abo o̩lo̩pu kpai abo unyi e̩ne̩fe̩nyiʼka Israe̩l?
And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me,	Omi la dohi kakini, E̩ne̩ uwe̩ che, Ondu? Oñ i ka ñw mi kakini, Omi che Jisus abo Nazare̩t e-kʼuwe̩ adoli-wñ le.
being defamed, we intreat: we are made as the filth of the world,	ma chakpabie̩ wa, a la gbo̩ko̩bʼuma; a dabe̩ne̩ kʼiwa ile̩-i, a chʼiwa ku ma delikwo bʼe̩wñ du te̩ gbogbo wʼifai.
They have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put themselves to pain,	Ma dʼo̩ka gbe̩, ikeke ma ja wʼunyi;
(Also he bade them teach the children of Judah	oñ i je̩ ñw ma ko̩ abo Juda eli o̩o̩do̩ le̩, go, ma fʼeli-wñ ko̩ nyʼubuku Jashar kakini,
Drop down, ye heavens, from above, and let the skies pour down righteousness: let the earth open, and let them bring forth salvation, and let righteousness spring up together; I the	O efojale, kito̩ kwʼate̩ le̩ wane̩,
one that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;	e̩ne̩ kʼi chʼe̩nuto̩gba unyi e-wñ o̩me̩me̩le̩, ali-wñ ki chʼe̩wñ kʼamo̩ma-wñ abumʼo̩ ku ma fʼo̩la-ma kamuhi te̩ ñw u.
And seven priests shall bear before the ark seven trumpets of rams' horns: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the priests shall blow with the trumpets. And God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she went, and filled the bottle with water, and gave the lad drink.	Tak O̩jo̩ mʼe eju chi, oñ i fʼomi obuga li; tak i le nakpa omiofo nyʼaiko le̩ e̩ko̩, oñ i mʼu du ñw imo̩to̩ le̩ ñmo̩.
And he called the name of that place Kibroth-hattaavah: because there they buried the people that lusted.	Todule̩ ma dʼodu ugbo kide̩ ko̩ Kibro̩t-hatafa todabu ku ma kʼoku abo kʼe̩wñ rʼuma e̩do̩ tabale le̩ ji o̩mo̩.
Moreover the prince shall not take of the people's inheritance by oppression, to thrust them out of their possession;	Anubi le̩ ge̩, idachi le̩ abʼamone̩ le̩ gbʼe̩wñ ogu-ma, kʼi fʼuma ke̩che̩ kwo bʼe̩wñ-ma ku ma ne̩ te̩ n; i akʼe̩wñ ogu ñw amo̩ma-wñ kwef e̩wñ kʼowñ onugo ne̩ kʼe̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ abo-mi ki we ekpatuka bʼane̩-wñ kʼi ne̩ te̩.
but prophesy not again any more at Beth-el: for it	e̩ ki la gbe̩do̩ kache̩ Be̩te̩l ge̩ n, todu uña kiafo̩ e-onu, kpʼunyi o̩fe̩ i la che.
Another parable spake he unto them;	I ño̩ kpʼita omune̩ ñwu ma kakini, Ojane̩ efojale dab o̩jo̩wu e-kʼonobule̩ mʼu gba kʼi la du maja ef agbam-gbam omu me̩ta, gbogbo tak o̩jo̩wu bie̩ nyʼo̩gbo̩dudu-wñ.
A man void of understanding striketh hands,	E̩ne̩ ki manʼibeefu n adʼo̩wo̩tʼo̩wo̩,
Shall not God search this out? For he knoweth the secrets of the heart.	O̩jo̩ ma atejane̩ e-le̩ n?
And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and wist	I ki dʼokolo ki mufu kwef ame̩wño̩re̩ egini wa ñw atama alu kʼe̩ dʼalaja udu kʼi fe̩ te̩, oñ atama ache e̩wñ e̩boma tod uwñ tod edure kʼi dure kʼi ma la ma n, taku ma atʼo̩ no̩ ñw u.
And Joseph commanded his servants the physicians to embalm his father: and the physicians embalmed Israel.	Taku Jose̩f ñwa ñw abuko̩lo̩-wñ ku ma chʼamobochi ku ma dʼata-wñ kpe̩ka. Abe̩le̩ amobochi le̩ mʼIsrae̩l du kpe̩ka.
The people therefore, that stood by, and heard	Todule̩ o̩wo̩ amone̩ ku ma dago jo̩ ku ma la agbo̩, ka kʼakpabana ko̩la; abomune̩ kakini, Onuche̩ O̩jo̩ ko̩la ñw u.

God hath spoken once; Twice have I heard this;	O̩jo̩ ka onuʼka me̩;

And they gave Hebron unto Caleb, as Moses said: and he expelled thence the three sons of Anak.	Taku ma mu He̩bro̩n du ñwu Kele̩b, alu ki Mose̩s ka le̩; oñ i fʼamo̩ma Anak me̩ta le̩ ne dufu.

Why boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighty man?	E̩wñ chi kʼe̩ je̩nyu ñw e̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩, O uwe̩ agbiti le̩,
And Jehoiachin the king of Judah went out to the king of Babylon, he, and his mother, and his servants, and his princes, and his officers: and the king of Babylon took him in the eighth year of his reign. And thy issue, which thou begettest after them, shall be thine,	Tak e-kʼuwe̩ adʼato̩ bi ubi-ma achʼe-we̩; oñ ma adʼodu amo̩maye-ma manyu ma ef e̩wñ ogu-ma.

And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying, Hosanna; Blessed	Oñ abo ku ma rʼo̩gba kpai abo ku ma rʼubi kpʼogu, kakini, Hosana; ekele ma kele e̩ne̩ ki awa ef odu Ondu;
All the commandments which I command thee this day shall ye observe to do, that ye may live, and multiply, and go in and possess the land which the	Uko̩ du kʼu nañwa ñw e̩ eñini-i, ame̩ ki fejutʼo̩ ku me̩ che, kʼame̩ ki deju, ku me̩ wewe nyo̩gba, ku me̩ nyʼo̩mo̩ ane̩ ane̩ e-ki Jihofa go̩ ñw amata-me̩ le̩.
And the first went, and poured out his vial upon the earth; and there fell a noisome and grievous sore upon the men which had the mark of the beast, and	Tak e-ejodudu le, oñ i mʼucha-wñ du da rʼef ane̩ ile̩; oñ ikete e̩bie̩ne̩ kpʼe-bibi Icwʼo̩la amone̩ ku ma nʼina e̩la ku ma laño̩ dojikane̩ ñw ojibo-wñ le̩.
For godly sorrow worketh repentance to salvation not to be repented of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.	Todu e̩do̩dudu ki chʼeju-wñ ñw e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ achuko̩lo̩ ibe erida tef ujadu, e-le̩ nʼejumama n; e̩do̩dudu ile̩-i la achuko̩lo̩ uku.
The Jews therefore, because it was the preparation, that the bodies should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that sabbath day was an high day,) besought Pilate that their legs might be broken, and	Todule̩, abu kʼo̩jo̩ le̩ chʼo̩jo̩ Emo̩latane̩, todu kʼoku amone̩ le̩ ki we ejʼoj oli o̩jo̩ uñmi, (todu o̩jo̩ uñmi kide̩ chʼo̩jo̩ ma), amaJu rodubo̩ Pailati todu ku ma fʼe̩re̩-ma guche̩, ku ma mʼuma ko kwʼo̩mo̩.
And Hezekiah prayed before the	Taku He̩ze̩kaya kwochʼadua o̩gba Jihofa, oñ i kakini, O Jihofa, O̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l; uwe̩ kʼe̩ gugu ate̩ amiche̩rub le̩, uwe̩, uwe̩ kate, chʼO̩jo̩ ojane̩ ojane̩ ile̩ du; uwe̩ fʼefojale kpʼane̩ ile̩ che.
We are confounded, because we have heard reproach: shame hath covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of the	Ukata-wa muchi me̩ todu a gbʼina ku ma bu;

Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa, O̩jo̩ Israe̩l, aka de̩ kakini, Go, narʼe̩wñ ido̩na ogu ki jʼef o̩wo̩-me̩ le̩ da tʼubi, owñ chʼe-kʼame̩ ne̩ akʼogu bʼonu Babilo̩n kpai abo Kaldia ku ma kpala nyʼume̩ ej o̩do̩da aku le̩; u la ako ma wa jeju alumeji ewo-i.
and saith unto them,	Tak i ka ñwu ma, kakini, E̩do̩ onugo-mi mukpabie̩ tabale gbogbo wa kadʼuku; ame̩ ki jʼemi, ku me̩ gwe̩ke̩ adide.
But shew kindness unto the sons of Barzillai the Gileadite, and let them be of those that eat at thy table: for so they came to me when I fled because of Absalom thy brother.	E̩ muda mo̩la ñw amo̩ma Barzilai, e̩ne̩ Gilead le̩, kʼe̩ la je̩ ñw ma jʼef abo ku ma jʼuje̩wñ oj itebulu e-we̩; todu abu kʼama wʼugbo mi e̩gba kʼu ra bʼAbsalom o̩maye-we̩ te̩ le̩ de̩.
Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country unto me,	Tak Aizaya akache̩ le̩, wʼugbo He̩ze̩kaya onu kakini, Abʼabo-i ka-i? Ugbo ma kwo wʼugbo-we̩? He̩ze̩kaya kakini, Ma kwo ane̩ o̩najiji wʼugbo mi, owñ che Babilo̩n.
And thou shalt make staves	E̩ ki dʼoli akesia fa ugbo̩lo̩ oli kʼe̩ mʼo̩jamalia ko wenyʼu.
Ye shall make you no idols nor graven image, neither rear you up a standing image, neither shall ye set up	Ame̩ ki da ode ñw o̩la-me̩ n, me̩ ki la gbʼojibo dago ñw o̩la-me̩ n, me̩ ki dʼokuta dago chʼe̩wñ o̩nagbolo n, me̩ ki la dʼokuta ki biʼe̩wñ dago ane̩-me̩ ku me̩ dojikane̩ ñw u n; todu omi, Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩, de̩.
And	Oñ i lewatu e̩gba ku ma chane̩ edodo o̩mo̩, ma la railo Jihofa n; todule̩ Jihofa fʼamidu kpe̩ rʼef una, oñ amidu le̩ fʼabo iche̩kibo̩-ma kpa.
And when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of Olives.	Tak e̩gba ku ma fʼeli ko̩ ma dufu nyʼugbo uwo O̩lif.
Then said I, Ah, Lord	Tak u kakini, Aya, Ondu Jihofa! mak uwe̩ dʼo̩wo̩ yʼabo-i kpai Je̩rusale̩m eju ochochi! Uwe̩ kakini, Ame̩ anʼure̩do̩; Okwo̩chageli la te̩ gbogbo tʼiñmi-ma.
And they shall be mine, saith the	Abo le̩ la achʼabo e-mi, Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du ka-i, ma achʼabo e-mi ogbolo o̩jo̩ kʼu nache te̩; omi la adʼo̩wo̩ mʼuma alu kʼata o̩ma adʼo̩wo̩ mʼo̩ma-wñ onugo kʼi arʼo̩.
And he took their king's crown from off his head, the weight whereof	Tak i mʼike̩be̩ onu abʼewo le̩ chi bʼo̩ oji te̩; uwoji-wñ la chʼo̩jamalia tale̩nt oka, okuta akoko jʼo̩la-wñ; oñ ma mʼu du do Defid oji. Tak i mʼane̩ kʼogu je̩ ko kwef ewo dufu, i nana tabale.
O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?	Ame̩ abo Galatia ame̩nidada, e̩ne̩ kʼume̩ eju ne e̩wñʼka, ame̩, ku ma fu Jisus Kraist jiwe te̩ foo eju-me̩ abu kʼi chʼe̩kamoli le̩?
How shall I give thee up, Ephraim?	Ab u nale kʼu natʼuwe̩ no̩? O Ifraim!
	Amonu chane̩ eche e̩wñ bibi e̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ i che,
I am afraid of you, lest I have bestowed upon you labour in vain.	Narailo todu me̩, tode̩gba kʼu fʼakanya uko̩lo̩ ugbo me̩ che tinyo̩ ofofo.
The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together,	Amonu ile̩ kʼo̩la-ma dojo̩,
And seek the peace of the city whither I have caused you to be carried away captives, and pray unto the	Me̩ ki tene o̩lafia ewo ugbo kʼu je̩ ñwu ma ño̩ me̩ nyi le̩, me̩ ki la rodubʼO̩jo̩ tod ewo le̩, todu ugbo o̩lafia-wñ oñ me̩ anʼo̩lafia e-me̩.
For we commend not ourselves again unto you, but give you occasion to glory on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to	I chʼedabi a ño̩ dabi adʼo̩la-wa dago ñw me̩ n, ama a muda abʼuña ñw me̩ ku me̩ du wa buba, todu ku me̩ nʼohi ugbo abo ku ma ale alu kʼeju de̩ abu ki ma chʼalu kʼe̩do̩ de̩ n.

And Nathan said to David, Thou	Taku Ne̩tan ka ñwu Defid kakini, Uwe̩ chʼe̩ne̩ le̩. Abu ku Jihofa, O̩jo̩ abo Israe̩l, ka de̩ kakini, Omi fʼekpo ba tʼuwe̩ oji kʼe̩ jʼonu Israe̩l, omi la gbʼe̩ kwef o̩wo̩ So̩l;
Lord, how long wilt thou look on?	Ondu, gbogbo nyʼe̩gba oñ uwe̩ adago ago ofo?
And all bare him witness, and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said, Is not this Joseph's son?	Oñ o̩chaka amone̩ nagbʼo̩ ibenu, ma laño̩ yaye o̩la ufe̩de̩nyo̩ ki kwʼef alu-wñ dufu; taku ma kakini, Owñ-i chʼo̩ma Jo̩se̩f de̩ n?
and being made perfect, he became the author of eternal salvation unto all them that obey him;	oñ abu kʼi mufu kpoji i mud e̩wñ ki chi kʼujadu ogbegbele̩ do̩mo̩ ñw abo du ku ma gbʼo̩la-wñ gbo̩,

And when the ten heard	Oñ abu kʼamame̩gwa gbʼo̩ o̩la amo̩maye meji le̩, i bi ma eju.
And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful	Tak i kwochokpo, i kakini, Emi nʼubailo gboo! Ugbo-i chʼugbo omune̩ n, unyi O̩jo̩ de̩, alaku e-efojale la de̩-i.
Bow down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily:	Hi eti-we̩ wane̩ ñw mi,
If in this life only we have hope in Christ, we are of all men most miserable.	Iche̩wñ kʼa kibeno Kraist ef udeju-wa ile̩-i kate, mak a chʼe̩nejumomi tʼamone̩ du le.
And when ye come into an house, salute it.	Abu ku me̩ la mugudu nyʼef unyi le̩, me̩ fʼugwa gwa.

Her princes within her	Amagboji-wñ ku ma jʼalumeji-wñ

But Abimelech had not come near her: and he said, Lord, wilt thou slay also a righteous nation?	Abime̩le̩k la te̩mʼo̩ ta n; oñ i kakini, Ondu, e̩ ñʼakpa abo uche̩ichi o̩kpakpa ge̩?
