who both killed the Lord Jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecuted us; and they please not God, and are contrary to all men:	ku ma fʼOndu Jisus kpai amakache̩ kpa ku ma ño̩ fʼuwa ne dufu; ma la nyo̩ O̩jo̩ eju n, ma laño̩ chʼe̩nuja amone̩ du.
wherein	Ma ko̩ nyʼu kakini, Ma ka ef abo uche̩ichi ka kʼibe dʼef uwe̩ kpai amaJu ka ku me̩ ako̩ onu. Gashmu ka abe̩le̩. Todule̩ oñ uwe̩ do̩mo̩ an, o̩do̩, i la dʼuwe̩ e̩do̩ kʼe̩ chʼonu-ma, abu kʼa gbo le̩ de̩.
And straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, and filled	Tak ababa le̩ e̩ne̩ʼka ef uma fule namʼugbo̩che̩ du, i mʼu du tunyʼomi e̩ka kʼi ñmʼo̩ nyʼo̩la e̩ko̩, tak i mʼu du tunyʼoj elikpo, oñ i dʼu ñw u kʼi ñmʼe̩.
My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee;	Uko-mi achʼo̩ga-uyo̩,
Now as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.	Oñ abu kʼi alale eti ohimini Galili, i fu Saimo̩n kpai Anduru o̩maye Saimo̩n li, abu ku ma jʼariga ef ohimini; todu ku ma chʼamekwuji.
And truly the Son of man goeth, as it was determined: but woe unto that man by whom he is betrayed!	Todu O̩ma One̩ alo alu ku ma date̩ chuu; ama atogwo ki chʼe-e̩ne̩ ku ma dʼowñ ñwu ma mu lugbo-wñ!
Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.	Efojale kpai ane̩-ile̩-i alale; i muda nʼugbo du kʼo̩la-mi alale rinyo̩ ofo n.
Then Nathan said unto David, Do all that	Taku Netan ka ñwu Defid kakini, E̩ che e̩wñ du ki dʼe̩do̩-we̩, todu O̩jo̩ dʼugbo we̩.
And if a woman have an issue of her blood many days out of the time of her separation, or if it run beyond the time of her separation; all the days of the issue of her uncleanness shall be as the days of her separation: she	I la che̩wñ kʼo̩la onobule̩ rʼe̩bie̩ o̩jo̩ wewe ki ma chʼiko elifo̩-wñ n, abe̩k iche̩wñ kʼe̩bie̩ le̩ kpo̩kpe̩ tʼalu kʼiko elifo̩-wñ de̩ le, aluka o̩jo̩ du kʼere̩bie̩ e-o̩la e̩kpabie̩-wñ akade i adʼef o̩la e̩daji-wñ; ef o̩jo̩ elifo̩-wñ n, abe̩le̩ i mudaji.
So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, saying, I	Todule̩ Ehaz fʼamonuche̩ kpe̩ ru Tiglat-pilesa, onu Asiria, kakini, Omi chʼadu-we̩ kpai o̩ma-we̩, mute̩gu wa kʼe̩ gba mi kwʼo̩wo̩ onu Siria, kpai kwʼo̩wo̩ onu Israe̩l ku ma kwane̩ tʼumi o̩la-i.
And if the priest look, and, behold, the plague	I la che̩wñ kʼatama gʼo, kʼo̩ga le̩ chane̩ echi abu ku ma fu gwe̩ le̩, tak i akpʼugbo kʼi mu e̩wñ o̩la le̩ na, abe̩k año̩, abe̩k udago-wñ, abe̩k uto̩ko̩-wñ.
And God said unto him in a dream, Yea, I know that thou didst this in the integrity of thy heart; for I also withheld thee from sinning against me: therefore suffered I thee not to touch her.	Tak O̩jo̩ ka ñw u ef o̩na le̩ kakini, Ochochi, u chema ka kʼef ofoo e̩do̩-we̩ uwe̩ che-i, omi laño̩ gwo̩nyʼuwe̩ tode̩gba kʼe̩ du mi re; todule̩ u ma je̩ ñw e̩ do̩wo̩kadʼo n.
They say unto him, He will miserably destroy those wicked men, and will let out	Ma ka ñw u kakini, Ame̩ne̩bie̩ne̩ le̩, i akpa ma rinyo̩ bie̩ne̩ bie̩ne̩, tak i adʼuche̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma le̩ nyʼamaluche̩ omune̩ o̩wo̩, abo le̩ akʼe̩ro-wñ ñw u iko iko-wñ.
And we went before to ship, and sailed unto Assos, there intending to take in Paul: for so had he appointed, minding himself to go afoot.	Oñ awa mʼo̩gba du, a tʼo̩ko̩ nyi Aso̩s, o̩mo̩ a che kʼa gba Po̩l tʼo̩ko̩; todu abu kʼa ka tane̩ le̩ de̩; owñ che kʼi le e̩re̩.
For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.	Todu O̩jo̩ dʼafu e-okpo ñw a n; chai e-ukpahiu kpʼe-ufydo̩ kpʼe-ibe ewane̩.
And we utterly destroyed them, as we did unto Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children, of every city.	Oñ a mʼuma kojo̩ ñw O̩jo̩ chaka, alu kʼa che Siho̩n onu He̩shbo̩n, a mʼewo du kʼone̩ jʼefu-wñ kojo̩ ñw O̩jo̩ hioko manyʼaboke̩le̩ kpai abobule̩ kpai abo-ma egini.
So it came to pass, when the king's commandment and his decree was heard, and when many maidens were gathered together unto Shushan the palace, to the custody of Hegai, that Esther was brought also unto the king's house, to the custody of Hegai, keeper of the women.	Abe̩le̩ i lewatu, e̩gba kʼo̩la onu kpai o̩da kʼi dute̩ tʼamone̩ eti kʼabimo̩to̩ abobule̩ wewe jeju jʼunyi Shushan, o̩wo̩ Hegai, ma laño̩ mʼE̩sta du wʼef unyi onu, tef o̩wo̩ Hegai kʼi ade abobule̩ le̩.
And the land of Egypt shall be desolate and waste; and they shall know that I	oñ ane̩ Ijipti amud alache̩ ki chʼegbili e̩lanyi kpʼ-okuta; tak ama ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩.
And Moses went up unto God, and the	Taku Mose̩s mute̩gu nyʼugbo O̩jo̩, oñ Jihofa kʼi dʼoj uwo le̩ nʼomudala dʼo̩, i kakini, Abu kʼuwe̩ aka ñw abunyi Jeko̩b de̩, kʼe̩ laño̩ ka ñw amo̩ma Israe̩l, kakini,
seemeth it but	E̩wñ re i che eju-me̩, kʼO̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l mʼume̩ date̩ bʼabo o̩gbadu Israe̩l te̩, kʼi la ko me̩ wa me̩ru o̩la-wñ ku me̩ che uko̩lo̩ ef uña ugugu e-Jihofa, ku me̩ la dago o̩gba abo o̩gbadu-i ku me̩ che e̩wñ ñwu ma?
ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and an hundred sheep, beside harts, and roebucks, and fallow deer, and fatted fowl.	Amokuno̩ ki yoyo chʼe̩gwa, amokuno̩ ku ma ko kwʼoko ije̩ wa la chʼogu, ame̩wño̩re̩ egini la chʼogume̩lu, e-le̩ manyu amabede, kpai amegbi kpai amate̩ kpai amajuwe̩ kpai amidagwo̩ kpai e̩wñ e̩gʼe-le̩ ki yoyo.
But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the	E̩wñ ku ma ka le̩ la bie̩ne̩ eju Samiue̩l, owñ chʼe-ku ma kakini, Dʼonu ñw a kʼi kajo̩ wa. Taku Samiue̩l rodubo̩ Jihofa.
And immediately, while he yet spake, cometh Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a great multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.	Oñ ababale̩ abu kʼi nʼo̩la le̩ aka, Judas, e̩ne̩ʼka ef amame̩gweji le̩ lewa, o̩wo̩ amone̩ nʼugbada kpʼugbolo kpe̩re̩ wa kpʼowñ, ma kwʼugbo amagboji amatama kpai amako̩takada kpai abogijo wa.
Then all the people of Judah took Uzziah, who	Tak abo Juda chaka mʼUzaya, kʼo̩do̩-wñ chʼe̩gwe̩fa, du jʼonu koji ata-wñ Amazaya.
When he had caused the tribe of Benjamin to come near by their families, the family of Matri was taken, and Saul the son of Kish was taken: and when they sought him, he could not be found.	Tak i mʼo̩lo̩pu Be̩njamin du me̩ru, akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi; tak i mʼabunyi Matrait du; oñ i mu So̩l, o̩ma Kish, du. Ama e̩gba ku ma tejane̩-wñ, ma liʼu n.
And the	Taku Jihofa ache ma alu kʼi che Siho̩n kpai O̩g, amonu abo Amo̩r, kpai alu kʼi che ane̩-ma, e̩gba kʼi fʼuma chile̩che̩ le̩.
For	Todu uku-ma awo̩ ma n;
Yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boasting of you should be in vain in this behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready:	U muda fʼamo̩maye kpe̩ wa, todu kʼuba-wa kʼa ba todu me̩ ki we echʼofofo ef ukpe̩ kide̩; todu kʼame̩ ki mʼo̩la tane̩ alu kʼu ka le̩;
I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and out, and find pasture.	Omi chʼalugbana; iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ du guduwa lefu mi ma ajadu-wñ; tak i anyʼejefu, i adufu, oñ i ali ije̩ kʼi je̩.
They that sow in tears	Abo ku ma nʼomi aku kʼe̩wñ gbe̩
Then shall ye know that I	Tak ame̩ ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩, owñ chʼe̩gba kʼoku abo-ma kʼuku kpa jʼe̩re̩ ode ode-ma alʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩-ma daka oj otete du ki gbo̩gba, kpʼoj uwo uwo du kpʼofe oli emimi du, kpʼofe oli ok ki hidu chaka, ugbo ku ma kʼe̩wñ ki akpo wa ñw ode-ma chaka.
And he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the covering of the tent above upon it; as the	tak i fʼunyabo ta bʼuña ugugu le̩ ma, oñ i mʼe̩wñ e̩boma ko bʼoji-wñ ma ate̩, alu ki Jihofa ñwa ñwu Mose̩s.
And king Rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood before Solomon his father while he yet lived, saying, What counsel give ye	Taku Reho̩boam, onu, fʼojuju nyi kpʼabogijo ku ma dago jʼo̩gba So̩lo̩mo̩n, ata-wñ, e̩gba kʼi ma ku ta n, i kakini, Ohi e̩wñ me̩ du ñwu mi, kʼu nadʼohi ñw amone̩-i?
So I spake unto the people in the morning: and at even my wife died; and I did in the morning as I was commanded.	Abe̩-le̩ oñ u ko̩la ñw amone̩ odudu-wñ; oñ e̩gba ane̩ o̩ya-mi ku; u la che alu ku ma ñwa ñwu mi odudu.
Command the children of Israel, and say unto them, My offering,	E̩ ki ñwa ñw abo Israe̩l kʼe̩ la ka ñwu ma kakini, E̩wñ O̩jo̩ e-mi, owñ chʼuje̩wñ-mi ku ma duwa ñwu mi lugbo una, e̩wñ ki akpo ru mi le̩, me̩ fejutʼo̩ ku me̩ ko wa ñwu mi iko-wñ kpakpa.
How think ye? if a man have an hundred sheep, and one of them be gone astray, doth he not leave the ninety and nine, and goeth into the mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?	Ab i de̩ eju-me̩ ta? Iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ʼka nʼamala ogume̩lu tak oka chila kwef uma, i atʼokeka chi ef ogume̩lu le̩ no̩ kʼi nyʼoj uwo uwo afeju e-kʼi chila le̩ n?
As the holy flock, as the flock of Jerusalem in her solemn feasts; so shall the waste cities be filled with flocks of men: and they shall know that I	Dabe̩ne̩ kʼame̩wño̩re̩ egini kiafo̩, dabe̩ne̩ kʼame̩wño̩re̩ egini Je̩rusale̩m e̩gba uje̩wñ uyo̩ ku ma dʼiko-wñ te̩, abe̩le̩ ewo ewo ki chihi te̩ ako̩ ñw ame̩wño̩re̩ egini ku ma chʼone̩; tak ama ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩.
Then went Samson down, and his father and his mother, to Timnath, and came to the vineyards of Timnath: and, behold, a young lion roared against him.	Taku Samson kpai ata-wñ kpai iye-wñ gwo̩ru nyi Timna, oñ ma lewa uche̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma e-Timna le̩. E̩ la go, o̩ma agaguʼka kwa tʼo̩ o̩la.
knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,	E̩wñ ku me̩ ama ejodudu de̩ kakini, E̩gba adiko o̩jo̩ otitala abo ku ma chʼone̩ uke̩ anʼuke̩ wa, ma la atale teju e̩ño̩ e̩wñ o̩re̩la e-ma,
And when he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was afterward an hungred.	Tak abu kʼi jialu o̩jo̩ o̩gbo̩ meji, kpʼodu o̩gbo̩ meji, ubi le̩ ebi kwokpʼo̩.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini,
If any man have an ear, let him hear.	Iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ du nʼeti, kʼi nagbo̩:
And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which	Abe̩le̩ onu Israe̩l kpai Jiho̩shafat, onu Juda, mute̩gu nyi Ramo̩t-gilead.
And his fellowservant fell down at his feet, and besought him, saying, Have patience with me, and I will pay thee all.	Todule̩ e̩ne̩ kʼowñ kpʼowñ chʼadu le̩ lewa bʼane̩ ma, i gbo̩ko̩bʼo̩ kakini, E̩ fe̩do̩je̩ kpʼomi, kʼu narʼo̩me̩ ñw e̩.
because the daughters of Manasseh had an inheritance among his sons: and the rest of Manasseh's sons had the land of Gilead.	todabu kʼamo̩ma Manasa onobule̩ nʼe̩wñ ogu manyʼamo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩. Oñ amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Manasa kibo̩ ne̩ ane̩ Gilead.
But in those	Ama erewa adure o̩do̩ o̩do̩ dʼef e-le̩.
And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.	I la nʼugbo du ku ma tʼe̩nomune̩ ojoji ubi n, ma la ara bʼo̩ te̩; todabu ku ma ma ma omuko̩la abomune̩ ojoji n.
And when they found him not, they turned back again to Jerusalem, seeking him.	oñ abu ku ma ma li u n, ma mudabi tu Je̩rusale̩m atene owñ.
To him give all the prophets witness, that through his name whosoever believeth in him shall receive remission of sins.	Amakache̩ chaka gbʼowñ ibenu ka kʼe̩ne̩ du kʼi ake̩do̩nʼowñ agba adure-wñ eto̩no̩ lef odu-wñ.
And her spirit came again, and she arose straightway: and he commanded to give her meat.	Tak afu-wñ mudabiwa, oñ i kwane̩ e̩re̩re̩le̩; tak i ñwañwu ma ku ma dʼe̩wñ ñw u je̩.
And of the children of Benjamin, the kindred of Saul, three thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept the ward of the house of Saul.	Abo Be̩nja-min, efu So̩l le̩, chʼone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ugbo me̩ta todu ojile-ma te̩tatʼabo unyi So̩l ubi akwoubi.
and said unto them, Ye men of Israel, take heed to yourselves what ye intend to do as touching these men.	Tak i ka ñw ma kakini, Ame̩, aboke̩le̩ Israe̩l, me̩ mʼo̩la-me̩ ne̩ ugbo abo-i, e̩wñ ku me̩ che ku me̩ che ma.
And if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the	I la che̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ du dure kʼi la chʼe̩wñʼka ku Jihofa tuko̩ ñwu ma ku ma ki we eche, dagba i ma chaka ma n, i muda ajabi kpo̩, i la anʼudu-wñ.
(for the	todu Jihofa, O̩jo̩-we̩, chʼO̩jo̩ kʼi ali ejumomi one̩; i adeyakpʼuwe̩ n, i la akpʼuwe̩ bie̩ rinyo̩ n, i agbenyo̩ alo kʼi go̩ ñw amata-we̩ le̩ n.
He that speaketh flattery to	E̩ne̩ ki adʼofe amonuku-wñ dufu todu kʼi je̩ ma e̩wñ,
A man shall not take his father's wife, nor discover his father's skirt.	One̩ ki ne̩ o̩ya ata-wñ n, i ki la chi ata-wñ ofe te̩ n.
Now go and smite Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling, ox and sheep, camel and ass.	Fa-i e̩ lo kʼe̩ fʼAmale̩k gwoda, kʼe̩ la fʼe̩wñ du kʼi ne̩ kojo̩ ñw O̩jo̩, e̩ ki do̩wo̩mʼuma n; tʼe̩ne̩ke̩le̩ tʼonobule̩ e̩ kpa ma, tʼimo̩to̩ kekele tʼo̩me̩kpa, tʼo̩kokuno̩ tʼe̩wño̩re̩ egini, tʼinyakulumi tʼo̩ke̩ke̩te̩.
and the little owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl,	kpai ogugu, kpai anumure kpai ogugu omoko̩
And it came to pass at that time, when Eli	Oñ iko le̩ abu kʼIlai la dachi e̩gu-wñ (eju-wñ chane̩ echubi e̩gba le̩ me̩, i gane̩ nyo̩nyo̩ ge̩ n);
and the ferret, and the chameleon, and the lizard, and the snail, and the mole.	kpai abibie̩ kpai abaji kpai abuta kpai igbi kpai ailojegbe̩.
Even the very dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against you: notwithstanding be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of God is come nigh unto you.	I chaka chʼebutu ewo-me̩ kʼi gamʼe̩re̩-wa, a agbanyo̩ bʼe̩re̩-wa te̩ rʼume̩ oji-i; i chaka dʼabe̩i ame̩ ki muda ma ka kʼojane̩ O̩jo̩ lewa anane̩ me̩.
therefore shalt thou serve thine enemies which the	todule̩ uwe̩ adʼef ebi kpai alugbe̩ kpai ago ofo kpai eku e̩wñ du kʼi aku one̩ are̩ ame̩nebi-we̩ e-ki Jihofa akpuche̩ rʼuwe̩ o̩la, oñ i adʼebije uno̩lo̩ nʼuwe̩ o̩lo̩ gbogbo tak i fʼe̩ chile̩che̩ rinyo̩.
If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,	Iche̩wñ kʼo̩maye e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ abe̩k onobule̩ tago ofo, kʼuje̩wñ añʼo̩ o̩jo̩ du,
the changeable suits of apparel, and the mantles, and the wimples, and the crisping pins,	kpʼafe̩ ku ma dʼu mʼo̩la kpʼo̩chada ku ma ko nʼika kpʼigbe̩chi kpʼikpa;
And Pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrifice to the	Taku Fero kakini, Naje̩ ñwu me̩ lo ku me̩ kpʼe̩wñ e̩bie̩ ñwu Jihofa, O̩jo̩-me̩, ef aje̩tachi; me̩ ki muda le jiji n. Me̩ ki gbo̩ko̩bʼo̩ ñwu mi.
The	Jihofa chʼE̩numo̩la kpai E̩nejumomi,
Wisdom crieth without;	Ibe dʼej o̩na akpogu taa;
And Baasha the son of Ahijah, of the house of Issachar, conspired against him; and Baasha smote him at Gibbethon, which	Taku Beasha, o̩ma Ahija kʼi chʼabo unyi Isakar, dʼalu nyʼu. Oñ Beasha fʼowñ kpa Gibe̩to̩n; abo Filistia ne̩ omo̩; todu Nedab kpʼabo Israe̩l chaka jʼakpala nyu Gibe̩ton.
while it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.	ef e-ku ma ka le̩ kakini,
Against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done	Uwe̩ kate omi dʼu re,
But the mercy of the	Ufe̩de̩nyo̩ Jihofa muda chʼakwo ogbegbele̩ tʼogbegbele̩
Thus saith the whole congregation of the	Abu kʼo̩gbo̩ abo o̩gbadu Jihofa ka de̩, kakini, Ada O̩jo̩ Israe̩l ku me̩ je̩-i chʼe̩wñ ge̩? kʼame̩ ki rida bʼetu Jihofa ubi te̩ eñini-i, kʼame̩ fʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ne ñw o̩la-me̩ ku me̩ ki fʼe̩re̩ ubi ro̩ ñwu Jihofa eñini-i ta?
And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou wouldest bless me indeed, and enlarge my coast, and that thine hand might be with me, and that thou wouldest keep	Je̩be̩z la kwado̩ O̩jo̩ Israe̩l kakini, O, uwe̩ ma de̩nyo̩ ñwu mi ochochi, kʼe̩ hi alo̩me̩-mi tʼubi, kʼo̩wo̩-we̩ ki la dʼugbo mi, kʼe̩ laño̩ fʼumi de bʼe̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ te̩, kʼi we e̩chʼe̩do̩dudu ñwu mi! Tak O̩jo̩ dʼe̩wñ kʼi bi le̩ ñw u.
Consider	Go ta, dohi ñw mi, O Jihofa O̩jo̩-mi;
Which things also we speak, not in the words which man's wisdom teacheth, but which the Holy Ghost teacheth; comparing spiritual things with spiritual.	I la chʼef o̩la kʼofili one̩ ko̩ wa oñ a nʼe̩wñ le̩ aka n, chai ef e-kʼAfu ko̩ wa; e̩wñ Afu ma nʼañwa e̩wñ Afu.
Also Judah took Gaza with the coast thereof, and Askelon with the coast thereof, and Ekron with the coast thereof.	Juda ño̩ fu Gaza du, manyʼane̩-wñ kadʼalo̩me̩-wñ, kpai Ashke̩lo̩n manyʼane̩-wñ kadʼalo̩me̩-wñ, kpai E̩kro̩n manyʼane̩-wñ kadʼalo̩me̩-wñ.
They gave me also gall for my meat;	Ma ño̩ mʼololo du chʼuje̩wñ-mi,
and say, What	kʼe̩ kakini;
Thou that dwellest in the gardens,	Uwe̩ kʼe̩ gugu oko le̩,
I called upon thy name, O	U kwa do̩ odu-we̩, O Jihofa,
But the	Jihofa muda dʼugbo mi dab agbiti ki abʼone̩ ailo;
For there is verily a disannulling of the commandment going before for the weakness and unprofitableness thereof.	Todu elaba uko̩ ku ma te̩ o̩gbo̩gba le̩ wate̩ tod e̩gbo-wñ kpʼile kʼi ma ne̩ n,
but	uwe̩ ki tʼiye-wñ no̩ kʼi lo-wñ, e̩ muda neke kʼamo̩ma-wñ; todu ki ra ñw e̩, kʼuwe̩ ki kpojolugbo.
Among all this people	Ef amone̩-i chaka amabawohi ku ma chi jo̩ chʼone̩ ogume̩lu mebie; e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-ma neke gwʼune̩cha ado odeele iloji oka, ma la adʼu re n.
When the	E̩gba ku Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ fʼalo̩me̩-we̩ hi ubi, alu kʼi katane̩ ñw e̩ le̩, kʼuwe̩ akakini, Naje̩ e̩la, todabu ki arʼonugo we̩ e̩do̩ kʼe̩ je̩, uwe̩ ki je̩ e̩la alu du ki rʼe̩ e̩do̩.
For I have set my face against this city for evil, and not for good, saith the	Todu u fʼeju-mi kparʼewo-i tod e̩bie̩ne̩, i chʼutodu e̩nyo̩ n, Jihofa ka-i; ma adʼu tef o̩wo̩ onu Babilo̩n owñ la anʼuna gujo rinyo̩.
And in Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon, Jehiel, whose wife's name	Oñ Jeie̩l, ata Gibeo̩n, gugu Gibeo̩n, odu o̩ya-wñ ko̩ Maaka:
Ain, Remmon, and Ether, and Ashan; four cities and their villages:	Ain kpai Rimo̩n kpai Ete̩r kpai Ashan: ewo me̩le̩ manyʼikpo unyi ikpo unyi-ma;
Hereby perceive we the love	Ef e-le̩ oñ a fʼufe̩do̩ ma, owñ chʼabu kʼe̩ne̩ le̩ mʼoji-wñ du tinyo̩ tod uwa; o̩me̩ la dʼawa o̩la kʼa ki dʼoji e-wa tinyo̩ tod amo̩maye.
Remember them, O my God, because they have defiled the priesthood, and the covenant of the priesthood, and of the Levites.	O O̩jo̩-mi, e̩ nadibekado ma, todabu ku ma fʼuko̩lo̩ atama le̩ daji, ma la fʼalo amatama kpai e-abo Lifai bie̩.
Now we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.	A chema ka kʼO̩jo̩ agbʼo̩la ame̩nadure n; one̩ muda adiba ñw O̩jo̩, kʼi la achʼe̩wñ ki dʼowñ e̩do̩, i agbʼo̩la e̩ne̩ le̩.
Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades,	kʼi ache Abia ñʼe̩la kpʼAjuwe̩ anʼo̩ma kpʼO̩ya O̩machi,
And through his policy also he shall cause craft to prosper in his hand; and he shall magnify	Lugbo ugbeju-wñ i aje̩ ñw one̩ egba ibe ra nyʼo̩wo̩. Oñ ef ibe e-wñ i ahi o̩la-wñ ne. Oñ ejo̩ yo̩ ku ma jo̩ yo̩ le̩ achigili i afʼamone̩ wewe chile̩che̩; i ñʼahidago bʼAgboji e-amagboji onugo; i muda aguche̩, i la chʼo̩wo̩ one̩ achʼo n.
And Solomon said, If he will shew himself a worthy man, there shall not an hair of him fall to the earth: but if wickedness shall be found in him, he shall die.	Taku So̩lo̩mo̩n kakini, Iche̩wñ kʼi mud e̩no̩me̩me̩le̩, mak iloji-wñ okate achi tʼane̩pe̩te̩ n; i muda che̩wñ ku ma fʼe̩bie̩ne̩ li ef uwñ, eku i aku.
But the house of Israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will not hearken unto me: for all the house of Israel	Abunyi Israe̩l muda anetirʼe̩ n; todu i dʼuma e̩do̩ ku ma netirʼe-mi n; todu abunyi Israe̩l chaka chʼama je̩ja kpʼe̩do̩ ki chʼagbo̩ni.
The elder unto the wellbeloved Gaius, whom I love in the truth.	Ogijo le̩ tʼugbo Gayo̩s e̩nufe̩do̩, e-kʼomi afe̩do̩ owñ ef ochochi.
And it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering the burnt offering, that Jehu said to the guard and to the captains, Go in,	Oñ i lewatu abu kʼi fʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo che kpa ababa le̩, Jihiu ka ñw amonuche̩-wñ kpai amagboji kakini, Me̩ nyʼejefu ku me̩ kpa ma; me̩ je̩ ñw e̩ne̩ du kʼi dufu n. Taku ma nʼalu o̩kwo̩chage̩li kpa ma; oñ amonuche̩ le̩ kpai amagboji ko ma rikpolo jʼo̩do̩da, oñ ma nyʼewo unyi Beal.
and sware by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven, and the things that therein are, and the earth, and the things that therein are, and the sea, and the things which are therein, that there should be time no longer:	oñ i fʼe̩ne̩ kʼi deju ogbegbele̩ nyile̩wa, e-kʼi nyi efojale kpʼe̩wñ du ki jʼef uwñ, kpʼane̩ ile̩ kpʼe̩wñ du ki jʼef uwñ, kpʼohimini kpʼe̩wñ du ki jʼef uwñ go kakini, Iko ñʼade̩ ge̩ n,
girded with girdles upon their loins, exceeding in dyed attire upon their heads, all of them princes to look to, after the manner of the Babylonians of Chaldea, the land of their nativity:	e̩wñ ulago lʼuma ago de, alawoni ki nʼo̩jaja jʼoji-ma, o̩chaka-ma chʼame̩nojima eju, ma chebiu abo Babilo̩n Kaldia, ane̩ ugbo ku ma bi ma le̩.
Hear ye therefore the word of the	Oñ ame̩ ku ma mʼume̩ ño̩ le̩ chaka kʼomi ko me̩ kpe̩ kwo Je̩rusale̩m nyi Babilo̩n le̩, me̩ ki gbʼo̩la Jihofa kakini.
And it came to pass at the time of the going down of the sun,	Oñ i lewatu adiko kʼolu atunyʼane̩ Jo̩shua ñwa ñwu ma, oñ ma mʼuma ko kwʼoji oli wʼane̩, taku ma ko ma rikpolo jʼef owo ugbo ku ma kʼo̩la-ma maja le̩, oñ ma kʼokuta elile-lile bʼalu owo le̩ ma, gbogbo tʼeñini.
Lest the	tode̩gba ki Jihofa aliʼi, kʼi la abʼi eju,
They eat up the sin of my people, and they set their heart on their iniquity.	Ama nʼadure abo-mi chʼuje̩wñ-ma;
And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps: there was not the like made in any kingdom.	Amidu me̩gweji la jʼoj ubo̩ me̩fa le̩ o̩wo̩ mejeji. I nʼojane̩ du ugbo ku ma che e̩go̩-wñ n.
and the anger of the	todule̩ oñ uwe̩do̩ Jihofa mutajo bʼane̩-i ma, kʼi kʼama du ku ma ko̩ ef ubuku-i wa bʼo ma;
Mark the perfect	Kejurʼe̩ne̩ ki mufu, e̩ la go e̩no̩kpa kpa,
For all these things do the nations of the world seek after: and your Father knoweth that ye have need of these things.	Todu abo uche̩ichi ile̩-i jʼatejane̩ e̩wñ le̩ du; Ata-me̩ chema ka kʼeku e̩wñ-i aku me̩.
Now I Paul myself beseech you by the meekness and gentleness of Christ, who in presence	Oñ omi, Po̩l, o̩to̩to̩la-mi agbo̩ko̩bʼume̩ lef o̩chikimi kpʼo̩yo̩o̩ e-Kraisti, owñ chʼomi kʼu chʼe̩ne̩ kʼu nahi o̩la-mi wane̩ e̩gba kʼu dʼugbo me̩, kʼu kwugbo me̩ tak u ne̩do̩ eko̩la ñw me̩ le̩;
In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I have given for an inheritance unto your fathers.	Iko le̩ abo unyi Juda kpai abo unyi Israe̩l akpe̩re̩, oñ ama akpe̩re̩ kwo ane̩ o̩pata ate̩ le̩ wa ane̩ kʼomi du ñw amata-me̩ ki chʼe̩wñ ogu-ma.
And it shall come to pass,	I la awatu, kʼamekwuji adago jʼeti-wñ; akwo E̩nge̩di gbogbo wa E̩ne̩glaim achʼugbo ku ma anʼiga dala. E̩ja-wñ la achʼuche̩ uche̩-wñ dabe̩ne̩ kʼe̩ja Ohimini Elite, ma awewe tabale.
He buildeth his house as a moth,	Unyi-wñ kʼi ako̩ dab unyi agara,
And when Samuel had caused all the tribes of Israel to come near, the tribe of Benjamin was taken.	Abe̩le̩ Samiue̩l mʼo̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu Israe̩l chaka ko me̩ru, oñ ma mʼo̩lo̩pu Be̩njamin du.
Peace	Ure̩do̩ ki dʼugbo amo̩maye kpai ufe̩do̩ manyʼe̩do̩-ekono kwʼugbo O̩jo̩ Ata kpai Ondu Jisus Kraist.
For we cannot but speak the things which we have seen and heard.	todu e̩wñ kʼa li kpʼe̩wñ kʼa gbo̩ a neke we eka n.
Tell ye the daughter of Sion,	Me̩ ka ñw o̩ma Zayo̩n e-onobule̩ kakini,
Wherefore they called these days Purim after the name of Pur. Therefore for all the words of this letter, and	Todule̩ ma fʼodu o̩jo̩ meji le̩ do̩ ko̩ Purim, alu kʼodu pur de̩. Todule̩, tod o̩la ki dʼef o̩takada-i du, kpai e̩wñ du ku ma li ugbo e̩wñ-i, kpai e̩wñ ki wʼugbo ma le̩,
And the sons of Jeconiah; Assir, Salathiel his son,	Amo̩ma Je̩konaya e̩namu le̩ che Salatie̩l o̩ma-wñ,
And whether one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; or one member be honoured, all the members rejoice with it.	E̩wñ año̩laʼka chaka li uwa, e̩wñ ki ronyʼaño̩la le̩ du abʼo̩ li uwa; ma chaka dʼojima ñw e̩wñ año̩laʼka, e̩wñ año̩la le̩ du abʼo̩ yo̩.
In the twenty and sixth year of Asa king of Judah began Elah the son of Baasha to reign over Israel in Tirzah, two years.	O̩do̩ ogu nyoke me̩fa kʼEsa jʼonu Juda, Ela o̩ma Beasha, chane̩ ejʼonu Israe̩l Tirza. I la je̩ o̩do̩ meji.
And the Philistines came and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.	Oñ abo Filistia lewa tala jo̩ ef o̩go̩ Re̩feim
The	Jihofa abi o̩na o̩pata-wñ ugbo kʼe̩wñ-wñ jo̩ kʼi chʼefojale ñw e̩, kʼi adʼomiojale ane̩-we̩ wa iko-wñ, kʼi la ade̩nyo̩ ñw uko̩lo̩ o̩wo̩-we̩ du; uwe̩ la ame̩ e̩wñ ñw abo uche̩ichi ojoji wewe, e̩ muda ame̩ ugbo e-ma n.
For indeed he accepted the exhortation; but being more forward, of his own accord he went unto you.	Todabu kʼi mʼo̩ko̩-wa kʼa gba bʼo̩ le̩ gba ochochi, ama abu kʼowñ onugo chʼe̩do̩chacha i la ge̩do̩la-wñ dufu wʼugbo me̩ le̩.
And Ben-hadad sent unto him, and said, The gods do so unto me, and more also, if the dust of Samaria shall suffice for handfuls for all the people that follow me.	Taku Be̩n-hedad fʼuche̩ kpe̩rʼu, oñ i kakini, Iche̩wñ kʼebutu Samaria anana bo̩jo̩ kʼamone̩ ku ma jʼugbo-mi ki ne̩ e̩kʼo̩wo̩ʼka e̩kʼo̩wo̩ʼka, mak amo̩jo̩ ki fʼabe̩le̩ che mi kpʼe-ki tule ta!
In the same hour came forth fingers of a man's hand, and wrote over against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the king's palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.	Iko le̩ kpakpa o̩mo̩wo̩ o̩wo̩ one̩ dufu wa, oñ i chane̩ ekorubutu o̩la o̩do̩ unyi onu ku ma kwo̩ ame̩rʼakete; oñ onu li e̩bu o̩wo̩ ki ko̩.
Now therefore come, let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine own life, and the life of thy son Solomon.	Todule̩ nagbo̩ko̩bʼe̩ kʼe̩ lewa fa-i kʼu naka ñw e̩ e̩wñ kʼe̩ che kʼe̩ fʼoji o̩la-we̩ kpʼoji So̩lo̩mo̩n o̩ma-we̩ jadu.
When he made a decree for the rain,	e̩gba kʼi fʼo̩me̩ hi te̩ tod omi ojale,
And the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.	o̩gba e̩ke̩ta la che jesint kpai age̩t kpai ame̩tist;
and	I la che̩wñ kʼabo ane̩ le̩ kʼe̩wñ eku abe̩k e̩wñ e̩yo̩ wa o̩jo̩ uñmi ku ma ta, awa jʼagba la o̩wo̩-ma o̩jo̩ uñmi kpai o̩jo̩ du kiafo̩ n; kʼa la ñʼatʼo̩do̩ e̩kebie o̩do̩ e̩kebie no̩ kʼane̩ ki ñmi kpai ome̩ du e̩gba.
O give thanks unto the God of gods:	O me̩ gogbodo̩ O̩jo̩ e-amo̩jo̩,
Yet I supposed it necessary to send to you Epaphroditus, my brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your messenger, and he that ministered to my wants.	Eju-mi i la dukpe̩ kʼu kpe̩ E̩pafrodaitus, o̩maye-mi kʼi abʼumi chuko̩lo̩ kʼomi kpʼowñ la chʼisoja kʼi la chʼe̩nukpuche̩ e-me̩ kʼi chabune̩ mi ef eku e̩wñ ki ku mi, wʼugbo me̩-i ge̩;

And he shall pass through the sea with affliction, and shall smite the waves in the sea, and all the deeps of the river shall dry up: and the pride of Assyria shall be brought down, and the sceptre of Egypt shall depart away.	Tak i alale gu ef ohimini o̩pe̩cha du,
My soul	onugo-mi aneju Ondu
He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous:	I akʼibe o̩lafia jo̩ ñw abo ku ma che e̩wñ tʼeju-wñ;
For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of that one body, being many, are one body: so also	Todu dabalu kʼaño̩la chʼokate kʼi la nʼe̩wñ wewe ki ronyʼu, kʼe̩wñ año̩la wewe le̩ la mud año̩la okate, abe̩le̩ Kraisti laño̩ de̩ ge̩.
And David commanded to gather together the strangers that	Taku Defid ñwa ñwu ma ku ma kʼamilowa du oj ane̩ Israe̩l wa; oñ i kʼamano̩do̩ jo̩ adʼokuta ku ma ane̩ kʼunyi O̩jo̩.
Moreover I will endeavour that ye may be able after my decease to have these things always in remembrance.	U lañʼachʼe̩do̩-chacha ku me̩ nʼe̩wñ udubigba-mi ki aje̩ ñwu me̩ rewa e̩wñ-i e̩gba du.
Then Job answered and said,	Taku Job dohi, kakini;
There brake he the arrows of the bow,	O̩mo̩ i fʼo̩fa ki ada ñaña guche̩ rinyo̩,
They shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the wall, they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the windows like a thief.	Ma muro̩ bʼewo le̩ ma,
	Alu kʼomi agbe̩ bʼe̩dagu omi te̩,
And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith the	Ma ñʼadʼokuta okate kwʼugbo we̩ ku ma adʼu chʼoji alo n,
And when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a	Tak abu ku ma le wʼugbo o̩wo̩ amone̩ le̩, e̩ne̩ʼka te̩ wʼugbo-wñ akʼokuku nyʼane̩ ñw u kakini,
The men of Beth-azmaveth, forty and two.	Aboke̩le̩ Be̩tazmafe̩t chʼo̩gbo̩ meji nyoke meji.
The	Jihofa kwane̩ dago ki ja,
But he, willing to justify himself, said unto Jesus, And who is my neighbour?	Ama abu kʼi dʼowñ e̩do̩ kʼi dale ñw o̩la-wñ, i ka ñwu Jisus kakini, E̩ne̩ ño̩ chʼekeji-mi ke?
The height of the one cherub	O̩gba che̩rub oka chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩gwa, abe̩le̩ che̩rub ekeji de̩ ge̩.
of whom is Hymenæus and Alexander; whom I have delivered unto Satan, that they may learn not to blaspheme.	Haime̩nio̩s kpai Ale̩ksanda jʼef abo le̩; oñ u mʼuma ko ñwu Setan, todu ki kʼuma o̩la ku ma we echakpabie̩.
and when they were gone aside, they talked between themselves, saying, This man doeth nothing worthy of death or of bonds.	Oñ abu ku ma le tʼo̩wo̩ʼka ma ko̩la ñw o̩la-ma kakini, One̩ kide̩ che e̩wñ du ki bʼuku kpʼagba jo̩ n.
For a fire is kindled in mine anger,	Todu una che̩kote̩ ef uwe̩do̩-mi,
They are exalted for a little while, but are gone	Ma hi o̩la-ma ne pe̩e̩, taku ma le ma;
He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law,	E̩ne̩ ki mʼeti du bʼuko̩-o̩la egbo̩ te̩,
She stretcheth out her hand to the poor;	I anʼo̩wo̩-wñ dala ñw ame̩no̩bata,
Then said Jesus again unto them,	Todule̩ i ño̩ dabi ka ñwu ma kakini, Omi alo, me̩ ñʼafeju mi, me̩ la aku ef adure-me̩; ugbo kʼomi anyi, ame̩ neke wa n.
I have seen thine adulteries, and thy neighings, the lewdness of thy whoredom,	U fʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩-we̩ li me̩,
but the seventh day	o̩jo̩ e̩kebie-wñ muda chʼo̩jo̩ uñmi ñwu Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩; e̩ ki chʼuko̩lo̩ du o̩jo̩ le̩ n, tʼuwe̩, tʼo̩ma-we̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, tʼo̩ma-we̩ onobule̩, tʼadu-we̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, tʼadu-we̩ onobule̩, tʼame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩-we̩, tʼilowa kʼi dʼejefu alaku-we̩;
And the children of Israel did evil again in the sight of the	Tak amo̩ma Israe̩l ño̩ che e̩wñ ki bie̩ne̩ eju Jihofa ge̩; taku Jihofa mʼuma ko nyef o̩wo̩ abo Filistia o̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ meji.
Lay hands suddenly on no man, neither be partaker of other men's sins: keep thyself pure.	E̩ ki kʼo̩wo̩ nʼe̩ne̩ du achigili n e̩ ki la bʼabomune̩ tuta ef adure n. Fejutʼo̩la-we̩ kʼe̩ de̩ yaala.
Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram, who	Oñ Rehoboam onu, fʼAdoram, kʼi nʼo̩da abo ku ma chʼuko̩lo̩ e̩re̩ kpe̩ nyʼo̩mo̩; tak abo Israe̩l chaka kʼokuta ro dʼo̩, oñ ma fʼu kpa. Taku Reho̩boam onu hika tʼef o̩ko̩ ogu-wñ, kʼi ra nyi Je̩rusale̩m.
As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour	Alu ki de̩ e̩gba kʼO̩jo̩ gu So̩do̩m kpai Go̩mo̩ra kpʼewo ewo ki me̩ru lo̩, Jihofa ka-i, abe̩le̩ e̩ne̩ du agugu o̩mo̩ n, o̩ma one̩ du lañʼage̩ne̩ o̩mo̩ ge̩ n.
but I say unto you, That whosoever is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever shall say to his brother, Raca, shall be in danger of the council: but whosoever shall say, Thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.	Omi muda ka ñwu me̩ kakini, E̩ne̩ du kʼi chʼawe̩do̩ rʼo̩maye-wñ, fʼajo̩ fa bʼo̩la-wñ ma me̩; e̩ne̩ du kʼi la ka ñw o̩maye-wñ kakini, Uwe̩ e̩nidada, fʼo̩la abo̩hiala fa bʼo̩la-wñ ma le̩; oñ e̩ne̩ kʼi kakini, Uwe̩ e̩ne̩fule̩fu! i fʼuña ubie̩ e-una fa bʼo̩la-wñ ma me̩.
Draw me not away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity,	E̩ ki fa mi alo manyʼame̩ne̩bibi,
And Moses stripped Aaron of his garments, and put them upon Eleazar his son; and Aaron died there in the top of the mount: and Moses and Eleazar came down from the mount.	Taku Mose̩s mʼe̩wñ o̩la Aro̩n gwo̩ bʼo̩ o̩la te̩, oñ i mʼu ko nyi E̩leaza, o̩ma-wñ, o̩la; tak Aro̩n leku oj uwo o̩mo̩. Oñ Mose̩s kpai E̩leaza gwo̩ru kwʼoj uwo le̩ wane̩.
And Moses said, Let no man leave of it till the morning.	Taku Mose̩s ka ñwu ma kakini, E-e̩ne̩ du ki bo̩ nyʼodudu n.
Behold, he findeth occasions against me,	Go, i atene aida mi,
Have ye not seen a vain vision, and have ye not spoken a lying divination, whereas ye say, The	I chʼane̩ ego e-ibe̩te̩ oñ me̩ li le̩ n? I la chʼifa olemi oñ me̩ bo̩ le̩ n? owñ chʼabu ku me̩ kakini, “Jihofa kakini,” kʼomi ma la ka n.
For the love of Christ constraineth us; because we thus judge, that if one died for all, then were all dead:	Todu ufe̩do̩ Kraisti mʼuwa ne̩ gaga; a fʼoji-wñ kpa kakini, E̩ne̩ʼka leku tod o̩chaka amone̩, mak o̩chaka amone̩ ku le̩;
And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:	Oñ Shela dʼo̩do̩ ogue̩gwa tak i bi E̩be̩r;
But if we shall say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold John as a prophet.	I la che̩wñ kʼa kakini, Ugbo one̩ i kwo, a arailo o̩wo̩ amone̩-i, todu Jo̩n dab akache̩ eju amone̩ du.
I made the nations to shake at the sound of his fall, when I cast him down to hell with them that descend into the pit: and all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, shall be comforted in the nether parts of the earth.	U je̩ ñw o̩la abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi ki ga noj ekuku ewane̩-wñ, e̩gba kʼu dʼowñ rikpolo nyʼef o̩jegu manyʼabo ku ma gwo̩ru nyʼef o̩lo̩ulu; tak e̩do̩ oli Ide̩n chaka, kpʼoli Le̩bano̩n e-o̩me̩me̩le̩ kpʼe-ki nyo̩ tule, e-du ki añmʼomiofo, nyi ugbo ki chʼo̩gane̩ ile̩ le̩.
And it came to pass, when they were gone over, that Elijah said unto Elisha, Ask what I shall do for thee, before I be taken away from thee. And Elisha said, I pray thee, let a double portion of thy spirit be upon me.	Oñ i lewatu, abu ku ma mudaba, E̩laija ka ñw E̩laisha kakini, E̩ bi mi e̩wñ kʼu nache ñw e̩ o̩gba taku ma mʼumi du bʼe̩ te̩. Tak E̩laisha kakini, Nagbo̩ko̩bʼe̩, kʼe̩ je̩ ñw ukpe̩ afu e-we̩ meji ki bʼumi o̩la ma.
And the Egyptians shall know that I	Tak abo Ijipti ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩, e̩gba kʼu fʼo̩wo̩-mi nadala nʼIjipti, kʼu nako amo̩ma Israe̩l kwʼefu-ma dufu.
And he spake before his brethren and the army of Samaria, and said, What do these feeble Jews? will they fortify themselves? will they sacrifice? will they make an end in a day? will they revive the stones out of the heaps of the rubbish which are burned?	Tak i chane̩ ekʼo̩la eju amo̩maye-wñ kpai eju abogu Samaria kakini, AmaJu, ame̩gbo ki de̩, e̩wñ ma jʼache ta? A tʼuma no̩ abe̩-i? Ma ache iche̩bo̩? Ma ache kpa o̩jo̩ kate? Ma akʼokuta kwʼojeita ojeita dabiwa jʼe̩gu-wñ? Okuta ku ma gujo rinyo̩ le̩?
Cursed	Ama ki mu e̩ne̩ du kʼi rʼoji ajo̩ ilowa abe̩k e̩ne̩ kʼi ma nʼata n, abe̩k o̩yaukuo̩ko da. Tak amone̩ le̩ du akakini, Ami.
And Abraham said, Because I thought, Surely the fear of God	Tak Ebraham kakini, Todu omi do̩ ka kʼe̩gahi O̩jo̩ dʼemi n, ma la adu mi kpa todu o̩ya-mi.
And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.	Taku Mose̩s ko amone̩ le̩ kwef uru dufu ku ma ledʼO̩jo̩; oñ ma kwodago e̩re̩ uwo le̩.
When Israel went out of Egypt,	E̩gba kʼabo Israe̩l kwʼIjipti dufu,
And because he was of the same craft, he abode with them, and wrought: for by their occupation they were tentmakers.	oñ ukpe̩ kʼobe-wñ chʼoka kpʼe-ma, i gugu ugbo ma oñ ma chuko̩lo̩; todu ma chʼabo ku ma hi unyabo ta, obe-ma de̩.
So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men: and they fled before the men of Ai.	Abe̩le̩ uwewe aboke̩le̩ ku ma dab one̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩ta nyʼo̩mo̩; oñ ma ra rʼo̩gba aboke̩le̩ Ai.
upon the which when I had fastened mine eyes, I considered, and saw fourfooted beasts of the earth, and wild beasts, and creeping things, and fowls of the air.	Abu kʼu kejurʼu u chane̩ ekpibe, oñ u li kʼame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ ane̩ ile̩-i kpʼame̩la ef o̩ko̩ kpʼame̩wñ ki afa kpʼame̩we̩ ojale jʼoji-wñ.
and will go all of you armed over Jordan before the	kʼe̩ne̩ke̩le̩ du efu-me̩ kʼi nʼebije ogu adaba o̩gba Jihofa, gbogbo tak i fʼame̩nebi-wñ ne dufu bʼeju-wñ te̩,
And Jehu sent through all Israel: and all the worshippers of Baal came, so that there was not a man left that came not. And they came into the house of Baal; and the house of Baal was full from one end to another.	Jihiu la fʼone̩ kpe̩ tʼugbo du oj ane̩ Israe̩l; tak amadojikane̩ ñwu Beal chaka lewa, i la nʼe̩ne̩ kate ki bo̩ ubi kʼi ma wa n. Oñ ma lewʼef unyi Beal; ef unyi Beal le̩ la che̩ko̩ ñw one̩ kwʼejuʼka tʼeju ekeji.
In those days they shall say no more, The fathers have eaten a sour grape, and the children's teeth are set on edge.	Adiko le̩ ma ñʼaka kakini,
But I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh shall fall down; and they shall know that I	Omi la akʼo̩wo̩ onu Babilo̩n dago, oñ o̩wo̩ Fero awane̩; tak ama ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩, owñ chʼe̩gba kʼu mʼo̩kwo̩chageli-mi du tunyʼonu Babilo̩n o̩wo̩, owñ la afʼu nadala abʼane̩ Ijipti oji ma.
And when the disciples saw	Oñ abu kʼamako̩che̩-wñ li ma yaye kakini, Abile kʼoli o̩gbaikolo gbe̩ e̩re̩re̩-i?
Thou coveredst it with the deep as	Uwe̩ mʼunefu le̩ ko bʼo̩la-wñ ma dabe̩ne̩ kʼafe̩;
And ye know that with all my power I have served your father.	Ame̩ la chema kʼukpahiu-mi du oñ omi ne̩ chuko̩lo̩ ñw ata-me̩.
A prudent	E̩nugbeju fejudʼe̩wñ bie̩ne̩, i amaja;
Come near, ye nations, to hear; and hearken, ye people: let the earth hear, and all that is therein; the world, and all things that come forth of it.	Te̩wa, ame̩ abuche̩ichi uche̩ichi, ku me̩ gbo̩;
And when they were assembled with the elders, and had taken counsel, they gave large money unto the soldiers,	Tak abu ku ma wajo̩ manyʼabogijo, ku ma la fʼojuju nyi, ma kʼo̩ko̩ ñw amisoja le̩ e̩kute̩;
I will also save you from all your uncleannesses: and I will call for the corn, and will increase it, and lay no famine upon you.	U la agba me̩ bʼe̩wñ iwa-me̩ du te̩; tak u nado̩ e̩wñ e̩yo̩ omu wa, oñ naje̩ ñw u nʼawo; u ñʼadʼo̩kpo̩ta nʼume̩ oji ge̩ n.
Therefore hear ye the counsel of the	Todule̩ me̩ ki gbʼo̩la ki Jihofa alo, owñ chʼe-kʼi lo nyu Babilo̩n, kpʼibe kʼi ñwanyʼane̩ amaKaldia: ma afa ma kwʼo̩mo̩ tila, owñ chʼame̩wño̩re̩ egini: i la ache kʼodo-ma ki mud alache̩ bʼuma ma chuu.
who shall be punished with everlasting destruction from the presence of the Lord, and from the glory of his power;	Abole̩ achʼudu-wñ, owñ chʼekpabie̩ bʼeju Ondu kpʼebʼugbo ojima e-ugbiti-wñ te̩ ogbegbele̩,
And these things write we unto you, that your joy may be full.	O̩la-wñ a la ako̩ ru me̩-i todu kʼuyo̩-wa ki nyo̩ kpa.
What will ye? shall I come unto you with a rod, or in love, and	E̩wñ dʼume̩ e̩do̩? O̩kpa nane̩ wʼugbo me̩? abe̩k ufe̩do̩? kpai afu o̩chikimi?

And there stood before them seventy men of the ancients of the house of Israel, and in the midst of them stood Jaazaniah the son of Shaphan, with every man his censer in his hand; and a thick cloud of incense went up. that Sanballat and Geshem sent unto me, saying, Come, let us meet together in	taku Sanbalat kpai Ge̩she̩m kpʼuche̩ rʼumi kakini, Wa kʼa de ewo egbili Ono. Ibe la dʼef uma ku ma che mi e̩bie̩ne̩.

Now when Pharaoh heard this thing, he sought to slay Moses. But Moses fled from the face of Pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of Midian: and he sat down by a well.	Oñ e̩gba ku Fero gbʼo̩, i che kʼi du Mose̩s kpa.
And whosoever toucheth one that is slain with a sword in the open fields, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be unclean seven days. and take double money in your hand; and the money that was brought again in the mouth of your sacks, carry	Me̩ mʼo̩ko̩ alu o̩me̩-wñ meji ko nyʼo̩wo̩-me̩ alo; o̩ko̩ ki dabi wʼef alu akpulu-me̩ le̩, me̩ muko nyʼo̩wo̩-me̩ alo ge̩; ikani i chʼibe legudu le̩.

For the law maketh men high priests which have infirmity; but the word of the oath, which was since the law,	Todu o̩lo̩da akʼamone̩ ku ma nʼe̩gbo o̩la chʼamagboji amatama; ama o̩la ego̩ kʼi go̩ le̩ kʼi ro̩ne o̩lo̩da, e-wñ chʼO̩ma ki mufu kpoji ogbegbele̩.

And he made the pillars, and two rows round about upon the one network, to cover the chapiters that	Abe̩le̩ i fʼebije ki dago waala le̩ che; oñ i fʼo̩gba po̩me̩grane̩t meji chenyʼoj iga kʼi bʼoji ukata kʼi nʼoji ebije ki dago waala le̩ ma; abe̩le̩ i ño̩ che todu ukata ekeji ge̩.
Therefore I take pleasure in infirmities, in reproaches, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses for Christ's sake: for when I am weak, then am I strong. And after him arose Jair, a Gileadite, and judged Israel twenty and two years.	Ubi-wñ Jair, e̩ne̩ Gilead le̩, kwane̩ owñ le̩ kajo̩ abo Israe̩l o̩do̩ ogu nyoke meji.
The people answered him, We have heard out of the law that Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man? And many of the people believed on him, and said, When Christ cometh, will he do more miracles than these which this	Ama amone̩ wewe ef o̩wo̩-amone̩ le̩ la ke̩do̩nʼo. Ma kakini, Kraisti lewa, i ache ujiwe wewe tʼe-kʼe̩ne̩-i che le?

Now when the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying, Certainly this was a righteous man.	Oñ abu kʼagboji amisoja ogume̩lu le̩ li e̩wñ ki wache, i dʼojima ñw O̩jo̩ kakini, E̩ne̩ kide̩ chʼe̩no̩kpakpa ogbolo.
And it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that God prepared a vehement east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of Jonah, that he fainted, and wished in himself to die, and said,	Oñ i lewatu e̩gba kʼolu kwane̩ O̩jo̩ la fʼafu o̩wo̩ olodudu ki agu e̩wñ jo ñwo̩che te̩, tak olu nada bi Jona oji ma oñ o̩la-wñ muda; tak i kwogbo̩ko̩ kʼowñ onugo ki ku, oñ i kakini, Eku nyo̩ ñwu mi tʼedeju le.
Whosoever hateth his brother is a murderer: and ye know that no murderer hath eternal life abiding in him.	E̩ne̩ du ki chʼachulaka o̩maye-wñ chʼakpone̩, me̩ la chema ka kʼiñmi ogbegbele̩ gugu ef akpone̩ du n.
And likewise did he for all his strange wives, which burnt incense and sacrificed unto their gods.	Abe̩le̩ i ño̩ che tod amo̩ya-wñ ononojo le̩ chaka, oñ ma fʼotulale gujo, ma ño̩ fʼiche̩bo̩ che ñw amo̩jo̩-ma.
Return, we beseech thee, O God of hosts: Look down from heaven,	Murida ge̩, egbo̩ko̩ a gbo̩ko̩bʼuwe̩, O O̩jo̩ kʼi nʼe̩wñ du le̩!
Then the king arose, and tare his garments, and lay on the earth; and all his servants stood by with their clothes rent.	Tak onu kwane̩, oñ i fʼe̩wñ o̩la-wñ fana, i la kwodachi ane̩pe̩te̩; oñ abuko̩lo̩-wñ chaka dago kpenyʼu, ukpo-ma la chʼe̩fana.

And they shall hang upon him all the glory of his father's house, the offspring and the issue, all vessels of small quantity, from the vessels of cups, even to all the vessels of flagons. And now, behold, I have brought the firstfruits of the land, which thou, O	E̩ la go, fai u mʼe̩jo̩ga e̩ro e̩wñ kʼane̩ ko dufu ko wa-i, owñ chʼe-kʼuwe̩, O Jihofa ko ñwu mi. Tak uwe̩ ki mʼu du gugu o̩gba Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩, kʼe̩ la dojikane̩ o̩gba Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩;

When once the master of the house is risen up, and hath shut to the door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door, saying, Lord, Lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto you, I know you not whence ye are:	E̩gba kʼe̩ne̩fe̩nyi kwane̩ kʼi la fʼo̩na re, kʼame̩ chane̩ edago jʼo̩do̩da, ku me̩ do̩wo̩kʼo̩na, kakini, Ondu, mʼu bi ñw a; tak i adohi ñwu me̩ kakini, U ma me̩ ugbo ku me̩ kwowa-i n;
And ye shall smite every fenced city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all wells of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones. In that day will I make the governors of Judah like an hearth of fire among the wood, and like a torch of fire in a sheaf; and they shall devour all the people round about, on the right hand and on the left: and Jerusalem shall be inhabited again in her own place,	Iko le̩ naje̩ ñw amidachi Juda dab una ef anade alumeji iji, ma la adab e̩mu ki ado̩go̩ ki kado uti o̩ka; ma la afʼamone̩ du ku ma donyʼuma daka le̩ lie̩, tʼab o̩wo̩ awo̩to̩, tʼabo o̩wo̩ awohi; oñ abo Je̩rusale̩m la ñʼagugu e̩gu e-ma pio̩o̩, owñ che Je̩rusale̩m.

And it came to pass, when Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who was yet in Egypt, heard	Tak e̩gba ki Je̩ro̩boam, o̩ma Nebat, gbʼo̩ (todu owñ dʼIjipti ta, owñ chʼugbo kʼi ra nyi bʼeju So̩lo̩mo̩n te̩ le̩, Je̩ro̩boam la gugu Ijipti.

ought ye not to know that the	I dukpe̩ kʼame̩ ma ka ku Jihofa, O̩jo̩ Israe̩l, mʼo̩da ojane̩ Israe̩l du ñwu Defid ogbegbele̩ n? I chʼalo e-omu owñ kpe̩ kpʼowñ kpʼamo̩ma-wñ n?
Likewise reckon ye also yourselves to be dead indeed unto sin, but alive unto God through Jesus Christ our Lord.	Abe̩le̩ ame̩ ki nafʼo̩la-me̩ lo rʼef abo ki ku ñw adure, ku me̩ la adeju ñw O̩jo̩ efu Kraisti Jisus.
But he said, Nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also the wheat with them.	Ama i kakini, O̩da, tode̩gba ku me̩ gu e̩kwe̩ du jo̩ ku me̩ fʼo̩ka gudu manyʼu.
saying, What shall we do to these men? for that indeed a notable miracle hath been done by them	kakini, E̩wñ a ache abo-i taa? todu Amone̩ ma ka kʼujiwe wache lʼef uma le̩, i la kwotejugede ñw abo du ku ma dodo Je̩rusale̩m; a la neke re̩ n.
Now	e̩gbaʼka i dʼej o̩na, e̩gbaʼka i dʼoju-kpologu,
Then cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.	Todule̩ ma dabi kpogu kakini, I chʼe̩ne̩ kide̩ n, chai Barabas. Barabas le̩ la chʼadinya.
	Tak e̩ nako̩ rʼonuche̩ ujeju abudo̩ Ondu Leo̩de̩sia, kakini, Ami, E̩nibenu kʼi achubi one̩ kpʼe-ogbolo le̩, kʼi chʼuchane̩ e̩wñ du kʼO̩jo̩ nyi, aka e̩wñ-i, kakini.
and his breath, as an overflowing stream, shall reach to the midst of the neck, to sift the nations with the sieve of vanity: and	afu ki akwef iñmo̩-wñ dab aji ki awobi
for they loved the praise of men more than the praise of God.	todu ma fe̩do̩ ojima e-one̩ tʼojima e-O̩jo̩ le.
ye also, as lively stones, are built up a spiritual house, an holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God by Jesus Christ.	Ama ño̩ jʼako me̩ ne unyi e-Afu dabe̩ne̩ kʼame̩ chʼokuta ki deju, ku me̩ chʼuche̩ amatama kiafo̩, kʼame̩ ki kʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ Afu e-ki nyo̩ O̩jo̩ eju kʼi gba lefu Jisus Kraisti wa.
If thou seekest her as silver,	iche̩wñ kʼe̩ la tene owñ alu ku ma tene ajifa
if my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.	kʼamone̩-mi ku ma dʼodu-mi mʼuma ahiʼo̩la-ma wane̩, ku ma chadua, ku ma la tene eju-mi, ku ma mu rida bʼo̩na o̩na bibi-ma te̩, e̩gba le̩ omi adʼefojale agbo̩, oñ natʼadure-ma no̩, tak u nafʼo̩ga ane̩-ma chekpa.
and in the vine	ikeli achiwebe̩te̩ma le chenʼe̩to̩ me̩ta; oñ i dabe̩ne̩ kʼi abu, ebu-wñ mutu dufu; ugbo kʼi mujo̩ mujo̩ le i mʼe̩ro achiwebe̩te̩ma ki kpa ko dufu.
Wherefore, holy brethren, partakers of the heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our profession, Christ Jesus;	Todule̩, amo̩maye kiafo̩, kʼame̩ mananyʼudo̩ e-efojale, me̩ nadibetʼe̩nukpuche̩ kpʼagboji amatama e-ugbalu kʼa gbalu-wñ le̩, owñ che Jisus;
Now shall the isles tremble in the day of thy fall; yea, the isles that	Fai tak ala ala aga o̩jo̩ kʼe̩ wane̩;
It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.	Todu erʼuma e̩do̩ i rʼuma e̩do̩, ame̩no̩me̩-ma ma la che. Todu iche̩wñ kʼabo uche̩ichi tuta kpai ama ef e̩wñ e-afu, mak ama le̩ la nʼuma o̩me̩ ku ma chʼabune̩-ma ef e̩wñ o̩re̩la.
And I will cause them to eat the flesh of their sons and the flesh of their daughters, and they shall eat every one the flesh of his friend in the siege and straitness, wherewith their enemies, and they that seek their lives, shall straiten them.	U la aie̩ ñwu ma je̩ o̩re̩la amo̩ma-ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpʼonobule̩, oñ e̩ne̩ du aje̩ o̩re̩la onuku-wñ iko ku ma akpala nyʼu le̩ kpai ef o̩bata kʼame̩nebi-ma kpʼabo ku ma tene oji ma ache ma le̩.
And if he that sanctified it will redeem his house, then he shall add the fifth	I la che̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ kʼi che kʼunyi-wñ kʼi fo̩ le̩ neku e̩gba tane̩, mak i adʼukpe̩lu omune̩ manyʼalo̩ko̩-wñ kʼe̩ lo le̩, tak i amud e-wñ.
And ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen years, be loosed from this bond on the sabbath day?	Oñ i ma dukpe̩ ku ma mʼiku onobule̩ kʼi chʼo̩ma Ebraham ku Setan fʼu ji te̩ o̩do̩ me̩gwe̩jo̩-i tu o̩jo̩ uñmi n?
The humble shall see	Ame̩ne̩do̩chikimi fʼu li me̩, e̩do̩-ma la bo̩;
He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool	E̩ne̩ ki akpʼake̩do̩nʼo̩la-wñ uche̩
Manasseh	O̩do̩ Manasa chʼe̩gweji e̩gba kʼi chane̩ ejʼonu-wñ; i la je̩ Je̩rusale̩m o̩do̩ ooje nyoke me̩lu. Odu iye-wñ la ko̩ He̩fziba.
How long,	Gbogbo wʼe̩gba, O Jihofa, uwe̩ adʼo̩la-we̩ maja o̩pioo? Uke̩do̩fulu-we̩ ajo̩ dab una?
And that servant, which knew his lord's will, and prepared not	Adu ki la ma e̩wñ ki dʼodu-wñ e̩do̩, kʼi ma la mo̩la tane̩ n, i la che alu ki dʼowñ e̩do̩ n, ma aja o̩me̩me̩le̩;
Then said	Tak i kakini. E̩ ki dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Lo-ammi ; todu ame̩ chʼabo-mi n, u la adʼubi-me̩ n.
And when they came nigh to Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth forth two of his disciples,	E̩gba ku ma me̩ru Je̩rusale̩m kpai Be̩tfage kpai Be̩tani awa, ugbo uwo O̩lif, i fʼamako̩che̩-wñ meji kpe̩,
The	Jihoia ache kʼe̩wñ e-mi ki mufu kpa;
And the shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flock to escape.	Amadidala anʼugbo ku ma ara nyi n,
Then he brought me back the way of the gate of the outward sanctuary which looketh toward the east; and it	Tak i dʼumi dabi wa lʼo̩na alaku o̩do̩da e-uña kiafo̩, owñ chʼe-ki kpejurʼo̩wo̩ olodudu le̩; i la che̩re.
A divine sentence	O̩la ki kwef uko onu dab ifa ebo̩;
And the	Jihofa la mʼuñmi du ñwu ma ugbo du, alu du kʼi go̩ ñw amata-ma le̩; e̩ne̩ du ef ame̩nebi-ma chaka dago o̩gba-ma n; todu Jihofa mʼame̩ne̩bi-ma chaka ko nyʼuma o̩wo̩.
and by him all that believe are justified from all things, from which ye could not be justified by the law of Moses.	ef e̩ne̩-i ma fʼale da ñw e̩ne̩ du ki ake̩do̩no ugbo e̩wñ du ku me̩ ma neke jale ef o̩lo̩da Mose̩s n.
So Solomon built the house, and finished it.	Abe̩le̩ So̩lo̩mo̩n fʼunyi le̩ ko, oñ i fʼu kpoji.
Whereupon neither the first	Tod e-kide̩ dagba i chʼe-ejodudu le̩ ma du wane̩ etito̩ lubi e̩bie̩ n.
Every bed, whereon he lieth that hath the issue, is unclean: and every thing, whereon he sitteth, shall be unclean.	Ate̩ du kʼe̩ne̩ kʼi agbʼe̩ño̩ hiaala le̩ dachi oji-wñ mudaji; e̩wñ du kʼi la gugu oji-wñ adaji ge̩.
Then said Saul unto the people that	Taku So̩l ka ñw amone̩ ku ma jʼugbo-wñ kakini, Me̩ fʼabo-wa kaluka ku me̩ li e̩ne̩ kʼi kwʼef uwa. Oñ e̩gba ku ma fʼuma kaluka go, Jo̩natan kpai e̩ne̩ kʼi anʼane̩ ogu-wñ do̩mo̩ n.
Thus will I make thy lewdness to cease from thee, and thy whoredom	Abe̩le̩ oñ naje̩ ñw e̩wñtuñ-we̩ kpʼo̩ko̩ eje̩-we̩ kʼe̩ ko kwʼane̩ Ijipti wa le̩ ki muda bʼe̩ o̩la te̩, kʼuwe̩ ki ño̩ chʼeju-we̩ ago ma ge̩ n, e̩ lañʼarewa Ijipti ge̩ n.
All the cities of the children of Aaron, the priests,	Ewo ewo amo̩ma Aro̩n owñ chʼamatama o̩chaka-wñ chʼewo me̩gwe̩ta manyʼane̩ ije̩ ki lʼo daka.
For thou	Todu uwe̩ chʼukibeno-mi, O Ondu Jihofa,
And the	taku Jihofa anyi akpa kpʼoduduna o̩ro̩ka, kpʼuna ki ajo gaa odu, kʼi bʼoji uña ugugu kpʼujeju ujeju oj uwo Zayo̩n du ma; todu kʼi chʼe̩wñ ubʼojima-wñ du ma ate̩.
Then the word of the	Oñ abu ku Hananaya, akache̩ le̩, fʼoli uno̩lo̩ guche̩ bʼo̩lo̩ Je̩re̩maya te̩ kpo̩kpe̩ pe̩e̩, o̩la Jihofa wʼugbo Je̩re̩maya, kakini,
his legs of iron, his feet part of iron and part of clay.	akwʼuta-wñ meji wʼagbe̩re̩ ane̩-wñ ma chʼebije, e̩rane̩-wñ chʼebije kpai ike̩te̩ kpe̩gwa nyʼomune̩.
And first I will recompense their iniquity and their sin double; because they have defiled my land, they have filled mine inheritance with the carcases of their detestable and abominable things.	Ejodudu nadʼakoji ñw ma tod udu ku ma fe̩ kpʼadure-ma onu meji, todabu ku ma nʼoku e̩wñ e̩de̩te̩-ma fʼane̩-mi daji, ma la je̩ ñw e̩wñ ogu-mi ki che̩ko̩ ñw e̩wñ ihie̩ne̩-ma.
Moreover I make a decree what ye shall do to the elders of these Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king's goods,	Noji e-le̩ ge̩, nadʼo̩da te̩ ugbo e̩wñ ku me̩ ache ñw abogijo amaju le̩ tod uko̩lo̩ unyi O̩jo̩ le̩ eko̩, kakini, Me̩ hika chi kwef e̩wñ ane̩ onu, owñ chʼe̩wñ are̩ ku ma rʼo̩ udaba ohimini le̩, ku me̩ ko ñw aboke̩le̩-i alu ku ma kpʼo̩ko̩ bie̩ kade, kʼe̩wñ du ki da ma hi n.
then your south quarter shall be from the wilderness of Zin along by the coast of Edom, and your south border shall be the outmost coast of the salt sea eastward:	alo̩me̩ ane̩-me̩ o̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩-wñ la akwo aje̩tachi Zin ale akolo Ido̩m, oñ alo̩me̩-me̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩ akwo oj Ohimini Omu ate̩tʼolodudu alo;
And the disciples of John shewed him of all these things.	Amako̩che̩ Jo̩n la mʼe̩wñ-i du duka ñw u.
Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.	Ame̩ onugo chʼe̩nibenu-mi kʼu kakini, I chʼomi che Kraisti n, chai kakini, Ekpe̩ ma kpe̩ mi uche̩ tʼo̩gba e̩ne̩ le̩.
I will never forget thy precepts:	Nagbenyo̩ o̩la kʼe̩ ka ñw one̩ kʼi de le̩ ogbegbele̩ n;
and from the age of fifty years they shall cease waiting upon the service	one̩ fʼo̩do̩ ooje da i ki tʼogu uko̩lo̩ le̩ e̩ja no̩, i ki ñʼache ge̩ n,
And Ahaz slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.	Tak Ehaz cholu manyʼamata-wñ, oñ ma mʼu du ji manyʼamata-wñ ef ewo Defid; taku He̩ze̩kaya o̩ma-wñ jʼonu koji-wñ.
In those days	Iko le̩ onu du dʼIsrae̩li n. Oñ iko le̩ abo o̩lo̩pu Dan tene ane̩ e̩wñ ogu-ma ku ma dodo jʼo̩mo̩; todu gbogbo wʼo̩jo̩ kʼa ka-i e̩wñ ogu-ma tʼuma o̩wo̩ ef abo o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu Israe̩li ta n.
(The	Jihofa, O̩jo̩ e-amata-me̩, kʼi ño̩ je̩ ñwu me̩ wewe tʼalu ku me̩ de̩ le icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ta, kʼi la de̩nyo̩ ñwu me̩, alu kʼi katane̩ ñwu me̩ le̩!
When thou goest, it shall lead thee;	Egba kʼe̩ tale i añʼe̩ ona;
Speak, Thus saith the	E̩ ki ka kakini, Abu ki Jihofa ka de̩ kakini:
And the spoilers came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies: one company turned unto the way	Tak amakpunyifo̩ kwef uru abo Filistia wa uche̩ me̩ta; Uche̩ʼka rida tʼo̩na alenyi Ofra, tʼane̩ Shual;
who is gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of God; angels and authorities and powers being made subject unto him.	Owñ ki dʼo̩wo̩ awo̩to̩ O̩jo̩ abu kʼi le tʼefojale le̩; amonuche̩ kpʼabo̩da kpʼabukpahiu che̩kamuhite̩ ñw u.
Exalt the	Hi Jihofa O̩jo̩-wa ne,
And when the men of the city arose early in the morning, behold, the altar of Baal was cast down, and the grove was cut down that	Tak e̩gba kʼabo ewo le̩ kwane̩ odudu odudu, me̩ go, ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ e-Beal le̩ mugulo̩ wane̩, Ashe̩ra ki jʼo̩la-wñ chelo̩ jʼane̩, oñ o̩ko̩ okuno̩ ekeji jʼoji ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ku ma ne o̩mo̩ alu kʼu ma du che lef una.
But thou, O son of man, behold, they shall put bands upon thee, and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:	I la chʼuwe̩, O o̩ma one̩, go, ma akʼiku ku ma ba kpo̩chi nyʼuwe̩ o̩la, oñ ma anʼe̩ ji uwe̩, todu kʼe̩ we edufu nyʼef amone̩ le̩.
And the Lord turned, and looked upon Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how he had said unto him, Before the cock crow, thou shalt deny me thrice.	Tak Ondu murida, oñ i go Pita. Taku Pita libekadʼo̩la e-Ondu le̩, abu i kʼi ka ñw u kakini, E̩ raire̩ mi onu me̩ta tak aiko̩ ki ko̩ eñini-i.
Let me be weighed in an even balance,	je̩ ñw ma fʼumi ñwago oj e̩bo̩ o̩kpakpa,
He openeth also their ear to discipline,	I ñʼabi eti-ma rʼo̩la eko̩che̩,
And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl	Taku Jihofa kakini, E̩ne̩ agbʼEhab ibe? kʼowñ ki nyi Ramo̩t-gilead kʼi wane̩ o̩mo̩? Tak e̩ne̩ʼka kʼe-wñ, e̩ne̩ omune̩ la kʼe-wñ.
There is one lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy: who art thou that judgest another?	Adʼo̩lo̩da wa kpʼakajo̩ chʼe̩ne̩kate, Owñ chʼe̩ne̩ ki nʼukpahiu kʼi ajadu, kʼi laño̩ nʼukpahiu kʼi ako nyʼef ulenyo̩ le̩. E̩ne̩ uwe̩ che, kʼe̩ kpʼekeji-we̩ abi ta?
But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceable, gentle,	E̩wñ ki dʼo̩gba ef ibe ki akwʼate̩ wa muda chʼede̩ yaala, tak i chʼe-ure̩do̩, i ache e̩wñ yo̩o̩; i chʼebo̩la, i che̩ko̩ ñw ejumomi one̩ eli kpʼe̩ro ki nyo̩; i añwa tʼemi tʼemi n, i nʼako̩ru n.
	Me̩ ki nʼibe ka kʼu wa kʼu fʼaba o̩lo̩da kpʼo̩la amakache̩ la n; u lewa kʼu la n, chai todu kʼu che kʼi jo̩ kpa.
For the day of the	Todu o̩jo̩ e-Jihofa me̩ me̩ kʼi abʼabo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi du ma.
and the sockets of the court round about, and the sockets of the court gate, and all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins of the court round about.	kpai o̩ka o̩ka ki la jʼe̩re̩ ologbo le̩ daka, kpai o̩ka o̩ka alu o̩na ologbo le̩ kpai ale uña ugugu le̩ chaka kpai ale ologbo ki ledaka.
Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,	Ateai chʼe̩ke̩fa, Ilaie̩l chʼe̩kebie,
Two and twenty years old	O̩do̩ Ehazaya chʼogu nyoke meji e̩gba kʼi chane̩ ejʼonu; i la jʼonu Je̩rusale̩m o̩do̩ʼka. Odu iye-wñ la ko̩ Atalaya o̩ma O̩mri onu Israe̩l.
Wherefore	Todu kide̩ me̩ kwef alumeji-ma dufu wa,
I also will laugh at your calamity;	omi ñʼanyanyi o̩jo̩ uchobi e-me̩ ge̩;
And Moses spake so unto the children of Israel: but they hearkened not unto Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.	Taku Mose̩s ko̩la abe̩le̩ ñw amo̩ma Israe̩l; ma muda nyi Mose̩s eti n, noji ubie̩do̩, kpai uko̩lo̩ adu ki bie̩ne̩ ñwu ma le̩.
Afterward I came unto the house of Shemaiah the son of Delaiah the son of Mehetabeel, who	Tak u nyʼef unyi She̩maya, o̩ma Delaya, ki chʼo̩ma Me̩he̩tabe̩l, kʼi fʼo̩na re nyʼo̩la-wñ tef unyi, oñ i kakini, Awa ki jeju ef unyi O̩jo̩, ef unyi lile le̩, kʼa la fʼolugbo̩na unyi lile le̩ re; todu ma awa ku ma dʼe̩ kpa; ochochi, ma awa odu ku ma dʼe̩ kpa.
He that hath the Son hath life;	AnʼO̩ma le̩ fʼiñmi ogbegbele̩ ne̩ me̩, e̩ne̩ ki ma nʼO̩ma O̩jo̩ n nʼiñmi n.
Through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkling of blood, lest he that destroyed the firstborn should touch them.	E̩do̩ ekono chʼe̩wñ ki fʼElaloji le̩ che, kʼi la dʼe̩bie̩ fonyʼolugbo̩na le̩, tode̩gba kʼe̩ne̩ ki akpʼamomo̩gba le̩ akʼuma o̩wo̩.
And I know that his commandment is life everlasting: whatsoever I speak therefore, even as the Father said unto me, so I speak.	U la chema ka kʼuko̩-wñ kʼi te̩ ñwu mi le̩ chʼiñmi ogbegbele̩; todule̩ o̩la e̩wñ kʼomi aka le̩, e̩wñ kʼAta ka ñwu mi, abe̩le̩ naka.
Take heed to thyself, lest thou make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in the midst of thee:	E̩ nafʼo̩la-we̩ de, tode̩gba kʼe̩ kpʼalo kpai abo ku ma dodo ane̩ ugbo kʼe̩ lo, tode̩gba kʼi amud oku te̩ alumeji-we̩.
	Ujadu inaina i ako ñw onu-wñ,
and her husband heard	kʼo̩ko̩-wñ la gbo̩, kʼi ma la kʼabu du ñw u, kʼi ma la ko̩ n, e̩gbale̩ oji du kʼi da le̩ adago, oñ o̩la du kʼi ne̩ kpʼO̩jo̩ nʼonugo o̩la-wñ le̩ adago.
The land shall be utterly emptied, and utterly spoiled: for the	Ane̩-i ate̩ ofo hioko, i adʼalache̩ te̩ hiele;
but if ye refuse and rebel, ye shall be devoured with the sword: for the mouth of the	me̩ muda ko̩ ku me̩ la fʼe̩re̩ ubi ro̩,
And the Egyptians will I give over into the hand of a cruel lord; and a fierce king shall rule over them, saith the Lord, the	Oñ nakʼabo Ijipti nyʼodu o̩lachi o̩wo̩;
Then I went on to the gate of the fountain, and to the king's pool: but	Tak u legudu nyʼAlaku E̩bi omi kpʼugbo abukpe ku ma gwa tod onu; i muda nʼugbo kʼe̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ kʼu tanʼo̩ le̩ ale n.
He that	E̩ne̩ ki ma fʼo̩wo̩ mʼe̩do̩la-wñ ne̩ n
Wherefore also we pray always for you, that our God would count you worthy of	Tod e-le̩ a ño̩ chadua todu me̩ e̩gba du, todu kʼO̩jo̩-wa ki je̩ ñwu me̩ nyo̩ bʼudo̩ ku ma do̩ me̩ jo̩, kʼi laño̩ che e̩wñ e̩nyo̩ du ki rʼe̩ e̩do̩ kpa, kpʼuko̩lo̩ e̩do̩ ekono du ef ukpahiu;
And Araunah said, Wherefore is my lord the king come to his servant? And David said, To buy the threshingfloor of thee, to build an altar unto the	Tak Arauna kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼodu-mi onu wʼugbo adu-wñ-i? Taku Defid kakini, Kʼu fʼajita ugwo̩ka le̩ la ef o̩wo̩-we̩, kʼu fʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ ne ñwu Jihofa, todu e̩wñ ibi le̩ ki we, kʼi kwo bʼamone̩-i te̩.
And Jonathan said to the young man that bare his armour, Come, and let us go over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be that the	Taku Jo̩natan ka ñw okolobia ki anʼane̩ ogu-wñ kakini, Lewa kʼa daba nyʼugbo abide abo e̩pi odukulu-i; ikani Jihofa ache uko̩lo̩ ñw a; todu i nʼe̩wñ du ki adu Jihofa hi ejadu lʼo̩wo̩ amone̩ n, dagba ma wewe, dagba ma de̩ ke̩.
Therefore thus saith the	Todule̩ abu ki Jihofa aka de̩ kakini:

And when the devil was cast out, the dumb spake: and the multitudes marvelled, saying, It was never so seen in Israel.	Tak abu kʼi fʼebili le̩ ne dufu, ajialu le̩ kwoko̩la. Oñ o̩wo̩ amone̩ le̩ kwoyaye, ma kakini, E̩wñ abe̩i tejugede ane̩ Israe̩l mama ta n.
And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:	Oñ Se̩rug dʼo̩do̩ ogue̩gwa, tak i bi Neho̩r;
and Jehu the son of Nimshi shalt thou anoint	Tak uwe̩ abʼekpo tu Jihiu, o̩ma Nishi, oji kʼi jʼonu Israe̩l, kpai E̩laisha, o̩ma Shafat Ebe̩lmehola, uwe̩ abʼekpo tʼo̩ oji kʼi mud akache̩ koji we̩.
Now, brethren, if I come unto you speaking with tongues, what shall I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelation, or by knowledge, or by prophesying, or by doctrine?	Ama fai, amo̩maye-mi, iche̩wñ kʼu nʼichi ichi aka awʼugbo me̩, ile e̩wñ u du ñw me̩? chai e̩gba kʼu ko̩la ñw me̩ ef o̩la ebite̩, abe̩k ef e̩wñ ema, abe̩k ef ache̩ eka, abe̩k ef o̩la e̩wñ ekone̩?
But first must he suffer many things, and be rejected of this generation.	Ama ejodudu i ali uwa wewe tila, oñ abo̩gba kide̩ afʼowñ ñwago ku ma kʼo̩ dab ijo̩bu.
I have loved you, saith the	Omi te̩tafe̩do̩ me̩, Jihofa ka-i. Ame̩ muda kakini, Ugbo, oñ uwe̩ te̩tafe̩do̩ wa ke? Iso̩ chʼo̩maye Jeko̩bi n? Jihofa ka-i; u la fe̩do̩ Jeko̩b;

and Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:	Abu kʼi fu Jare̩d bi Mahalale̩l ño̩ deju o̩do̩ icham nyʼogue̩gwa, i laño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.

Then Jacob rose up, and set his sons and his wives upon camels;	Taku Jeko̩b kwane̩, oñ i mʼamo̩me̩ne̩ke̩le̩-wñ kpai amo̩ya-wñ ko gugu oji inyakulumi;
And he gathered up all the food of the seven years, which were in the land of Egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of the field, which	Oñ i fʼuje̩wñ o̩do̩ mebie le̩ e-du ki jʼoj ane̩ Ijipti yajo̩, i la mʼuje̩wñ le̩ ko maja ewo ewo; owñ chʼuje̩wñ oko ki lʼewo ewo daka, e-le̩ i ko jo̩ ewo ewo le̩.
And in his estate shall stand up a vile person, to whom they shall not give the honour of the kingdom: but he shall come in peaceably, and obtain the kingdom by flatteries. And when he was come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works that they had seen;	Oñ abu kʼi ame̩ru awa, ugbo agwo̩ru uwo O̩lif le̩, ugwe̩ko̩ amako̩che̩ le̩ chaka chane̩ e̩yo̩, ma nʼomu lile añwulo̩ O̩jo̩ todu uko̩lo̩ ukpahiu du ku ma li,

And the people said unto me, Wilt thou not tell us what these	Tak amone̩ le̩ ka ñwu mi kakini, E̩wñ kʼuwe̩ ache-i uwe̩ aka ñw a e̩wñ kʼi ache wa n?

then thy elders and thy judges shall come forth, and they shall measure unto the cities which	e̩gbale̩ abogijo-we̩ kpai amakajo̩-we̩ adufu wa, ma la añwa ujiji-wñ akwo ugbo kʼoku one̩ le̩ te̩ le̩ nyʼewo ewo ki lʼe̩ne̩ ku ma kpa le̩ daka;
But whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth	Ama e̩ne̩ ki hie̩do̩ wane̩ chii ago ef o̩lo̩da ki mufu kʼi ño̩ chʼe-o̩mone̩ le̩, kʼi la gugu ef uwñ waa, kʼi ma mud agbo̩ kʼi agbenyo̩ n, chai ache uko̩lo̩-wñ, owñ le̩ agbede ef e̩wñ kʼi ache.
The God of my mercy shall prevent me:	O̩jo̩ anʼufe̩de̩nyo̩-wñ ledo mi;
Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Me̩ ki che tʼeju alu kʼoji ajo̩ ku ma du te̩ de̩, kpai e̩wñ o̩kpakpa, ku me̩ gba e̩ne̩ kʼoji ji bʼef o̩wo̩ e̩ne̩ ki atʼo̩ mane̩ te̩. Me̩ ki chʼilowa kpʼabo ku ma ma nʼata n kpʼo̩yaukuo̩ko̩ du uji kpʼo̩lachi n. Me̩ ki la dʼe̩bie̩ ki ma fʼudu n dafo ugbo-i n.
For a nation is come up upon my land, strong, and without number, whose teeth	Todu abo uche̩ichiʼka lewa oj ane̩-mi me̩,

Now it came to pass in the days of Ahasuerus, (this	Oñ i lewatʼo̩kpanachi Ahasurus, (Ahasurus kide̩ chʼe-kʼo̩da onu-wñ te̩ kwo India gbogbo wʼltiopia, i nʼo̩da ojane̩ ojane̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩fa nyoke mebie),

So the children went in and possessed the land, and thou subduedst before them the inhabitants of the land, the Canaanites, and gavest them into their hands, with their kings, and the people of the land, that they might do with them as they would. and said unto them,	tak i ka ñwu ma kakini, E̩ne̩ du ki agba imo̩to̩ kekele-i ef odu-mi, omi i gba le̩, oñ e̩ne̩ du kʼi agba mi, e̩ne̩ kʼi kpe̩ mi wa i agba le̩; todu e̩ne̩ ki nya efu me̩ chaka, e̩ne̩ le̩ gbe̩gbe̩.
That which was torn	E-kʼame̩la fana, omi la du wʼugbo we̩ n; omi oñ ofu-wñ bu; ef o̩wo̩-mi oñ e̩ gba, dagba ma muji o̩ro̩ka, dagba ma muji odu.
And thou shalt stone him with stones, that he die; because he hath sought to thrust thee away from the	Uwe̩ ki la kʼokuta ro̩ dʼo kʼi ku, todabu kʼi tene efʼuwe̩ fa ubi bi Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ kʼi dʼe̩ kwʼane̩ Ijipti wa, kwef unyi adu le̩ te̩.
And the	Oñ Jihofa ka ñwu Jihiu kakini, Ukpe̩ kʼuwe̩ fʼe̩wñ o̩me̩me̩le̩ che ugbo e̩wñ ki nyo̩ eju-mi kʼe̩ che le̩, kʼe̩ fʼe̩wñ du che abo unyi Ehab teju alu ki dʼumi e̩do̩, amo̩ma-we̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ gbogbo tʼo̩gba o̩gba e̩ke̩le̩ agugu oj ede Israe̩l.
If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me;	iche̩wñ kʼu dʼe̩bie̩ne̩ ro̩me̩ ñw e̩ne̩ kʼe̩do̩-wñ chʼoka kpʼomi
Let now our rulers of all the congregation stand, and let all them which have taken strange wives in our cities come at appointed times, and with them the elders of every city, and the judges thereof, until the fierce wrath of our God for this matter be turned from us.	Me̩ ki chi amagboji wa koji abo ujeju-i chaka, tak abo du ku ma nʼabobule̩ ononojo chʼo̩ya ef ewo ewo-wa-i, ku ma nawa iko iko ku ma date̩; abogijo ewo ewo du kpai amaka-jo̩ ki nawa kpai ama, gbogbo tak uwe̩do̩ O̩jo̩-wa inaina-i ki rida bʼuwa oji te̩, gbogbo taku ma fʼo̩la o̩ya i che kpa chaka.
But	I muda che̩nyo̩ ñw mi kʼu te̩me̩ru O̩jo̩;

Thou shalt fall upon the mountains of Israel, thou, and all thy bands, and the people that	Uwe̩ awane̩ oj uwo uwo Israe̩l, uwe̩, kpʼo̩wo̩ o̩wo̩ amone̩-we̩ chaka, kpai amone̩ amone̩ ku ma jʼugbo we̩. Nadʼe̩ ñw ame̩we̩ uche̩ uche̩ du ku ma chʼe̩ño̩ e̩la, kpʼame̩wñ iñmi egbili ku ma mʼe̩ du je̩.
For if we would judge ourselves, we should not be judged.	I la chʼe-kʼa ma fʼo̩la-wa ñwa ru ojoji i ma nʼajo̩ ñw a n.
For I could wish that myself were accursed from Christ for my brethren, my kinsmen according to the flesh:	Todu i ma nyo̩ mi eju ku ma mʼumi onugo du te̩ ñw O̩jo̩ kwo bi Kraisti te̩ tod amo̩maye-mi, owñ chʼamefu-mi lo̩na o̩re̩la.

and the third	Tak o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩ta ma nʼo̩wo̩-ma onugo kʼane̩ o̩la o̩ko̩ rinyo̩.

How shall we do for wives for them that remain, seeing we have sworn by the	Ab a achʼo̩la o̩ya tod abo-ma ki bo̩bo̩ le̩? Abu kʼa fu Jihofa go̩ ka kʼa akʼamo̩ma-wa ñwu ma ku ma nʼe̩ chʼo̩ya n?
But the rest of the dead lived not again until the thousand years were finished. This	Udajikwane̩ e-ejodudu le̩ de̩. Abo uku ki bo̩ la adeju n gbogbo tak o̩do̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko le̩ jo̩.
searching what, or what manner of time the Spirit of Christ which was in them did signify, when it testified beforehand the sufferings of Christ, and the glory that should follow. And all the people came up after him, and the people piped with pipes, and rejoiced with great joy, so that the earth rent with the sound of them.	Tak amone̩ du darʼo̩ ubi te̩gu wa, oñ amone̩ le̩ fʼo̩kpana fa, ma la nʼuyo̩ lile ayo̩. Oñ ane̩ chane̩ ekpana noj ekuku-ma.
So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.	Defid la deku o̩ma-wñ o̩jo̩ du. Abe̩le̩ Absalom ra, oñ i le tu Ge̩shur, i la dʼo̩do̩ me̩ta o̩mo̩.
Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:	Me̩ neti: me̩ go, agbe̩yo̩ ledufu kʼi gbʼe̩yo̩.

and Jokim, and the men of Chozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had the dominion in Moab, and Jashubi-lehem. And	kpai Jokim kpai aboke̩le̩ Koziba kpai Joash kpai Seraf, kʼi nʼo̩da Moab, kpai Jashubaile̩-he̩m. O̩la-i chʼe-igbelegbele
And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that	Abe̩le̩ O̩jo̩ dʼibe kpai oji o̩la ema ñwu So̩lo̩mo̩n nana tabale, kpai e̩do̩ ki de̩ gbagada, i dabe̩ne̩ kʼe̩lanyi eti ohimini.
From above hath he sent fire into my bones,	I dʼuna kpuche̩ kwʼatate̩ wa tʼef achiku-mi,

and said to his servant, Go up now, look toward the sea. And he went up, and looked, and said,	Tak i ka ñw e̩nuko̩lo̩-wñ kakini, Mute̩gu alo kʼe̩ go o̩wo̩ ohimini abadi. Tak i mute̩gu i la go, oñ i kakini, E̩wñ du do̩mo̩ n. Tak i kakini, E̩ ño̩ le onu mebie ta.

In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abel-beth-maachah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali, and carried them captive to Assyria. And Jacob lived in the land of Egypt seventeen years: so the whole age of Jacob was an hundred forty and seven years.	Jeko̩b la dʼo̩do̩ me̩gwebie ane̩ Ijipti; abe̩le̩ o̩jo̩ Jeko̩b, owñ chʼo̩do̩ kʼi da tak i ku, chʼo̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ mebie nyoke mebie.

Then he said unto me, Lo, I have given thee cow's dung for man's dung, and thou shalt prepare thy bread therewith.	Tak i ka ñwu mi kakini, Go, omi mʼechu okuno̩ ko ñw e̩ koji echu one̩ me̩, e-le̩ oñ uwe̩ ane̩ hi uje̩wñ-we̩.
This book of the law shall not depart out of thy mouth; but thou shalt meditate therein day and night, that thou mayest observe to do according to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thy way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success.	O̩la o̩takada uko̩-o̩la-i akwo bʼuwe̩ alu te̩ n, ama e̩ nayaye-wñ tʼo̩ro̩ka tʼodu, todu kʼuwe̩ ki dejute̩ kʼe̩ che teju alu du ku ma kʼo̩rubutu efu-wñ; todu e̩gbale̩ e̩wñ-we̩ kʼe̩ che anawo ñw e̩, e̩gbale̩ tak i ara ñw e̩.

And if ye will not be reformed by me by these things, but will walk contrary unto me;	Me̩ ma ko̩che̩ ugbo e̩wñ kʼu nache me̩ le̩ n, ku me̩ muda alule̩ tʼaboji ñwu mi ta,

Of the sons of Uzziel; Micah the first, and Jesiah the second.	Amo̩ma Uzie̩l e-e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ che Maika chʼe̩nejodudu, Ishaya la chʼekeji.
Then the prophets, Haggai the prophet, and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied unto the Jews that	Iko le̩ amakache̩, owñ che Hagai ki chʼakache̩, kpai Ze̩karaya, o̩ma Ido, ama le̩ kache̩ ñw amaju ku ma jo̩ Juda kpai Je̩rusale̩m; ma ka lugbo odu O̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l ki bʼuma ma le̩.
Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength:	Lugbo ukpahiu-we̩ e̩ fʼohimini abadi kpe̩ru ojoji;
And the people shall be	Amone̩ amone̩ la adabe̩ne̩ kʼokuta sime̩ti ku ma ro̩, dabe̩ne̩ kʼikeke ku ma lo̩ wane̩,
And I say also unto thee, That thou art Peter, and upon this rock I will build my church; and the gates of hell shall not prevail against it.	Omi laño̩ aka ñw e̩ ge̩ kakini, Uwe̩ che Pita, oñ oj apata le̩ u la ako̩ ujeju abo-mi kʼu do̩; e̩wñ uro̩na alaku o̩jegu ñʼagbiti bʼowñ jo̩ n.
And he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured	Tak i mʼumi du wʼagbaru unyi le̩, i la fʼoli ugbogaga agbaru ñwa oko-ke, o̩wo̩ʼka-wñ chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩lu, o̩wo̩ ekeji-wñ la chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩lu: unabe̩ alaku le̩ ejemi-wñ chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩ta, ejano̩mo̩-wñ la chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩ta.
Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the Father that dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.	E̩ ke̩do̩no ka kʼomi dʼef Ata, kʼAta la dʼef umi n? O̩la alu-mi e-kʼomi aka ñwu me̩-i, i chʼibe efu-mi oñ naka-i n; Ata kʼi muda gugu efu mi achʼuko̩lo̩ e-wñ le̩.
And his inward affection is more abundant toward you, whilst he remembereth the obedience of you all, how with fear and trembling ye received him.	E̩do̩-wñ la chefe̩rʼume̩ ololo tule, abu kʼibe-wñ kad alu kʼo̩chaka-me̩ gbo̩la gbo̩ ku me̩ la mʼowñ gba kpʼailo era kpʼo̩la e̩ga.
For such an high priest became us,	Todu agboji amatama e̩go̩ e-le̩ chʼeju-wñ ñw a, owñ chʼe̩ne̩ ki fe̩, ali e̩bie̩ne̩ dʼef uwñ n, i de̩ jali, i che̩date̩ bʼame̩nadure te̩, oñ i mud e̩ne̩ ki dʼatate̩ tʼefojale efojale le;
Also in the third year of his reign he sent to his princes,	Tak o̩do̩ e̩ke̩ta kʼi jʼonu i fʼamagboji-wñ Be̩nhe̩il kpʼObadaya kpai Ze̩karaya kpai Netane̩l kpai Maikaya kpuche̩ nyʼako̩ amone̩ e̩wñ ewo ewo Juda;
Who can utter the mighty acts of the	E̩ne̩ akeka e̩wñ ukpahiu ki Jihofa ache?
He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good: and if he shall at all change beast for beast, then it and the exchange thereof shall be holy.	I arida n, i la adʼomune̩ kpailo̩ n, i adʼu kpailo̩ kʼe̩nyo̩ ki koji e̩bie̩ne̩ abe̩k e̩bie̩ne̩ ki koji e̩nyo̩ n; i la che̩wñ kʼi du e̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ kpailo̩ e̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ maku tʼe-ejodudu, tʼe-kʼi du kpailo̩, ejeji-ma afo̩.
then they shall confess their sin which they have done: and he shall recompense his trespass with the principal thereof, and add unto it the fifth	mak i agbalu e̩wñ adure kʼi che le̩; oñ i adʼe̩wñ akoji udu ki fe̩ ki chʼeju-wñ yiili wa, oñ i ñʼadʼukpe̩lu-wñ mʼo̩, tak i ako ñw e̩ne̩ kʼi fʼudu-wñ.
and came down to Capernaum, a city of Galilee, and taught them on the sabbath days.	Tak i gwo̩ru wa Kapanahum ewo Galiliʼka, oñ i do̩mo̩ ako̩ ma e̩wñ o̩jo̩ uñmi;
And he sent messengers throughout all Manasseh; who also was gathered after him: and he sent messengers unto Asher, and unto Zebulun, and unto Naphtali; and they came up to meet them.	Tak i fʼamonuche̩ kpe̩ lʼugbo du ojane̩ Manama; abo le̩ laño̩ kʼo̩la-ma jeju rʼo̩ ubi ge̩; tak i fʼamonuche̩ kpe̩ nyʼugbo Ashe̩r kpai ugbo Ze̩biulo̩n kpai ugbo Naftali; oñ abo le̩ mute̩gu ledo ma.
For every one that useth milk	todu e̩ne̩ du ki añmo̩ omi-e̩nya mud ugbodu ugbo o̩la o̩kpakpa; todu ome̩-kpa i che.
Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard:	Go, omi akwa kakini, Elelelele-o! E̩ne̩ du la agbo̩ n;
Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth;	tode̩gba kʼefu abo̩wo̩ ejaduña ako̩ ñw e̩wñ anana e-we̩,
And Jesus came and spake unto them, saying,	Taku Jisus lewa ko̩la ñwu ma kakini, Ma mʼo̩da du efojale kpai oj ane̩-ile̩-i du ñwu mi me̩.
And when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave	Tak i mʼakala me̩lu kpai e̩ja meji le̩ ko, abu kʼi cheju go ojale, i fʼadua che nyʼu, oñ i mʼakala le̩ bu jo̩, tak i mʼu ko ñw amako̩che̩-wñ ku ma kʼo jo̩ ñwu ma, e̩ja meji le̩ i kpe̩ ñwu ma chaka.

And at the evening sacrifice I arose up from my heaviness; and having rent my garment and my mantle, I fell upon my knees, and spread out my hands unto the	Tak iko e̩gba ku ma kʼe̩wñ ele ane̩ wa u kwane̩ kpʼe̩do̩ e̩kpabie̩-mi, e̩wñ o̩la-mi kpai otogbo-mi che̩fana ta; tak u mʼokuku-mi konyʼane̩, oñ u fʼo̩wo̩-mi nadala jo̩ ñwu Jihofa, O̩jo̩-mi;
And when the days of his mourning were past, Joseph spake unto the house of Pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes, speak, I pray you, in the ears of Pharaoh, saying,	Tak e̩gba kʼo̩jo̩ eku ede̩-wñ jo̩, Jose̩f ko̩la ñw abo unyi Fero kakini, Iche̩wñ ku me̩ li mi eju, narodubʼume̩ ku me̩ ko̩la nyu Fero eti, kakini,
When Jesus came into the coasts of Cæsarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying,	Oñ abu ku Jisus lewa oj ane̩ Se̩saria e-Filipai, i nʼamako̩che̩-wñ ene kakini, E̩ne̩ oñ amone̩ aka kʼO̩ma One̩ che ta?
And the king said unto Joab, Behold now, I have done this thing: go therefore, bring the young man Absalom again.	Tak onu ka ñwu Joab kakini, Go ta, u fʼe̩wñ-i che me̩; todule̩ e̩ nalo, kʼe̩ dʼAbsalom okolobia le̩ wa.
also from the house of Gilgal, and out of the fields of Geba and Azmaveth: for the singers had builded them villages round about Jerusalem.	ma ño̩ kwo Be̩tgilgal wa, kpai kwo oko oko Geba kpai Azmafe̩t; todu amakeli le̩ fʼiga iga-ma bu le Je̩rusale̩m daka.
I fast twice in the week, I give tithes of all that I possess.	Najalu onu meji tak o̩jo̩ mebie ñwa; e̩wñ du kʼu ne̩ nakpe̩ rʼe̩gwa kʼu dʼukpe̩ʼka chele.
If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stacks of corn, or the standing corn, or the field, be consumed	Iche̩wñ kʼuna kwotane̩ kʼi la fʼe̩tutu mu gbogbo tak i fʼo̩bo o̩ka abe̩k e-ki dago jo̩, abe̩k i fʼuche̩ onugo gujo rinyo̩; e̩ne̩ ki gwʼuna le̩ aro̩me̩ alu ki cheju-wñ chuu.

And Jesus being full of the Holy Ghost returned from Jordan, and was led by the Spirit into the wilderness,	Oñ Jisus, kʼi che̩ko̩ ñw Afu Kiafo̩, mudabi kwo Jordan wa, oñ Afu le̩ nʼowñ ale ef aje̩tachi
which was	e-Je̩si, e-Obe̩d, e-Boas, e-Salmon, e-Neason,
And he passed through mount Ephraim, and passed through the land of Shalisha, but they found	Tak i lale gu ef ane̩ uwo Ifraim kpai ane̩ Shalisha du. Ma muda li ma n; oñ ma lale gu ef ane̩ Shaalim du, ma la jʼo̩mo̩ n. Tak i lale gu ef ane̩ abo Be̩njamin du ma muda li ma n.

and he said,	tak i kakini, O Jihofa, O̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l, O̩jo̩ du ki dab uwe̩ efojale ate̩ kpai ile̩ o̩gane̩-i do̩mo̩ n; uwe̩ kʼe̩ de alo kʼe̩ kpe̩ kpʼufe̩de̩nyo̩ ugbo amadu-we̩ ku ma lule̩ o̩gba-we̩ kpai e̩do̩-ma chaka,

Then Hezekiah commanded to prepare chambers in the house of the	Taku He̩ze̩kaya ñwa ñwu ma ku ma ñwʼe̩ko̩da unyi ef unyi Jihofa che̩; oñ ma fʼu ñwo̩che;
Then fled Moses at this saying, and was a stranger in the land of Madian, where he begat two sons.	Ef o̩la kide̩ oñ Mose̩s ra, tak i mud ilowa ane̩ Midian. O̩mo̩ i bi amo̩me̩ne̩ke̩le̩ meji.
Now there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.	Amoko wewe la dʼujo̩ akolo uwo o̩mo̩ ajije̩.
I say then, Hath God cast away his people? God forbid. For I also am an Israelite, of the seed of Abraham,	Todule̩ u kakini, O̩jo̩ kʼamone̩-wñ rinyo̩? O̩jo̩ ki kpo̩na! Todu abo Israe̩l omi che, ugbe̩ Ebraham, abo o̩lo̩pu Be̩njamin u che.
Then the Jews took up stones again to stone him.	AmaJu ño̩ dabi mʼokuta konyʼo̩wo̩ todu ku ma ro̩dʼo.

(for they shall hear of thy great name, and of thy strong hand, and of thy stretched out arm;) when he shall come and pray toward this house;	todu ama agbo̩ uwohi odu-we̩ inaina, kpai e̩wñ o̩wo̩-we̩ ki gbiti, kpai o̩wo̩-we̩ kʼe̩ nadala te̩; e̩gba kʼe̩ne̩ abe̩le̩ lewa kʼi chʼadua rʼo̩wo̩ unyi-i,

the same shall drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out without mixture into the cup of his indignation; and he shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels, and in the presence of the Lamb:	e̩ne̩ le̩ ñʼañmo̩ kwef o̩te̩ wain e-e̩do̩fulu e-O̩jo̩, e-ki chʼe̩gwe̩gwa ef ago uwe̩do̩-wñ ku ma ma chʼomi gwʼo̩ n; oñ ma aje̩ ñw u li uwa ef una kpʼitolu eju amonuche̩ kiafo̩ kpʼeju O̩mala le̩.

And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in Egypt: and thou shalt observe and do these statutes.	Uwe̩ ki la dibekado ka kʼuwe̩ chʼadu Ijipti; uwe̩ ki la fejutʼo̩ kʼe̩ che tʼeju e̩wñ uhio̩me̩-i.

Whatsoever is sold in the shambles,	E̩wñ du ku ma ta ef aja, me̩ je̩, me̩ ki gwili-wñ n tod akone̩ o̩la ki dʼef ume̩.
The slothful hideth his hand in	E̩nejudo̩o̩ adʼo̩wo̩ tunyʼugba;
But of the children of Israel did Solomon make no servants for his work; but they	So̩lo̩mo̩n muda kʼamo̩ma Israe̩l du chʼamadu todu uko̩lo̩-wñ n; ama la chʼabogu kpʼabo ki dʼoji dufu ef amagboji-wñ kpʼamagboji o̩kogu-wñ kpʼamananya-wñ.
But on the morrow all the congregation of the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron, saying, Ye have killed the people of the	Ama o̩jo̩ñwa-wñ abo o̩gbadu abo Israe̩l chaka kwokeñmini nyu Mose̩s kpai Aro̩n o̩la, ma kakini, Ame̩ fʼamone̩ Jihofa kpa kpa me̩.

And it came to pass that night, that the word of the	Oñ i lewatu odu o̩jo̩ le̩ gbage̩de̩, kʼo̩la Jihofa lewʼugbo Netan kakini,
That they may shoot in secret at the perfect:	kʼama ki maja ata do e̩ne̩ ki mufu,
The heathen are sunk down in the pit	Ura kʼabo uche̩ichi gwamʼumako mi me̩;
And it came to pass, that, while they communed	Oñ i leatu, ef oluka ku ma che, kpʼene ku ma nʼomune̩, Jisus, onugo, la te̩meru ma, oñ i le kpʼama.
For a great door and effectual is opened unto me, and	todu alo̩na lile ugbo kʼuko̩lo̩ anoji ef uwñ mubi ñw mi, abo ku ma la kpona nyʼu lachawewe.
They answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.	Ma dohi ka ñw u kakini, Ef adure ma bi we̩ ogbolo, uwe̩ ñʼako̩ wa e̩wñ? Taku ma mʼowñ du rikpolo tʼo̩do̩da.
And he sent Judah before him unto Joseph, to direct his face unto Goshen; and they came into the land of Goshen.	Tak i fu Juda kpe̩ tʼo̩gba-wñ nyʼugbo Jose̩f, kʼi jiwe o̩na Goshe̩n ñwu ma; oñ ma lewa ane̩ Goshe̩n.
and Me-jarkon, and Rakkon, with the border before Japho.	kpai Me̩-jarko̩n kpai Ra-kon; alo̩me̩-wñ la te̩ kado Jo̩pa.
