And Saul eyed David from that day and forward.	Oñ eju So̩l nabi Defid le akwo o̩jo̩ le̩ gbogbo tʼejo̩gba-wñ.
Forasmuch as	I nʼe̩ne̩ du ki dab uwe̩ n, O Jihofa;
Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,	E̩ nare ma wa ku ma fʼo̩la-ma kamuhite̩ ñw amagboji kpʼabo̩da, ku ma gbo̩lagbo̩, kʼo̩la-ma ki che̩mu tane̩ tod uko̩lo̩ ki nyo̩ du,
Then the princes, the governors, and captains, the judges, the treasurers, the counsellors, the sheriffs, and all the rulers of the provinces, were gathered together unto the dedication of the image that Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up; and they stood before the image that Nebuchadnezzar had set up.	Tak amakomu onu kpʼamakoji onu kpʼamigo̩bina kpʼamedibo kpʼamadigede kpʼabo̩hiala kpʼamamoli o̩lo̩da kpʼabo ku ma nʼo̩da ojane̩ ojane̩ du jeju wʼugbo ku ma adʼojibo ki Ne̩biukadne̩za onu le̩ du dago nyane̩. And he returned to the man of God, he and all his company, and came, and stood before him: and he said, Behold, now I know that	Tak i mudabi tʼugbo e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ le̩, owñ kpai abo-wñ chaka, oñ i lewa dago o̩gba-wñ; tak i kakini, E̩ go ta, u chema ka kʼO̩jo̩ du dʼile̩-i n chai oj ane̩ Israe̩l. these	Odu amo̩ma Iso̩ e-e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ jo̩-i: Elaifaz o̩ma Ada kʼi chʼo̩ya Iso̩, Rue̩l o̩ma Basemat kʼi chʼo̩ya Iso̩.

And whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole. and the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third part of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.	Odu awo le̩ la ko̩ O̩ge̩le̩; oñ ukpe̩ e̩ke̩ta omi le̩ mud o̩ge̩le̩, amone̩ wewe la leku noj omi le̩, todabu ki alukoko.

For rulers are not a terror to good works, but to the evil. Then Jael Heber's wife took a nail of the tent, and took an hammer in her hand, and went softly unto him, and smote the nail into his temples, and fastened it into the ground: for he was fast asleep and weary. So he died. She	Owñ le̩ chʼoli e-iñmi ñw abo ku ma gwo̩nyʼu;

But let him ask in faith, nothing wavering. For he that wavereth is like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.	I ki muda bi ef e̩do̩ eko̩no̩, i ki ñwa tʼemi tʼemi n. Todu e̩ne̩ ki do̩mo̩ añwa tʼemi tʼemi dab akpoli ohimini kʼafu adʼu, kʼi la arʼo̩ tʼemi tʼemi.

And when I beheld, lo, the sinews and the flesh came up upon them, and the skin covered them above: but	Tak u go, oñ go, ili la manyʼu, oñ o̩re̩la mute̩gu wa, año̩ la bʼuma ma; afu du muda dʼef uma n.
And the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat your fill, and dwell therein in safety.	Ane̩ le̩ la arʼo̩je̩ ñwu me̩, oñ me̩ aje̩ kefu, ku me̩ la dodo o̩mo̩ to̩ko̩o̩.
But when Jesus perceived their thoughts, he answering said unto them,	Ama abu ku Jisus li iñwa ku ma je̩ le̩, i dohi ñwu ma kakini, E̩wñ chi ku me̩ jiñwa ef e̩do̩-me̩?
There is	Ugbo ki awʼe̩ nʼenye̩do̩ ge̩ n,
But he denied, saying, I know not, neither understand I what thou sayest. And he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.	I muda raire̩ kakini, U mʼe̩wñ kʼe̩ ka-i n, u la mʼofe-wñ n; tak i dufu nyʼo̩be̩ya; oñ aiko ko̩.

Howbeit then, when ye knew not God, ye did service unto them which by nature are no gods.	Ama e̩gbale̩, abu ku me̩ ma ma O̩jo̩ n, ame̩ chʼadu ñw abo kʼitaligba-ma ma chʼamo̩jo̩ n:
And thus shalt thou do unto them, to cleanse them: Sprinkle water of purifying upon them, and let them shave all their flesh, and let them wash their clothes, and	Alu kʼuwe̩ la ache ma kʼe̩ fʼuma o̩la gwo rinyo̩ le̩ de̩: E̩ ki tʼomi ku ma duwa tod adure le̩ rʼuma o̩la, kʼe̩ je̩ ñwu ma dʼabe̩ fʼedudu año̩la-ma la hioko, kʼe̩ la je̩ ñwu ma fʼe̩wñ o̩la-ma gwe̩, ku ma che kʼo̩la-ma ki fe̩.

And he changed his behaviour before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down upon his beard.	Oñ i mʼalu kʼi te̩tache rida ugbo-ma. I fʼakpaine che dabe̩ne̩ kʼi dʼef o̩wo̩-ma ahimu, i chane̩ ekina nyʼalugbana alaku nyaña nyaña. I la je̩ ñw ito̩-wñ bʼo̩ alu wa bʼilagba-wñ ma.
There shall be	Oj ojokunyi Moab chaka kpʼojukpologu-wñ, inaku eda dʼugbo du. Todu u fu Moab kpo̩fo̩ dab e̩wñ eku ki ma wʼe̩ne̩ du eju n, Jihofa aka-i.
And fifty men of the sons of the prophets went, and stood to view afar off: and they two stood by Jordan.	Tak aboke̩le̩ ooje, ef amo̩ma amakache̩, le tekejo̩ akpejuru ma o̩najiji; oñ ama meji dago eti Jo̩rdan.
Now about the midst of the feast Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.	E̩gba ku ma fʼujeju ucholo je̩ wʼukpeji, Jisus mute̩gu nyʼunyi O̩jo̩, oñ i nako̩ ma e̩wñ.
These	E̩wñ ku me̩ ache de̩, E̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-me̩ ki nakʼochochi kpʼeke-ji-wñ, kʼajo lʼo̩na ochochi kpai ure̩do̩ alaku-me̩,
When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said,	Todule̩ e̩gba ku Jisus mʼomi e̩ka le̩ gba, i kakini, I kpoji me̩; tak abu kʼi fʼoji-wñ dalo̩ i mʼafu-wñ du dufu.
and Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,	kpai Hado̩ram, kpai Uzal, kpai Dikla,
And he judged Israel twenty and three years, and died, and was buried in Shamir.	Owñ le̩ la kajo̩ abo Israe̩l o̩do̩ ogu nyoke me̩ta, tak i leku, oñ ma mʼu du ji Shamir.
I	Ilowa omi che ane̩-ile̩-i;
For behold this selfsame thing, that ye sorrowed after a godly sort, what carefulness it wrought in you, yea,	Todu me̩ go, e̩wñ kide̩ gbage̩de̩, owñ ebʼe̩do̩dudu ki chʼeju-wñ ñw e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ ku me̩ che le̩, alu ki chʼuko̩lo̩ e̩do̩chacha ef ume̩, ku me̩ kʼomu e-me̩, kʼi wo̩ me̩, ku me̩ railo, ku me̩ ñeju, ku me̩ go̩larʼe̩wñ e̩nyo̩, ku me̩ bʼudu ñw u! ef e̩wñ du me̩ dʼo̩la-me̩ dago ku me̩ de̩ yaala ugbo o̩la le̩.
Now therefore arise, go forth, and speak comfortably unto thy servants: for I swear by the	Todule̩ fai e̩ kwane̩ kʼe̩ nyʼo̩lo̩fe̩, kʼe̩ ko̩la anye̩do̩ ñw abo-we̩; todu nago̩ Jihofa, kakini, Uwe̩ ma dufu n, i nʼe̩ne̩ kate kʼi ad emi kpʼuwe̩ odu eñini-i n; e-le̩ la abie̩ne̩ ñw e̩ tʼe̩bie̩ne̩ du ki ke̩re̩bʼuwe̩ akwo o̩jo̩ okolobia-we̩ gbogbo wʼifai le.
It shall not seem hard unto thee, when thou sendest him away free from thee; for he hath been worth a double hired servant	I ki dabe̩ne̩ kʼofu abʼe̩ eju-we̩ e̩gba kʼe̩ tʼo̩ no̩ kʼi kwo bʼuwe̩ te̩ ofofo n; todu i nʼile ñw e̩ dab one̩ meji ku ma ro̩me̩ uko̩lo̩ ñwu ma gbogbo wʼo̩do̩ me̩fa le̩. Abe̩le̩ taku Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ ade̩nyo̩ ñw e̩ ef e̩wñ du kʼuwe̩ ache.
in that thou buildest thine eminent place in the head of every way, and makest thine high place in every street; and hast not been as an harlot, in that thou scornest hire;	owñ chʼe-kʼuwe̩ fʼujiwe o̩ko̩ eje̩-we̩ ko̩ dago ñwʼo̩la-we̩ ugwe̩ta o̩na du, kʼe̩ la fʼotete-we̩ che ki gbo̩gba te̩ o̩na o̩na du? Uwe̩ la te̩ta-dab ajo̩ko̩ n, owñ chʼe̩de̩te̩ o̩me̩ era ñw e̩ kʼe̩ che.
For from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every one	Todu akwʼe̩ne̩ ki nya efu ma gbogbo nyʼe̩ne̩lile ma,
But my God shall supply all your need according to his riches in glory by Christ Jesus.	O̩jo̩ e-mi la ache kʼe̩wñ kʼeku-wñ aku me̩ ki jo̩ kpa ñwu me̩ teju alu kʼanana-wñ de̩ ef ojima efu Kraist Jisus.
But now he is dead, wherefore should I fast? can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he shall not return to me.	Fai i la leku, tod e̩wñ najialu? U neke dʼu dabi wa ge̩? Omi anyʼugbo owñ, i muda adabi wʼugbo e-mi ge̩ n.
And Amnon was so vexed, that he fell sick for his sister Tamar; for she	E̩do̩ñwañwala kʼAmno̩n che tod o̩maye-wñ, Temar, je̩ ñw o̩ga fʼu mu; todu i ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ mama ta n; i la firʼAmno̩n alu kʼi ale kʼi ado̩wo̩kadʼo.
Where	Ugbo amo̩jo̩ Hemat kpai Arpad jo̩? Ugbo amo̩jo̩ abo Se̩farfe kpʼe-Hina kpʼe-Ifa jo̩? Ama gba Samaria bʼumi o̩wo̩ te̩ me̩?
And a certain centurion's servant, who was dear unto him, was sick, and ready to die.	Oñ agboji amisoja ogume̩luʼka nʼadu kʼi che̩nʼojima ugbo-wñ kʼi acho̩ga, i ache ki ku.
And they shall no more offer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.	Abe̩le̩ ma ñʼakpa e̩wñ e̩bie̩-ma ñw ikpakachi ge̩ n, owñ chʼe-ku ma ajo̩ko̩ bʼo̩ ej ubi le̩. Ei-ki chʼuhio̩me̩ ñwu ma nyʼo̩hio̩gu-ma ogbegbele̩.
And of the sons of Zattu; Elioenai, Eliashib, Mattaniah, and Jeremoth, and Zabad, and Aziza.	Oñ ef amo̩ma Zatu, E̩lioenai kpʼE̩liashib kpai Matanaya kpai Je̩re̩mo̩t kpai Zabad kpai Aziza ne̩.
Therefore Michal the daughter of Saul had no child unto the day of her death.	Oñ Maikal o̩ma So̩l le̩ nʼo̩ma du gbogbo mʼo̩jo̩ uku-wñ n.
So the king hearkened not unto the people: for the cause was of God, that the	Abe̩le̩ onu ko̩ enetirʼamone̩ le̩; todu O̩jo̩ che, todu ki Jihofa ki che teju o̩la-wʼñ kʼi ka lʼalu Ahija, e̩ne̩ Shailon le̩, ñwu Je̩ro̩boam o̩ma Nebat.
And the prince in the midst of them, when they go in, shall go in; and when they go forth, shall go forth.	Oñ e̩gba ku ma nyʼejefu, idachi le̩ atʼalumeji-ma gudu nyʼejefu, oñ e̩gba ku ma dufu, ma akpe̩re̩ dufu.
And in the same house remain, eating and drinking such things as they give: for the labourer is worthy of his hire. Go not from house to house.	Me̩ ki la gugu ef unyi le̩ gbage̩de̩, ku me̩ je̩ ku me̩ la ñmo̩ e̩wñ ku ma ne̩ ugbo ma; todu e̩nuko̩lo̩ nyo̩ bʼo̩me̩-wñ jo̩ ku ma ra ñw u. Me̩ ki ru tʼunyi unyi ale n.
Who	E̩ne̩ nʼuko̩la kʼe̩wñ ema ma dʼef uwñ-i n akʼo̩la kʼu lo maja taa?
even all the Jews returned out of all places whither they were driven, and came to the land of Judah, to Gedaliah, unto Mizpah, and gathered wine and summer fruits very much.	tak amaju chaka mudabi kwʼugbo du ku ma ne ma nyi le̩, oñ ma wa ane̩ Juda ugbo Ge̩dalaya, Mizpa. Oñ ma ko omi achiwebe̩te̩ma kpʼuje̩wñ o̩lo̩ji wa jo̩ nana nana.
So the people sent to Shiloh, that they might bring from thence the ark of the covenant of the	Abe̩le̩ abo le̩ fʼuche̩ kpe̩ nyi Shailo oñ ma dʼakpati alo Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du kwʼo̩mo̩ wa, owñ chʼe-ki gugu alumeji amiche̩rub le̩. Amo̩ma Ilai meji, Ho̩fni kpai Finehas, la jʼugbo akpati alo O̩jo̩ o̩mo̩.
And Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Go in unto thy father's concubines, which he hath left to keep the house; and all Israel shall hear that thou art abhorred of thy father: then shall the hands of all that	Tak Ahitofe̩l ka ñw Absalom kakini, E̩ nyʼejefu ugbo amabadu ata-we̩, owñ chʼabo kʼi to̩no̩ jʼubi ku ma dejutʼunyi-wñ; tak abo Israe̩l chaka agbo̩ kʼata-we̩ ahihie̩ne̩ we̩ me̩; tak o̩wo̩ abo du ku ma jʼugbo-we̩ agbiti.
And when there arose a great dissension, the chief captain, fearing lest Paul should have been pulled in pieces of them, commanded the soldiers to go down, and to take him by force from among them, and to bring	Oñ abu kʼi mud aro̩ lile jo̩ onu ogu kwodejiji tode̩gba ku ma fu Po̩l fana rinyo̩, i je̩ ñw amisoja mugwo̩ru nyʼo̩mo̩ ku ma mu Po̩l dinya kwʼalumeji ku ma mʼu du wʼef aku.
And in the synagogue there was a man, which had a spirit of an unclean devil, and cried out with a loud voice,	E̩ne̩ʼka la dʼef unyi ujeju le̩ kʼi nʼafu ebili ki ma de̩hiolo n; oñ i dʼomu dago akwa kakini,
For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes, in divers places.	Todu abo uche̩ichiʼka akwane̩ tʼabo ichi omune̩ o̩la, oñ ojane̩ʼka ako bʼojane̩ ekeji; ukpo̩ta la akpa, ane̩ ñʼamiejo ugbo ojoji ojoji.
Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way,	E̩ne̩ ki aje̩ ñw e̩ne̩ ki ache e̩wñ tʼeju-wñ la rʼo̩na e̩bie̩ne̩
He shall build me an house, and I will stablish his throne for ever.	Owñ le̩ chʼe̩ne̩ ki akʼunyi ñwu mi, oñ nafʼede e-wñ lonyane̩ tʼogbegbele̩.
For she	oñ i ka ñw adu le̩ kakini, E̩ne̩ tʼale oko kʼi aledo wa awa-i? Oñ adu le̩ kakini, Odu-mi le̩ de̩. Tak i mʼukpo-wñ du bʼoji-wñ ma wane̩.
To deliver their soul from death,	kʼi gba onugo-ma bʼuku te̩,
Wherefore didst thou flee away secretly, and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent thee away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?	E̩wñ chi kʼe̩ ra maja maja, kʼe̩ ji lʼolo kwugbo mi, kʼe̩ ma ka ñwu mi n? kʼomi ma je̩ ñw e̩ lo kpai anyi kpai eli kpai eicha kpai umo-lo n?
When Moses saw	Abu ku Mose̩s la liʼu, i yaye e̩wñ igo kʼi li. Oñ abu kʼi me̩rʼu kʼi agʼo, omuko̩la Ondu ka kakini,
and all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, which reigned in Heshbon, unto the border of the children of Ammon;	kpai ewo ewo Sihon onu abo Amo̩r chaka e-kʼi jʼo̩fe̩-wñ He̩shbo̩n, gbogbo wa alo̩me̩ ubo Amo̩n;
If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master's use,	Todule̩ iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ du fʼo̩la-wñ gwe̩ hiolo bʼe-ubiane̩ le̩ te̩ mak i achʼe̩wñ eku tod e̩wñ ojima, i afo̩, kʼi anʼeku ñw odu-wñ kʼi chʼeñwo̩che te̩ tod uko̩lo̩ e̩nyo̩ du.
And the men did so; and took two milch kine, and tied them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home:	Tak aboke̩le̩ le̩ fʼabe̩le̩ che, oñ ma mʼamokuno̩ meji kʼe̩nya-ma chenʼomi ko ronyʼo̩kane̩ adu le̩, oñ ma fʼamo̩ma-ma dahi jʼunyi.
And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them, and shall overcome them, and kill them.	Tak e̩gba du ku ma fʼibenu-ma gba kpoji e̩la ki ate̩gu kwef o̩lo̩ulu le̩ wa akʼogu bʼuma, i la afʼuma du, tak i akpa ma.
where the people of Israel were slain before the servants of David, and there was there a great slaughter that day of twenty thousand	Oñ abuko̩lo̩ Defid gwʼabo Israe̩l dajane̩, uku ki kpa ma o̩jo̩ le̩ tabale, one̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ogu ku.
He opened the rock, and the waters gushed out;	I mʼokuta bi, oñ omiofo muke̩che̩ dufu;
And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the	Ebe̩l ge̩, i ño̩ chi kwef amo̩mojo̩do̩ ame̩wño̩re̩-wñ egini wa, e-ki yoyo efu-ma. Jihofa la go Ebe̩l kpai e̩wñ ele kʼi kowa,
I think myself happy, king Agrippa, because I shall answer for myself this day before thee touching all the things whereof I am accused of the Jews:	U gbede eju o̩la-mi, Onu Agripa, abu kʼu nache kʼu kʼomu o̩la-mi o̩gba-we̩ eñini-i ugbo e̩wñ du kʼamaJu agwajo̩ nʼumi-i.
the children of Hagab, the children of Shalmai, the children of Hanan,	kpai amo̩ma Hagab kpai amo̩ma Shamlai kpai amo̩ma Hanan
and as soon as she saw them with her eyes, she doted upon them, and sent messengers unto them into Chaldea.	E̩gba kʼi fʼeju do ma ababa i tene ma, oñ i fʼamonuche̩ kpe̩rʼuma Kaldia.
Ye offer polluted bread upon mine altar; and ye say, Wherein have we polluted thee? In that ye say, The table of the	Ame̩ kʼuje̩wñ e̩daji wa che oj ubo̩ iche̩bo̩-mi. Oñ ame̩ kakini, Ugbo oñ a fʼuwe̩ daji? Owñ chʼe-kʼame̩ kakini, Itebulu Jihofa chʼe̩wñ ide̩te̩.
one young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:	o̩mokuno̩ o̩ko̩ʼka, okoloʼka, okolo o̩mo̩do̩ʼka kʼi chʼutodu iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo;
And the king said unto me, (the queen also sitting by him,) For how long shall thy journey be? and when wilt thou return? So it pleased the king to send me; and I set him a time.	Tak onu ka ñwu mi kakini (o̩ya-wñ la gugu kpenyʼu), O̩jo̩ onu e̩ je̩ ule̩-we̩? iko e̩gba oñ e̩ dabi wa? Abe̩le̩ i nyo̩ onu eju kʼi kpe̩ mi; tak u fʼiko-wñ ka ñw u.
Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake,	I chaka dʼabe̩le̩ i fʼuma jadu tod odu e-wñ,
Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents of gold;	Uwoji o̩jamalia ki wʼo̩wo̩ So̩lo̩mo̩n o̩do̩ʼkate che o̩jamalia tale̩nt ulo̩gwa nyʼo̩gbo̩ me̩ta nyoke me̩fa,
And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all	Ogu la dago agbagba Reho̩boam kpai Je̩ro̩boam o̩ko̩ko̩lo̩.
For Christ	Todu Kraist chʼukpoji o̩lo̩da tef o̩kpakpa ñw e̩ne̩ du ki ake̩do̩no.
And five of you shall chase an hundred, and an hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight: and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.	E̩ne̩-me̩ me̩lu ane̩ one̩ ogume̩lu ule, e̩ne̩-me̩ ogu me̩lu la ane̩ one̩-ma icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ugbo me̩gwa ule; alu ugbada la agwʼame̩nebi-me̩ da jʼane̩ o̩gba-me̩.
Say ye not, A confederacy, to all	I chʼo̩de̩de̩ e̩wñ kʼamone̩-i ka kʼalu ejo̩ nyu, kʼuwe̩ aka kʼalu ejo̩nyu n, e̩ ki railo e̩wñ kʼama arailo-wñ le̩ n, e̩ ki la gagogodo n.
And the king said, What honour and dignity hath been done to Mordecai for this? Then said the king's servants that ministered unto him, There is nothing done for him.	Tak onu kakmi. Ojima kpai ubumo̩ e̩wñ ma du ñwu Mo̩rde̩kai tod e̩wñ kʼi che-i taa? Tak abuko̩lo̩ onu ku ma che e̩wñ ñw u le̩ kakini, Ma che e̩wñ du ñw u n.
And it shall come to pass in the increase, that ye shall give the fifth	Oñ i awatu e̩gba ku me̩ ako e̩wñ oko wʼunyi, ame̩ ki kʼukpe̩ e̩ke̩lu ñwu Fero, oñ ukpe̩ me̩le̩ kibo̩ achʼe-me̩ o̩to̩to̩la-me̩, todu ulu oko kpai uje̩wñ-me̩, todu abo unyi-me̩ kpai uje̩wñ todu abo-me̩ egini.
Rejoice the soul of thy servant:	Che kʼonugo adu-we̩-i ki yo̩,
So we fasted and besought our God for this: and he was intreated of us.	Abe̩le̩ a kwojalu, oñ a gbo̩ko̩bʼO̩jo̩-wa todu e̩wñ-i; i la mʼomu-wa gbagbo̩.
Ye made also a ditch between the two walls for the water of the old pool: but ye have not looked unto the maker thereof, neither had respect unto him that fashioned it long ago.	Me̩ ño̩ fʼobuga gwa agbagba o̩do̩ meji le̩ tod e̩dagu omi igbele le̩. Me̩ muda go e̩ne̩ ki che e̩wñ-i n, me̩ la diba ñw e̩ne̩ ki fʼe̩wñ le̩ ñwa e̩i e̩do̩-wñ igbelegbele n.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini,
Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,	Amazaya o̩ma-wñ, Azaraya o̩ma-wñ, Jotam o̩ma-wñ,
The children of Solomon's servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Sophereth, the children of Peruda,	Amo̩ma amadu So̩lo̩mo̩n jo̩-i: amo̩ma Sotai kpai amo̩ma Hasofe̩re̩t kpai amo̩ma Pe̩ruda
And let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.	E̩wñ o̩me̩me̩le̩ e̩che̩ ki hia wa n: todu a ma bʼo̩wo̩ lo̩ n adiko-wñ lewa a ako wʼunyi.
And he laid	Tak i mʼo̩wo̩-wñ ko nʼo, tak e̩re̩re̩le̩ i to̩ru tʼo̩kpakpa, tak i dojima ñw O̩jo̩.
And there shall be upon every high mountain, and upon every high hill, rivers	Tak aji kpʼo̩cha omi ajʼoj uwo ki gbo̩gba du kpai oj otete ki nana, owñ chʼo̩jo̩ ku ma kpʼone̩ wewe le̩, e̩gba kʼo̩do̩go̩ o̩do̩go̩ awane̩.
Not that any man hath seen the Father, save he which is of God, he hath seen the Father.	I cheka kʼe̩ne̩ du li Ata n, chai e̩ne̩ ki kwʼugbo O̩jo̩; owñ le̩ fʼAta li.
to that above the door, even unto the inner house, and without, and by all the wall round about within and without, by measure.	gbogbo tʼate̩ ñw alo̩na, gbogbo wʼunyi ejefu kpʼej o̩do̩da-wñ, kpʼo̩la o̩do̩-wñ ki le daka chaka tʼejefu-wñ tʼejo̩do̩da-wñ, e̩ñwa e̩ñwa i che.
And the men answered her, Our life for your's, if ye utter not this our business. And it shall be, when the	Tak aboke̩le̩ le̩ ka ñw u kakini, Oji-wa ki koji e-me̩, iche̩wñ kʼame̩ ma du o̩la-wa-i ka dufu n; mak e̩gba ki Jihofa mʼane̩-i du ñw a a ache e̩nyo̩ kpai ochochi kpʼuwe̩.
I have heard the check of my reproach,	U gbo̩ eju ku ma daru mi, oñ i mud anyo̩ ñw mi,
And	E̩gba ku ma kwʼewo le̩ ku ma ma le jiji ta n, Jose̩f ka ñw adejutunyi-wñ kakini, Kwane̩, rano aboke̩le̩ le̩; e̩gba kʼe̩ fʼuma mu e̩ ka ñwu ma kakini, E̩wñ chi ku me̩ dʼe̩bie̩ne̩ ro̩me̩ e̩nyo̩?
Therefore Daniel went in unto Arioch, whom the king had ordained to destroy the wise	Todule̩ Danie̩l nyʼejefu ugbo Erio̩k, e-kʼonu du dago kʼi fʼamanibe Babilo̩n kpa; oñ i nyʼakʼabe̩-i ñw u kakini, E̩ ki kpa amanibe Babilo̩n in; mʼumi du nyʼo̩gba onu, tak u nakʼofe o̩na le̩ ñw onu.
If I whet my glittering sword,	I la che̩wñ kʼu fʼo̩be̩chageli-mi ki adʼojiji no̩,
But he turned, and said unto Peter,	Oñ i murida ka ñwu Pita kakini, Lale tʼubi-mi, Setan: e̩wñ e̩da mi hi e̩ che, todabu kʼe̩ ma dʼibe tʼe̩wñ e-O̩jo̩ n, chai tʼe̩wñ e-amone̩.
My knees are weak through fasting;	Okuku-mi gbogu noj alu eji;
And gave them the lands of the heathen:	Tak i mʼane̩ ane̩ abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi ko ñw ma;
and of the rest of the oil that	tak atama aba ekpo ki bo̩ ef o̩wo̩-wñ tʼoj eti awo̩to̩ e̩ne̩ ku ma che ku ma gwʼo̩ o̩la rinyo̩ le̩ kpai tʼoji onu o̩wo̩-wñ awo̩to̩ kpai tʼoji onu e̩re̩-wñ awo̩to̩, noji e̩bie̩ iche̩bo̩ abi eje̩ le̩;
Of the children of Zebulun, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;	E-amo̩ma Ze̩biulo̩n o̩gba o̩gba-ma, akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi-ma, ikpo unyi ikpo unyi amata-ma, likpa aluka odu-ma ku ma ko̩, akwʼo̩do̩ ogu nyʼate̩to̩gba-wñ, abo du ku ma bʼoko ogu enyi jo̩:

then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to separate himself thence in the midst of the people.	taku Je̩re̩maya kwo Je̩rusale̩m dufu kʼi nyʼane̩ Be̩njamin kʼi mʼukpe̩ e-wñ gba ef amone̩ o̩mo̩.

Blessed	Ondu ki nʼele̩,
And when he went in to his wife, she conceived, and bare a son, and he called his name Beriah, because it went evil with his house.	Tak i letejefu ugbo o̩ya-wñ, oñ i fefu nyo̩, i la fʼo̩me̩ne̩kele̩ bi, oñ i dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Be̩raya, ukpe̩ kʼe̩bie̩ne̩ wa bʼunyi-wñ ma.
And the Spirit bade me go with them, nothing doubting. Moreover these six brethren accompanied me, and we entered into the man's house:	Oñ Afu ka ñwu mi kʼu lebʼuma, kʼu we eñwʼibe tʼemi tʼemi. Amo̩maye me̩fa kide̩ ño̩ lebʼumi, tak a mugudu tef unyi e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kide̩.
Therefore his sisters sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.	Todule̩ amo̩maye-wñ onobule̩ le̩ kpuche̩ nyʼugbo-wñ kakini, Ondu, go, o̩ga fʼe̩ne̩ kʼe̩ che̩do̩-wñ le̩ gwe̩gbo te̩.

And when it was day, they knew not the land: but they discovered a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it were possible, to thrust in the ship. He keepeth all his bones:	I ade achiku-wñ;

and having in a readiness to revenge all disobedience, when your obedience is fulfilled.	o̩la-wñ laño̩ che̩mu te̩ kʼi bʼudu ñw eko̩ gbo̩lagbo̩ du, e̩gba du kʼugbagbo̩ e-me̩ jo̩ kpa.

For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness, till all the people	Todu abo Israe̩l tale ef aje̩tachi le̩ o̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ meji, gbogbo taku ma fʼabo ichi le̩ du, owñ chʼaboke̩le̩ ku ma jogu ku ma kwʼ Ijipti dufu wa le̩, lie̩ kpa, todabu ku ma ma netirʼomu Jihofa n; owñ chʼabo ki Jihofa fugo̩ ñwu ma ka kʼi aje̩ ñwu ma fʼeju-ma do ane̩ e-ki Jihofa go̩ ñw amata-ma ka kʼi adu ñw a n, ane̩ kʼomi e̩nya kpai iño̩ acha efu-wñ.

And they did so, and brought forth those five kings unto him out of the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish,	Taku ma fʼabe̩le̩ che, ma la kʼamonu me̩lu le̩ kwef owo dufu ñw u, owñ che onu Je̩rusale̩m kpai onu He̩bro̩n kpai onu Jarmut kpai onu Lakish kpai onu Eglo̩n.
And he sent messengers to Ahab king of Israel into the city, and said unto him, Thus saith Ben-hadad,	Oñ i fʼamonuche̩ kpe̩ nyʼef ewo le̩ ugbo Ehab onu Israe̩l. I kakini, Abu ku Be̩n-hedad ka de̩ kakini,
And if men strive together, and one smite another with a stone, or with	I la che̩wñ kʼone̩ meji jʼajiñwa, kʼoka mʼokuta du nʼekeji abe̩k ero̩kpo̩ ñw u, kʼe̩ne̩ le̩ ma ku n, kʼi muda dachi oj ate̩,
And I saw as it were a sea of glass mingled with fire: and them that had gotten the victory over the beast, and over his image, and over his mark,	Tak e̩wñ kʼu li dabe̩ne̩ kʼohimini egigo kʼuna chʼe̩gwe̩gwanyʼu; kpʼabo ku ma du ugbo uja e̩la le̩ kpʼugbo ojibo-wñ kpʼugbo inaba odu-wñ, ma nʼumolo e-O̩jo̩ dago jʼo̩la ohimini egigo le̩.

And it came to pass in the month Nisan, in the twentieth year of Artaxerxes the king,	Oñ i lewatu ochu Nisan, o̩do̩ e̩ko̩gu kʼArtaze̩rksis jʼonu, e̩gba kʼomi achiwebe̩te̩ma jʼo̩gba-wñ, u la mʼomi achiwebe̩te̩ma du nʼo̩wo̩ ñw onu. U la bʼeju-mi nyʼo̩wo̩ eju-wñ mama ta n.

And the foundation	Okuta udane̩-wñ ño̩ chenʼo̩ko̩ nana, okuta-wñ chʼelilelile. I nʼokuta ki chʼo̩hibo̩wo̩ me̩gwa, i ño̩ nʼokuta ki chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩jo̩ ge̩.
For that ye	E-ku me̩ ma ka koji de̩, kakini, Iche̩wñ ki dʼOndu e̩do̩ a la adeju oñ a achʼe-i abe̩k e-le̩.
But brother goeth to law with brother, and that before the unbelievers.	Chai kʼo̩maye kʼi do̩ o̩maye ajo̩? kʼe-le̩ la chʼo̩gba abo ku ma ma ke̩do̩no n?
Thou shalt eat it within thy gates: the unclean and the clean	Uwe̩ ki fʼe-le̩ je̩ ef aku aku-we̩; tʼabo kʼo̩la-ma daji tʼabo kʼo̩la-ma fe̩ aje̩ okujo̩, alu ku ma je̩ egbi kpai abede le̩.
Then the priest shall wash his clothes, and he shall bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the priest shall be unclean until the even.	Tak atama agwe̩ e̩wñ o̩la-wñ, kʼi fʼo̩la-wñ gwe̩ ef omiofo, ubile̩ tak i agudu wʼef uru, oñ o̩la atama le̩ adaji gbogbo mʼe̩gba kʼolu tunyʼane̩.
The	Anubi le̩ Jihofa ka ñw mi iko Josaya onu kakini, e̩ fʼe̩wñ kʼIsrae̩l che ki alʼubi ubi le̩ li me̩? I mute̩gu tʼoj uwo du ki gbo̩gba kpai of oli emimi du, oñ i tʼajo̩ko̩ o̩mo̩.
and Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:	Abu kʼi fu Matusala bi Ino̩k tale kpai O̩jo̩ o̩do̩ oli me̩fa, i ño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.

And the angel thrust in his sickle into the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast	Abe̩le̩ onuche̩ le̩ mʼujegbe-wñ du rikpolo tef ane̩ ile̩, oñ i fʼiga achiwebe̩te̩ma ja, tak i mʼu du rikpolo tef aguo̩ko̩lo̩ lile ki chʼe-e̩do̩fulu O̩jo̩ le̩.
And the man increased exceedingly, and had much cattle, and maidservants, and menservants, and camels, and asses.	Abe̩le̩ e̩ne̩ le̩ nana nyo̩gba ololo, i la nʼame̩wño̩re̩ egini wewe, kpai amadu onobule̩, kpai amadu e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, kpai aminyakulumi kpai amo̩ke̩ke̩te̩.
Hear, O my people, and I will speak;	Neti, O amone̩-mi, tak u nako̩la,
being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.	E̩ro o̩kpakpa ki kʼume̩ efu lefu Jisus Kraist tod ojima kpai uñwulo̩ O̩jo̩.
But if the slayer shall at any time come without the border of the city of his refuge, whither he was fled;	Ama iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ kʼi kpʼone̩ le̩ mʼalo̩me̩ oke̩ko̩ ugbo kʼi ra nyi le̩ daba, e̩gba du kʼi chaka le,
For if the inheritance	Todu iche̩wñ kʼe̩te̩ e̩wñ ogu ku ma aje̩ le̩ chʼo̩lo̩da, e̩te̩-wñ ño̩ chʼo̩la-ekatane̩ de̩-i ge̩ n; O̩jo̩ la dʼu chʼele-ufe̩do̩-e̩nyo̩ ñw Ebraham lef o̩la-ekatane̩.
And the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.	E̩ne̩ kide̩ la nʼamo̩monobule̩ me̩le̩ ku ma ma mʼe̩ne̩ke̩le̩ n ku ma jʼakache̩.
And he said, Oh let not the Lord be angry, and I will speak yet but this once: Peradventure ten shall be found there. And he said, I will not destroy	Tak i kakini, I ki bi Ondu eju n, kʼu nako̩la onukate ta. Ikani ma fʼone̩ me̩gwa li o̩mo̩ fa? Oñ i kakini, Nakpʼo̩ bie̩ n todu one̩ me̩gwa le̩.
and he gathered men unto him, and became captain over a band, when David slew them	Tak i mʼaboke̩le̩ ko mʼe̩do̩ oñ i mud agboji udalaʼka, owñ chʼe̩gba ki Defid fʼuma kpa le̩; taku ma nyi Damaskus, oñ ma fʼodo do o̩mo̩, i la fʼo̩fe̩ je̩ Damaskus.
But, O	Ama, uwe̩ O Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du kʼe̩ kajo̩ tʼo̩kpakpa,
Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood:	Uwe̩ fʼe̩biomi kpai aji kpana;
And Moses sent to call Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab: which said, We will not come up:	Taku Mose̩s kpʼone̩ nyʼado̩ Detan kpai Abiram, amo̩ma Eliab wa; oñ ma kakini, A le n.
And forgetteth that the foot may crush them,	i la agbenyo̩ ka kʼe̩re̩ neke kpʼo̩fo̩ mʼane̩,
There are	Año̩la e̩-efojale̩ la do̩mo̩, kpʼaño̩la e-ane̩ ile̩-i ge̩. Ojima e-efojale muda chʼojoji, oñ ojima e-ane̩ ile̩-i la chʼojoji.
But Jerusalem which is above is free, which is the mother of us all.	Ama Je̩rusale̩m ki dʼate̩ chʼo̩mone̩, e-le̩ chʼiye-wa.
For the fitches are not threshed with a threshing instrument, neither is a cart wheel turned about upon the cummin; but the fitches are beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.	Ma gwu igogo ef agu dab o̩ka n
And Pharaoh said unto him, Get thee from me, take heed to thyself, see my face no more; for in	Taku Fero ka ñw u kakini, Kwo bʼumi te̩; fʼo̩la-we̩ de; e̩ ki ño̩ go mi eju ogbegbele̩ ge̩ n; todu o̩jo̩ kʼe̩ fʼe u-mi li eku e̩ ku.
And he took up his parable, and said,	Tak i mʼita-wñ du tʼalu akpa kakini,
On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ocran, prince of the children of Asher,	O̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwaka-wñ che Pagie̩l o̩ma Okran, kʼi chʼidachi abo Ashe̩r:
and he said,	Oñ i kakini,
and he laid	Oñ i mʼu du kad alu-mi, i kakini, Go, e̩wñ-i kad uko-we̩ me̩; udu kʼe̩ fe̩ kwo bʼe̩ te̩, e̩wñ bʼadure-we̩ ma me̩.
And	E̩wñ kʼonu tene-i chekpuna, i la nʼe̩ne̩ du ki neke dʼu dufu o̩gba onu-i n, chai amo̩jo̩ kʼama ma dodo kpenyʼo̩re̩la n.
Take thou also unto thee principal spices, of pure myrrh five hundred	Uwe̩ ki mʼe̩wñ ido̩ro̩ e-o̩me̩me̩le̩ ko: e-mur kʼi chʼomi kʼi chʼalu she̩ke̩l oli me̩gwa, e-sinamo̩n ki akpo ki chʼukpe̩reji alu le̩, owñ chʼoli me̩lu, e-kalamus ki akpo ki chʼalu she̩ke̩l oli me̩lu,
He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha;	O̩kakachi ogu fʼo̩la ka, i kakini, Ibaa!
And when he had gathered all the chief priests and scribes of the people together, he demanded of them where Christ should be born.	Tak i fʼamagboji amatama kpai amako̩takada amone̩ do̩ jeju, oñ i tene ugbo ma ugbo ku ma abi Kraisti.
And Huram sent him by the hands of his servants ships, and servants that had knowledge of the sea; and they went with the servants of Solomon to Ophir, and took thence four hundred and fifty talents of gold, and brought	Taku Huram kʼo̩ko̩ kpʼabuko̩lo̩-wñ ku ma mʼe̩wñ ohimini abadi kpuche̩ rʼu lʼo̩wo̩ abuko̩lo̩-wñ; tak ama manyʼabuko̩lo̩ So̩lo̩mo̩n nyi Ofir, ma la kʼo̩jamalia alu tale̩nt oli me̩la kwʼo̩mo̩ wa, oñ ma mʼu ko nyʼugbo So̩lo̩mo̩n, onu.
And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.	Oñ e̩wñ kʼe̩ gbo̩ ugbo mi eju ame̩nibenu wewe le̩, e̩ nakonyʼabo ku ma achubi one̩ o̩wo̩, ku ma ñʼabo̩jo̩ ku ma ko̩ abo omune̩ e̩wñ ge̩.
And as ye go, preach, saying, The kingdom of heaven is at hand.	Abu ku me̩ alo me̩ natakoya kakini, Ojane̩ e-efojale me̩rʼo̩wo̩ me̩.
He built also the house of the forest of Lebanon; the length thereof	Todu i nʼoli kwʼef oko Le̩bano̩n kʼunyi-wñ le̩: ujiji-wñ chʼohibo̩wo̩ ogume̩lu, unabe̩-wñ la chʼohibo̩wo̩ ooje, o̩gba-wñ la chʼohibo̩wo̩ ogue̩gwa, i tane̩ oji oli sida ku ma ko che oli urane̩-wñ o̩gba o̩gba me̩le̩, igbo oli sida la nʼoji oli urane̩-wñ le̩.
Have respect unto the covenant:	E̩ nabumo̩ ñw alo le̩;
And when they had fasted and prayed, and laid	Tak e̩gba ku ma fʼalu ji ku ma la fʼadua che, ma kʼo̩wo̩ nʼuma oji oñ ma tʼuma no̩.
And	E̩wñ ki la achʼuhio̩me̩ ogbegbele̩ ñwu me̩ de̩, kakini, ef ochu e̩kebie, o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwa ochu le̩, me̩ ki hi onugo o̩la-me̩ wane̩, me̩ ki la chʼuko̩lo̩ du n, tʼo̩mane̩, tʼilowa kʼi ge̩ne̩ ef ume̩;
Adam, Sheth, Enosh,	Ade̩m, Se̩t, Inosh,
and he shall take the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the living bird, and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the running water, and sprinkle the house seven times:	tak i akʼoli sida kpai hiso̩p kpai e̩wñ ekpikpa manyʼe̩we̩ kʼi deju le̩ wa, oñ i akʼe-le̩ tunyʼe̩bie̩ e̩we̩ ku ma kpa, kpai tunyʼomi ki acha le̩, kʼi tafio̩ unyi le̩ onu mebie.
Then made he ten lavers of brass: one laver contained forty baths:	Tak i nʼebije ekpikpa che ukpachi ugwo̩wo̩ me̩gwa: ukpachi-wñ oka aje̩ otube̩ o̩gbo̩ meji; ukpachi ugwo̩wo̩ le̩ okoka chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩le̩; ukpachi ugwo̩wo̩ le̩ la nʼoji o̩ka me̩gwa le̩ okoka lale.
And if a man sell a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold;	I la che̩wñ kʼone̩ mʼunyi ki dʼef ewo ki nʼaku du ta, mak i chenʼo̩da kʼi adabi gba tane̩ tak o̩do̩ kʼi dʼu ta le̩ muda; i la anʼo̩da e̩gba tane̩ gbogbo nyʼo̩do̩ odukulu.
We roar all like bears, and mourn sore like doves: we look for judgment, but	O̩chaka-wa achekuku dab amibe̩a,
And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and	Oñ Saimo̩n Pita kpai ako̩che̩ omune̩ʼka tu Jisus ubi. Agboji amatama la chema ako̩che̩ e-le̩, oñ i gudu kpai Jisus tef anuku atama le̩.
And my tongue shall speak of thy righteousness	Ukpalu-mi la anʼe̩wñ o̩kpakpa-we̩
While I live will I praise the	Abu kʼu deju-i naje̩nyu Jihofa;
I am that bread of life.	Omi chʼuje̩wñ e-iñmi.
With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm:	o̩wo̩ ukpahiu kpai o̩wo̩ kʼi nadala te̩ oñ i ne̩ che,
My fruit	E̩ro-mi nyo̩ tʼo̩jamalia le, ochochi, i tʼo̩jamalia kʼi de̩ hiolo le,
Can a man take fire in his bosom,	One̩ neke gbʼuna mʼe̩do̩ kʼukpo-wñ ma ajo̩ n?
Hazor, Ramah, Gittaim,	kpai Ha-zor kpai Ramah kpai Gitaim
And he said unto them,	Tak i ka ñwu ma, kakini, Ugbo du ku me̩ gudu tef unyi, o̩mo̩ me̩ ru gbogbo tʼe̩gba ku me̩ kwʼugbo le̩ dufu.
and needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.	i ño̩ chʼutodabu kʼeku kʼe̩ne̩ du ki gbibenu one̩ ma ku owñ n; todu owñ chema e̩wñ ki dʼef one̩.
And they rose up in the morning early, and worshipped before the	Ma takpa kwane̩ odudu o̩jo̩ñwa-wñ oñ ma dojikane̩ o̩gba Jihofa. Taku ma mudabi tʼunyi-ma Rama. E̩lkana la fʼo̩ya-wñ, Hana, ma; Jihofa la dibekadʼo.
Now the rest of the acts of Jehoash which he did, and his might, and how he fought with Amaziah king of Judah,	Oñ e̩wñ ki bo̩ ki Jihoash che le̩, kpʼukpahiu-wñ, kpai alu kʼi ja kpai Amazaya onu Juda le̩, inabali-wñ che̩ko̩ rʼef o̩takada Iko E̩wñ Amonu Israe̩l le̩ n?
For this	Todu ma fʼe̩ne̩-i lo̩ ka kʼi bʼojima ki nana tʼe-Mo̩se̩s le jo̩, alu kʼe̩ne̩ ki akʼunyi nʼubumo̩ tʼunyi onugo le.
And I will kindle a fire in the houses of the gods of Egypt; and he shall burn them, and carry them away captives: and he shall array himself with the land of Egypt, as a shepherd putteth on his garment; and he shall go forth from thence in peace.	Tak omi akʼuna ef unyi unyi amo̩jo̩ Ijipti; owñ la agu uma jo, oñ i ako ma lo tef amu; i la akʼane̩ Ijipti bʼo̩la ma, alu kʼadidala akʼukpo-wñ bʼo̩la ma; tak i akwʼo̩mo̩ dufu kpʼure̩do̩.
And all the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them, did Joshua take, and smote them with the edge of the sword,	Taku Jo̩shua mʼewo ewo amonu le̩ chaka kpai amonu-ma chaka ko oñ i nʼalu ugbada gwo ma da, i la mʼuma ko jo̩ ñw O̩jo̩ hioko, alu ki Mose̩s adu Jihofa le̩ ñwate̩.
Speak unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them, Whatsoever	E̩ nako̩la ñw Aro̩n kpai amo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, kpai amo̩ma Israe̩l chaka kakini, E̩ne̩ du kʼi chʼabunyi Israe̩l, abe̩k ilowa du kʼi dʼane̩ Israe̩l, kʼi dʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩ e-wñ wa, dagba i chʼoji kʼi da kʼi ara, dagba ki chʼe̩wñ ki gʼe̩do̩la-wñ aduwa ku ma mʼu du che iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo ñwu Jihofa,
which indeed is the least of all seeds: but when it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in the branches thereof.	E̩yo̩-wñ chenya falii tʼe̩yo̩ du le; i muda tiga kʼi nana kpa, i tʼe̩wñ oko kwe̩ kwe̩ kwe̩ du le, i la mud oli. Todabe̩le̩ ame̩we̩ ojale lewa ru jʼe̩to̩-wñ.
And I will bring upon that land all my words which I have pronounced against it,	U la ako o̩la du kʼu ka nyʼane̩ le̩ wa abʼo oji ma, owñ chʼe̩wñ du ki che̩ko̩ ef ubuku-i, e-ku Je̩re̩maya kache̩ bʼabo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi du ma.
And ye shall do as I have done: ye shall not cover	Tak ame̩ ache alu kʼomi che-i; ame̩ akʼe̩wñ bʼuko-me̩ ma n, me̩ la ajʼuje̩wñ unyi aku n.
and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada	Be̩naya, o̩ma Jiho̩yada, la nʼo̩da abo Ke̩re̩t kpai abo Pe̩le̩t; amo̩ma Defid la chʼuto̩gba abo ku ma ate̩ko-wñ.
And the sister of Tahpenes bare him Genubath his son, whom Tahpenes weaned in Pharaoh's house: and Genubath was in Pharaoh's household among the sons of Pharaoh.	Oñ o̩maye Tafenes le̩ bi Genubat, o̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, ñw u, Tafenes nʼo̩ma le̩ gba ef unyi Fero; Genubat la dʼef unyi Fero ef amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ e-Fero.
I am	Omi, kʼu kwadʼO̩jo̩, kʼi la dohi ñw mi,
So shall they fear the name of the	Abe̩le̩ tak ama arailo odu Jihofa akwʼo̩wo̩ olane̩,
But after that I am risen, I will go before you into Galilee.	Ama e̩gba ku ma mʼumi du kwane̩, natʼume̩ o̩gba nyi Galili.
In every thing give thanks: for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus concerning you.	Me̩ fʼugwa-wñ gwa ef e̩wñ du, todu e̩wñ ki dʼO̩jo̩ e̩do̩ efu Kraisti Jisus ñwu me̩ le̩ de̩.
And they departed quickly from the sepulchre with fear and great joy; and did run to bring his disciples word.	Taku ma kwo bʼoji le̩ te̩ piopio, ailo-wñ naba ma, ma la ayo̩ ololo. Oñ ma fule alo ku ma mʼu du ka ñw amako̩che̩-wñ.
And God came unto Balaam, and said, What men	Tak O̩jo̩ lewa ugbo Belam, oñ i kakini, Aboke̩le̩ ku ma jʼugbo-we̩-i chʼe̩ne̩?
And in that day shall the deaf hear the words of the book, and the eyes of the blind shall see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.	Tak o̩jo̩ le̩ amajeti agbʼo̩la
And David took	Taku Defid ño̩ mʼamabadu kpʼamo̩ya omune̩ ko ñw o̩la-wñ kwef abo Je̩rusale̩m, abu kʼi kwo He̩bro̩n wa. Ma ño̩ fʼamo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩ bi ñwu Defid ge̩.
Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.	I laño̩ dukpe̩ kʼabo̩do̩da agbʼo̩ ibenu kʼowñ chʼe̩no̩me̩me̩le̩; tode̩gba kʼi añwa tef ina ebu kpai oku Abulumone̩ le̩.
Till he fill thy mouth with laughing,	I muda aje̩ ñw alu-we̩ ko̩ ñw anyi,
Then answered they and said before the king, That Daniel, which	Taku ma dohi o̩gba onu kakini, Danie̩l, kʼi dʼef abimo̩to̩ Juda ku ma mu wa le̩, anyʼuwe̩ eti n, kpai aba kʼe̩ dʼo̩wo̩-we̩ tʼo̩ le̩ n, i muda abi ebi-wñ onu me̩ta tak o̩jo̩ ki du.
He hath blinded their eyes, and hardened their heart;	I fʼuma eju chubi, i laño̩ fʼuma e̩do̩ no̩;
As for me, I have not hastened from	I muda chʼe-mi, u naju ekwo bʼide ala ede te̩ kʼu tʼe̩ ubi n,
Again, David gathered together all the chosen	Taku Defid ño̩ mʼaboke̩le̩ Israe̩l ku ma fʼuma ñwa go taku ma chi ma, ko wa jeju ge̩, ma chʼone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ogue̩gwa.
now therefore swear unto me here by God that thou wilt not deal falsely with me, nor with my son, nor with my son's son:	todule̩ e̩ fʼO̩jo̩ go̩ ñwu mi emi, ka kʼe̩ ñache e̩wñ olemi kpai omi kpai o̩ma-mi kpai aaju-mi n, chai likpa alu kʼomi mo̩la ñw e̩ alu le̩ uwe̩ ache ñwu mi kpai ane̩ e-kʼe̩ ge̩ne̩ oji-wñ-i.
And the likeness of the firmament upon the heads of the living creature	Oñ e̩wñ ki biu agbagba ki te̩ ofofo dʼate̩ ñw ame̩wñ iñmi le̩, e̩ go i dab ogigo ki abailo, i nadala te̩ oji-ma ate̩.
And I will lay my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel: and they shall do in Edom according to mine anger and according to my fury; and they shall know my vengeance, saith the Lord	U la anʼo̩wo̩ abo-mi Israe̩l fʼache̩-mi na abʼIdo̩m ma; tak ama ache Ido̩m teju uwe̩do̩-mi kpai e̩do̩fulu-mi efu Ido̩m; abe̩le̩ ama ama ache̩ ena-mi, Ondu Jihofa ka-i.
from thirty years old and upward even unto fifty years old, every one that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacle of the congregation:	akwʼo̩do̩ o̩gue̩gwa gbogbo nyʼo̩do̩ ooje, owñ chʼabo du ku ma wʼef akanya le̩ ku ma che uko̩lo̩ ef unyabo ujeju;
Belshazzar, whiles he tasted the wine, commanded to bring the golden and silver vessels which his father Nebuchadnezzar had taken out of the temple which	Abu ki Be̩lshaza do̩mo̩ adʼomi achiwebe̩te̩ma le̩ kadʼalu, i ka ñwu ma ku ma kʼe̩wñ eku o̩jamalia kpai ajifa e-ki Ne̩biukadne̩za, ata-wñ, ko kwef unyi O̩jo̩ ki de̩ Je̩rusale̩m todu kʼonu kpʼabojima-wñ, kpʼamo̩ya-wñ, kpʼamabadu-wñ, ki ñmo̩ kwef uwñ.
Then thine handmaid said, The word of my lord the king shall now be comfortable: for as an angel of God, so	Tak adu-we̩-i kpibe kakini, Agba, o̩la onu-i ki mud e-ki aje̩ ñw o̩la le̩ mu da; todu alu kʼonuche̩ O̩jo̩ de̩, abe̩le̩ odu-mi onu de̩ ugbo e̩wñ e̩nyo̩ kpai e̩bie̩ne̩ ema: Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ ki la dʼugbo-we̩!
even to prepare me timber in abundance: for the house which I am about to build	owñ chʼutodu ku ma ñw oli che ñwu mi e̩kute̩, todu unyi kʼu na che kʼu ko̩-i atabale, awuwu-wñ agbe̩.
And	I la dab ane̩ ego kʼu li le̩, owñ chʼalu kʼane̩ ego de̩ kʼu li e̩gba kʼu wa kʼu fʼewo-i kpabie̩; ane̩ ego ojoji ojoji kʼu li la dab ane̩ ego kʼu li o̩la aji Che̩bar le̩; tak u lewa fʼeju bʼane̩ ma.
And he sent out arrows, and scattered them;	I la kʼo̩fa-wñ kpuche̩ dufu oñ i fʼuma kpatuka;
And as I was considering, behold, an he goat came from the west on the face of the whole earth, and touched not the ground: and the goat	Oñ abu kʼu do̩mo̩ akpibe, go, obuko̩ʼka kwʼolane̩ wa lale eju ile̩-i du, e̩re̩-wñ du kad ane̩ n: obuko le̩ la nʼigbaʼka ki kadʼagbagba eju-wñ meji.
And, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured kine and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.	Me̩ go, amokuno̩ mebie kwef ohimini dufu, año̩la-ma de̩ bo̩lo̩bo̩lo̩, ma chʼeyoyo, oñ ma jʼef icho̩lo̩ alʼije̩.
even the prophet Jeremiah said, Amen: the	owñ che Je̩re̩maya, akache̩, kakini, Ami! Jihofa ki fʼabe̩le̩ che, Jihofa ki je̩ ache̩ o̩la kʼe̩ ka le̩ ki che̩, kʼi la mʼe̩wñ eku unyi Jihofa, kpʼame̩namu le̩ ko kwo Babilo̩n dabiwa jo̩ uña-i.
And it shall be, if thou have no delight in her, then thou shalt let her go whither she will; but thou shalt not sell her at all for money, thou shalt not make merchandise of her, because thou hast humbled her.	Oñ i lewatu kʼi ma dʼuwe̩ e̩do̩ n, e̩gbale̩ uwe̩ ki tʼo̩ no̩ kʼi nyʼugbo du kʼi rʼe eju; uwe̩ ki muda dʼu ta tod o̩ko̩ kilikili n, uwe̩ ki chʼo dabe̩ne̩ kʼadu n, todu uwe̩ fʼowñ kpabie̩ me̩.
And the uttermost cities of the tribe of the children of Judah toward the coast of Edom southward were Kabzeel, and Eder, and Jagur,	Oñ ewo ewo abo o̩lo̩pu Juda akwo ukpoji-wñ o̩wo̩ alo̩me̩ Ido̩m o̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩ le̩ che Kabzee̩l kpai Ede̩r kpai Jagur
And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.	Oñ lef ugbite̩re̩ ki akpo̩rane̩ ufe̩do̩ amone̩ wewe abulo̩;
so that the fishes of the sea, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the field, and all creeping things that creep upon the earth, and all the men that	kʼame̩ja ohimini kpʼame̩we̩ ojale, kpʼame̩wñ iñmi egbili kpʼe̩wñ du ki afa, kʼi afa ane̩pe̩te̩, kpʼamone̩ du ku ma jo̩ eju ile̩-i, amiejo eju-mi ki dane̩ o̩mo̩, uwo uwo ki gbo̩gba agulo̩ wane̩, oñ ugbo ki dago kpakpa awane̩, aku aku du la awʼane̩pe̩te̩.
but have renounced the hidden things of dishonesty, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully; but by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.	A muda fʼe̩wñ anyo̩ ki maja le̩ naba me̩, a lule̩ ugbeju n, a la chʼe̩wñ gwo̩ o̩lO̩jo̩ n; ama ef edutejugede kʼa dʼochochi tejugede a dʼo̩la-wa dago ñw akone̩ o̩la ki dʼef e̩do̩ e̩ne̩ du eju O̩jo̩.
Then said the lord of the vineyard, What shall I do? I will send my beloved son: it may be they will reverence	Tak odu uche̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma le̩ kakini, E̩wñ nache? Nakpe̩ o̩ma ufe̩do̩-mi; ukani ma adiba ñw u.
They came round about me daily like water;	I lʼumi de dabe̩ne̩ kʼomiofo gbogbo dʼo̩jo̩;
Then the priest of Jupiter, which was before their city, brought oxen and garlands unto the gates, and would have done sacrifice with the people.	Oñ atama e-Jupiter kʼi do̩gba ewo le̩ mʼamokuno̩ o̩ko̩ kpai e̩wñ ku ma ta wenyu ma o̩la kowa alu-aku, i dʼowñ e̩do̩ kʼowñ kpai o̩wo̩ amone̩ le̩ ki chʼiche̩bo̩.
Keep silence before me, O islands; and let the people renew	Me̩ chechi jo̩ o̩gba-mi, O ala ala;
And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter: now his sons were with his cattle in the field: and Jacob held his peace until they were come.	Oñ Jeko̩b gbo̩ ka kʼi fʼo̩ma-wñ Daina o̩la daji; e̩gbale̩ amo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ la jʼoko ugbo ame̩-wñ ukpa-wñ, oñ Jeko̩b chechi gbogbo taku ma lewa.
And thus did Hezekiah throughout all Judah, and wrought	Abe̩le̩ He̩ze̩kaya la che ugbo du Juda; oñ i fʼe̩wñ ki nyo̩ kʼi la chʼo̩kpakpa ki chʼalu ku ma chubi one̩ eju Jihofa O̩jo̩-wñ che.
And he said unto him, Son, thou art ever with me, and all that I have is thine.	Ama i ka ñw u kakini, O̩ma-mi, uwe̩ dʼugbo mi e̩gba du; e̩wñ du ki chʼe-mi la chʼe-we̩.
O remember not against us former iniquities: Let thy tender mercies speedily prevent us:	E̩ ki rewa udu kʼabo-wa igbelegbele fe̩ kʼe̩ ko bʼuwa oji ma n;
Lo, he goeth by me, and I see	Go, i alale gu mi du, u la liʼu n;
Moses my servant is dead; now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, thou, and all this people, unto the land which I do give to them,	Mose̩s adu-mi la leku me̩; todule̩ uwe̩ ki kwane̩ kʼe̩ daba Jo̩rdan-i, uwe̩ kpai amone̩-i chaka, me̩ nyʼoj ane̩ kʼu nadu ñwu ma, owñ chʼamo̩ma Israe̩l-i.
With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful;	Uwe̩ añʼe̩numo̩la ka kʼuwe̩ chʼe̩numo̩la,
But the men would not hearken to him: so the man took his concubine, and brought her forth unto them; and they knew her, and abused her all the night until the morning: and when the day began to spring, they let her go.	Ama aboke̩le̩ le̩ ko̩ enyʼu eti. Abe̩le̩ e̩ne̩ le̩ gwo̩nyʼabadu-wñ, oñ i mʼu du dufu ñwu ma; taku ma bʼo̩ dachi, ma la fʼu chʼo̩bata odu le̩ gbogbo ñw o̩jo̩. Tak e̩gba kʼo̩jo̩ chane̩ eñwa, ma tʼowñ no̩.
Who hath wrought and done	E̩ne̩ chʼe̩wñ abe̩i, kʼi la fʼuche̩ kpa,
And it shall come to pass, when it is seen that Moab is weary on the high place, that he shall come to his sanctuary to pray; but he shall not prevail.	Tak i awatu, e̩gba ku Moab dʼo̩la-wñ wa te̩, e̩gba kʼuhia fʼu hia oj otete le̩, kʼi lewʼuña-wñ kiafo̩ kʼi cha-duwa, i anʼoji ñw u n.
Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another man's foundation:	abe̩le̩ e̩wñ ki kad omi eju chʼUche̩nyo̩ eje̩, i chʼugbo ku ma dʼodu Kraisti akwoubi n, todu kʼu we ekʼunyi oj e̩re̩ unyi kʼe̩ne̩ omune̩ ñwa;
But if we hope for that we see not,	I muda che̩wñ kʼa kibeno e̩wñ kʼeju-wa ma dʼo ta n, a afe̩do̩lichi aneju e̩wñ le̩.
and Jattir with her suburbs, and Eshtemoa with her suburbs,	kpai Jatir manyʼane̩ ije̩ ki lʼo daka kpai E̩shtemoa manyʼane̩ ije̩ ki lʼo daka
Them hath he filled with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of work, of the engraver, and of the cunning workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver,	I je̩ ñw ibe chʼe̩ko̩ ef e̩do̩-ma ku ma chʼuko̩lo̩ o̩wo̩ ojoji ojoji du, uko̩lo̩ alo̩ egwu kpai o̩ka uko̩lo̩ kpai e̩ne̩ ki achiya nyʼukpo odufa kpai odufa ekpikpa kpai ekpikpa kpai e-line̩n ku ma hi reju, kpai e̩ne̩ kʼi ahi ukpo—owñ chʼabo ku ma chʼuko̩lo̩ du, kpai abo ku ma ñw ibe ina e̩te̩le̩ eko̩ nyʼe̩wñ.
Yea, when they had made them a molten calf, and said, This	Ochochi, e̩gba ku ma fʼo̩mokuno̩ da ñw o̩la-ma, ku ma la kakini, O̩jo̩-we̩ ki dʼuwe̩ kwef Ijipti wa le̩ de̩, ku ma la fʼe̩wñ achakpabie̩ che nana;
But	I muda chʼame̩, me̩ murida, ku me̩ kʼe̩re̩ nyʼule̩-me̩ nyʼef aje̩tachi lʼo̩na ohimini Ekpikpa.
As concerning therefore the eating of those things that are offered in sacrifice unto idols, we know that an idol	Todule̩ i chʼe-ugbo o̩la e̩la iche̩bo̩ eje̩ le̩, a cheli ka kʼode chʼe̩wñ du ef ile̩-i n, kʼO̩jo̩ du la do̩mo̩ n, chai okate le̩.
Then he shall turn his face toward the fort of his own land: but he shall stumble and fall, and not be found.	Tak i arʼeju-wñ da rʼo̩wo̩ aku aku ane̩-wñ onugo; i muda ake̩re̩ kʼi awane̩, oñ one̩ ñʼaliʼu ge̩ n.
And the vale of Siddim	O̩go̩ sidim le̩ la che̩ko̩ ñw o̩fe̩ o̩bia bitume̩n; tak amonu So̩do̩m kpai Go̩mo̩ra ra, oñ ma leane̩ o̩mo̩, tak abo ki bo̩ ra tʼoj uwo le̩.
Herein is our love made perfect, that we may have boldness in the day of judgment: because as he is, so are we in this world.	Ef e-i oñ ufe̩do̩ mufu kpa ugbo e-wa, todu kʼa ki nʼeju e̩gbo̩ o̩jo̩ ajo̩, todu alu kʼowñ le̩ de̩, abe̩le̩ awa la de̩ ile̩-i.

and ye also shall bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.	Ame̩ la ñʼagba ibenu ge̩, todabu ku me̩ jʼugbo mi kwʼabakwane̩.

And Jonathan Saul's son arose, and went to David into the wood, and strengthened his hand in God.	Taku Jo̩natan, o̩ma So̩l, kwane̩ oñ i nyʼugbo Defid efoko o̩mo̩, kʼi dʼune̩do̩ ñw u ef O̩jo̩.

And David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women	Abe̩le̩ Defid lewʼunyi-wñ Je̩rusale̩m; tak onu mʼabobule̩ me̩gwa ku ma chʼamabadu-wñ le̩ ko, owñ chʼabo kʼi tʼuma no̩ jʼubi ku ma dejutʼunyi, oñ i ko ma jʼef o̩wo̩ one̩, owñ la nʼuje̩wñ-ma ku ma aje̩, i muda nyʼejefu ugbo ma n. And when the days of her purifying are fulfilled, for a son, or for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtledove, for a sin offering, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest:	Tak e̩gba kʼo̩jo̩ o̩la egworinyo̩-wñ jo̩ kpa, dagba i chʼe-o̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ dagba i chʼe-o̩ma onobule̩, i adʼo̩mala o̩mo̩do̩ʼka wa ugbo atama alugbo̩na unyabo ujeju todu iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo kpai o̩ma o̩ke̩te̩be̩ abe̩k omikede todu iche̩bo̩ adure;

And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:	Oñ i awatu e̩gba kʼu nadu akpa wa bʼoji ane̩-ile̩ ma, ma ali o̩ba ef akpa le̩,

And truly, if they had been mindful of that	I la che̩wñ kʼibe-ma ma kadʼe-ku ma kwef uwñ dufu le̩ ma ma lʼuña edabi.
For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.	Todu ma chane̩ edʼumi dafo dab iche̩bo̩ omi me̩, iko ku ma tʼumi no̩ kʼu lo le̩ lewa me̩.
And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:	Tak o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩ta-wñ mud iyawo Kena e-Galili; iye Jisus la dʼane̩ o̩mo̩.
If then God so clothe the grass, which is to day in the field, and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more	I muda che̩wñ kʼO̩jo̩ kʼe̩wñ abe̩le̩ nyʼo̩la egbe oko e-kʼi do̩mo̩ eñini, ku ma la ko rikpolo tef igbeli o̩na; onumonu e-kʼi ako nyʼame̩ o̩la atule taa ame̩ abe̩do̩-ekono re-i!
and the seven angels came out of the temple, having the seven plagues, clothed in pure and white linen, and having their breasts girded with golden girdles.	oñ amonuche̩ mebie ku ma nʼuchobi mebie le̩ kwef unyi O̩jo̩ ejefu dufu, ukpo line̩n ki de̩ hiolo ki afane̩ bʼo̩la-ma ma, oñ e̩wñ ujiñmi ajamalia ji mʼe̩do̩-ma ugbo e̩nya-ma.

which my lips have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was in trouble.	todu uko-mi muchi

And the priest shall take the sodden shoulder of the ram, and one unleavened cake out of the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and shall put	Tak atama adʼo̩wo̩ okolo e̩hi le̩ kpai akala ki ma nʼo̩jo̩wu n oka kwef agba le̩ kpai o̩kpukpulu ki ma nʼo̩jo̩wu n oka, oñ i akʼo nyʼe̩do̩wo̩ e̩ne̩ Nazarait le̩, owñ chʼabu kʼi fʼoji e̩date̩-wñ la,

And the men of Gibeon sent unto Joshua to the camp to Gilgal, saying, Slack not thy hand from thy servants; come up to us quickly, and save us, and help us: for all the kings of the Amorites that dwell in the mountains are gathered together against us. And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.	O̩wo̩ amone̩ le̩ la nʼibeʼkate anyʼe̩wñ ki Filip aka le̩ e̩ti, e̩gbʼo̩ ku ma gbo̩ ku ma laño̩ li ujiwe kʼi che.
When the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through dry places, seeking rest; and finding none, he saith, I will return unto my house whence I came out. And David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and came and said before Jonathan, What have I done? what	Taku Defid ra bo̩ Nayo̩t e-Rama te̩, oñ i lewa o̩gba Jo̩natan, i kakini, E̩wñ omi che ta? Udu e̩wñ omi fe̩? E̩wñ la chʼadure kʼu ta eju ata-we̩ kʼi atene oji-mi taa?
Take, I pray thee, my blessing that is brought to thee; because God hath dealt graciously with me, and because I have enough. And he urged him, and he took	Agba, e̩ mʼe̩wñ ugwa-mi ku ma du wa le̩ gba, todabu kʼO̩jo̩ chʼufe̩de̩nyo̩ ñwu mi, kʼu laño̩ chenʼe̩wñ du. Abe̩le̩ i kutʼowñ, oñ i mu-gba.

And your father hath deceived me, and changed my wages ten times; but God suffered him not to hurt me.	Ata-me̩ muda chʼumi uji, i la mʼe̩wñ uro̩me̩-mi rida onu me̩gwa, O̩jo̩ muda je̩ ñw u che mi e̩bie̩ne̩ du n.
And the servant that was set over the reapers answered and said, It	Tak e̩nuko̩lo̩ kʼabo ku ma kpʼo̩ka le̩ jʼef o̩wo̩-wñ dohi kakini, Igbe̩le̩ abo Moab kʼowñ kpai Neomi kpe̩re̩ kwʼane̩ Moab wa de̩.
He sendeth the springs into the valleys,	I aje̩ ñw e̩bi omi e̩bi omi cha nyʼef o̩go̩ o̩go̩:

These ten times have ye reproached me:	Onu me̩gwa ku me̩ bʼumi ina de̩;
And when Moses saw that the people	Tak e̩gba ku Mose̩s li kʼamone̩ le̩ mʼofe-ma du tʼo̩fe̩ (todu Aro̩n je̩ ñwu ma dʼofe-ma tʼo̩fe̩ ki mud ubio̩la ugbo ame̩nebi-ma),

And they smote the rest of the Amalekites that were escaped, and dwelt there unto this day.	Oñ ma fʼabʼe̩bo̩bo̩ Amale̩k ku ma fʼuma o̩wo̩ igbele gwoda. Ma la dodo o̩mo̩ gbogbo tʼemni.
That which groweth of its own accord of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undressed:	Uwe̩ ki la ya inane̩ uche̩-we̩ kpai e̩ro achiwebe̩te̩ma kʼe̩ ma ño̩ n le̩ jo̩ n; o̩do̩ uñmi yo̩o̩ tod ane̩ le̩ i ache.
And when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,	E̩gba ku ma la kwʼef o̩ko̩ tane̩, ababale̩ amone̩ fʼowñ ma,
above all, taking the shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be able to quench all the fiery darts of the wicked.	me̩ mʼo̩kpatabili ugbe̩yo̩ e-e̩do̩ ekono gba manyʼe̩wñ du, me̩ neke dʼe-le̩ kpʼo̩fa-una e̩ne̩bibi le̩ lu chaka.
thou which hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him; and spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled	kʼe̩ la fʼe̩wñ kʼe̩ katane̩ ñwu Defid ata-mi de ñw u me̩; ochochi, e̩ nʼalu-we̩ ko̩la, tak e̩ nʼo̩wo̩-we̩ che kpa, alu ki de̩ eñini-i.

And it came to pass, when king Jeroboam heard the saying of the man of God, which had cried against the altar in Beth-el, that he put forth his hand from the altar, saying, Lay hold on him. And his hand, which he put forth against him, dried up, so that he could not pull it in again to him.	Oñ i lewatu, e̩gba kʼonu gbo̩ o̩la kʼe̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ le̩ ka, owñ chʼe-kʼi kwa bʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ e-Be̩te̩l ma le̩, taku Je̩ro̩boam fʼo̩wo̩-wñ nadala ugbo kʼi dago kpenyʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩ le̩, kakini, Me̩ gwo̩nyʼu. For he said unto him,	Todu i ka ñw u kakini, Kwʼef e̩ne̩ le̩ dufu, uwe̩ afu ki ma de̩hiolo n.
And by a prophet the	Jihofa la du Israe̩l kwʼoj ane̩ Ijipti wa lʼo̩wo̩ akache̩,
And they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because the Egyptians might not eat bread with the Hebrews; for that	Taku ma mʼe-owñ du gugu ojoji ñw u, e-ma la dʼugbo e-ma, e-abo Ijipti ku ma je̩ e̩wñ kpai owñ dʼugbo e-ma, todabu ki ma dugbo kʼabo Ijipti aje̩ e̩wñ kpai abo Hibru n, tod e̩wñ ibie̩ne̩ i che ñw abo Ijipti.
Now David had said, Surely in vain have I kept all that this	Defid la fʼo̩la-i katane̩ e̩gba le̩ me̩, kakini, Ede kʼu de e̩wñ du kʼe̩ne̩-i ne̩ aje̩tachi kʼe̩wñ du kʼo̩wo̩-wñ ne̩ ma lenyo̩ n, chʼofofo: i la d ʼe̩bie̩ne̩ rʼo̩me̩ e̩nyo̩ ñwu mi.
And all that heard him were astonished at his understanding and answers.	Ibe abo du ku ma netirʼu mukpatuka tod eju-wñ ki chene̩ kpai ohi kʼi adu ñwu ma.
And Ishbi-benob, which	oñ Ishbibe̩nob, kʼi de̩ ef amo̩ma akachi le̩, uwoji o̩kwo̩-wñ tʼe̩bo̩ me̩gweji le, alu ku ma ñwa ihio̩, e̩wñ ido̩na ogu kʼi ji mʼo̩la chʼetito̩, oñ i nʼibe ka kʼi adu Defid kpa.
And Asa in the thirty and ninth year of his reign was diseased in his feet, until his disease	Oñ o̩do̩ ogue̩gwa nyoke me̩la kʼEsa jʼonu o̩ga fʼe̩re̩-wñ mu, o̩ga-wñ la bie̩ne̩ alo waa, i chaka chʼef oga-wñ le̩ i tene Jihofa n, chai amobochi.
And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage: and the door was shut.	Oñ ubi ma abu ku ma nyʼala, o̩ko̩ya etito̩ le̩ lewa. Tak abo kʼo̩la-ma chʼe̩mu tane̩ mugudu nyʼugbo uje̩wñ iyawo kpai owñ, oñ ma fʼo̩na re.
But the goat, on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before the	ma muda adʼudeju o̩mewo e-kʼanya je̩ tod Azaze̩l wa o̩gba Jihofa, ku ma dʼu che e̩wñ e̩boma, ku ma fʼu kpuche̩ alo tef aje̩tachi todu Azaze̩l.
Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.	Me̩ ki kʼe̩re̩ oji okokolo n, me̩ ki ja o̩wo̩ meji ilagba-me̩ kʼi bo̩ piepiele n.
And the child grew, and waxed strong in spirit, filled with wisdom: and the grace of God was upon him.	Oñ imo̩to̩ le̩ anana waa, i la nʼukpahiu nyo̩gba, ibe che̩ko̩ ñw u, ufe̩de̩nyo̩ O̩jo̩ la gugu oji-wñ.
For jealousy	Todu ogu eja chʼe̩do̩fulu one̩,
When thou art departed from me to day, then thou shalt find two men by Rachel's sepulchre in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee, The asses which thou wentest to seek are found: and, lo, thy father hath left the care of the asses, and sorroweth for you, saying, What shall I do for my son?	E̩gba kʼe̩ kwo bʼumi te̩ eñini-i, uwe̩ ali aboke̩le̩ meji ugbo ojinoji Reche̩l, aio̩me̩ Be̩njamin Ze̩lza; oñ abo le̩ aka ñw e̩ kakini, Ma fʼamo̩ke̩ke̩te̩ kʼe̩ nyʼatene le̩ li me̩; e̩ la go, e-amo̩ke̩ke̩te̩ le̩ awʼata-we̩ eju ge̩ n, ejiji e-we̩ i ada kakini, Ab u nache e-o̩ma-mi ta?
Therefore thus saith the	Todule̩ abu ki Jihofa. O̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l, aka ugbo amadidala ku ma dejutʼamone̩-mi de̩ kakini, Ame̩ fʼame̩wño̩re̩-mi egini kpatuka me̩, me̩ la fʼuma ne rinyo̩, me̩ la fejute̩ ma n. Go, omi anʼe̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ ku me̩ jʼache wa afejudo me̩, Jihofa aka-i.
Help,	Jihofa te̩ko-o, todu e̩ne̩ ki akpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩ de̩ ge̩ n;
And the saying pleased me well: and I took twelve men of you, one of a tribe:	O̩la le̩ la nyo̩ mi eju; oñ u mʼaboke̩le̩-me̩ me̩gweji ko, e̩ne̩ʼka e̩ne̩ʼka chʼutodu o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu okoke du;
Are	O̩chaka-ma chʼame̩nukpuche̩? O̩chaka-ma chʼamakache̩? O̩chaka-ma chʼamakone̩wñ? O̩chaka-ma chʼamachʼuko̩lo̩ ukpahiu?
Uriah the Hittite: thirty and seven in all.	Uraya, e̩ne̩ He̩t: o̩chaka-ma chʼogue̩gwa nyoke mebie.
and said, This	ma kakini, Owñ-i ka kakini, U neke fʼunyi O̩je̩ Ejefu-i gulo̩ tak u namʼu du ko̩ o̩jo̩ me̩ta.
And ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.	i la dʼume̩ e̩do̩ ku me̩ wʼugbo mi ku me̩ anʼiñmi n.
The prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What	Akache̩ ki nʼo̩na i ki ka oj o̩na-wñ dufu ke, e̩ne̩ ki la nʼo̩la-mi i ki kʼo̩la e-mi o̩gbolo. Ma dʼelikpo ñwa e̩yo̩ o̩ka? Jihofa aka-i.
But after I am risen again, I will go before you into Galilee.	Ama anubi ekwane̩-mi nadʼo̩gba-me̩ nyi Galili.

He that is wounded in the stones, or hath his privy member cut off, shall not enter into the congregation of the	E̩ne̩ kʼi chʼonoji dagba eikpa-wñ kpo̩fo̩, dagba i chʼeko ma kʼo, i ñʼagudu wʼef ujeju Jihofa n.

And thou shalt make for it four rings of gold, and put the rings in the four corners that	Uwe̩ ki la ada elika o̩jamalia me̩le̩ todu-wñ, oñ e̩ mʼelika le̩ ko nyʼalo-wñ me̩le̩ ugbo e̩re̩-wñ me̩le̩.
Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;	Ama ke, me̩ ki nʼe̩wñ ache alu kʼo̩mane̩ ache nyo̩nyo̩ bʼUche̩nyo̩ Kraisti jo̩: todu dagba u lewa ali me̩, dagba kʼeju-mi ma dane̩ n, todu kʼu gbʼinabali-me̩ kakini, Ame̩ dago ef afuʼka, e̩do̩-me̩ chʼoka, oñ me̩ jo̩ abʼomune̩ dobulu ñw o̩la e̩do̩-ekono e-Uche̩nyo̩;

And Naomi said, Turn again, my daughters: why will ye go with me?	Oñ Neomi kakini, Me̩ mudabi, amo̩ma-mi! E̩wñ chi kʼame̩ ale bʼumi? Omi ño̩ nʼo̩ma efu ku ma achʼo̩ko̩-me̩ ta?
For thou, Lord,	Todu uwe̩, Ondu, chʼe̩ne̩nyo̩, uwe̩ hika tʼo̩la no̩ ñw one̩, ufe̩de̩nyo̩-we̩ la chʼe̩kute̩ ñw abo du ku ma kwadʼuwe̩.

and they shall be afraid: pangs and sorrows shall take hold of them; they shall be in pain as a woman that travaileth: they shall be amazed one at another; their faces	e̩do̩-ma la ada kpu.
The children of the other Elam, a thousand two hundred fifty and four.	Amo̩ma Elam ekeji le̩ chʼicham nyʼulo̩ko̩ nyʼooje nyoke me̩le̩.
Is	I chʼe-kʼa ka ñw e̩ Ijipti le̩ de̩ ka kʼe̩ tʼuwa no̩ kʼa chʼuko̩lo̩ adu ñw abo Ijipti n? Todu i ma nyo̩ tule ñw a kʼa chʼuko̩lo̩ adu ñw abo Ijipti tʼeku ef aje̩tachi-i le.

And the king said unto his servants, Know ye not that there is a prince and a great man fallen this day in Israel?	Tak onu ka ñw abo-wñ kakini, Ame̩ chema ka kʼagboji kpai e̩ne̩ lile lewane̩ ane̩ Israe̩l eñini n?
And David said unto him, From whence comest thou? And he said unto him, Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.	Taku Defid ka ñw u kakini, Ugbo e̩ kwo wa? Oñ i ka ñw u kakini, U fʼuma o̩wo̩ kwʼuru abogu Israe̩l wa.
And if any man obey not our word by this epistle, note that man, and have no company with him, that he may be ashamed.	I la che̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ du ma gbʼo̩la-wa kʼi dʼef o̩takada-i gbo n, me̩ fʼeju kʼo̩ hi, todu ku me̩ ki we̩ edʼu cho̩la, todu kʼi fejutunyane̩.
He came unto his own, and his own received him not.	I wʼugbo e̩wñ e-wñ; abo e-wñ la gbʼo̩ n.
He was more honourable than the thirty, but he attained not to the	I nʼojima tʼabo ogue̩gwa le̩ le, o̩wo̩-wñ muda tu abo me̩ta ejodudu le̩ n. Defid la mʼabo ide-wñ ko nyef o̩wo̩-wñ.
And as soon as he knew that he belonged unto Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who himself also was at Jerusalem at that time.	Tak abu kʼi fu ma ka kʼi kwʼojane̩ ku He̩ro̩d nʼo̩da-wñ, i fʼowñ kpe̩ nyʼugbo He̩ro̩d, abu kʼowñ onugo la de̩ Je̩rusale̩m o̩jo̩ kʼa ka-i.
He	I dabe̩ne̩ kʼibe̩a kʼi kpala anede e̩la ñw mi,
In the first	Ochu ejodudu, o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩le̩ ochu le̩, ame̩ aje̩ E̩laloji, uje̩wñ uyo̩-wñ chʼo̩jo̩ mebie; uje̩wñ ki ma nʼo̩jo̩wu n oñ ame̩ aje̩.
In that day shall Israel be the third with Egypt and with Assyria,	O̩jo̩ le̩ Israe̩l achʼe̩ne̩ke̩ta manyʼIjipti kpai Asiria, e̩nyo̩ ki kwʼugbo O̩jo̩ ki atʼalumeji ane̩-ile̩-i ma ache,
Surely	Ochochi, alu kʼo̩ya ki adʼo̩wo̩ tef ukpo arʼo̩kpo̩ akwo bʼo̩ko̩-wñ te̩,

And if a stranger shall sojourn among you, and will keep the passover unto the	I la che̩wñ kʼilowa ge̩ne̩ efu-me̩, kʼi dʼe̩ e̩do̩ kʼi ade Elaloji ñwu Jihofa, alu kʼuhio̩me̩ Elaloji de̩, kpai alu ku ma kpʼoji o̩la-wñ te̩, abe̩le̩ i ache; ame̩ ane̩ uhio̩me̩ okate, i chaka chʼilowa, i chaka chʼo̩mane̩.

And about the time of her death the women that stood by her said unto her, Fear not; for thou hast born a son. But she answered not, neither did she regard	Oñ abu kʼi ache kʼi ku abobule̩ ku ma dago kpenyʼu ka ñw u kakini, E̩ ki railo n, todu e̩ fʼo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi me̩. I muda dohi n, i la nyʼeti re n.

and offered at the dedication of this house of God an hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin offering for all Israel, twelve he goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.	E̩wñ ku ma la ko wa e̩gba ku ma bi unyi O̩jo̩ le̩ de̩: amo̩kokuno̩ chʼogume̩lu, amokolo chʼo̩gwo̩ko̩, amo̩mala chʼulo̩ko̩; oñ e̩wñ adure eko wa tod abo Israe̩l chaka chʼamobuko̩ me̩gweji alu kʼaluka o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu abo Israe̩l de̩.
But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither, if we eat, are we the better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.	Uje̩wñ la adʼuwa dago ñw O̩jo̩ n: dagba a ma je̩ n, a nya n; dagba a je̩, a anana tule n.
and he said unto Aaron, Take thee a young calf for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and offer	oñ i ka ñw Aro̩n kakini, Mʼo̩mʼokuno̩ o̩ko̩ʼka du todu iche̩bo̩ adure, kpai okoloʼka todu iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo, ejeji-wñ ki mufu, kʼe̩ mʼuma ko wa che o̩gba Jihofa.
Set ye up a standard in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations, prepare the nations against her, call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashchenaz; appoint a captain against her; cause the horses to come up as the rough caterpillers.	Me̩ dʼagaliga dago oj ane̩-i,
and in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.	ku me̩ ma chʼokpo abo ku ma kobʼume̩ le̩ ef e̩wñ du n; e-te̩ chʼujiwe ule-nyo̩ ñwu ma, i muda chʼujiwe ujadu ugbo e̩-me̩, e-i la kwʼugbo O̩jo̩.
Speak, ye that ride on white asses,	Ame̩ ku me̩ tano o̩ke̩ke̩te̩ efufu le̩,
and	Me̩ chema abu kʼu ma dʼo̩wo̩ mo̩ e̩wñ du ki nʼile kʼu we eduka ñw me̩ n, u la we eko̩ me̩ ejʼo̩ja kpai unyi unyi n.

and he shall cleave it with the wings thereof,	I agwo̩nyu ika-wñ meji kʼi fʼu fana, i muda afana nyane̩ kpa n. Tak atama agu e-le̩ jo oj ubo̩ iche̩bo̩, oj iji ki jʼoj una le̩; e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo i che, owñ chʼe̩wñ eduwa lʼugbo una kʼi akpo ru Jihofa.
And he said, Wherefore doth my lord thus pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil	Oñ i kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼodu-mi anʼadu-wñ ule-i ta? Todu ab u che? Abe̩k e̩bie̩ne̩ e̩wñ dʼef o̩wo̩-mi?

Taku ma takpa kwane̩; oñ i lewatu abu kʼo̩jo̩ añwa bulubulu, Samiue̩l do̩ So̩l wʼoj o̩pata unyi le̩ kakini, Kwane̩, kʼu fʼe̩ kpe̩ kwʼemi alo. Taku So̩l kwane̩, oñ amameji ledufu, owñ kpai Samiue̩l.

of the doctrine of baptisms, and of laying on of hands, and of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment.	kpʼo̩la baptism, kpʼo̩wo̩ ekonʼone̩, kpʼabo ki ku edajikwane̩ kpʼajo̩ o̩gbegbele̩ ekʼone̩.
And I have declared unto them thy name, and will declare	U la je̩ ñwu ma mʼodu-we̩, naño̩ je̩ ñwu ma ma ge̩; todu kʼufe̩do̩ e-kʼe̩ ne̩ fe̩do̩ mi ki nadʼef uma, kʼomi kʼu la dʼef uma ge̩.
But if the Spirit of him that raised up Jesus from the dead dwell in you, he that raised up Christ from the dead shall also quicken your mortal bodies by his Spirit that dwelleth in you.	I la che̩wñ kʼAfu e̩ne̩ ki du Jisus dajikwane̩ kwef abo ki ku dodo ef ume̩ mak e̩ne̩ ki du Kraisti Jisus dajikwane̩ kwef abo ki ku le̩ ñʼadʼiñmi ñw año̩la-me̩ e-uku-i ge̩ lef Afu-wñ kʼi dodo ef ume̩.
For thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas;	Tod uwe̩ dʼumi rikpolo tef unefu,
While ye have light, believe in the light, that ye may be the children of light.	Abu ku me̩ chene̩ ugane̩ le̩ me̩ nake̩do̩no ugane̩ le̩ todu ku me̩ ki mud amo̩ma ugane̩.
God brought them out of Egypt;	O̩jo̩ ko ma kwʼIjipti dufu wa-i;
Behold, their valiant ones shall cry without: the ambassadors of peace shall weep bitterly.	Go, amo̩ga-ma jʼo̩do̩da akwa;
But exhort one another daily, while it is called To day; lest any of you be hardened through the deceitfulness of sin.	me̩ ki la dugbe̩do̩ ñw omune̩ o̩jo̩ñwa o̩jo̩ñwa ku ma do̩ kʼeñini; tode̩gba kʼe̩wñ ki jʼef ila adure aje̩ ñw e̩do̩-me̩ no̩.
Also I will make him	Omi ñʼadʼowñ chʼo̩mo̩gba-mi ge̩,
And he searched,	Oñ i tejane̩, i chane̩ ugbo e-ogijo, i kpoji ugbo e-imo̩to̩; ma la fʼago le̩ li ef akpulu Be̩njamin.
Now to him that worketh is the reward not reckoned of grace, but of debt.	Ma fʼo̩me̩ ku ma ra ñw e̩ne̩ ki achuko̩lo̩ lo̩na ufe̩do̩-e̩nyo̩ n, chai lo̩na o̩me̩ eje̩.
And he went and sent to Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, saying, The king of Moab hath rebelled against me: wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle? And he said, I will go up: I	Tak i le nakpʼuche̩ ru Jiho̩shafat onu Juda kakini, Onu Moab ko̩ mi me̩; e̩ je̩ kʼe̩ lebʼumi akʼogu bo̩ Moab? Oñ i kakini, Nale; omi dʼalu kʼuwe̩ de̩, abo-mi la dab abo-we̩, amanya-mi ño̩ dab amanya-we̩ ge̩.
And his father refused, and said, I know	Ata-wñ muda ko̩, oñ i kakini, U chema, o̩ma-mi, u chema; owñ le año̩ chʼuche̩ amone̩ kpo̩fo̩, owñ año̩ chʼelile ge̩; okekele-wñ muda anana tʼowñ le, oñ ugbe̩-wñ amud ukpe̩ko̩ amone̩ uche̩ uche̩.
So the posts passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, even unto Zebulun: but they laughed them to scorn, and mocked them.	Abe̩le̩ amime̩cho̩ja ku ma fule le̩ le gu ef ewo ewo du oj ane̩ Ifraim kpai Manasa gbogbo wa Ze̩biulo̩n; ma muda nyʼuma anyi nacha, oñ ma kʼuma ru.
The	Jihofa che kʼi jadu mi me̩,
And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spake to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.	Oñ abo ku ma chi tʼamone̩ le̩ ofe kpai amako̩takada-ma ledufu, oñ ma ka ñw amone̩ le̩ kakini, Abu ku Fero ka de̩ kakini, Nakʼegbe ñwu me̩ ge̩ n.
For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?	Ama iche̩wñ ki chelʼef olemi e-mi oñ ochochi O̩jo̩ chʼo̩be̩le̩ke̩te̩ jo̩ kʼi chʼojima ñw u, e̩wñ chi ku ma ñʼakajo̩ mi dabe̩ne̩ kʼomi chʼe̩nadure ta?
	Ugbo kʼekuku ma de̩ n, o̩gba e̩ga ugbo ku ma wa kpa omiofo,
If thy brother be waxen poor, and hath sold away	I la che̩wñ kʼale fʼo̩maye-we̩ mu kʼi la mʼane̩-wñ ojiʼka du ta, e̩gbale̩ abʼo̩wo̩ ata-wñ abe̩k abo̩wo̩ iye-wñ awa kʼi mʼe̩wñ kʼo̩maye-wñ ko ta le̩ gba tane̩.
And Moses took the rod from before the	Taku Mose̩s mʼo̩kpa le̩ du kwʼo̩gba Jihofa, alu kʼi ñwa ñw u.
And thou shalt take the breast of the ram of Aaron's consecration, and wave it	Tak uwe̩ amʼache̩do̩ okolo Aro̩n ki chʼe-kʼi ko nyʼo̩wo̩ e̩ko̩ le̩ du, kʼe̩ miejo o̩gba Jihofa kʼi che e̩wñ eduwa miejo; e-le̩ la achʼukpe̩ e-we̩.
that Hanani, one of my brethren, came, he and	Hanani, o̩maye-miʼka, lewa, owñ kpai aboke̩le̩ Juda iche̩ka; tak u tʼuma ene o̩la amaJu ku ma mufu tane̩, owñ chʼame̩namu ki bo̩ le̩, kpai o̩la Je̩rusale̩m.
For the time	Todu iko kʼajo̩ chane̩ kwʼunyi O̩jo̩ lewa me̩; i la che̩wñ ki chane̩ ugbo e-wa ejodudu mak e̩wñ chʼukpoji abo ku ma ko̩ egbʼUche̩nyo̩ e-O̩jo̩ gbo̩ ke?
At the last it biteth like a serpent,	E̩gba otitala-wñ i ulʼone̩ dab ejo̩,

I have digged, and drunk water; and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of the besieged places.	U fʼura gwa,
As the nations which the	Alu kʼabo uche̩ichi e-ki Jihofa naje̩ ñwu ma lenyo̩ rʼame̩ o̩gba de̩ alu le̩ ame̩ alenyo̩ ge̩; todabu ku me̩ ko̩ enetirʼomu Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩.

For	Amo̩ma-ma aje̩ja, e̩do̩-ma chʼe̩no̩; ama le̩ nakpʼe̩ ru. Uwe̩ ki ka ñwu ma kakini, Abu kʼOndu Jihofa aka de̩.

I have considered the days of old,	U fʼe̩wñ iko igbele lo me̩,

Your remembrances	O̩la ibe-me̩ chʼita elulu,
And the king hath sent with him Zadok the priest, and Nathan the prophet, and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and they have caused him to ride upon the king's mule:	onu la fi Zedok, atama kpai Netan, akache̩, kpai Be̩naya, o̩ma Jiho̩yada, kpʼabo Ke̩re̩t kpʼabo Pe̩le̩t kpuche̩ lebʼo̩; oñ ma je̩ ñw u tane̩ imiulu onu ale;

But the ark of God had David brought up from Kirjath-jearim to	(Defid muda dʼakpati O̩jo̩ kwo Kiriat-jearira wʼugbo ki Defid ñwo̩che te̩ ñw u e̩gbale̩ me̩; todu i fʼunyabo fa tod uwñ Je̩rusale̩m.)
I have caused thee to multiply as the bud of the field, and thou hast increased and waxen great, and thou art come to excellent ornaments:	U je̩ ñw e̩ wewe nyʼo̩gba dab e̩wñ ki aya oko, oñ e̩ nana nyo̩gba, kʼe̩ la tabale-i, tak e̩ kʼe̩wñ ijaga e-ijaga nyʼo̩la; e̩ fʼe̩nya gwu, iloji-we̩ ño̩ gwe̩; e̩ muda tʼago ofo kpo̩, oñ ago ofo-we̩ chʼo̩pee.

And the women said unto Naomi, Blessed	Tak abobule̩ le̩ ka ñwu Neomi kakini, Jihofa ki nele, owñ kʼi ma tʼuwe̩ no̩ kʼe̩ we enʼefu o̩pio̩o̩ eñini-i n; odu-wñ ki nʼuwohi ane̩ Israe̩l.
Thirty and two years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.	O̩do̩-wñ chʼogue̩gwa nyoke meji e̩gba kʼi chane̩ ejʼonu; i la jʼonu Je̩rusale̩m o̩do̩ me̩jo̩.
And again, Esaias saith,	Aizaya ño̩ ka kakini,
And the priest shall make an atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and it shall be forgiven them; for it	Tak atama afʼe̩bo-ma che todu abo o̩gbadu abo Israe̩l chaka, taku ma ato̩no̩ ñwu ma; todu ela i la, ma la mʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩-ma duwa ñwu Jihofa lugbo una, ma fʼiche̩bo̩ adure-ma che o̩gba Jihofa me̩, tod ela ku ma la le̩;

But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith,	E̩ro e-Afu muda chʼufe̩do̩ kpʼuyo̩ kpʼure̩do̩ kpʼe̩do̩-eje̩ kpʼumo̩la kpʼe̩nyo̩ kpʼechubi one̩
Praise the	Je̩nyu ñw Jihofa. O Je̩rusale̩m!
Moreover the brasen altar, that Bezaleel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, had made, he put before the tabernacle of the	Anubile̩ ge̩, ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ e-ebijeikpa ku Be̩zale̩l o̩ma Uri o̩ma He̩r che dʼo̩gba uña ugugu Jihofa o̩mo̩; oñ So̩lo̩mo̩n kpʼabo ujeju le̩ tene Jihofa ugbo-wñ.
And there was delivered unto him the book of the prophet Esaias. And when he had opened the book, he found the place where it was written,	oñ ma mʼo̩takada Aizaya akache̩ du ñw u. Tak i mʼo̩takada le̩ chi, oñ i li ugbo ku ma kʼolubutu kakini,
In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, came the word of the	Ochu e̩ke̩jo, o̩do̩ ekeji ki Darius jʼonu, o̩la Jihofa wʼugbo Ze̩karaya akache̩, o̩ma Be̩rikaya o̩ma Ido, kakini,
And he carved	Tak i fʼina iche̩rub kpai oli ki dab e̩kpe̩ kpʼododo ki mutu ko nyʼu; oñ i kʼo̩jamalia gamʼo̩, i fʼu ka tunyʼina-wñ.
Then said I, Woe	Tak u kakini, Atogwo chʼe-mi! e-mi ta me̩! todabu kʼomi chʼe̩ne̩ kʼi nʼuko kʼi chechiwa, kʼu laño̩ dodo alumeji amone̩ kʼuko-ma chechiwa: todu eju-mi dʼOnu, owñ che Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du!
In the year of this jubile ye shall return every man unto his possession.	O̩do̩ o̩ga echi-i e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-me̩ adabi tʼunyi e-wñ.
Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.	Abe̩le̩ e̩ ki ra bʼe̩ño̩ e̩wñ kʼokolobia ache le̩ te̩, kʼe̩ nabʼo̩kpakpa kpʼe̩do̩ eko̩no kpʼufe̩do̩ kpʼure̩do̩ kpe̩re̩ manyʼabo ku ma do̩ Ondu udo̩ kwef e̩do̩ ki de̩hiolo.
The waters compassed me about,	Omi le̩ lʼumi daka gbogbo wa kad onugo-mi;
Notwithstanding the king's word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the king, to number the people of Israel.	I chaka ka abe̩le̩, o̩la onu fʼe-Joab du, kpai e-amagboji ogu-wñ. One dieth in his full strength,	I nʼe̩gba kʼiñmi e̩ne̩ʼka ako̩ kpa tak i aku,

And thou shalt take of the blood thereof, and put	Tak uwe̩ ache e̩bie̩-wñ, kʼe̩ dʼu kado igba-wñ me̩le̩ kpʼoji alo e̩bale-wñ me̩le̩ kpʼoji e̩wñ ku ma be̩ tʼo̩ daka. Abe̩le̩ uwe̩ agwʼo rinyo̩, kʼe̩ fʼe̩wñ e̩boma che tod uwñ.
then will I also walk contrary unto you, and will punish you yet seven times for your sins.	e̩gbale̩ omi alule̩ tʼaboji ñwu me̩, oñ nagwo me̩, omi onugo agwo me̩ onu mebie tod adure-me̩.

But if he thrust him suddenly without enmity, or have cast upon him any thing without laying of wait,	I muda che̩wñ kʼi dʼe̩wñ gwunyʼu achigili ku ma ma chʼe̩no̩la-wñ n, abe̩k i dʼe̩wñ ro̩ dʼo kʼi ma kpala unede̩ owñ n,

And he killed James the brother of John with the sword.	I la nʼugbada kpa Jeme̩s o̩maye Jo̩n.
And it came to pass, when she travailed, that	Abe̩le̩ e̩gba kʼi achefu le̩, oka dʼo̩wo̩ dufu; tak e̩ne̩ kʼi agbʼoji o̩ma mʼowu ekpikʼpa du ji mʼo̩wo̩-wñ, i kakini, E-ki dufu wa ejodudu de̩.
and Zadok, a young man mighty of valour, and of his father's house twenty and two captains.	Kpai Zado̩k kʼi chʼokolobia kʼi chʼagbiti kʼi nʼuwohi manyʼamagboji abogu ogu nyoke meji kwʼunyi ata-wñ.
And on the other side of Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, an hundred and twenty thousand.	Abo Rube̩n kpai abo Gad kpai ukpe̩reji o̩lo̩pu abo Manasa kʼo̩la-ma che̩mu ñw ogu ku ma kwʼudaba Jo̩rdan wa chʼicham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ugbo o̩gbo̩ me̩fa.
Nevertheless, whereto we have already attained, let us walk by the same rule, let us mind the same thing.	Alu du ki de̩, ugbo kʼa lewa tu, a ki nalule̩ tʼeju e-le̩ gbage̩de̩.
And the men of Shechem set liers in wait for him in the top of the mountains, and they robbed all that came along that way by them: and it was told Abimelech.	Tak aboke̩le̩ She̩ke̩m kʼabo-ma iche̩ka kpalajo̩ oj uwo, oj uwo, oñ e̩ne̩ du kʼi lale ugbo ma o̩mo̩ ma bʼo̩ gbʼane̩; oñ ma mʼu du ka ñw Abime̩le̩k.
But his citizens hated him, and sent a message after him, saying, We will not have this	Abane̩-wñ muda chulaka-wñ oñ ma fʼabogijo kpe̩ tʼo̩ ubi, ma kakini, I dʼuwa e̩do̩ kʼe̩ne̩-i ki chʼonu-wa n.
When the	E̩gba ki Jihofa mʼabo Zayo̩n ku ma mu le̩ ko dabi wa,
Therefore thou shalt have none that shall cast a cord by lot in the congregation of the	Todule̩ uwe̩ ñʼanʼe̩ne̩ du kʼi arʼanya kʼiku e̩ñwa ki je̩ ñw e̩ ef ujeju Jihofa n.
The Jews answered him, saying, For a good work we stone thee not; but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.	AmaJu dohi ñw u kakini, I chʼutodu uko̩lo̩ o̩me̩me̩le̩ oñ a kʼokuta ro̩ dʼe̩-i n, chai todu akpabie̩ O̩jo̩ kʼe̩ che; i laño̩ chʼutodabu kʼuwe̩ kʼe̩chʼone̩ adʼo̩la-we̩ chʼO̩jo̩.
then shall they know that I	Tak ama ama ka kʼomi Jihofa, O̩jo̩-ma de̩, oñ chʼabu kʼu je̩ ñwu ma nyʼef amu ef abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi, kʼu laño̩ mʼuma ko wa oj ane̩-ma ajo̩; u ñʼatʼe̩ne̩ du ef uma no tʼo̩mo̩ ge̩ n;
Now I am come to make thee understand what shall befall thy people in the latter days: for yet the vision	Fa-i, u la lewa kʼu je̩ ñw e̩ mʼoji e̩wñ ki ake̩re̩bʼamone̩-we̩ e̩gba iko otitala; todu ane̩ ego le̩ chʼutodu iko o̩jo̩ ki dʼubi.
Therefore I said, Hearken to me;	Todule̩ u kakini, Netirʼumi;
All his transgressions that he hath committed, they shall not be mentioned unto him: in his righteousness that he hath done he shall live.	Ma ñʼarewa ada du kʼi je̩ ku ma dʼu gwunyʼu ge̩ n: i adeju ef e̩wñ o̩kpakpa kʼi che.
And Saul smote the Amalekites from Havilah	Taku So̩l fʼabo Amale̩k gwoda, akwo Hafila abu kʼe̩ nyi Shur, e-ki dʼo̩gba Ijipti le̩.
And in this mountain shall the	Taku Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du anʼe̩wñ e̩nyo̩ hi uje̩wñ uyo̩ ñw amone̩ du oj uwo-i, uje̩wñ o̩te̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma ki bie̩ nyu, kpʼe-e̩wñ oyo kʼo̩ko̩to̩ chʼe̩kefu-wñ, e-o̩te̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma ki bie̩ nyu ku ma fʼu ta jalii.
Baana the son of Ahilud;	Beana, o̩ma Ahilud, ne̩ Taanak kpai Me̩gido kpai Be̩t-shean ki dʼokolo Zaretan, o̩gane̩ Je̩zree̩l le̩, akwo Be̩t-shean wa Abe̩l-mehola gbogbo tʼudaba Jokmeam chaka;
And all Judah stood before the	Oñ abo Juda chaka kwo̩dago jo̩ o̩gba Jihofa, manyʼamo̩ma-ma egini kpʼamo̩ya-ma kpʼamo̩ma-ma.
The lips of the wise disperse knowledge:	Uko̩ amanibe afʼe̩wñ ema fiatuka;
And I turned, and lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came four chariots out from between two mountains; and the mountains	Tak u ño̩ chʼeju-mi nyʼate̩ ago, e̩ la go, o̩kogu me̩le̩ kwʼagbagba uwo meji dufu; uwo le̩ la chʼuwo ebijeikpa.
For the terrible one is brought to nought, and the scorner is consumed, and all that watch for iniquity are cut off:	Todu ma mʼe̩nubailo le̩ du chʼofofo, e̩ne̩ ki ache̩de̩te̩ le̩ atakpa,
And Jesus answering said unto them,	Taku Jisus ka ñwu ma kakini, Amo̩ma o̩kpanachi kide̩ ane̩ o̩ya, ma laño̩ ko ma kpo̩ko̩ ge̩:
And a mighty king shall stand up, that shall rule with great dominion, and do according to his will.	Tak onu ki gbitiʼka akwane̩. I anʼo̩da lile ache e̩wñ du ki dʼowñ e̩do̩.
And they gave out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, these cities which are	Taku ma ño̩ mʼewo ewo kʼa kʼodu-ma jo̩-i ko ñwu ma kwef e̩wñ o̩lo̩pu abo Juda kpai kwef e̩wñ o̩lo̩pu abo Simeon,
And Ashur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.	Oñ Ashur ata Te̩koa nʼo̩ya meji, Hila kpai Neara.

A word fitly spoken	O̩la ku ma ka iko-wñ
She maketh fine linen, and selleth	I ahi ukpo line̩n reju kʼi dʼu ta;
The words of the wicked	O̩la kʼame̩ne̩bibi aka chʼala ekpa anede e̩bie̩,

but he that is married careth for the things that are of the world, how he may please	ama e̩ne̩ ki nʼo̩ya nʼejiji e̩wñ ile̩-i eda, alu kʼi ale kʼi anyʼo̩ya-wñ eju. Oñ ibe-wñ chʼejeji.

all these	Abo-i chaka chʼamo̩ma Himan, agane̩ onu ef O̩la O̩jo̩, kʼi dʼigba-wñ kwane̩. O̩jo̩ la mʼamo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ me̩gwe̩le̩ kpʼamo̩ma onobule̩ me̩ta ko ñwu Himan.

If there be a controversy between men, and they come unto judgment, that	Iche̩wñ kʼiñwa chi ñw one̩ meji, ku ma dʼo̩la-ma ajo̩, ku ma fʼajo̩-ma ka; mak ama ki dale ñw e̩no̩kpakpa, ku ma ki kpa e̩ne̩bibi abi.

I have sent among you the pestilence after the manner of Egypt: your young men have I slain with the sword, and have taken away your horses; and I have made the stink of your camps to come up unto your nostrils: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the	U dʼe̩wñ ibi kpuche̩ wʼef ume̩ alu ki de̩ Ijipti;
