Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, till all be fulfilled.	Ami, naka ñwu me̩, kakini, I nʼugbo du kʼabo̩gba-i alale, gbogbo tak e̩wñ-i chaka wache n.
The righteous also shall see, and fear,	Ame̩no̩kpakpa ali, oñ ailo amʼuma,
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñw u kakini, E̩ ki dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Je̩zree̩l ; todu iko bo̩ pe̩e̩ tak omi anache̩ e̩bie̩ Je̩zree̩l abʼunyi Jihiu ma, oñ na je̩ ñw o̩fe̩ ojane̩ Israe̩l ki ku.
Now Sarai Abram's wife bare him no children: and she had an handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name	Se̩rai, o̩ya Ebram, la bi o̩ma ñw u n. Oñ i ne̩ imo̩to̩ onobule̩ kʼi ache e̩wñ ñw u, e̩ne̩ Ijipti i che, odu-wñ ko̩ Hega;
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kpai Aro̩n, i kakini,
And of the children of Israel's half, which Moses divided from the men that warred,	Oñ kwef ukpe̩reji e-abo Israe̩l e-ku Mose̩s fʼe-ma kpai e-abo ku ma nyʼoko ogu le̩ kpe̩ru ojoji—
And the fifth angel poured out his vial upon the seat of the beast; and his kingdom was full of darkness; and they gnawed their tongues for pain,	Tak e-e̩ke̩lu mʼucha-wñ du darʼoj ede e̩la le̩; tak ojane̩-wñ mud e̩chubi te̩; taku ma kwolʼukpalu-ma tod ewo ki awo̩ ma,
sorrowing most of all for the words which he spake, that they should see his face no more. And they accompanied him unto the ship.	e-kʼi awo̩ ma tule oñ chʼo̩la kʼi ka kakʼama ñʼali eju-wñ ge̩ n. Taku ma chaite̩-wñ wʼugbo o̩ko̩.
That thou mayest walk in the way of good	Todu kʼuwe̩ ki lule̩ o̩na ame̩ne̩nyo̩
For I am a man under authority, having soldiers under me: and I say to this	Todu omi onugo chʼe̩ne̩ kʼu dʼef o̩da, kʼu nʼamisoja o̩wo̩-mi, oñ naka ñw e-i kakini, Lo, i la alo; oñ naka ñw ekeji kakini, lewa, i la awa; u la aka ñw adu-mi kakini, Chʼe-i, i la ache.
And he said unto them,	Tak i ka ñwu ma kakini, Ame̩ chʼabo ku me̩ dale ñw o̩la-me̩ eju amone̩; O̩jo̩ muda chema ef e̩do̩-me̩; todu e̩wñ ki nʼojima ef amone̩ chʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ eju O̩jo̩.
O	O Jihofa, uwe̩ chema;
Behold, the days come, saith the	Go, o̩jo̩-wñ awa, Jihofa ka-i, kʼama ane̩ ewo-i ñw Jihofa, akwʼo̩do̩go̩ Hanane̩l gbogbo wʼalaku agbade aku meji le̩.
And he said, Lo,	Tak i kakini, Go, i chʼo̩ro̩ka gbaa ta, i la chʼiko kʼame̩wñ ukpa ajejujʼugbo okate de̩ n; me̩ fʼomiofo kpa ñw ame̩wño̩re̩ egini ku me̩ lo tekedu e̩wñ ñwu ma je̩.
And the	Oñ Jihofa ka ñw u kakini, Ane̩ kʼu go̩ ñw Ebraham kpai Aise̩k kpai Jeko̩b, kʼu kakini, Nadu ñw ugbe̩-we̩ le̩ de̩: omi je̩ ñw e̩ li kpai eju-we̩, uwe̩ muda adaba nyʼo̩mo̩ n.
Thou shalt also be a crown of glory in the hand of the	Uwe̩ lʼachʼike̩be̩ alifia ef o̩wo̩ Jihofa
And the land shall mourn, every family apart; the family of the house of David apart, and their wives apart; the family of the house of Nathan apart, and their wives apart;	Oñ ane̩-i adaido̩, akwo̩ra unyi du adate̩ ojoji; akwo̩ra unyi Defid adate̩, amo̩ya-ma adate̩; akwo̩ra unyi Netan adate̩, amo̩ya-ma la adate̩ ojoji;
therefore ye shall see no more vanity, nor divine divinations: for I will deliver my people out of your hand: and ye shall know that I	Todule̩ ame̩ ñʼali ane̩-ego e-ibe̩te̩ ge̩ n, me̩ la abʼifa n. Oñ nagbʼabo-mi bʼume̩ o̩wo̩ te̩; tak ame̩ ama ka kʼomi Jihofa de̩.
Mine eyes	Eju-mi adʼugbo abo ku ma chubi mi oj ane̩-i,
and Goshen, and Holon, and Giloh; eleven cities with their villages:	kpai Goshe̩n kpai Holon kpai Gilo: ewo me̩gwaka manyu ikpo unyi ikpo unyi-ma.
And the Spirit and the bride say, Come. And let him that heareth say, Come. And let him that is athirst come. And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely.	TʼAfu, tʼo̩ya-etito̩ le̩ kakini, Lewa. E̩ne̩ ki la gbo̩ kʼi nakakini, Lewa, oñ e̩ne̩ kʼolugbe̩ akpʼo̩, kʼi nawa: e̩ne̩ du ki dʼowñ e̩do̩ ki lewa gba omi e-iñmi ele ofofo.
My confusion	Eju-mi kad ukata-mi ku ma chi gbogbo dʼo̩jo̩,
and the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.	tak Afu Kiafo̩ gwo̩ru wa tanʼo, año̩la-wñ dab ikede, tak omuko̩la ka kwʼefojale kakini, Uwe̩ chʼO̩ma ufe̩do̩-mi; u fʼuyo̩-mi li ef uwe̩.
And the rest of the acts of Amaziah,	Oñ e̩wñ ki bo̩ kʼAmazaya che, inabali-wñ che̩ko̩ rʼef o̩takada Iko E̩wñ kʼAmonu Juda che le̩ n?
All the days of his separation he	O̩jo̩ du kʼi fʼo̩la-wñ date̩ kade le̩ i afo̩ ñwu Jihofa.
For the law made nothing perfect, but the bringing in of a better hope	todu o̩lo̩da le̩ mʼe̩wñ du fu kpoji n, oñ ma dʼibe ekono ki nyo̩ tule wa koji-wñ, lef e-le̩ oñ a ate̩me̩rʼO̩jo̩.
And they were coupled beneath, and coupled together at the head thereof, to one ring: thus he did to both of them in both the corners.	Ma chʼegamʼomune̩ o̩gane̩; tak oji-wñ ate̩ tunyʼelikaʼka, abe̩le̩ i fʼeji che tod ugbo kʼalo-wñ meji ade.
those that were numbered of them,	abo e-o̩lo̩pu Ze̩biulo̩n ku ma kaluka le̩ chʼone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko ugbo ooje nyoke mebie nyʼone̩ ulo̩ko.
Out of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the	Ma chi kwef e̩wñ kʼogu-ma je̩ jo oñ ma che ki fo̩ ku ma ane̩ chʼuko̩lo̩ ef unyi Jihofa.
I will surely assemble, O Jacob, all of thee; I will surely gather the remnant of Israel; I will put them together as the sheep of Bozrah, as the flock in the midst of their fold: they shall make great noise by reason of	O Jeko̩b, omi akʼabo-we̩ chaka jeju chuu,
Behold, the	Go, Jihofa mʼu du kpogo
And thou shalt anoint the tabernacle of the congregation therewith, and the ark of the testimony,	Uwe̩ ki dʼe-le̩ kulu o̩la unyabo ujeju kpai akpati ibenu le̩,
His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen;	O̩re̩la-wñ aje̩ rinyo̩, ku ma we eliʼu;
For they have not served thee in their kingdom, and in thy great goodness that thou gavest them, and in the large and fat land which thou gavest before them, neither turned they from their wicked works.	Todu ma rʼe̩ ojane̩-ma n, kpʼef e̩nyo̩-we̩ inaina kʼe̩ du ñwu ma le̩ kpʼojane̩ lile ki arʼo̩je̩ kʼe̩ dute̩ ñwu ma le̩ n, ma la dʼubi gbʼuko̩lo̩ e̩bie̩ne̩-ma le̩ n.
And will not rather say unto him, Make ready wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serve me, till I have eaten and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?	kʼi ma la aka ñw u n kakini, E̩ ki fʼo̩je̩ o̩kpane̩ hi ñwu mi, kʼe̩ laño̩ dʼe̩wñ tʼo̩la-we̩ kʼe̩ che e̩wñ ñwu mi, gbogbo tak u je̩ kʼu la ñmo̩ kpa; tak ubi e-le̩ uwe̩ aje̩ uwe̩ la añmo̩?
he cropped off the top of his young twigs, and carried it into a land of traffick; he set it in a city of merchants.	i fʼe̩pa-wñ ki dʼoji-wñ ate̩ ko̩da nyʼalu oñ i mʼu du le tʼoj ane̩ amanyaja, oñ i mʼu du nyi ef ewo amanyaja.
And Joab answered and said, Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.	Taku Joab dohi kakini, E-le̩ ki me̩ru mi n, e-le̩ ki me̩ru mi n, kʼomi ki kʼe̩wñ mi abe̩k ekpʼo̩ bie̩.
For	Todu, i kakini, O̩la o̩takada-wñ chewoji, i la chegbiti; i muda lewa año̩la-wñ che̩gbo, uko̩la-wñ la chʼibe̩te̩.
it seemed good to me also, having had perfect understanding of all things from the very first, to write unto thee in order, most excellent Theophilus,	abu kʼu fʼe̩re̩ e̩wñ le̩ du chi kwʼuchane̩-wñ o̩bio̩bie̩, omi ño̩ do̩ ki nyo̩ kʼu ko̩ o̩takada rʼuwe̩ alu ki de̩ aro̩ne aro̩ne, Teo̩filo̩s uwe̩ e̩ne̩gbani;
Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for	Abe̩le̩ u fʼo̩la mu tane̩ tod unyi O̩jo̩-mi, alu du kʼo̩wo̩ bo̩jo̩ kade, o̩jamalia do̩mo̩ tod e̩wñ o̩jamalia, ajifa do̩mo̩ tod e̩wñ ajifa, ebijeikpa do̩mo̩ tod e̩wñ ebije ikpa, ebije do̩mo̩ tod e̩wñ ebije, oli la do̩mo̩ tod e̩wñ oli, manyʼe-le̩ okuta one̩ks do̩mo̩ kpʼokuta ku ma da e̩wñ nyʼu, kpʼokuta o̩tajele, kpʼokuta kʼina-wñ chʼojoji ojoji, kpʼokuta akoko ojoji ojoji chaka, kpʼokuta marbe̩l e̩kute̩.
and the	oñ Jihofa we̩do̩ mu ma wu tʼe̩te̩te̩te̩ kwʼane̩-ma ef e̩do̩fulu, kpai ef ubieju inaina, oñ i mʼuma ko rikpolo tʼoj ane̩ omune̩, alu ki de̩ eñini-i.
And when he was at the place, he said unto them,	Oñ abu kʼi tʼugbo le̩ i ka ñwu ma kakini, Me̩ chadua ku me̩ we etʼef ajama.
And he brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he measured the gate according to these measures.	Tak i mʼumi du wʼef anuku o̩wo̩ olodudu-wñ; oñ i fʼalaku-wñ ñwa teju e̩ñwa e-le̩ ge̩;
And the princes, governors, and captains, and the king's counsellors, being gathered together, saw these men, upon whose bodies the fire had no power, nor was an hair of their head singed, neither were their coats changed, nor the smell of fire had passed on them.	Oñ abu kʼamakomomi kpʼamakoji onu kpʼamigo̩bina kpʼabo̩hiala onu jʼugbo kate o̩mo̩, ma fʼabo-i li kʼuna ma nʼukpahiu du año̩la-ma n, kʼiloji oji-ma la jo n, i la chʼafe̩-ma abu du n, e̩ la gbʼulu una o̩la-ma n.
Moreover he said unto me, Son of man, all my words that I shall speak unto thee receive in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.	I ño̩ ka ñwu mi kakini, O̩ma one̩, o̩la du kʼomi aka ñw e̩, e̩ mugba tʼef e̩do̩-we, kʼe̩ la nʼeti-we̩ gbo̩,
And he made the most holy house, the length whereof	Tak i fʼunyi efo̩ e-efo̩ ko̩; ujiji-wñ chʼalu kʼunabe̩ unyi le̩ de̩, owñ chʼohiba o̩gu, unabe̩-wñ la chʼohiba o̩gu; tak i kʼo̩jamalia ki de̩ hiolo alu tale̩nt ulo̩gwa lamʼo̩.
And it shall come to pass in that day,	Tak i awache iko le̩ kʼOndu adʼo̩wo̩-wñ tʼo̩ onukeji kʼi fʼe̩bobo̩ amone̩-wñ la ñw o̩la-wñ, owñ chʼabo ku ma bo̩bo̩ kwʼAsiria kpai Ijipti kpai Patro̩s kpai Kush kpai Elam kpai Shainar kpai Hemat kpai ala ala ohimini abadi.
Then said Elijah unto the people, I,	Tak E̩laija ka ñw amone̩ kakini, Omi, omi kate bo̩ kʼu chʼakache̩ Jihofa; amakache̩ Beal la chʼone̩ oli me̩la.
but chiefly them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and despise government. Presumptuous	abo kʼe-ma to̩gba chʼabo ku ma lule̩ tʼo̩re̩la ubi ef e̩ño̩ e̩wñ ki akpone̩ bie̩ ku ma laño̩ dʼe̩no̩da du rʼoche̩ke̩ne̩.
And the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon, which brought gold from Ophir, brought algum trees and precious stones.	Oñ abuko̩lo̩ Huram kpʼabuko̩lo̩ So̩lo̩mo̩n, ku ma kʼo̩jamalia kwʼOfir wa, ño̩ kʼoli algum kpʼokuta akoko wa ge̩.
If the scourge slay suddenly,	Iche̩wñ kʼedili kpʼone̩ achigili,
and one goat	manyʼo̩mewoʼka tod iche̩bo̩ adure; abo e-le̩ achʼojoji ñw iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo o̩ko̩ko̩lo̩ le̩ kpai e̩wñ ele-wñ kpai omi-wñ.
They encourage themselves	Ma dʼugbe̩do̩ ñw o̩la-ma ugbo e̩wñ bie̩ne̩ ku ma ñwa le̩;
Let no man therefore despise him: but conduct him forth in peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.	todule̩ e̩ne̩ du ki dʼo̩ rʼibe̩te̩ n. Me̩ ki la chʼo̩na ule̩-wñ ef ure̩do̩, todu kʼi wʼugbo mi: todu omi kpʼamo̩maye le̩ jʼemi aneju-wñ.
Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?	Todule̩ ma ñʼawe ekʼe̩wñ ki jʼef e̩hia-ma dajane̩ alo waa,
Thus she committed her whoredoms with them, with all them	I la tʼo̩la-wñ no̩ ñwu ma, o̩chaka-ma chʼabo Asiria ku ma fe̩rʼeju tule; oñ i nʼode ode abo du kʼibe-wñ tʼo̩ le̩ fʼo̩la-wñ daji.
And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven,	I nʼe̩ne̩ du ki te̩gu nyʼefojale n, chai e̩ne̩ ki gwo̩ru kwʼefojale wa, owñ chʼO̩ma One̩ kʼi dʼefojale.
The ninth	E̩ne̩ e̩ke̩la tod ochu e̩ke̩la chʼAbieze̩r e̩ne̩ Anato̩t e-abo Be̩njamin. One̩ ki la jʼef uche̩ e-wñ che icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ogu nyoke me̩le̩.
The sluggard	E̩nejudo̩o̩ nʼibe eju o̩la-wñ tʼone̩
I write not these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn	I chʼanyo̩ nako mʼume̩ o̩takada kʼu nako̩-i n, chai dabe̩ne̩ kʼibe oñ nadu tʼamo̩ma-mi kʼu nafe̩do̩ efu.
and Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirma. These	kpai Jeuz kpat Shokia kpai Mirma bi ñw u; abo-i chʼamo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, abo ku ma dʼoji dufu ef amata ma che.
And the king of the children of Ammon answered unto the messengers of Jephthah, Because Israel took away my land, when they came up out of Egypt, from Arnon even unto Jabbok, and unto Jordan: now therefore restore those	Tak onu amo̩ma Amo̩n dohi ñw amonuche̩ Je̩fta le̩, kakini, Todu e̩gba kʼabo Israe̩l kwʼIjipti awa le̩ ma mʼane̩-mi gba akwo Amo̩n gbogbo wa Jabo̩k, kpai gbogbo wa Jo̩rdan; todule̩ e̩ namʼo̩wo̩ ta bʼane̩ le̩ te̩ ye̩e̩.
Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.	Aboʼka la añwo̩ dabe̩ne̩ kʼomi ma ñʼawʼugbo me̩ ge̩ n.
And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay the wood in order upon the fire:	Tak amo̩ma Aro̩n atama le̩ akʼuna jʼoj ubo̩ iche̩bo̩, ma la atʼiji jo̩ oj una le̩;
I call heaven and earth to record this day against you,	Oñ nado̩ ojale kpai ile̩ ku ma gbibenu nyʼume̩ eñini-i, ka kʼomi mʼiñmi kpai uku kpai e̩nyo̩ kpai ama kojo̩ o̩gba-me̩-i; todule̩ e̩ mʼiñmi du, kʼuwe̩ kpai ugbe̩-we̩ ki deju,
and for a sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lambs of the first year: this	e̩wñ iche̩bo̩ ure̩do̩ la chʼokuno̩ meji, okolo me̩lu, obuko̩ me̩lu, kpai amala o̩mo̩do̩ ʼka me̩lu. Abo e-le̩ la chʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩ e-E̩lize̩r o̩ma She̩deur.
for I am with thee, and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much people in this city.	todabu kʼomi dʼubi-we̩, e̩ne̩ du la akobʼuwe̩ kʼi achʼuwe̩ e̩bie̩ne̩ n; todabu kʼamone̩ wewe jʼewo-i ñw mi.
Go in, speak unto Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.	Nyʼejefu, kʼe̩ ka ñwu Fero, onu Ijipti, kʼi tʼamo̩ma Israe̩l no̩ ku ma kwo bʼane̩-wñ te̩.
Then the king promoted Shadrach, Meshach, and Abed-nego, in the province of Babylon.	Tak onu ko Shedrak kpai Mishe̩k kpʼAbe̩d-nego nyo̩gba ef uko̩lo̩ ojane̩ Babilo̩n.
For since I spake, I cried out, I cried violence and spoil; because the word of the	Todu e̩gba du kʼu nako̩la ekwa nakwa.
And thou shalt say unto them, This	Uwe̩ ki la ka ñwu ma kakini, E̩wñ ki lʼugbo una ku me̩ aduwa ñwu Jihofa le̩ de̩: amo̩ma ala o̩mo̩do̩ʼka kʼi mufu meji eji o̩jo̩ñwa o̩jo̩ñwa, ku ma chʼiche̩bo̩ e̩gujo o̩ko̩ko̩lo̩.
	I chʼabu kʼate̩ko du ma dʼefu-mi ni n?
He shall be great, and shall be called the Son of the Highest: and the Lord God shall give unto him the throne of his father David:	Owñ le̩ anana,
Also thou shalt not approach unto a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is put apart for her uncleanness.	Uwe̩ ki te̩me̩ru onobule̩ ki dʼelifo̩ kʼe̩ fʼu tago ofo n.
From the place of his habitation he looketh upon all the inhabitants of the earth.	ugbo kʼi dodo i anyope̩ ago
I acknowledged my sin unto thee,	U je̩ ñw e̩ ma adure-mi,
Seeing there be many things that increase vanity, what	Abu kʼe̩wñ wewe do̩mo̩ ki aje̩ ñw e̩wñ o̩wai nana nyo̩gba, ugbo e̩tule e-one̩ de̩ efu-wñ?
And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.	Omi la adʼugbe̩ʼka kwefu Jeko̩b dufu,
Have I committed an offence in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God freely?	Abe̩k adure u ta o̩la-mi kʼu hiwane̩ kʼame̩ ki hidago le̩? todabu kʼu fʼUche̩nyo̩ O̩jo̩ je̩rʼume̩ ele ofo?
I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.	Todule̩ u nʼe̩do̩-chacha akpe̩ owñ wa tule, todu kʼame̩ ki li u ku me̩ dabi yuyo̩ ge̩, kʼe̩do̩dudu e-mi ki buchi.
And	Tak amone̩ adodo ef uwñ, ekojo̩ ñw uku ñʼade̩ ge̩ n; Je̩rusale̩m muda agugu to̩ko̩o̩.
But God forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, by whom the world is crucified unto me, and I unto the world.	Ama O̩jo̩ ki kpo̩na nyʼuba e̩ba ñw omi, chai ef oli-uku Ondu-wa Jisus Kraist, lef e-le̩ ile̩-i chʼe̩kamoli ñw omi, omi laño̩ chʼe̩kamoli ñw ile̩.
And the Tirshatha said unto them, that they should not eat of the most holy things, till there stood	Tak igo̩bina ka ñwu ma ka kʼama ki we eje̩ e̩wñ efo̩ e-efo̩, gbogbo tak atama ki ne̩ Urim kpai Tumim ki kwane̩.
But ye	Ame̩ muda chʼo̩lo̩pu kʼO̩jo̩ chi. Me̩ chʼuche̩ amatama kʼo̩wo̩ onu ne̩ me̩, abo uche̩ichi kiafo̩, amone̩ todu kʼo̩wo̩-wñ ki ne̩ me̩ ki nʼugbo ku me̩ akʼunyo̩-wñ dufu, owñ ki fʼume̩ do̩ kwef e̩chubi tef ugane̩-wñ ki chʼawuwu le̩.
and began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!	Taku ma chane̩ egwʼo̩ ugwa kakini, Agba-o, Onu amaJu!
Rejoice evermore.	Me̩ nayo̩ e̩gba du.
The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.	Afu alo tʼo̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩,
And there were four leprous men at the entering in of the gate: and they said one to another, Why sit we here until we die?	E̩gbale̩ abo̩ga ikpemute me̩le̩ jʼalaku: oñ ma ka ñw o̩la-ma kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼawa gugu emi gbogbo tak a ku?
And those officers provided victual for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon's table, every man in his month: they lacked nothing.	Oñ abo ku ma ko dago jo̩ le̩ nʼuje̩wñ eko wa todu So̩lo̩mo̩n onu, kpai tod e̩ne̩ du ki awʼitebulu So̩lo̩mo̩n onu, e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ ne̩ ochu e-wñ; ma je̩ ñw e̩wñ du ki ña ma n.
But there are some of you that believe not.	Ama aboʼka jʼef ume̩ ku ma ma ke̩do̩no n. Todu Jisus chema kwʼejodudu abo ki che ku ma ma ke̩do̩no n, kpai e̩ne̩ ki adʼowñ ñw amone̩ mu.
For I will take you from among the heathen, and gather you out of all countries, and will bring you into your own land.	Todu omi ako me̩ kwef abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi, kʼu la ako me̩ kwʼoj ane̩ ane̩ du wa jo̩, oñ nako ma wa oj ane̩ e-me̩ onugo.
And when the people were come into the wood, behold, the honey dropped; but no man put his hand to his mouth: for the people feared the oath.	Oñ e̩gba kʼamone̩ le̩ lewa efoko le̩, go, iño̩ akito̩ wʼane̩. E̩ne̩ du muda hi o̩wo̩-wñ mʼalu n; todu amone̩ arailo ego̩ ku ma go̩ le̩.
What ye know,	E̩wñ kʼame̩ ma, omi ño̩ ma ge̩;
And Moses commanded the children of Israel according to the word of the	Taku Mose̩s ñwa ñw abo Israe̩l alu kʼo̩la Jihofa ka le̩ kakini, E̩wñ kʼabo o̩lo̩pu amo̩ma Jose̩f ka le̩ chʼochochi.
And the men did the work faithfully: and the overseers of them	Abo le̩ fʼuko̩lo̩-wñ che alu ku ma achubi one̩ nyo̩nyo̩. Oñ abo ku ma du ñwu ku ma fejute̩ ma che Jehat kpai Obadaya, ku ma chʼabo Lifai ef amo̩ma Me̩rari; kpai Ze̩karaya kpai Me̩shulam, ef amo̩ma Kohat, ku ma fejutʼo; abo Lifai-i chaka la chʼo̩ka e̩wñ eli enu.
For this is the will of God,	Todu e̩wñ ki dʼO̩jo̩ e̩do̩ de̩, owñ che kʼame̩ ki nafo̩, ku me̩ fʼo̩wo̩ mʼo̩la ne̩ bʼe̩wñ abutabu eche te̩,
Wherefore, my dearly beloved, flee from idolatry.	Tod e-kide̩, abufe̩do̩-mi, me̩ ki ra bʼode eche te̩.
When I therefore was thus minded, did I use lightness? or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be yea yea, and nay nay?	Todule̩ eneku kʼu neku ewʼugbo me̩ le̩ chʼe̩wñ fuye̩e̩ eju-me̩? e̩wñ kʼu neku-wñ, naneku-wñ likpa o̩re̩la, todu kʼi-i, i-i, kpai o̩da, o̩da, ki dʼugbo mi?
Behold, I	Go, omi chʼe̩nagwunyʼuwe̩, Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du ka-i, u la agu okogu-we̩ jo ef odudu, oñ o̩kwo̩chageli afʼamo̩ma idu-we̩ lie̩ rinyo̩; u la akʼe̩wñ kʼuwe̩ akpa kʼe̩ je̩ da bʼane̩ ile̩ te̩, e̩ne̩ du ñʼagbo̩ omuko̩la amonuche̩-we̩ ge̩ n.
and Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.	abu kʼi fu Pe̩le̩g bi E̩be̩r ño̩ dʼo̩do̩ ulo̩ko̩ nyʼogue̩gwa, i laño̩ bi amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩.
not rendering evil for evil, or railing for railing: but contrariwise blessing; knowing that ye are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.	me̩ ki chʼone̩ e̩bie̩ne̩ koji e̩bie̩ne̩ kʼi che me̩ n, me̩ ki bʼina koji ina n, chai adua one̩ me̩ ka; todabu ku ma fʼume̩ do̩ tef e-le̩, todu kʼame̩ ki je̩ e̩nyo̩ O̩jo̩ e̩wñ ogu.
Their wings	ika-ma gamʼomune̩; abu ku ma alo ma na n; e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ muda fʼeju kparʼo̩gba-wñ alo.
And thou shalt make boards for the tabernacle	Tak uwe̩ ane̩ oli akesia che akatakpo uña ugugu le̩, edago i adago.
And they shall be coupled together beneath, and they shall be coupled together above the head of it unto one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.	ma a gamʼomune̩ e̩re̩-wñ o̩gane̩, tak i amanyʼomune̩ kʼoji-wñ ki tunyʼelikaʼka; abe̩le̩ i ade̩ ñw ejeji-wñ; ab e-le̩ achʼalo-wñ meji.
And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes thereof: two tenth deals shall be in one cake.	Tak e̩ mʼomu te̩ke̩te̩ke̩ du kʼe̩ fʼakala me̩gweji de̩; ukpe̩gwa meji ajʼef akalaʼka.
And he carried out thence all the treasures of the house of the	Tak i mʼe̩wñ akoko unyi Jihofa chaka, kpai e̩wñ unyi onu ko kwʼo̩mo̩, oñ i fʼe̩wñ eku ku ma nʼo̩jamalia che ko̩da rinyo̩ pe̩le̩pe̩le̩, owñ chʼe-ku So̩lo̩mo̩n onu Israe̩l che ef unyi Jihofa, alu ki Jihofa ka le̩.
Yea, though he live a thousand years twice	Dagba i chaka deju o̩do̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ onu meii, kʼi ma la li e̩nyo̩ du n, o̩chaka-ma anyʼugbo kate n?
And he said unto me, Son of man, I send thee to the children of Israel, to a rebellious nation that hath rebelled against me: they and their fathers have transgressed against me,	I ka ñwu mi kakini, O̩ma one̩, ekpʼuwe̩ nakpʼuwe̩ nyʼugbo amo̩ma Israe̩l, ugbo abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi ku ma ma gbʼe̩nyo̩ n, ku ma la ko mi; ama kpʼamata-ma te̩tajʼada gbogbo tʼeñini kide̩.
O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance;	O O̩jo̩, abuche̩ichi mugudu wʼef e̩wñ ogu-we̩;
Sing unto God, ye kingdoms of the earth;	Me̩ keli do̩ O̩jo̩, ame̩ ojane̩ ojane̩ ile̩-i;
And at Jerusalem dwelt	Oñ amo̩ma Juda iche̩ka kpʼamo̩ma Be̩n-jamin iche̩ka dodo Je̩rusale̩m. E-amo̩ma Juda che: Ataya, o̩ma Uzaya, o̩ma Ze̩karaya, o̩ma Amaraya, o̩ma Shefataya, o̩ma Mahalale̩l ef amo̩ma Pe̩re̩z;
And when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was taken up; and a cloud received him out of their sight.	Tak abu kʼi fʼo̩la-i ka, abu ku ma lʼagʼo, ma mʼu du le tʼate̩, oñ akpaʼka mʼowñ gba bʼuma eju te̩.
to be	ku ma che e̩wñ ibe ibe kʼo̩la-ma ki de̩ yaala, ama ki fejutʼunyi e-ma, ama ki chʼame̩ne̩nyo̩, ama ki fʼo̩la-ma kamu-hite̩ ñwu amo̩ko̩ e-ma todu kʼamone̩ ki we echakpabie̩ o̩lO̩jo̩:
And the firstborn of the poor shall feed, and the needy shall lie down in safety: and I will kill thy root with famine, and he shall slay thy remnant.	O̩mo̩gba e̩nubie̩ la ajʼuje̩wñ,
As the cold of snow in the time of harvest,	Dab afu ki akpa abʼo̩la iko ku ma jʼachʼakanya e̩wñ oko eko wʼunyi
Wherefore remember, that ye	Todule̩ me̩ nalibekado kakini, E̩gba kʼame̩, abo uche̩ichi ef ore̩la chʼabo kʼabo ku ma do̩ ma ko̩ abo kʼo̩wo̩ one̩ da ma e̩pi ef o̩re̩la, ado̩ Ame̩ kʼabo e̩piodukulu;
And thou shalt appoint Aaron and his sons, and they shall wait on their priest's office: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.	Oñ uwe̩ achi Aro̩n kpai amo̩ma-wñ jo̩, tak ama afejute̩ uko̩lo̩ atama-ma le̩; e̩ne̩ ejaduña du kʼi ate̩me̩ru, ekpa ma akpa.
all the cities of the plain, and all Gilead, and all Bashan, unto Salchah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.	owñ chʼewo ewo egbili le̩ chaka kpai Gilead chaka kpai Beshan chaka gbogbo wa Saleka kpai E̩drei, kʼi chʼewo ewo ojane̩ O̩g Beshan.

And I went unto the prophetess; and she conceived, and bare a son. Then said the	oñ u te̩wʼugbo akache̩ onobule̩ le̩; i la fʼefu nyo̩, oñ i fʼo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi. Taku Jihofa ka ñw mi kakini, E̩ dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Mahe̩r-shalal-hash-baz;
Then Joab arose, and came to Absalom unto	Taku Joab kwane̩, oñ i lewʼugbo Absalom unyi-wñ, i ka ñw u kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼabuko̩lo̩-we̩ dʼuna tʼoko-mi?
Unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness:	Ugane̩ akwane̩ ef e̩chubi ñw ame̩-no̩kpakpa;

I have raised him up in righteousness, and I will direct all his ways: he shall build my city, and he shall let go my captives, not for price nor reward, saith the	Omi dʼu kwane̩ ef o̩kpakpa,
	I chʼe-one̩, olugbo-wñ dabe̩ne̩ kʼegbe;
and knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.	ma la ma n, gbogbo uwobi omi le̩ lewa, oñ i mʼuma ko chaka; abe̩le̩ ewa O̩ma One̩ ñʼade̩.

And thou shalt make upon the breastplate two rings of gold, and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.	uwe̩ ki la chʼelika o̩jamalia meji jʼo̩la e̩wñ ube̩do̩ma le̩, kʼe̩ la fʼelika meji le̩ ro̩ tʼeti e̩wñ ube̩do̩ma meji.
Then the king held out the golden sceptre toward Esther. So Esther arose, and stood before the king,	Tak onu fʼokute̩ o̩jamalia-wñ nadala ñw E̩sta, abe̩le̩ E̩sta kwane̩ oñ i kwodago o̩gba onu.
Righteousness keepeth	O̩kpakpa ade e̩ne̩ kʼo̩na-wñ de̩ kpo̩o̩lo,
Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people with his own blood, suffered without the gate.	Lef e-kide̩ Jisus onugo fʼuwa li ejo̩do̩da ala le̩, todu kʼi che kʼamone̩ le̩ ki fo̩, lef e̩bie̩ e-wñ,
And seekest thou great things for thyself? seek	Uwe̩ atene e̩wñ lile ñw o̩la-we̩? E̩ ki tene n; todu, go, omi akʼe̩bie̩ne̩ wa bʼoji o̩re̩la du ma, Jihofa ka-i; omi muda adʼoji-we̩ ñw e̩ kʼi chʼe̩wñ kʼogu je̩ ñw e̩ ugbo du kʼuwe̩ anyi.
And he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.	Oñ i lewa atakoya ef unyi ujeju-ma o̩gbo̩ ojane̩ Galili du, i laño̩ nʼamebili ane dufu.
And in their mouth was found no guile: for they are without fault before the throne of God.	Ma la li olemi ef alu-ma n, ma nʼe̩kpabie̩ o̩la n.
Take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of the Lord, for an example of suffering affliction, and of patience.	Amo̩maye, me̩ kʼamakache̩ ku ma ko̩la ef odu Ondu le̩ chʼe̩wñ uwo̩li uwa e̩bie̩ne̩ eli kpai e̩do̩ eje̩.
And they shall bring the glory and honour of the nations into it.	oñ ma akʼojima kpʼubumo̩ e-abo uche̩ichi wʼef uwñ.
But now I have written unto you not to keep company, if any man that is called a brother be a fornicator, or covetous, or an idolater, or a railer, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; with such an one no not to eat.	Fa-i u muda ko̩ rʼume̩ kakini, Iche̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ du ku ma do̩ kʼo̩maye chʼe̩nabutabu, abe̩k e̩nejufufu, abe̩k achode, abe̩k abʼone̩ ina, abe̩k añmo̩te̩ abe̩k adinya e̩wñ; me̩ ki gbʼo̩ chʼo̩la n; me̩ ki la bʼe̩ne̩ e̩go̩ le̩ jʼuje̩wñ n.
How long shall I see the standard,	Gbogbo nyʼe̩gba oñ nali agaliga le̩ kade?
Turn away my reproach which I fear:	Mʼina-mi kʼailo-wñ aba mi le̩ rida bʼumi te̩;
And the man that lieth with his father's wife hath uncovered his father's nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood	Oñ e̩ne̩ kʼi bʼo̩ya ata-wñ dachi mʼago ofo e-ata-wñ du te̩ me̩: ekpa ma akpa ejeji ma chuu, e̩bie̩-ma nʼoji o̩la e-ma onugo.
but at the place which the	chai ugbo ki Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ adu kʼi je̩ ñw odu-wñ dodo o̩mo̩, o̩mo̩ uwe̩ akpa e̩wñ Elaloji e̩gbʼane̩-wñ, abu kʼolu atunyʼane̩, iko kʼe̩ kwʼIjipti dufu wa le̩.
And while they	Oñ abu ku ma jʼo̩mo̩ acholuka kpʼowñ, amonoji onu lewa, oñ ma naju edu Heman nyʼoko̩te̩ kʼE̩sta ñwo̩che le̩.

For the king had taken counsel, and his princes, and all the congregation in Jerusalem, to keep the passover in the second month.	Todu onu kpʼamagboji kpʼabujeju du ku ma jo̩ Je̩rusale̩m fʼibe kpe̩ ka ku ma ade Elaloji ef ochu ekeji.
And they went forth, and preached every where, the Lord working with	Tak abo le̩ ledufu atakoya ugbo du, Ondu la bʼuma chuko̩lo̩, i je̩ ñw O̩la le̩ lonyane̩ lef ujiwe ki tʼo̩ ubi.]
Then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the glory of the	Abe̩le̩ u kwane̩, oñ u kwodufu nyʼegbili; e̩ la go, ojima Jihofa dago o̩mo̩, i dab ojima kʼu li o̩la ohimini Che̩bar le̩; oñ u lewa fʼeju bʼane̩ ma.
God shall bless us;	O̩jo̩ ade̩nyo̩ ñw a;
Are not five sparrows sold for two farthings, and not one of them is forgotten before God?	Ma ta amicho̩lo̩ me̩lu iko̩bo̩ meji n? okate ef uma alʼO̩jo̩ eju n.

Then answered Haggai, and said, So	Taku Hagai dohi kakini, Abe̩le̩ amone̩-i de̩, oñ abe̩le̩ abo ichi-i de̩ eju-mi-i, Jihofa ka-i; abe̩le̩ uko̩lo̩ du kʼo̩wo̩-ma che la de̩ ge̩; oñ e̩wñ du ku ma ko wa o̩mo̩ chʼe̩daji.
And it came to pass after this, that the king of the children of Ammon died, and Hanun his son reigned in his stead.	Oñ i lewatu ubi le̩ ge̩, kʼonu amo̩ma Amo̩n leku, taku Hanun, o̩ma-wñ, jʼonu koji-wñ.
Children's children	Amo̩ma e-amo̩ma chʼike̩be̩ abogijo,
and saying, Alas, alas, that great city, that was clothed in fine linen, and purple, and scarlet, and decked with gold, and precious stones, and pearls!	ma akakini,
that at that time ye were without Christ, being aliens from the commonwealth of Israel, and strangers from the covenants of promise, having no hope, and without God in the world:	kakini, Ame̩ jo̩ e-me̩ ojoji ñwu Kraist iko le̩, o̩wo̩-me̩ la dʼef e̩wñ ane̩ Israe̩l in, abu ku me̩ chʼononojo ugbo alo ku ma kpe̩ ugbo e̩wñ ku ma ko̩la-wñ tane̩ le̩, me̩ nʼukibeno n, me̩ nʼO̩jo̩ n, me̩ jo̩ ile̩-i ofofo.
then shalt thou enquire, and make search, and ask diligently; and, behold,	mak uwe̩ ki nitele-wñ, kʼe̩ la atejane̩, kʼe̩ tene o̩bie̩ o̩bie̩; e̩ la go, iche̩wñ ki dʼabe̩le̩, ka ku ma fʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ abe̩le̩ che alumeji-we̩ ochochi,
and turn ye not aside: for	me̩ ki la muna tʼo̩wo̩ʼka n; me̩ ki tʼe̩wñ ofofo ki ma nʼile n, ki ma la agbʼone̩ n, ubi n, todu e̩wñ le̩ chaka chʼo̩wai.
And the	Taki Jihofa kakini, Alu kʼadu-mi Aizaya-i tʼale ago ofo kpai e̩re̩ ofo o̩do̩ me̩ta kʼi chʼujiwe kpai e̩wñ awuwu ugbo o̩la Iiipti kpai o̩la Itiopia le̩,
and saying, Lord, my servant lieth at home sick of the palsy, grievously tormented.	oñ i kakini, Ondu, imo̩to̩-mi dachi ef unyi acho̩ga e̩kuto̩la, i ali uwa bie̩ne̩ bie̩ne̩.
For in much wisdom	Todu ibe ene̩ nana chʼe̩do̩ wuulu ene̩ nana,

While he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's	Abu kʼi nʼo̩la aka ta, ma kwʼunyi agboji unyi ujeju le̩ wa kakini, O̩ma-we̩ onobule̩ leku me̩; e̩wñ chi kʼe̩ che Akone̩wñ akanya ta?
And they sent out unto him their disciples with the Herodians, saying, Master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of God in truth, neither carest thou for any	Taku ma fʼamako̩che̩ e-ma kpai abo He̩ro̩d kpuche̩ nyʼugbo-wñ, ma kakini, Akone̩ e̩wñ, a chema ka kʼe̩ chʼe̩ne̩ ochochi, kʼe̩ la kʼone̩ o̩na O̩jo̩ ef ochochi, kʼo̩la e̩ne̩ du ma wʼe̩ eju n, todu uwe̩ ago eju one̩ n.
the third, Absalom the son of Maachah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith:	e̩ke̩ta che Absalom, o̩ma Maaka kʼi chʼo̩ma onobule̩ Talmai onu Gishur; e̩ke̩le̩ che Adonija o̩ma Hagit;
And he said unto them,	Tak i ka ñwu ma kakini, O̩ma One̩ chʼOndu o̩jo̩ uñmi.
And his mother answered and said, Not	Iye-wñ muda dohi kakini, O̩da, ma adʼodu-wñ ko̩ Jo̩n;
He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not with me scattereth abroad.	E̩ne̩ ki ma chʼe̩ne̩ ubi-mi n, mak e̩nagwunyʼumi de̩. E̩ne̩ ki ma la bʼumi yajo̩ n mak efiatuka i afiatuka le̩.
The children of Jericho, three hundred forty and five.	Amo̩ma Je̩riko chʼoli me̩fa nyʼo̩gbo̩lo̩ meji nyoke me̩lu.
The word of the	O̩la Jihofa ki wʼugbo Hosiya, o̩ma Been, iko Uzaya kpai Jotan kpai Ehaz kpai He̩ze̩kaya, amonu Juda, kpai iko Je̩roboam, o̩ma Joash, onu Israe̩l de̩.
And ye shall take no satisfaction for him that is fled to the city of his refuge, that he should come again to dwell in the land, until the death of the priest.	Ame̩ ki la gbʼo̩ko̩ e̩boma kʼe̩ne̩ ki ra nyʼo̩ke̩ko̩-wñ duwa kʼi la oji o̩la-wñ tane̩ kʼi dabi tʼane̩-wñ gbogbo tak atama lile ki ku n.

And he asked Pharaoh's officers that	Tak i tʼamonoji Fero ku ma jʼef o̩wo̩ one̩ ef unyi odu-wñ kpʼowñ ene kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼeju-me̩ chʼekpa jo̩ abe̩i eñini-i?
And the congregation sent thither twelve thousand men of the valiantest, and commanded them, saying, Go and smite the inhabitants of Jabesh-gilead with the edge of the sword, with the women and the children.	Tak abo o̩gbadu le̩ fʼamagbiti icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩gweji ku ma nʼuwohi tule kpe̩ nyʼo̩mo̩, oñ ma ñwa ñwu ma kakini, Lo, ku me̩ nʼalu ugbada fʼabo ku ma dodo Jebe̩sh-gilead gwodajane̩, manyʼabobule̩-ma manyʼabo-ma egini.
and through a window in a basket was I let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.	taku ma du mi tef agba lef ope o̩gba tane̩, oñ u fʼo̩ o̩wo̩.
And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters' table.	Ama i kakini, Ochochi, Ondu; todu i chaka chʼamabia ma je̩ e̩gbanyo̩ uje̩wñ ki akwʼoj itebulu amodu-ma wane̩.
But as it is written,	ki la dʼalu ku ma ko̩tane̩ kakini,
For finding fault with them, he saith,	Todu abu kʼi kalunyʼuma o̩la, i kakini,
And Joshua said unto all the people, Thus saith the	Taku Jo̩shua ka ñw amone̩ le̩ chaka kakini, Abu ki Jihofa, O̩jo̩ abo Israe̩l ka de̩ kakini, Igbele igbele amata-me̩ dodo ejudaba Yufretis le̩, owñ che Te̩ra, ata Ebraham kpai ata Neho̩r; oñ ma jʼare̩ amo̩jo̩ omune̩ o̩mo̩.

The brother of Michah	E̩shaya chʼo̩maye Maika; e-amo̩ma E̩shaya che Ze̩karaya.
They chose new gods;	Ma chi amo̩jo̩ etito̩,
But if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not consumed one of another.	I muda che̩wñ ku me̩ fʼomune̩ lo̩ ku me̩ fʼu je̩, me̩ nago tod efʼomune̩ lie̩.
For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness,	Todu nagbʼe̩wñ unye̩do̩ tod uji-ma,

And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name	Taku Juda fʼo̩ma onobule̩ abo Kenan oka li, odu-wñ ko̩ Shua; i la ne̩ chʼo̩ya oñ i nyʼejefu ugbo-wñ.
and he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the hill before the	Oñ i mʼuma ko nyʼabo Gibeo̩n o̩wo̩. Taku ma ko ma lo̩ oj uwo o̩gba Jihofa, oñ amamebie lewane̩ e̩gbakate. Ma la ko ma kpa iko ku ma kpa e̩wñ oko, e̩gba ejodudu-wñ e̩gba ku ma chane̩ ekpa o̩ka barli.
And as he passed over Penuel the sun rose upon him, and he halted upon his thigh.	Oñ olu kwane̩ bʼowñ ma abu kʼi lale gu Pe̩nie̩l du, i nachika ude-wñ.
Then a lord on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God, and said, Behold,	Tak agboji ogu e-kʼonu lo̩ nʼo o̩wo̩ alule̩ dohi ñw e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ le̩ kakini, Go, iche̩wñ ki Jihofa ma bi ope ope te̩ efojale, e̩wñ kʼe̩ ka-i ma neke che? Oñ i kakini, Go, uwe̩ aliʼi kpai eju-we̩, e̩ muda aje̩ n.
Then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went	Tak onu ogu le̩ gwo̩nyʼu o̩wo̩ tʼo̩wo̩ʼka, i tʼowñ ene, kakini, O̩la e̩wñ e̩ ne̩ kʼe̩ duka ñw mi?
and the	Jihofa laño̩ nʼo̩la-we̩ aka eñini kide̩ ka kʼe̩ chʼamone̩ todu kʼowñ kʼi ne̩, alu kʼi katane̩ ñw e̩ le̩, ka kʼuwe̩ ki de uko̩-wñ chaka,

And the Spirit of God came upon Saul when he heard those tidings, and his anger was kindled greatly.	Tak e̩gba kʼi gbʼo̩la-i, Afu O̩jo̩ lewa bu So̩l ma oñ uwe̩do̩-wñ mutajo tabale.

that she called unto the men of her house, and spake unto them, saying, See, he hath brought in an Hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and I cried with a loud voice:	i la nomudala do̩ aboke̩le̩ unyi-wñ, i ka ñwu ma kakini, Me̩ go, owñ dʼe̩ne̩ Hibruʼka wʼugbo wa kʼi chʼuwa uke̩; i wʼejefu ugbo mi kʼi bʼumi dachi, tak omi dʼomu nyate̩ akpogu;

Moreover I said unto the king, If it please the king, let letters be given me to the governors beyond the river, that they may convey me over till I come into Judah;	Uño̩ka ñw onu kakini, Iche̩wñ ki nyo̩ onu eju, kʼi naje̩ ñwu ma kʼo̩takada ñwu mi kʼu ko ñw amigo̩bina ku ma jʼudaba ohimini le̩, kʼama ki je̩ ñwu mi lale gudu gbogbo tak u lewa Juda;
Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be full.	Gbogbo wʼifa-i me̩ bi e̩wñ du ef odu-mi ta n, me̩ bi, me̩ la agba, todu kʼuyo̩-me̩ ki chʼe̩kefu.

but hast lifted up thyself against the Lord of heaven; and they have brought the vessels of his house before thee, and thou, and thy lords, thy wives, and thy concubines, have drunk wine in them; and thou hast praised the gods of silver, and gold, of brass, iron, wood, and stone, which see not, nor hear, nor know: and the God in whose hand thy breath	e̩ muda hi o̩la-we̩ ne akobʼOndu efojale; ma la kʼe̩wñ eku unyi-wñ wa jʼo̩gba-we̩-i, tak uwe̩ kpʼabojima-we̩ kpʼamo̩ya-we̩ kpʼamabadu-we̩, ne̩ e-le̩ ñmo̩ omi achiwebe̩te̩ma; uwe̩ la kele amo̩jo̩ aji-fa kpʼo̩jamalia kpʼebijekpa kpʼebije kpai oli kpʼokuta ki ma gane̩ n, i gbʼo̩la n, i la ma e̩wñ n; kʼuwe̩ ma la dojima ñw O̩jo̩ kʼiñmi-we̩ dʼef o̩wo̩-wñ n, e-kʼi ne̩ o̩na-we̩ du le̩.

But if the princes hear that I have talked with thee, and they come unto thee, and say unto thee, Declare unto us now what thou hast said unto the king, hide it not from us, and we will not put thee to death; also what the king said unto thee:	I muda che̩wñ kʼamagboji gbo̩ ka kʼomi ko̩la kpʼuwe̩, ku ma la wʼugbo we̩ aka ñw e̩ kakini, E̩wñ kʼe̩ ka ñw onu le̩, e̩ ka ñw a abajo̩-i; e̩ ki dʼu maja ñw a n, tak a we edʼe̩ kpa; kpʼe̩wñ kʼonu ño̩ ka ñw e̩ ge̩.

And all the people shall know,	amone̩ le̩ du la ama,
envyings, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such like: of the which I tell you before, as I have also told	kpʼelie̩na kpʼo̩te̩ eñmo̩ kpʼe̩wñ awulu eche kpʼe̩wñ ki dab e-le̩; naka ñwu me̩ tane̩ ugbo e̩wñ-i, alu kʼu ño̩ ka ñwu me̩ o̩gbo̩gba le̩ kakini, Abo ku ma jʼef e̩wñ e̩go̩-i ache aje̩ e̩wñ ogu ojane̩ O̩jo̩ n.
from which some having swerved have turned aside unto vain jangling;	Abu kʼabo iche̩ka ju lʼo̩wo̩ʼka, ma muna tef o̩la o̩wai eka.
For what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world, and lose his own soul?	Todu e̩wñ chʼile kʼone̩ aje̩, kʼi mʼo̩gbo̩ ile̩-i du gba nyʼo̩wo̩, kʼi la mʼonugo-wñ du chofu?

And they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men an hundred thousand.	Ma la mʼame̩wñu-kpa-ma ko; inyakulumi-ma che icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ooje, ame̩wño̩re̩ egini la che icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ oli me̩lu, amo̩ke̩ke̩te̩ la che icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ meji, onugo one̩ la che icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ogume̩lu.

Wherefore Adoni-zedec king of Jerusalem sent unto Hoham king of Hebron, and unto Piram king of Jarmuth, and unto Japhia king of Lachish, and unto Debir king of Eglon, saying,	Todule̩ Adoni-Zede̩k, onu Je̩rusale̩m le̩ fʼone̩ kpe̩ru Hohma onu He̩bro̩n, kpai Piram onu Jarmut, kpai Jafia onu Lakish, kpai De̩bir onu Eglo̩n, kakini,
	Abo kʼebi kpʼalugbe̩ e̩wñ o̩kpakpa akpa ma gbede, todu efu-ma ako̩.
As many were astonied at thee; his visage was so marred more than any man, and his form more than the sons of men:	Alu kʼawuwu-we̩ fʼamone̩ wewe mu—
And when Moses was gone into the tabernacle of the congregation to speak with him, then he heard the voice of one speaking unto him from off the mercy seat that	Tak e̩gba ku Mose̩s nyʼef unyabo ujeju kʼi ko̩la kpai owñ, i gbo̩ abu kʼomuko̩la le̩ dʼate̩ ñw ugugu unyie̩do̩ ki bʼoji akpati ibenu ma ako̩la ñw u, akwo alumeji amiche̩rub meji le̩; oñ i ko̩la ñw u.
Now Moses in the law commanded us, that such should be stoned: but what sayest thou?	Efo̩lo̩da Mose̩s la tuko̩ ñw a ka kʼa ki kʼokuta ro̩ dʼe̩ne̩ e̩go̩-i; uwe̩ fa, ab e̩ ka?
And the letters were sent by posts into all the king's provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day,	Oñ ma mʼo̩takada le̩ ko kpuche̩ lʼo̩wo̩ abo ku ma fule nyʼojane̩ ojane̩ onu le̩ chaka, ku ma fʼamaJu chaka chihi rinyo̩, ku ma kpa ma, ku ma je̩ ñwu ma lenyo̩ rʼane̩, tʼimo̩to̩, tʼogijo, tʼabimo̩to̩ egini, tʼabobule̩, o̩jo̩ okate, owñ chʼo̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩ta ochu e̩ke̩gweji, owñ chʼochu Adar, ku ma la mʼane̩-ma ko je̩.
For the	Todu Jihofa adʼe̩gahi Jeko̩b dabi wa
But be not ye called Rabbi: for one is your Master,	Ame̩ ki muda je̩ ñwu ma do̩ me̩ ko̩ Rabai n: todu e̩ne̩ʼka do̩mo̩ kʼi chʼako̩ me̩ e̩wñ; o̩chaka-me̩ la chʼamo̩maye.
Deck thyself now	Kʼe̩gahi kpʼuto̩ nyʼo̩la ke;
See that ye refuse not him that speaketh. For if they escaped not who refused him that spake on earth, much more	Me̩ nago, ku me̩ we ede̩yakpʼe̩ne̩ ki ako̩la le̩. Todu iche̩wñ kʼabo ku ma de̩yakpo̩ e̩ne̩ ki juka ñw ma ile̩-i ma fʼo̩wo̩ tane̩ n, e-wa, kʼa dubigba e̩ne̩ ki kwʼefojale le̩ atule nana n?
And all thy estimations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs shall be the shekel.	E̩wñ du kʼe̩ lo o̩ko-wñ, uwe̩ ki lo alu ku she̩ke̩l e-uña kiafo̩ de̩; gera ogu che she̩ke̩l oka.
And they made the plate of the holy crown	Oñ ma fʼo̩jamalia hiolo gwu pe̩te̩ke̩ todu ike̩be̩ kiafo̩ le̩, ma la fʼolubutu ko̩ nyʼu alu ku ma kina nyʼe̩wñ uhiuko̩ kakini, EFO̩ ÑWU JIHOFA.
And Aaron shall bring the goat upon which the	Tak Aro̩n adʼo̩mewo e-kʼanya je̩ todu Jihofa le̩ wa oñ i adʼu che iche̩bo̩ adure;
Once have I spoken; but I will not answer:	Omi ko̩la onuʼka me̩, u ñʼadohi ge̩ n;
Which leaveth her eggs in the earth,	Todu i atʼe̩ge̩-wñ no̩ jʼef ane̩,
folly is set in great dignity, and the rich sit in low place.	ma dʼidada gugu ef uña o̩gba oñ amanana gugu ej ubi.

the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,	o̩ma E̩lkana, o̩ma Joe̩l, o̩ma Azaraya, o̩ma Ze̩fanaya,
For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:	Todu ame̩nugbolu ku ma kʼalu ofo chewewe, ma la kʼone̩ ibe ila, abo e̩pi-eda tule efu ma,
And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.	Oñ ma gugu o̩gba o̩gba one̩ ogume̩lu ogume̩lu, kpai ooje ooje.
For the ear trieth words,	todu eti ajʼo̩la ma
The Son of man indeed goeth, as it is written of him: but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had never been born.	Todu O̩ma One̩ alo alu ku ma ko̩ o̩la-wñ tane̩ chuu; ama atogwo ñw e̩ne̩ ku ma dʼO̩ma One̩ ñw amone̩ mu lugbo wñ! Ma ma bi e̩ne̩ le̩ n, i ma chʼome̩me̩le̩ ñw u.
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens:	O O̩jo̩, uwe̩ ki dʼatate̩ ñw efojale!
Therefore when thou doest	Todule̩ e̩gba kʼe̩ dʼe̩wñ chʼele ejumomi, e̩ ki fʼo̩kakachi o̩gba-we̩, alu kʼame̩nayechi ache ef unyi ujeju kpʼej o̩na, todu kʼamone̩ ki dʼojima ñwu ma n. Ami, naka ñwu me̩ kakini, Ma mʼuro̩me̩-ma gba kpa me̩.
And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Henoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these	Oñ amo̩ma Midian la che: Ifa kpai Ife̩r kpai Hino̩k kpai Abaida kpai E̩ldea. Abo-i chaka chʼamo̩ma Ke̩tura.
For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.	Todu O̩jo̩ kpʼO̩ma-wñ wʼile̩ todu kʼi kajo̩ ile̩ n, chai todu ku ma fʼile̩ jadu lef uwñ.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, Gwo̩ru tane̩ alo; todu amone̩-we̩, kʼuwe̩ ko kwʼane̩ Ijipti dufu wa le̩, fʼo̩la-ma kpabie̩ me̩;
Then was the king exceeding glad for him, and commanded that they should take Daniel up out of the den. So Daniel was taken up out of the den, and no manner of hurt was found upon him, because he believed in his God.	Tak e̩do̩ onu bo̩ ololo, oñ i ñwañw ma ku ma mu Danie̩l du kwef ura le̩ dufu. Abe̩le̩ ma du Danie̩l kwef ura le̩ dufu, ma la li e̩wñ du ki chʼo n, todabu kʼi ke̩do̩nʼO̩jo̩-wñ.
Turn thou us unto thee, O	Mʼuwa rida bʼuwe̩, O Jihofa, tak e-le̩ achʼerida wa!
And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all	U dʼe̩do̩-mi tʼenʼibe atene kpʼetejane̩ e̩wñ du ku ma che o̩gane̩ efojale. Akanya ki awo̩-i oñ O̩jo̩ ko ñw amo̩ma amone̩ ku ma ne̩ fʼo̩la-ma demane̩.
and the name of Saul's wife	odu o̩ya So̩l la ko̩ Ahinoam, o̩ma Ahimaz. Odu onu abogu-wñ ko̩ Abina, o̩ma Ne̩r, kʼi chʼo̩maye ata So̩l.
and Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,	Shamsherai kpai Shiharaya kpai Atalaya
and the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up	Tak atama ago o̩ga le̩, oñ i adʼe̩wñ kʼo̩ga le̩ dʼo̩la-wñ tʼef unyi kʼifʼo̩na re nyʼu o̩jo̩ mebie;
After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.	Ubi le̩ tak i gwo̩ru nyi Kapanahum, owñ kpʼiye-wñ kpʼamo̩maye-wñ kpʼamako̩che̩-wñ. Ma gugu o̩mo̩ pe̩, ma muda jʼo̩jo̩ wewe n.
Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to	Todule̩ me̩ naro e̩ro e-ki nyo̩ bʼuribeda jo̩, me̩ ki la we echane̩ eka efu o̩la-me̩ kakini, Ata-wa kʼa ne̩ chʼEbraham; todu naka ñwu me̩ ka kʼO̩jo̩ neke du amo̩ma kwane̩ ñw Ebraham kwef okuta ki jo̩-i.
	Me̩ mʼo̩la-me̩ ne̩ ku me̩ ki we eche e̩wñ o̩kpakpa-me̩ eju amone̩ ku ma go; cho̩kpo̩ni ame̩ anʼuro̩me̩ du ugbo Ata-me̩ kʼi dʼefojale n.
Out of heaven he made thee to hear his voice, that he might instruct thee: and upon earth he shewed thee his great fire; and thou heardest his words out of the midst of the fire.	I je̩ ñw e̩ gbo̩ omuko̩la-wñ kwʼefojale; todu kʼi kʼuwe̩ o̩la; i ño̩ je̩ ñw e̩ li una-wñ inaina ile̩-i, uwe̩ la gbo̩ o̩la kʼi ka alumeji una le̩.
The sea is come up upon Babylon: she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.	Ohimini lewa abi Babilo̩n ma me̩;
Art thou better than populous No, that was situate among the rivers,	Uwe̩ nyo̩ tu Noamo̩n
And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.	Tak i gbo̩ko̩bʼo̩ nana kʼi we ekpe̩ ma kwʼoj ane̩ le̩ alo.

Now in the eighteenth year of his reign, when he had purged the land, and the house, he sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, and Maaseiah the governor of the city, and Joah the son of Joahaz the recorder, to repair the house of the	Oñ ef o̩do̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩jo̩ kʼi jonu, e̩gba kʼi che kʼane̩ kpʼunyi le̩ ki fe̩ kpa, i fu Shefan, o̩ma Azalaya, kpai Maaseya, agboji ewo le̩ kpai Joa o̩ma Joahaz, kʼi akʼinabali nyʼo̩takada, kpuche̩ nyʼañwʼunyi Jihofa, O̩jo̩-wñ, che.
I have declared my ways, and thou heardest me:	U dʼo̩na o̩na-mi ka, uwe̩ la dohi ñw mi me̩;
An horse	Anya egbʼone̩, chʼolemi,
As he went to Ziklag, there fell to him of Manasseh, Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zilthai, captains of the thousands that	Abu kʼi dʼejo̩na alo tu Ziklag, abo Manasa ku ma ñwa chʼef o̩wo̩-wñ chʼAdna kpai Jo̩zabad kpai Je̩dieye̩l kpai Maike̩l kpai Jo̩zabad kpai E̩laihiu kpai Ziltai, amagboji one̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ e-abo Manasa.
Then came the first, saying, Lord, thy pound hath gained ten pounds.	Oñ e-ejodudu kwodufu wʼo̩gba-wñ, i kakini, Odu, ipamu-we̩ nʼile ipamu me̩gwa.
The cup of blessing which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ? The bread which we break, is it not the communion of the body of Christ?	Ago uje̩nyu kʼa je̩nyʼuwñ le̩, i chʼuta e̩bie̩ Kraist eta de̩ n? Akala kʼa abu le̩, i chʼuta e-año̩la Kraist eta de̩ n?
And it shall come to pass,	Tak e̩gba kʼu kwʼugbo we̩ ababa Afu Jihofa adʼuwe̩ nyʼugbo kʼomi ma ma n; oñ e̩gba kʼu lewa ka ñw Ehab, kʼi ma la li uwe̩ n, i adʼumi kpa. Omi adu-we̩-i la te̩tarailo Jihofa kwʼo̩jo̩ imo̩to̩-mi.
Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first	E̩ nako̩la ñw abo Israe̩l kakini, Ochu ekebie, o̩jo̩ ejodudu ochu le̩, me̩ añmi, urewa e-ogu ekpa i che, owñ chʼujeju kiafo̩.
The sons of Simeon after their families: of Nemuel, the family of the Nemuelites: of Jamin, the family of the Jaminites: of Jachin, the family of the Jachinites:	Amo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ Simeo̩n, akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi-ma che: e-Nemue̩l kʼi chʼabo akwo̩ra unyi abo Nemue̩l; e-Jamin, abo akwo̩ra unyi abo Jamin; e-Jachin, abo akwo̩ra unyi abo Jachin;
Thus saith the Lord	Abu kʼOndu Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Todabu kʼebije-we̩ ko dafo, kʼago-we̩ kwote̩ ofo lugbo e̩wñ abutabu-we̩ kʼe̩ che kpʼabo kʼe̩ tene ma le̩; kpai todu ode ode e-e̩wñ ihie̩ne̩-we̩ chaka, kpai tod e̩bie̩ amo̩ma-we̩ kʼe̩ ko ñwu ma;
Having then gifts differing according to the grace that is given to us, whether prophecy,	Abu kʼa la nʼele ufe̩de̩nyo̩ ojoji ojoji teju alu kʼufe̩de̩nyo̩ ku ma du ñw a de̩, dagba i chʼache̩-eka, ache̩-eka-wa ki chʼeju e̩do̩ ekono-wa;
And immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.	Oñ i kwane̩, i mʼakpata-wñ du ababa, oñ i ledufu eju-ma chaka; todabe̩le̩ ibe-ma chaka mukpatuka, ma kwodojima ñw O̩jo̩ kakini, A li e̩wñ abe̩i mama ta n.
We see not our signs:	A li ujiwe-wa n;
She said moreover unto him, We have both straw and provender enough, and room to lodge in.	I ño̩ ka ñw u ge̩ kakini, A chene̩ e̩gbe ku ma dachi oji-wñ kpai ije̩ ki bʼuma jo̩, uña la dʼef unyi kʼe̩ ru.
And the	Taki Jihofa ka ñwu Jo̩shua kakini, E̩ ki railo ma n, todu omi mʼuma ko nyʼuwe̩ o̩wo̩; e̩ne̩kate efu-ma adago o̩gba-we̩ n.
And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months. And the	Akpati O̩jo̩ le̩ la gugu ef unyi Obe̩d-ido̩m ugbo abo-wñ ochu me̩ta; oñ Jihofa de̩nyo̩ ñw unyi Obe̩d-ido̩m, kpʼe̩wñ du kʼi ne̩.
Then saith he to the man,	E̩gba le̩ ika ñw e̩ne̩ le̩ kakini, Fʼo̩wo̩ we̩ nadala. Oñ i mudabi tʼiko o̩lafia dab ekeji-wñ.
Now all this was done, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken of the Lord by the prophet, saying,	Oñ o̩gbo̩ e̩wñ-i du wa che todu kʼe̩wñ kʼOndu ka lef akache̩ le̩ ki che̩ kakini,
He will turn again, he will have compassion upon us; he will subdue our iniquities; and thou wilt cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.	I arida, i la adabi lʼuwa ejumoni,
Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed	E̩gba le̩ abo̩kpakpa adʼohi ñw u kakini, Ondu, e̩gba oñ a li kʼebi akpʼe̩ kʼa la dʼe̩wñ ñw e̩ je̩? abe̩k alugbe̩ akpʼe̩, tak a dʼomi ñw e̩ ñmo̩?
Men shall buy fields for money, and subscribe evidences, and seal	O̩mo̩ amone̩ anʼo̩ko̩ la ane̩ uche̩, ma la adʼo̩wo̩ tʼo̩takada ijali-wñ, ma la a hi uko̩, oñ ma adʼame̩nibenu wa oj ane̩ Be̩njamin, kpʼane̩ ki le̩ Je̩rusale̩m daka kpʼewo ewo Juda kpʼewo ewo ane̩ uwo kpʼewo ewo ugbo kʼane̩ de̩ te̩e̩le̩ kpʼewo ewo ane̩ o̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩, todu naje̩ ñw amu ma ki rida ku ma dabi, Jihofa ka-i.
The evil bow before the good;	Ame̩ne̩bie̩ne̩ ate̩kpe̩ ñw ame̩ne̩nyo̩,
and it shall be with him, and he shall read therein all the days of his life: that he may learn to fear the	e-le̩ la ade̩ ugbo-wñ, i la achʼo̩kalatu-wñ o̩jo̩ du kʼudeju-wñ kade, todu kʼi ko̩che̩ ailo Jihofa O̩jo̩-wñ era, kʼi fʼuko̩-o̩la-i du kpai uhio̩me̩-wñ de, kʼi che tʼeju-wñ;
While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep, and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee. For they have taken of their daughters for themselves, and for their sons: so that the holy seed have mingled themselves with the people of	Todu ma mʼamo̩ma-ma onobule̩ ko ñw o̩la-ma kpʼamo̩ma-ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩. Wherefore I take you to record this day, that I	Todu kide̩ nagbo̩la-mi ibenu ugbo me̩ eñini kide̩ kakini, Omi de̩hiolo ugbo e̩bie̩ e̩ne̩ du,

And on the fifth day nine bullocks, two rams,	Oñ e-o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩lu-wñ chʼo̩kokuno̩ me̩lu kpai okolo meji kpai amala me̩gwe̩le̩ ku ma chʼo̩mʼo̩do̩ʼka ku ma mufu,
Therefore, behold, I will this once cause them to know, I will cause them to know mine hand and my might; and they shall know that my name	Todule̩ omi aje̩ ñw ma ma, onu ʼkate-i oñ naje̩ ñw ma ma ukpahiu-mi kpʼugbiti-mi, tak ama ama ka kʼodu-mi ko̩ Jihofa.
And the Levites took down the ark of the	Tak abo Lifai mʼakpati Jihofa du wʼane̩, kpʼakpati ki manyʼu e-kʼojibo o̩jamalia le̩ jʼefu-wñ, oñ ma mʼu ko jʼoj okuta lile le̩; tak aboke̩le̩ Be̩t-shime̩sh mʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo kpʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ ki bo̩ ko wa chʼiche̩bo̩ ñwu Jihofa o̩jo̩ le̩.
Therefore the prudent shall keep silence in that time; for it	Todule̩ e̩ne̩ ki ache e̩wñ ibe ibe achechi gugu iko e̩go̩-i;
Thus ye shall be filled at my table with horses and chariots, with mighty men, and with all men of war, saith the Lord	Efu-me̩ la ako̩ ñw amanya kpʼabo ku ma gwa o̩kogu kpʼamagbiti kpʼabogu chaka oj itebulu e-mi, Ondu Jihofa ka-i.
Do ye not yet understand, neither remember the five loaves of the five thousand, and how many baskets ye took up?	Ame̩ mʼoji-wñ ta n, me̩ laño̩ rewa akala me̩lu e-one̩ icham me̩fa nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ le̩ kpʼaligada monu ku me̩ ko n?
Then Peter said, Lo, we have left all, and followed thee.	Oñ Pita kakini, Go, a tʼe̩wñ e-wa no̩ me̩, a la tʼuwe̩ ubi-i.
I said therefore unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if ye believe not that I am	Todule̩ u ka ñwu me̩ ka kʼame̩ aku ef adure-me̩; todu, iche̩wñ ku me̩ ma ke̩do̩no ka kʼomi de̩ n, me̩ aku ef adure-me̩.
then hear thou from the heavens,	mak uwe̩ ki dʼefojale ugbo uña ugugu-we̩ le̩, kʼe̩ gbʼadua-ma kpʼo̩ko̩ ku ma gba bʼe̩ kʼe̩ che alu kʼoji ajo̩-ma de̩, kʼe̩ la tʼedure kʼamone̩-we̩ dʼe̩ re le̩ no̩.
and Joanna the wife of Chuza Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many others, which ministered unto him of their substance.	kpai Joana o̩ya Chusa, adigede He̩ro̩d, kpai Susana kpai abobule̩ omune̩ ojoji wewe. Abobule̩-i nʼane̩ e-ma ache e̩wñ ñwu ma.
And they sat before him, the firstborn according to his birthright, and the youngest according to his youth: and the men marvelled one at another.	Taku ma kwogugu o̩gba-wñ, o̩mo̩gba gugu uña ogijo, e-kekele la gugu uña imo̩to̩-wñ; oñ i mud e̩wñ awuwu ñw aboke̩le̩ le̩.
And the sons of Tola; Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father's house,	Oñ amo̩ma Tola che Uzai kpai Refaya kpai Je̩rie̩l kpai Jameai kpai Ibsam kpai Shemue̩l, abo ku ma dʼoji dufu ef unyi unyi amata-ma ma che, e-Tola, ku ma chʼamagbiti ki nʼuwohi ef o̩gba e-ma: aluka-ma o̩kpanachi Defid che icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ ogu nyoke meji nyʼulo̩gwa oji.
Also the sons of the stranger, that join themselves to the	I che-abononojo ku ma kʼo̩la-ma manyu Jihofa,

then will I cut off Israel out of the land which I have given them; and this house, which I have hallowed for my name, will I cast out of my sight; and Israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all people:	mak e̩gba le̩ omi akʼabo Israe̩l da bʼoj ane̩ e-kʼomi du ñwu ma-i te̩; tak unyi-i, e-kʼu che kʼi fo̩ tod odu-mi, nadʼu ro̩ tinyo̩ bʼumi eju te̩; tak Israe̩l amud ita kpai icha ugbo amone̩ ojoji ojoji du.
in the three and twentieth year of Nebuchadrezzar, Nebuzar-adan the captain of the guard carried away captive of the Jews seven hundred forty and five persons: all the persons	O̩do̩ Ne̩bitikadre̩za ogu nyoke me̩ta, Ne̩biuzaradan, agboji abide, mʼamaJu ulo̩gwa nyʼo̩gbo̩ mebie nyoke me̩lu ko nyʼef amu alo: amone̩ le̩ chaka che icham me̩lu nyʼulo̩gwa.
And one of them,	Ama Kayafas, kʼi chʼe̩ne̩ʼka efu-ma abu kʼi chʼagboji amatama o̩do̩ le̩, ka ñwu ma kakini, Ame̩ mʼe̩wñ du n;
To shew that the	kʼama ki du ñe̩ña ka ki Jihofa chʼo̩kpakpa;
And the children of Joseph said, The hill is not enough for us: and all the Canaanites that dwell in the land of the valley have chariots of iron,	Tak abo Jose̩f kakini, Ane̩ uwo le̩ nʼuña bʼuwa jo̩ n; abo Kenan ku ma dodo oj ane̩ o̩go̩ chaka chene̩ o̩kogu ebije, tʼabo ku ma jo̩ Be̩t-shean kpai adogbe adogbe-wñ, tʼabo ku ma jo̩ ef o̩go̩ Je̩zree̩l.
If a false witness rise up against any man to testify against him	Iche̩wñ kʼe̩nibenu o̩lachiʼka kwane̩ kʼi gbʼibenu nyʼone̩ tod udu kʼi fe̩;
Therefore Abimelech rose early in the morning, and called all his servants, and told all these things in their ears: and the men were sore afraid.	Tak Abime̩le̩k takpa kwane̩ odudu oñ i fʼabuko̩lo̩-wñ chaka do̩ wa, i la fo̩la-i du ka ñwu ma gbo̩; tak aboke̩le̩ le̩ kwo chokpo ololo.
And thou shalt remember all the way which the	Uwe̩ ki la dibekado o̩na du ki Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ te̩tane̩ we̩ le ef aje̩tachi-i o̩do̩ o̩gbo̩ meji-i, kʼi che kʼi hi uwe̩ wane̩, kʼi jʼuwe̩ ma, kʼi ma e̩wñ ki dʼef e̩do̩-we̩, abe̩k uwe̩ jʼade uko̩-wñ, abe̩k uwe̩ aje̩ n.
Therefore thus saith the	Todule̩ abu ki Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Go, omi adʼe̩ kpuche̩ bʼeju ane̩ ile̩-i te̩. O̩do̩-i pitii oñ uwe̩ aku, todabu kʼe̩ ko̩la ubi edagbo̩ Jihofa.
Now to the	I chʼe-abo ukpe̩reji o̩lo̩pu Manasa le̩, Mose̩s mʼane̩ ku ma ane̩ du ñwu ma Beshan; Jo̩shua muda dʼane̩ ñw abo ukpe̩reji o̩lo̩pu Manasa ki bo̩ ef amo̩maye-ma ejudaba Jo̩rdan o̩wo̩ olane̩-wñ. Oñ e̩gba ki Jo̩shua je̩ ñwu ma lo tʼunyabo-ma kʼi la kadua ñwu ma,
But shun profane	E̩ ki himama ekale̩ kʼo̩ja aka ofofo le̩: todu ama anyo̩gba tule ef ewe ekpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩,
And Jonathan said, Far be it from thee: for if I knew certainly that evil were determined by my father to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?	Taku Jo̩natan kakini, E-le̩ ki jiji rʼuwe̩; todu iche̩wñ kʼomi ma ma re̩ ka kʼata-mi fʼe̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ ñwa nyʼuwe̩, omi ma ka ñw e̩ n?
who being the brightness of	abu kʼowñ chʼo̩gaa e-ojima-wñ, alu kʼonugo onugo O̩jo̩ de̩ alu le̩ i de̩ che̩ che̩ che̩, i laño̩ mʼe̩wñ du gbane̩ lef o̩la ukpahiu-wñ, abu kʼi fʼe̩gwe̩hiolo e-adure che kpa, i kwogugu o̩wo̩ awo̩to̩ inaina ef uña atate̩-i,
and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.	kpai Gedor kpai Ahayo kpai Ze̩karaya kpai Miklot.
And these	E̩ muda mʼe̩wñ-i ko maja ef e̩do̩-we̩;
Every man praying or prophesying, having	E̩ne̩ke̩le̩ du ki achadua abe̩k i akache̩ kʼi dʼe̩wñ bʼoji-wñ ma, i mʼanyo̩ ko mʼoji-wñ.
By faith they passed through the Red sea as by dry	E̩do̩ ekono chʼe̩wñ ku ma lale gu ef Ohimini Ekpikpa du dabe̩ne̩ kʼane̩ e̩gbe̩; e-kʼabo Ijipti chʼajama-wñ kʼi la mʼuma ko mi.

Egypt riseth up like a flood, and	Ijipti akwane̩ dabu Naye̩l,
So also Christ glorified not himself to be made an high priest; but he that said unto him,	Abe̩le̩ Kraisti dojima ñw o̩la-wñ kʼi mud agboji amatama n, chai e̩ne̩ kʼi ko̩la ñw u kakini,
even	tale̩nt e-o̩jamalia-wñ che icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩ta, owñ chʼo̩jamalia Ofir, ajifa-wñ ku ma gwe̩ la che tale̩nt icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ mebie ku ma du lamʼo̩do̩ unyi unyi le̩.

and Judas begat Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begat Esrom; and Esrom begat Aram;	Tamar la bi Pe̩re̩z kpai Ze̩ra ñwu Juda. Pe̩re̩z la bi He̩zro̩n. He̩zro̩n la bi Ram.
If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay	Ame̩ ma gbo̩ n, kʼame̩ ma adʼu tʼe̩do̩ n, kʼame̩ ki dʼojima ñw odu-mi n, Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du ka-i, mak u nakpʼama le̩ wa anʼume̩ oji, tak omi anama ñw e̩nyo̩ kʼu du ñwu me̩; ochochi, omi fʼama na ñw ume̩, todabu ku me̩ ma dʼu tʼe̩do̩ n.
And in those days, when the number of the disciples was multiplied, there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews, because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration. And it came to pass, when Jesus had made an end of commanding his twelve disciples, he departed thence to teach and to preach in their cities.	Oñ i lewatʼe̩gba ki Jisus fuñwa ñw amako̩che̩-wñ me̩gweji kpa, i kwʼo̩mo̩ le nyʼakʼamone̩ e̩wñ kpʼakoya eta ewo ewo-ma.
And for Aaron's sons thou shalt make coats, and thou shalt make for them girdles, and bonnets shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.	E̩ ki laño̩ chʼafe̩ kpai e̩wñ ujiñmi kpai o̩tajiya ki gbo̩gba tod amo̩ma Aro̩n ge̩; kʼi chʼojima kpai alifia ñw u.

who by him do believe in God, that raised him up from the dead, and gave him glory; that your faith and hope might be in God.	ku me̩ ke̩do̩nʼO̩jo̩ lefuwñ. Owñ chʼO̩jo̩ kʼi dʼowñ kwane̩ kwef abo ki ku, kʼi laño̩ mʼojima du ñw u, todu kʼuke̩do̩no-me̩ kpʼukibeno-me̩ ki chʼO̩jo̩.

to execute judgment upon all, and to convince all that are ungodly among them of all their ungodly deeds which they have ungodly committed, and of all their hard	kʼi che alu kʼoj ajo̩ ka abʼe̩ne̩ du ma, kʼi laño̩ du uko̩lo̩ ki ma kpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩ n ku ma che lʼo̩na ki ma kpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩ n le̩ biu abo du ku ma ma kpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩ n, kpai o̩la ki gbiti du kʼame̩nadure ku ma ma kpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩ n du ko̩la nyʼowñ.

because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed	Todu e̩wñ O̩jo̩ kʼone̩ ma tejugede ef uma; todu O̩jo̩ dʼu tejugede ñwu ma.

How forcible are right words!	O̩la o̩kpakpa nʼukpahiu tabale̩!
And in the fourth watch of the night Jesus went unto them, walking on the sea.	Oñ e̩gba ide e̩ke̩le̩ odu i lule̩ ej ohimini awʼugbo ma.
And I will take the remnant of Judah, that have set their faces to go into the land of Egypt to sojourn there, and they shall all be consumed,	Tak omi akʼabo e̩bo̩bo̩ Juda ku ma fʼeju-ma gwanyi enyʼIjipti ku ma ge̩ne̩ o̩mo̩, ma alie̩ rinyo̩ chaka, ma awane̩, oj ane̩ Ijipti. O̩kwo̩chageli kpʼukpo̩ta ako ma mi. Ama aku akwʼe-ki nya gbogbo wa e-ki nana tule, lʼalu o̩kwo̩chageli kpʼukpo̩ta. Ama la ache ama kpai awuwu kpai oli ina kpai ina.
And when he was demanded of the Pharisees, when the kingdom of God should come, he answered them and said,	Oñ abu kʼamaFarisi tʼowñ ene kakini, Adiko e̩gba ojane̩ O̩jo̩ awa? I dohi ñwu ma kakini, Ojane̩ e-O̩jo̩ awa kpai e̩wñ-igo-ego n;
And the people came to the house of God, and abode there till even before God, and lifted up their voices, and wept sore;	Tak amone̩ le̩ lewa Be̩te̩l, oñ ma kwogugu o̩gba O̩jo̩ o̩mo̩ gbogbo dʼo̩jo̩, ma la chi omu-ma nyʼate̩ araku anyianyi.
This	E-le̩ la chʼuko̩-o̩la todu e̩ne̩ Nazarait kʼi doji, e̩wñ O̩jo̩ e-wñ kʼi ache ñwu Jihofa todu e̩date̩-wñ le̩, e-le̩ amanyu e̩wñ ki bo̩ kʼo̩wo̩-wñ atu; alu kʼoji ki da de̩, alu le̩ i ache tʼeju uko̩ o̩la e-e̩date̩-wñ le̩ tila.

And the captains over the hundreds did according to all	Tak amagboji one̩ ogume̩lu ogume̩lu le̩ che teju e̩wñ du ki Jihoyada, atama le̩, ñwate̩; oñ e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ mʼabo-wñ ko, owñ chʼabo kidukpe̩ ku ma gudu nyʼejefu o̩jo̩ uñmi, manyʼabo ki dukpe̩ ku ma ledufu o̩jo̩ uñmi, oñ ma lewa ugbo Jiho̩yada atama.

And Abimelech gat him up to mount Zalmon, he and all the people that	Tak Abime̩le̩k mute̩gu tʼoji uwo Zalmo̩n, tʼowñ tʼaboke̩le̩ du ku ma jʼugbo-wñ; oñ Abime̩le̩k mʼo̩kanyi du nʼo̩wo̩, oñ i mʼe̩to̩ oliʼka da wane̩, i mʼu du nʼika-wñ. And Jehiel, and Azaziah, and Nahath, and Asahel, and Jerimoth, and Jozabad, and Eliel, and Ismachiah, and Mahath, and Benaiah,	oñ Je̩haye̩l kpai Azazaya kpai Nehat kpai Asahe̩l kpai Je̩rimo̩t kpai Jo̩zabad kpʼIlaie̩l kpʼIsmakaya kpai Me̩hat kpai Be̩naya chʼamafejule̩, ma la jʼef o̩wo̩ Kono̩naya kpai Shimeai o̩maye-wñ, alu ku He̩ze̩kaya onu, kpai Azaraya kʼi chʼe̩nuto̩gba unyi O̩jo̩ dʼo̩da ñwu ma le̩.
And these	E̩wñ ogu kʼabo Israe̩l gba oj ane̩ Kenan, owñ chʼe-kʼE̩leaza atama le̩ kpai Jo̩shua, o̩ma Nun, kpai abo ku ma dʼoji dufu ef amata o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu abo Israe̩l kpe̩ ñwu ma.
Upon the first	O̩jo̩ ejodudu ef o̩jo̩ mebie du e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-me̩ ki nadʼe̩wñ ne ugbo-wñ teju alu ki ra ñw u, todu ki we enʼo̩ko̩ ete̩ e̩gba du kʼu lewa.
And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned,	Oñ e̩gba ku ma fʼo̩gba o̩gba amo̩maye-wñ lo akwo̩ra unyi akwo̩ra unyi amo̩maye-wñ: Jiaye̩l chʼoji-ma, kpai Ze̩karaya,
Therefore thus saith the	Todule̩ abu ki Jihofa ka o̩la onu Asiria le̩ de̩ kakini, I agudu wʼef ewo-i n, i la atʼo̩fa o̩mo̩ n, i anʼugbe̩yo̩ wʼo̩gba-wñ n, i la akpʼugbudu nyʼu n.
And they journeyed from Oboth, and pitched at Ije-abarim, in the wilderness which	Taku ma kʼe̩re̩ nyʼule̩ kwo Obot, oñ ma lewa ru Iye-abarim, ef aje̩tachi ki dʼo̩gba Moab o̩wo̩ olodudu.
For every high priest is ordained to offer gifts and sacrifices: wherefore	Todu ma dʼagboji amatama du dago todu kʼi kʼe̩wñ ele kpʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ wa; todule̩ eku aku e̩ne̩ le̩ kʼi nʼe̩wñ kʼi aduwa ge̩.
And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.	Tak O̩jo̩ ka ñwu Noa kakini, Eda o̩re̩la du lewa o̩gba-mi me̩; todu ane̩-ile̩ che̩ko̩ ñw o̩lachi lugbo ma; go, omi akpʼama bie̩ manyu ane̩-ile̩.
And he that burneth them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.	Oñ e̩ne̩ du kʼi gu ma jo le̩ agwe̩ e̩wñ o̩la-wñ, tak i la agwʼo̩la-wñ ef omiofo, ubile̩ tak i a nʼugbo kʼi awʼef uru le̩.
And under the brim of it round about	Tak o̩gane̩ eti-wñ ki kama le̩, ikoko ne daka, e̩gwa-wñ jʼef ohibo̩wo̩ʼka, abe̩le̩ ma le e̩gbagu omi le̩ daka, ikoko le̩ chʼo̩gba o̩gba meji, ma fʼu da manyʼu e̩gba ku ma da onugo e̩wñ e̩gbagu omi le̩.
	E̩ne̩ ki aka ñw onu kakini, Uwe̩ e̩nebili,
And Elkanah went to Ramah to his house. And the child did minister unto the	Tak E̩lkana le tʼunyi-wñ Rama. Oñ imo̩to̩ le̩ nache e̩wñ ñw Jihofa eju Ilai atama le̩.
What	E̩wñ chʼuwe̩, ohimini abadi, kʼe̩ ra?
And they two made a covenant before the	Tak ama meji fʼalo che eju Jihofa. Defid la kwogugu efoko o̩mo̩, oñ Jo̩natan le tʼunyi-wñ.
though Noah, Daniel, and Job,	dagba Noa kpai Danie̩l kpai Job chaka jʼo̩mo̩, oji-mi, Ondu Jihofa ka-i, ma ma gba o̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ abe̩k onobule̩ n; chai onugo oji-ma kate ma ma gba lugbo o̩kpakpa-ma.
Nevertheless the priests of the high places came not up to the altar of the	I chaka dʼabe̩le̩ amatama otete otete le̩ mute̩gu wa ugbo ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ Jihofa Je̩rusale̩m le̩ n, ma muda aje̩ uje̩wñ ki ma nʼo̩jo̩wu efu n ef amo̩maye-ma.
that his heart be not lifted up above his brethren, and that he turn not aside from the commandment,	kʼi we ehio̩la-wñ ne tʼamo̩maye-wñ le, kʼi la we ena bʼuko̩ le̩ te̩, tʼo̩wo̩ awo̩to̩ tʼo̩wo̩ awohi; todu kʼi kpojolugbo ef o̩fe̩-wñ, owñ kpai amo̩ma-wñ, alumeji Israe̩l.
Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus saith the	Fʼuche̩ kpe̩rʼame̩namu le̩ chaka kakini, O̩la She̩maya e-Nehelam ku Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Todabu ku She̩maya fʼache̩ ka ñwu me̩ ki ma chʼomi kpʼo̩ uche̩ n, kʼi la je̩ ñwu me̩ ke̩do̩no olemi,
Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall arise; when I sit in darkness, the	E̩ ki gwoye rʼumi oji n, O e̩nebi-mi;
Then his father and his mother said unto him,	Oñ ata-wñ kpai iye-wñ ka ñwu kakini, Onobule̩ du dʼef amo̩ma amo̩maye-we̩, kpai ef amone̩-mi-i kʼe̩ ne̩ n, kʼuwe̩ anyʼatene o̩ya ef abo Filistia abo e̩pi odukulu-i? Samson muda ka ñw ata-wñ kakini, Uwe̩ kʼe̩ tene ñw omi ke; todu i nyo̩ mi eju.
and think not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to	Me̩ ki we eka ef ume̩ kakini, Ata-wa kʼa ne̩ chʼEbraham; todu eka naka ñwu me̩-i, kakini, O̩jo̩ neke kʼamo̩ma kwane̩ ñwu Ebraham kwef okuta ki jo̩-i.
Take Aaron and Eleazar his son, and bring them up unto mount Hor:	E̩ mʼAro̩n kpai E̩leaza o̩ma-wñ ko, kʼe̩ ko ma wʼoj uwo Ho̩r-i;
Because thou shalt forget	Uwe̩ agbenyo̩ akanya-we̩;
Therefore if thine enemy hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give him drink: for in so doing thou shalt heap coals of fire on his head.	I muda che̩wñ kʼebi akpa e̩nebi-we̩, e̩ ñwʼo̩ o̩je̩ kʼi je̩; alugbe̩ akpʼo, dʼomi ñw u ñmo̩; todu e̩ che-i, mak e̩ge̩-una uwe̩ agbanyʼo oji le̩.
Even that it would please God to destroy me;	O i ma nyo̩ O̩jo̩ eju kʼi fʼumi kpo̩fo̩ rʼane̩,
And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things,	Todu e̩ che kʼamone̩ ki dab ame̩ja ohimini abadi,
Who art thou that judgest another man's servant? to his own master he standeth or falleth. Yea, he shall be holden up: for God is able to make him stand.	Uwe̩ kʼuwe̩ akajo̩ imo̩to̩ e̩ne̩ omune̩, e̩ne̩ uwe̩ che taa? Edago-wñ ewane̩-wñ, o̩wo̩ odu-wñ i de̩. I la adago; todu Ondu neke je̩ ñw u dago.
When thou didst terrible things	E̩gba kʼe̩ che e̩wñ ubailo kʼawa ma neju-wñ n,
But which of you, having a servant plowing or feeding cattle, will say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and sit down to meat?	E̩ne̩ la dʼefu-me̩ kʼi nʼadu ki alʼuche̩-wñ, abe̩k i adide amala-wñ, kʼi aka ñw u e̩gba kʼi doji kwʼoko, kakini, Lewa ababa, kʼe̩ guane̩ kʼe̩ jʼe̩wñ;
And it came to pass, when she pressed him daily with her words, and urged him,	Oñ i lewatu, abu kʼi akutʼo̩ o̩la eka ñw u o̩jo̩ñwa o̩jo̩ñwa, kʼi la akʼo̩ e̩che̩, uhia fʼu hia—uku ma me̩!
And Moses brought out all the rods from before the	Taku Mose̩s mʼo̩kpa le̩ chaka ko kwʼo̩gba Jihofa dufu wa ñw abo Israe̩l chaka: taku ma go, e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ la mʼo̩kpa e-wñ du.
Then contended I with the rulers, and said, Why is the house of God forsaken? And I gathered them together, and set them in their place.	Tak u ko bʼamachimo̩la igo̩bina, oñ u kakini, E̩wñ chi ku ma hi unyi O̩jo̩ tinyo̩? Tak u ko ma wa jo̩, oñ u ko ma jʼe̩gu-ma.
On the eighth day he sent the people away: and they blessed the king, and went unto their tents joyful and glad of heart for all the goodness that the	O̩jo̩ e̩ke̩jo̩-wñ i je̩ ñw amone̩ kwʼo̩mo̩; ma la kadua ñw onu, oñ ma nʼuyo̩ kpai e̩do̩ e̩bo̩ alo tʼunyabo-ma todu e̩nyo̩ du ki Jihofa du ña Defid, adu-wñ, kpai abo-wñ Israe̩l ge̩.
My heart is fixed, O God, my heart is fixed:	Edo̩-mi de̩ kpoko, O O̩jo̩,
And thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escape the judgment of God?	Uwe̩ one̩, kʼe̩ kpʼabo ku ma nʼe̩wñ abe̩-i ache abi, kʼuwe̩ onugo la che e̩wñ le̩, e̩ fulo ka kʼuwe̩ afu tane̩ bʼajo̩ O̩jo̩ te̩?
Therefore they sought again to take him: but he escaped out of their hand,	Todule̩ ma ño̩ dabi feju emʼu; oñ i kwʼef o̩wo̩-ma le.
Thou hast despised mine holy things, and hast profaned my sabbaths.	Uwe̩ fʼe̩de̩te̩ e̩wñ-mi kiafo̩ che me̩, e̩ la fʼo̩jo̩ uñmi-mi bie̩.

And the Philistine said, I defy the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.	Oñ e̩ne̩ Filistia le̩ kakini, Ina nabu abo ogu Israe̩l eñini-i; mʼe̩ne̩ʼka chi dufu ñwu mi kʼa ja kpai o̩la-wa.
And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: and	Oñ o̩mamanya kpʼomuko̩la kpʼakpabana nadufu kwef ede le̩. Agege una mebie jʼo̩gba ede le̩ ajo, ama le̩ chʼamAfu mebie e-O̩jo̩;
Now, O king, establish the decree, and sign the writing, that it be not changed, according to the law of the Medes and Persians, which altereth not.	Fa-i onu, uwe̩ ki dʼo̩da le̩ nyane̩ ke, kʼe̩ dʼo̩wo̩ tʼo̩, ki we erida alu kʼo̩da abo Me̩dia kpai abo Pe̩rsia ki ma alu n de̩.
And Judah did evil in the sight of the	Juda la fʼe̩wñ ki bie̩ne̩ che eju Jihofa. Oñ ma nʼe̩wñ adure ku ma jʼache nyʼowñ ogu eja tʼe̩wñ du kʼamata-ma che le.
The word of the	O̩la Jihofa ño̩ wʼugbo mi ge̩ kakini,
being enriched in every thing to all bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiving to God.	I la aje̩ ñw me̩ mud anana ef e̩wñ du ku me̩ ki chʼo̩wo̩ ñw one̩ alu du ku ma chʼo̩wo̩ ñw one̩; e-le̩ achʼuko̩lo̩ ugwa egwʼO̩jo̩ lef uwa.
The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.	O̩la ku Habakuk, akache̩, li de̩.
And God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians that dwelt in Gur-baal, and the Mehunims.	O̩jo̩ la te̩ko-wñ ugbo abo Filistia kpʼugbo abo Arabia ku ma gugu Gur-beal, kpʼabo Me̩on.
For when we were yet without strength, in due time Christ died for the ungodly.	Todu e̩gba kʼa chʼame̩ne̩gbo ta, e̩gba kʼiko-wñ lewatu, Kraisti leku tod abo ku ma ma te̩takpe̩do̩rʼO̩jo̩ n.

And she coming in that instant gave thanks likewise unto the Lord, and spake of him to all them that looked for redemption in Jerusalem.	Oñ abu kʼi lewa bano ma iko auwa kʼa ka-i, i dago aje̩nyʼO̩jo̩, oñ i nʼo̩la-wñ aka ñw abo du ku ma jʼaneju adiko e̩gba ku ma agba Je̩rusale̩m tane̩.
Be ye not as your fathers, unto whom the former prophets have cried, saying, Thus saith the	Ame̩ ki we edab amata-me̩, e-kʼamakache̩ o̩gbo̩gba le̩ kwa rʼuma oji kakini, Abu ki Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du ka de̩ kakini, Me̩ mudabiwa bʼo̩na e̩bie̩ne̩-me̩ kpai e̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ ku me̩ jʼache le̩ te̩ fai. And he shall do with the bullock as he did with the bullock for a sin offering, so shall he do with this: and the priest shall make an atonement for them, and it shall be forgiven them. And when the messengers were come in, behold,	Tak e̩gba kʼamonuche̩ mugudu wʼejefu, go, amude oji-wñ la tʼoj ate̩ manyʼaloji edudu ewo ugbo oji-wñ le̩.
I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine anger is turned away from him.	Omi añwʼelubibi-ma che;
And it shall come to pass,	I la ade̩ kʼonugo e̩wñ du ki añmiñmi ki achiche̩ ugbo du kʼohimini lile le̩ acha kade adeju. Uwewe e̩ja-wñ le̩ atabale; todu omi-i lewa o̩mo̩ me̩. Oñ o̩ga du atakpa. Ugbo du kʼohimini le̩ acha kade e̩wñ o̩mo̩ du adeju!

and say unto the Ammonites, Hear the word of the Lord	E̩ ki la ka ñw amo̩ma Amo̩n kakini, Me̩ gbʼo̩la Ondu Jihofa kel Abu kʼOndu Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, todabu kʼe̩ kakini, Ibaa! nyʼuña-mi kiafo̩ e̩gba ku ma fʼudaji; kpai arʼojane̩ Israe̩l e̩gba ku ma fu gwʼalache̩; kpai arʼabunyi Juda e̩gba ku ma nyʼef amu le̩;
And when we had sailed over the sea of Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra,	Oñ abu kʼa mudaba omi-omu e̩-Silisia kpai Pamfilia a lewa Maira, ane̩ Lisia.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, Fʼo̩wo̩ nadala nʼoj ohimini, todu kʼomi-wñ ki dabi wa abʼabo Ijipti kpai o̩ko̩ogu o̩ko̩ogu-ma kpai amanʼanya-mama.
Wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thy raiment upon thee, and get thee down to the floor:	Todule̩ e̩ fʼo̩la gwe̩, kʼe̩ dʼekpo kurʼo̩la; tak e̩ kʼukpo bʼo̩la ma, kʼe̩ la gwo̩ru nyʼugbo ajita ugwo̩ka le̩; e̩ muda je̩ ñw e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ le̩ fʼe̩ li n, gbogbo tak i fʼe̩wñ je̩ kʼi laño̩ ñmo̩ kpa.

And king David said to Ornan, Nay; but I will verily buy it for the full price: for I will not take	Taku Defid, onu, ka ñw O̩rnan kakini, O̩da; omi muda ala alu kʼaja-wñ de̩ yiili; todu omi agbʼe̩wñ e-we̩ todu Jihofa n, u la akʼe̩wñ kʼomi ma chʼudu-wñ n che iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo n.
The preparations of the heart in man,	E̩wñ kʼe̩do̩ ñwa ki che chʼe̩wñ one̩,
I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able	E̩nya u du ñw me̩ ñmo̩, i chʼo̩je̩ u du ñw me̩ n; todu me̩ bʼo̩ jo̩ e̩gba le̩ n: me̩ la bʼo̩ jo̩ abajo̩-i ta n;

Now it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag;	Oñ abu ku So̩l leku, e̩gba ki Defid doji kwoko ekpa abo Amale̩k, ki Defid la jʼo̩jo̩ meji Ziklag;
And David went thence to Mizpeh of Moab: and he said unto the king of Moab, Let my father and my mother, I pray thee, come forth,	Taku Defid kwʼo̩mo̩ le tu Mizpe e-Moab, oñ i ka ñw onu Moab kakini, Narodubʼe̩ todu kʼe̩ je̩ ñw ata-mi kpai iye-mi ku ma dufu wa ajʼugbo-we̩, gbogbo tak u ma e̩wñ kʼO̩jo̩ ache todu mi.
Be thou ashamed, O Zidon: for the sea hath spoken,	Anyo̩ ki mʼe̩, O Saido̩n, todu ohi mini le̩,
Thus will I do unto this place, saith the	Abu kʼu nache uña-i kpʼabo ku ma dodo o̩mo̩ de̩, Jihofa aka-i. Nache kʼewo-i ki dab Tofe̩t.
For thus saith the	Todu abu ki Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Ame̩ ñʼali afu n, me̩ lañʼali omi ojale n; o̩go̩-i muda ako̩ ñw omi, oñ ame̩ añmo̩ tʼame̩ tʼame̩wñ ukpa-me̩ tʼame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩-me̩.
And he came by the Spirit into the temple: and when the parents brought in the child Jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,	Oñ i le ef Afu le̩ wʼef unyi O̩jo̩; tak abu kʼabo ku ma bi Jisus imo̩to̩ le̩ la dʼu wa ku ma che e̩wñ italigba o̩lo̩da ñw u,
If the theft be certainly found in his hand alive, whether it be ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restore double.	Iche̩wñ ku ma li udeju e̩la kʼi ji o̩wo̩-wñ, dagba i chʼo̩kokuno̩, dagba i chʼo̩ke̩ke̩te̩, dagba i chʼe̩wño̩re̩ egini, i arʼo̩me̩-wñ onu meji.
And now for a little space grace hath been	Faʼ Jihofa, O̩jo-wa, dʼufe̩de̩nyo̩ ña wa iko re-i, kʼi tʼe̩bobo-wa no̩ kʼa fʼuma o̩wo̩, kʼi mʼaleʼka du ñw a ef uña-wñ kiafo, kʼO̩jo̩-wa ki mʼuwa eju ne̩, kʼi la je̩ ñw a ruko re ef uko̩lo̩ adu-wa.
And he shall put	Oñ i achʼe̩bie̩ le̩ kado igba ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ kʼi dʼalugbo̩na unyabo ujeju o̩gba Jihofa le̩; tak i adʼe̩bie̩-wñ ki bo̩ dajane̩ e̩re̩ ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo kʼi dago alugbo̩na unyabo ujeju.
that thou mayest bear thine own shame, and mayest be confounded in all that thou hast done, in that thou art a comfort unto them.	todu kʼuwe̩ ki nʼadu anyo̩-we̩ onugo, kʼukata-we̩ ki chi tod e̩wñ du kʼe̩ che, abu kʼuwe̩ nyʼuma e̩do̩.
For they will turn away thy son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of the	Todu i arʼo̩ma-we̩ da bʼumi ubi te̩, kʼama ki re̩ amo̩jo̩ omune̩: abe̩le̩ tak uwe̩do̩ Jihofa ma atajo bʼuwe̩ ma, oñ i ma fʼe̩ chile̩che̩ piopio.
And the men which journeyed with him stood speechless, hearing a voice, but seeing no man.	Ugoju mʼaboke̩le̩ ku ma kpe̩re̩ kpʼowñ nyule̩ da dago abu ku ma gbo̩ omuko̩la le̩ ku ma ma muda li e̩ne̩ du n.
For we are the circumcision, which worship God in the spirit, and rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh.	todu awa chʼabo-e̩pi-e̩da, owñ chʼawa kʼa nʼAfu O̩jo̩ ache O̩jo̩, kʼa laño̩ buba efu Kraisti Jisusi, kʼa ma la ke̩do̩no e̩wñ ef o̩re̩la re n;

They joined themselves also unto Baalpeor,	Ma kʼo̩la-ma dama kpai Beal-peo̩r,
And Pilate, when he had called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,	Taku Pailat fʼamagboji amatama kpʼamagboji kpʼamone̩ le̩ do̩wajo̩,
and the doors shall be shut in the streets, when the sound of the grinding is low, and he shall rise up at the voice of the bird, and all the daughters of musick shall be brought low;	kʼama fʼalu o̩na ojukpologu re; kʼekuku e̩wñ eno̩ bo̩ re, kʼone̩ akwane̩ todu omuko̩la e̩we̩ kʼi agbo̩, ku ma fʼamo̩ma onobule̩ ku ma keli chi ukata;

And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow all trees for meat, whose leaf shall not fade, neither shall the fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new fruit according to his months, because their waters they issued out of the sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shall be for meat, and the leaf thereof for medicine. All the cities of the Levites within the possession of the children of Israel	Ewo ewo abo Lifai du ku ma jʼalumeji ane̩ kʼabo Israe̩l ne̩ le̩, chʼo̩gbo̩ meji nyoke me̩jo̩ manyʼane̩ ije̩ ki lʼuma daka.
And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn	Tak atama adʼe-le̩ʼka wʼugbo ubo̩ iche̩bo̩, oñ i amʼoji-wñ lida, tak i agujo oj ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ le̩; oñ e̩bie̩-wñ awelo wʼane̩ akolo ubo̩ iche̩bo̩;
Wherefore he did evil in the sight of the	Abe̩le̩ i fʼe̩wñ ki bie̩ne̩ eju Jihofa che, alu kʼabunyi Ehab che le̩; todu ama le̩ mud abo̩hiala-wñ abu kʼata-wñ leku ku ma nʼe̩ tʼef ulenyo̩.
Therefore will I divide him	Todule̩ nadʼukpe̩-wñ te̩ ef ame̩ne̩-lile,
Wherefore they are no more twain, but one flesh. What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.	Tod abe̩le̩ ama ño̩ chʼeji ge̩ n, chai o̩re̩laʼka. Todule̩ e̩wñ kʼO̩jo̩ fugwodama rʼoka, one̩ ki fʼu daru n.
For he maketh small the drops of water:	Todu i afa ito̩ ito̩ omi tʼatate̩,
But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold; for it	Ane̩ ije̩ ame̩wño̩re̩-ma kʼi lʼewo ewo-ma daka ma ata n; todu ane̩-ma o̩pioo i che.
And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,	Mizraim la bi abo Lud, kpai abo Anam, kpai abo Lehab, kpai abo Naftuh,
And it was	Oñ i lewatu e̩gba kʼE̩laisha, e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ le̩, gbo̩ ka kʼonu Israe̩l fʼe̩wñ o̩la-wñ fana, i fʼuche̩ kpe̩ nyʼugbo onu kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼe̩ fʼe̩wñ o̩la-we̩ fana? Je̩ ñw u wʼugbo mi, tak i ama ka kʼakache̩ dʼIsrae̩l.
And it came to pass, when the priests were come out of the holy	Oñ i lewatu, e̩gba kʼamatama kwʼef uña kiafo̩ le̩ dufu, (todu amatama du kʼeju-ma dʼane̩ o̩mo̩ fʼo̩la-ma che ki fo, ma la nyeti alu kʼukpe̩-ma de̩ aro̩ne aro̩ne n;
And he sent them to Lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses: a month they were in Lebanon,	Oñ i fʼuma kpe̩ nyi Le̩banon, one̩: icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩gwa nʼochuʼka aro̩ne aro̩ne; ma fʼochuʼka je̩ Le̩bano̩n, taku ma jʼochu meji unyi. Adonai-ram la chʼagboji abo ku ma nʼuko̩lo̩ ire̩ ache le.
And he shall break it as the breaking of the potters' vessel that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not be found in the bursting of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth, or to take water	i la adʼu kpo̩fo̩ alu ku ma kpʼucha abucha fo̩
And the	Taku Jihofa kakini, Iche̩wñ kʼu li ame̩no̩kpakpa ooje ef ewo So̩do̩m le̩, e̩gba le̩ natʼugbo kide̩ no̩ chaka todu ma.
And Lot went up out of Zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his two daughters with him; for he feared to dwell in Zoar: and he dwelt in a cave, he and his two daughters.	Taku Lo̩t mute̩gu kwo Zoar dufu, oñ i lewa dodo oj uwo le̩, amo̩ma-wñ onobule̩ meji la jʼugbo-wñ, todu i railo edodo Zoar; abe̩le̩ i gugu ef owo, owñ kpai amo̩ma-wñ onobule̩ meji le̩.
And my heart hath been secretly enticed,	kʼe̩wñ le̩ gwʼe̩do̩-mi o̩gwo̩ maja maja,
And the priest shall take the basket out of thine hand, and set it down before the altar of the	Tak atama amʼagba le̩ gba bʼuwe̩ o̩wo̩ te̩, kʼi la dʼu guane̩ o̩gba ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩.
then shall the father of the damsel, and her mother, take and bring forth	e̩gbale̩ ata igbe̩le̩ le̩ kpai iye-wñ akʼe̩wñ ijali aga igbe̩le̩ le̩ dufu wʼalaku ugbo abogijo ewo le̩;
Now when the high priest and the captain of the temple and the chief priests heard these things, they doubted of them whereunto this would grow.	Oñ e̩gba kʼagboji amadide unyi O̩jo̩ kpʼamagboji amatama gbʼo̩la kide̩ i fitu ma tabale, ab e̩wñ le̩ ade̩ ejo̩gba taa?
O spare me, that I may recover strength,	Mʼeju-we̩ rida bʼumi te̩, kʼe̩do̩-mi ki lewane̩,
But I had pity for mine holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the heathen, whither they went.	Odu-mi kiafo̩ le̩ muda wʼumi eju, owñ chʼe-kʼabo unyi Israe̩l fʼu kpabie̩ te̩ ef abo uche̩-ichi uche̩ichi ugbo ku ma nyi le̩.
Then said he, Knowest thou wherefore I come unto thee? and now will I return to fight with the prince of Persia: and when I am gone forth, lo, the prince of Grecia shall come.
