And it came to pass on the seventh day, that the child died. And the servants of David feared to tell him that the child was dead: for they said, Behold, while the child was yet alive, we spake unto him, and he would not hearken unto our voice: how will he then vex himself, if we tell him that the child is dead?	Oñ i lewatu o̩jo̩ ekebie-wñ, o̩ma le̩ leku. Oñ abuko̩lo̩ Defid railo eka ñw u kʼo̩ma le̩ leku, todu ma kakini, Go, e̩gba kʼo̩ma le̩ deju, a ko̩la ñw u i la nyʼuwa eti n, ab a ale kʼa ka ñw u ka kʼo̩ma le̩ leku? I neke chʼo̩la-wñ e̩bie̩ne̩.
He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab: for his mother was his counsellor to do wickedly.	Owñ le̩ ño̩ lule̩ o̩na o̩na abunyi Ehab; todu iye-wñ chʼe̩ne̩ ki ako owñ kʼi chʼe̩wñ bie̩ne̩.

And Abimelech rose up, and all the people that	Tak Abime̩le̩k kpai amone̩ du ku ma jʼugbo-wñ kwane̩ odu, oñ ma fʼo̩la-ma kpe̩ uche̩ me̩le̩, ma lewa kpala nyu She̩ke̩m le̩.
Take heed now that ye fail not to do this: why should damage grow to the hurt of the kings?	Me̩ fʼo̩la mu, me̩ ki la bʼo̩wo̩ lo̩ ef e̩wñ-i n: e̩wñ chi kʼe̩wñ akpabie̩ abe̩i, kʼofu ki bʼamonu?
I will praise the name of God with a song,	Nanʼeli je̩nyu ñw odu O̩jo̩;
And I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which laboured with me in the gospel, with Clement also, and	I-i, u ñʼabi we̩, uwe̩ kʼe̩ te̩tane̩ oli uno̩lo̩ kpʼomi ogbolo, e̩ nate̩ko abobule̩-i ma bʼumi dobulu ef Uche̩nyo̩ manyu Kle̩me̩t kpai abo ki bo̩ ku ma bʼumi chʼuko̩lo̩ le̩, kʼodu-ma la jʼef o̩takada e-iñmi.

And when he looked behind him, he saw me, and called unto me. And I answered, Here	Tak e̩gba kʼi gʼubi-wñ, i fʼumi li, oñ i fʼumi do̩. Tak u dohi kakini, Omi de̩.
And they took Joseph's coat, and killed a kid of the goats, and dipped the coat in the blood;	Taku ma mʼafe̩ Jose̩f ko, ma la fʼo̩mʼewo kpa, oñ ma mʼafe̩ le̩ ko tunyʼe̩bie̩-wñ;
forasmuch as an excellent spirit, and knowledge, and understanding, interpreting of dreams, and shewing of hard sentences, and dissolving of doubts, were found in the same Daniel, whom the king named Belteshazzar: now let Daniel be called, and he will shew the interpretation.	todabu ku ma li ufu o̩me̩me̩le̩ kpʼe̩wñ ema kpʼoji e̩wñ ema kpʼofe o̩na eka kpʼoji o̩la ki gbiti edudufu kpʼo̩la ki gwuji ene̩, efu Danie̩l, owñ chʼe-kʼonu dʼodu-wñ ko̩ Be̩lte̩shaza. having the understanding darkened, being alienated from the life of God through the ignorance that is in them, because of the blindness of their heart:	abu kʼef ibe-ma chʼe̩chubi, ku ma mud ononojo ñw iñmi O̩jo̩, lef ugbodu ki dʼefu-ma, lef echi kʼe̩do̩-ma chi;

And when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.	Ma la kwo bʼamone̩ ki tinyo̩ le̩ te̩ oñ ma mʼowñ du alu kʼi de̩ ef o̩ko̩ kpai ama. O̩ko̩ omune̩ ño̩ jʼugbo-wñ ge̩.
Then the Philistines said, Who hath done this? And they answered, Samson, the son in law of the Timnite, because he had taken his wife, and given her to his companion. And the Philistines came up, and burnt her and her father with fire.	Tak abo Filistia kakini, E̩ne̩ che e̩wñ-i ta? Oñ ma kakini, Samson, kʼi chʼana e̩ne̩ Timna le̩ che, todabu kʼi mʼo̩ya-wñ du, kʼi la mʼu du kpo̩ ekeji-wñ. Tak abo Filistia mute̩gu wa, oñ ma nʼuna fʼonobule̩ le̩ kpai ata-wñ gujo.
And unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a part among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of the	Tak i mʼukpe̩ ʼka du ñwu Kele̩b, o̩ma Jefune le̩, ef abo Juda, alu kʼo̩la ki Jihofa ñwa ñwu Jo̩shua de̩, owñ che Kiriat-arba, owñ che He̩bro̩n, (Arba le̩ chʼata Anak).
How long will ye imagine mischief against a man?	Gbogbo nyʼe̩gba oñ ame̩ akobʼone̩,
Nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or of them that divide the hoof:	Ama abo ki atije̩ abe̩k e̩re̩-ma chʼe̩kpana kʼame̩ ma aje̩ ni de̩: inyakulumi, todabu kʼi atije̩ kʼe̩re̩-wñ ma la kpana n, i chʼe̩wñ elifo̩ ñwu me̩.

and	kʼuwe̩do̩ Jihofa mutajo bʼume̩ ma, kʼi la fʼo̩na ojale re, kʼomi ki we elo̩, tak ane̩ ñʼarʼo̩je̩ ge̩ n, kʼame̩ lenyo̩ bʼane̩ ki nyo̩ ki Jihofa adu ñwu me̩-i te̩ piopio.

and to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:	ku ma ño̩ nʼo̩da ku ma ne amebili dufu;

Woe unto them! for they have gone in the way of Cain, and ran greedily after the error of Balaam for reward, and perished in the gainsaying of Core.	Atogwo ñwu ma! Todabu ku ma mʼo̩na Ken du, ma laño̩ mʼo̩la-ma darʼef ila Belam ku ma rʼo̩me̩ ñwu ma, oñ ma lenyo̩ rʼef iñwa Ko̩ra.

And Naaman said, Be content, take two talents. And he urged him, and bound two talents of silver in two bags, with two changes of garments, and laid	Taku Neaman kakini, I ki nyʼuwe̩ eju kʼe̩ gbʼitale̩nt meji. O	O Jihofa, omi chʼadu-we̩;
I tell you that he will avenge them speedily. Nevertheless when the Son of man cometh, shall he find faith on the earth?	Naka ñwu me̩, kakini, Owñ anʼache̩ ma piopio. Ama e̩gba kʼO̩ma One̩ lewa i ñʼali e̩do̩-e̩kono̩ oj ane̩-ile̩-i?
And when the seven among four thousand, how many baskets full of fragments took ye up?	E̩gba kʼi chʼakala mebie ku ma kpe̩ ñw amone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ me̩le̩ le̩ fa, abubo̩-wñ ko̩ agba monu me̩ ko taa? Ma ka ñw u, kakini, Ebie.
And on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtles, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.	Tak o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩jo̩-wñ i akʼamikede meji abe̩k amo̩mo̩ke̩te̩be̩ meji wa ñw atama ugbo alugbo̩na unyabo ujeju.
and he went after the man of Israel into the tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of Israel, and the woman through her belly. The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And	O̩la ki Je̩re̩maya, akache̩, ñwa ñwu Se̩raya, o̩ma Ne̩raya, o̩ma Maseya, e̩gba kʼi lebo̩ Ze̩de̩kaya, onu Juda, nyi Babilo̩n o̩do̩ e̩ke̩le̩ ku Ze̩de̩kaya jʼo̩fe̩ le̩ de̩. Se̩raya le̩ la chʼe̩ne̩ ki nʼo̩da unyi olu onu.
	Abo o̩gbaʼka do̩mo̩ kʼenyi-ma chʼo̩kwo̩chageli,
As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness:	I chʼe-mi, nali eju-we̩ ef o̩kpakpa;
There shall none of his meat be left;	I ajʼuje̩wñ kʼi abo̩ n;
And on the seventh day ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work.	O̩jo̩ e̩kebie-wñ, me̩ ñʼanʼujeju kiafo̩ ge̩; me̩ ki che uko̩lo̩ akanya du n.
The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek	Eke kʼe̩ne̩bibi ake i kakini, I atejane̩ n;
I know that ye are Abraham's seed; but ye seek to kill me, because my word hath no place in you.	U chema ka ku me̩ chʼugbe̩ Ebraham, me̩ muda feju ekpa mi, todabu kʼo̩la e-mi ma nʼuña ef ume̩ n.
How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle!	Me̩ go abu kʼame̩nugbiti lewane̩
And ye shall tell my father of all my glory in Egypt, and of all that ye have seen; and ye shall haste and bring down my father hither.	Me̩ ki dʼojima-mi ane̩ Ijipti du ka ñw ata-mi, kpai e̩wñ du ku me̩ liʼi. Me̩ nahiane̩ ku me̩ dʼata-mi gwo̩ru wʼemi.
Now the Philistines fought against Israel: and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.	Oñ abo Filistia kʼogu bo̩ abo Israe̩l. Tak aboke̩le̩ Israe̩l ra rʼo̩gba abo Filistia, oñ ma che ma agbe̩, ma lewane̩ oj uwo Gilboa.
Therefore thus saith the	Todule̩ abu ki Jihofa ka de̩ kakini:
And it came to pass, when Joseph was come unto his brethren, that they stript Joseph out of his coat,	Oñ i lewatu e̩gba ku Jose̩f wʼugbo amo̩maye-wñ, ma la gwo̩ko̩ rʼu o̩la, ma mʼafe̩-wñ gwo̩, owñ chʼafe̩ kʼina-wñ chʼojoji ojoji ki dʼo̩la-wñ le̩;
And	Ma fʼamicherub kpʼoli ki dab e̩kpe̩ le̩ che nyʼo̩la-wñ; oli ki dab ekpe̩ le̩ la dago agbagba che̩rub meji, oñ che̩rub okoke du nʼeju meji eji.
I lifted up mine eyes again, and looked, and behold a man with a measuring line in his hand.	Tak u chi eju-mi nyʼate̩, e̩ la go, u li e̩ne̩ ki nʼiku uñwe̩wñ ef o̩wo̩-wñ!
And the people cried unto Moses; and when Moses prayed unto the	Tak amone̩ le̩ raku do̩ Mose̩s, oñ Mose̩s rodubo̩ Jihofa, tak una le̩ nye̩do̩.
and Jesse begat his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimma the third,	oñ Je̩si bi E̩liab, o̩mo̩gba-wñ, Abinadab la tekeji, Shima la chʼe̩ke̩ta,
And the children of Israel said, Who	Tak amo̩ma Israe̩l kakini, E̩ne̩ dʼef abo o̩lo̩pu Israe̩l chaka kʼi ma wʼef ujeju le̩ ugbo Jihofa n? Todu ma go̩ elile nʼe̩ne̩ kʼi ma dufu wa ñwu Jihofa Mizpa le̩ n, ma go̩ kakini, Ma adʼe̩ne̩ le̩ kpa chuu.
Now also when I am old and greyheaded, O God, forsake me not;	I-i, u chaka chʼogijo kʼiloji-mi chʼefufu,
Hath not my hand made all these things?	I chʼo̩wo̩-mi chʼe̩wñ-i du n?
And they said, We saw certainly that the	Ma kakini, A li ejugede pee ka ki Jihofa dʼugbo-we̩; oñ a kakini, kʼawa ki go̩ ñw o̩la-wa, owñ chʼawa kpai uwe̩, kʼa kpʼalo kpai uwe̩,
but is now made manifest by the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, who hath abolished death, and hath brought life and immortality to light through the gospel:	fai i la mʼu du tejugede lef ukwotejugede E̩najadu-wa Kraist Jisus kʼi fʼuku gbogili te̩ i laño̩ mʼiñmi kpʼewe eche̩, ejeji-wñ, ko wʼugbo ugane̩ lef Uche̩nyo̩;
the children of Gad and the children of Reuben came and spake unto Moses, and to Eleazar the priest, and unto the princes of the congregation, saying,	Oñ amo̩ma Gad kpai amo̩ma Rube̩n lewa ka ñwu Mose̩s kpai E̩leaza atama kpai amidachi abo o̩gbadu le̩ kakini,

And it came to pass, when they were come into Samaria, that Elisha said,	Oñ i lewatu e̩gba ku ma lewa Samaria, E̩laisha kakini, Jihofa, mʼeju abo-i chi kʼama ki gane̩. Taki Jihofa mʼeju-ma chi, oñ ma kwogane̩; me̩ la go, ma jʼalumeji Samaria.
and their meat offering of flour mingled with oil, three tenth deals unto one bullock, two tenth deals unto one ram,	kpai e̩wñ ele-ma ge̩, kʼi chʼomu te̩ke̩te̩ke̩ kʼekpo kpe̩gwa nyʼu, ukpe̩gwa me̩ta ki chʼutodu o̩kokuno̩ʼka, ukpe̩gwa meji la chʼutodu okoloʼka,

Moreover I call God for a record upon my soul, that to spare you I came not as yet unto Corinth.	Abe̩le̩ omi ado̩ O̩jo̩ kʼi chʼenibenu onugo-mi, kakini, Edo̩wo̩ mʼume̩ kʼu do̩wo̩ mʼume̩ oñ u ma wa Ko̩rint-in.
to the end that none of all the trees by the waters exalt themselves for their height, neither shoot up their top among the thick boughs, neither their trees stand up in their height, all that drink water: for they are all delivered unto death, to the nether parts of the earth, in the midst of the children of men, with them that go down to the pit.	todu kʼoli du ki jʼo̩la omi omi ki we ehi o̩la-ma ne ef e̩gba ku ma gba, ku ma la we edʼoji-ma tunyʼakpa, kʼamagbiti-ma ki we edago ef o̩gba-ma, owñ chʼe̩ne̩ du kʼi añmʼomi; todu ma mʼo̩chaka-ma ko ñw uku me̩, ku ma nyʼugbo ki chʼo̩gane̩ ile-i, alumeji amo̩ma amone̩, manyʼabo ku ma gwo̩ru nyʼef o̩lo̩ulu.

For the	Todu Jihofa chʼO̩jo̩ inaina,
Thou shalt not raise a false report: put not thine hand with the wicked to be an unrighteous witness.	E̩ ki gba o̩la o̩lemi kʼe̩ du ka n. E̩ ki du o̩wo̩-we̩ dama kpai e̩ne̩bibi kʼe̩ mud e̩nibenu o̩lachi n.

And I fell at his feet to worship him. And he said unto me, See	Tak u lewane̩ o̩gba e̩re̩-wñ kʼu dojikane̩ ñw u. Tak i ka ñw mi kakini, Nago e̩ ki che n: omi chʼe̩ne̩ kʼomi kpʼuwe̩ kpʼamo̩maye-we̩ ku ma nʼo̩la ibenu Jisus chʼadu, e̩ ki dojikane̩ ñw O̩jo̩. Todu afu ache̩ ku ma ka le̩ chʼo̩la ibenu e-Jisus.

keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life.	me̩ nadejute̩ o̩la-me̩ ef ufe̩do̩ O̩jo̩, me̩ naneju ejumomi Ondu-wa Jisus Kraist tef iñmi o̩gbegbele̩.

and it came to pass, when we came to the inn, that we opened our sacks, and, behold,	oñ i lewatu e̩gba kʼa lewa uru kʼa mʼakpulu-wa tu, go, o̩ko̩ e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ dʼalu akpulu-wñ, o̩ko̩-wa du jo̩ kpa; oñ a ño̩ du nʼo̩wo̩ dabi wa-i.

And it came to pass, when David was come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lo-debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,	Oñ i lewatu, e̩gba ku Defid lewa Mahanaim, Shobi, o̩ma Nahash kʼi de̩ Raba kʼi dʼef amo̩ma Amo̩n, kpai Machir, o̩ma Amie̩l kʼi de̩ Lo-debar, kpai Barzilai e̩ne̩ Gilead kʼi de̩ Rogelim;
And Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother, took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.	Tak O̩tnie̩l, o̩ma Kenaz, okekele Kele̩b e̩ne̩ke̩le̩, fʼu du; tak i mʼAksa o̩ma-wñ du ñw u chʼo̩ya.
And with you there shall be a man of every tribe; every one head of the house of his fathers.	Oñ e̩ne̩ʼka e̩ne̩ʼka kʼi kwʼef o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu du amanyʼuwe̩; e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ abo le̩ achʼuto̩gba unyi amata-wñ.

While Peter yet spake these words, the Holy Ghost fell on all them which heard the word.	Abu ku Pita nʼo̩la-i aka ta, Afu Kiafo̩ lewa abʼo̩la abo du ku ma gbʼo̩la le̩ ma.
So they smote him, and his sons, and all his people, until there was none left him alive: and they possessed his land.	Abe̩le̩ ma fʼowñ kpa, kpai amo̩ma-wñ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai amone̩-wñ chaka, gbogbo tak e̩ne̩ du ma bo̩ ñw u ge̩ n: oñ ma mʼane̩-wñ gba.

Have I conceived all this people? have I begotten them, that thou shouldest say unto me, Carry them in thy bosom, as a nursing father beareth the sucking child, unto the land which thou swarest unto their fathers? And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came against the city, and his servants did besiege it.	Ne̩biukadne̩za, onu Babilo̩n, la lewʼewo le̩, abu kʼabuko̩lo̩-wñ kpala nyʼu o̩mo̩.
Two	U fʼe̩wñ meji bi ugbo we̩ me̩;
And all things	E̩te̩ e̩wñ du la chʼO̩jo̩, kʼi fʼuwa ño̩ru ñw o̩la-wñ lefu Kraisti, kʼi la mʼuko̩lo̩ e̩wñ eche ñw one̩ e-eñʼone̩ ru-i du ñw a ge̩;

And the servant took ten camels of the camels of his master, and departed; for all the goods of his master	Tak adu le̩ mʼaminyakulumi odu-wñ me̩gwa ko, oñ i le, e̩wñ e̩nyo̩ odu-wñ du jʼef o̩wo̩-wñ; oñ i kwane̩, i le tu Me̩sopotemia, ewo Neho̩r le̩,
And I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph, and I will bring them again to place them; for I have mercy upon them: and they shall be as though I had not cast them off: for I	Tak u nadʼugbiti ñw unyi Juda,
How long, ye simple ones, will ye love simplicity?	Ame̩, ame̩nemo̩, gbogbo nyʼe̩gba oñ ame̩ afe̩do̩ emo̩-me̩ kade ta?
Thus will I cause lewdness to cease out of the land, that all women may be taught not to do after your lewdness.	Abe̩le̩ oñ nache kʼe̩wñ-tuñ eche ki takpa oj ane̩ le̩; kʼabobule̩ du ki ko̩che̩ kʼama ki we ewʼe̩wñtuñ-me̩ che.
And he that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with graveclothes: and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus saith unto them,	E̩ne̩ ki ku le̩ la kwodufu wa, e̩re̩-wñ kpai o̩wo̩-wñ chʼe̩ji o̩kpe̩; ugbogbo la chʼe̩wenyʼeju-wñ. Jisus ka ñwu ma kakini, Me̩ mʼu tu ku me̩ tʼo̩ no̩ kʼi lo.
And a certain scribe came, and said unto him, Master, I will follow thee whithersoever thou goest.	Tak ako̩takadaʼka te̩wa ka ñw u kakini, Akone̩ e̩wñ, natʼe̩ ubi ugbo du kʼe̩ nyi.
and said, Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither: the	tak i kakini, Ago ofo oñ u ne̩ kwef iye-mi, ago ofo nadabi nyʼo̩mo̩ ge̩; Jihofa mʼu ko wa, Jihofa laño̩ mʼu ko le ge̩. Odu Jihofa ki nele.
Thou hast walked in the way of thy sister; therefore will I give her cup into thine hand.	Uwe̩ lule̩ tʼo̩na o̩maye-we̩; todule̩ u mʼago omi-wñ du tʼef o̩wo̩-we̩ me̩.
Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee:	E̩ ki dʼo̩la bi e̩ne̩ ki ake̩ n tode̩gba kʼi achʼulaka-we̩;
and the border was drawn from the top of the hill unto the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of mount Ephron; and the border was drawn to Baalah, which	tak alo̩me̩ le̩ te̩ akwo oj uwo le̩ wa ugbo e̩bi omi Neftoa, oñ i ledufu nyʼewo ewo oj uwo Efro̩n; tak i rida kwʼo̩mo̩ anyi Beala (owñ le̩ che Kiriat-jearim),
And unto the sons of Kohath,	Ma la ko alu kʼanya je̩ kwef akwo̩ra unyi ef o̩lo̩pu (Ifraim kpai ef o̩lo̩pu Dan) kpai kwef ukpe̩reji o̩lo̩pu Manasa ñw amo̩ma Kohat ki bo̩, ewo me̩gwa.
And he that is eight days old shall be circumcised among you, every man child in your generations, he that is born in the house, or bought with money of any stranger, which	Me̩ la adʼe̩pi o̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ du o̩gba o̩gba me̩ o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩jo̩ ku ma bi, tʼe̩ne̩ ku me̩ bi unyi, tʼe̩ne̩ ku me̩ dʼo̩ko̩ la ugbo ononojo du ki ma chʼugbe̩ e-we̩ n.
But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.	Ma muda kwogagogodo, ailo fʼuma mu, ma do̩ kʼafuʼka ma li le̩.
The suburbs shall shake at the sound of the cry of thy pilots.	Ukwa amañʼo̩ko̩-we̩ o̩na ku ma gbo̩
All the days of his separation shall he eat nothing that is made of the vine tree, from the kernels even to the husk.	O̩jo̩ du kʼi fʼo̩la-wñ date̩ kade i aje̩ e̩wñ du ku ma ne̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma che n, dagba i chʼe̩yo̩-wñ dagba i chʼeikpa-wñ.
They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.	I la nʼugbo du ku ma la akpe̩te̩ oji yeele n, ma ala o̩wo̩ meji ilagba-ma n, ma la akʼo̩re̩la-ma da re n.
And Jesus knowing their thoughts said,	Tak abu ki Jisus chema ibe ku ma kpe̩ le̩, i kakini, E̩wñ chi ku me̩ kpʼibe bibi efe̩do̩-me̩?
But they presumed to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the ark of the covenant of the	Ma la fʼibenu je̩ oñ ma mute̩gu tʼoj uwo uwo le̩; akpati alo Jihofa, kpai Mose̩s muda kwef uru le̩ dufu n.
the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;	onu Mado̩n chʼoka; onu He̩zo̩r chʼoka;
But I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: Fear him, which after he hath killed hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, Fear him.	U muda ajuka ñw me̩ e̩ne̩ ku ma arailo-wñ; me̩ ki railo e̩ne̩ kʼi akpa kʼi ño̩ nʼo̩da edurikpolo tef una uña ubie̩; ochochi, naka ñw me̩, me̩ narailo e̩ne̩ le̩.
And as they went about to kill him, tidings came unto the chief captain of the band, that all Jerusalem was in an uproar.	Oñ abu ku ma jʼafeju alu ku ma ale ku ma dʼowñ kpa, inabali-wñ lewa ugbo onu-ogu le̩, kakini, Ogbo̩ Je̩rusale̩m du mudutu.
Now Peter sat without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, Thou also wast with Jesus of Galilee.	Pita la gugu ef ologbo o̩do̩da; oñ imo̩to̩ onobule̩ʼka lewʼugbo-wñ, i kakini, Uwe̩ ño̩ dʼugbo Jisus e̩ne̩ Galili le̩ ge̩.
And the Levites: both Jeshua the son of Azaniah, Binnui of the sons of Henadad, Kadmiel;	Abo Lifai la jo̩-i: Je̩shua o̩ma Azanaya kpai Binui kʼi dʼef amo̩ma He̩nedad kpai Kadmie̩l
And the	Abe̩le̩ Jihofa mʼane̩ chaka kʼi go̩ ka kʼi ako ñw amata-ma ko ñw abo Israe̩l; oñ abu ma mʼu gba ma kwo dodo jʼo̩mo̩.
If he be able to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be your servants: but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall ye be our servants, and serve us.	I la che̩wñ kʼi neke bʼumi ja, kʼi la adʼumi kpa, e̩gbale̩ a achʼamadu e-me̩; i muda che̩wñ kʼu fʼe̩ne̩ le̩ du, kʼu la mʼu du kpa, mak ame̩ achʼama-du e-wa ku me̩ re̩ wa.
And the maiden pleased him, and she obtained kindness of him; and he speedily gave her her things for purification, with such things as belonged to her, and seven maidens,	Oñ imo̩to̩ onobule̩ le̩ nyo̩ owñ eju; tak i chane̩ emo̩la ñw u; oñ i hika mʼe̩wñ kʼi ane̩ gwo̩la rinyo̩ ko ñw u piopio, manyʼe̩wñ ki chʼukpe̩-wñ, kpai abimo̩to̩ abobule̩ mebie ki chʼeju-wñ ku ma ko ñw u kwef abʼunyi onu. I la mʼowñ du manyʼabimo̩to̩-wñ mebie kwʼo̩mo̩ tʼuña ki nyo̩ tʼuma le ef unyi abobule̩.
Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies:	Uwe̩ añwʼitebulu che te̩ o̩gba-mi
And while he yet talked with them, behold, the messenger came down unto him: and he said, Behold, this evil	Abu kʼi nʼo̩la le̩ aka kpʼama, go, onuche̩ le̩ mugwo̩ru wʼugbo-wñ; oñ i kakini, Me̩ go, e̩wñ bie̩ne̩-i kwʼugbo Jihofa; e̩wñ chi kʼu ñʼakibeno Jihofa gbogbo alo ge̩?
An ungodly man diggeth up evil:	E̩ne̩ ebili agwa e̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ dufu,
And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that	O̩ba le̩ adʼef akpa, tak omi onugo agʼo kʼu nadibekado alo-ekpe̩ e-ogbegbele̩ ki dʼagbagba O̩jo̩ kpai onugo ame̩wñ iñmi du ki chʼo̩re̩la, owñ chʼe-du ki dʼane̩-ile̩.

And the young men arose, wound him up, and carried	Tak abokolobia kwane̩ mʼowñ du tʼef o̩kpe̩, oñ ma mʼu du kwef unyi naji.

And Joshua called for all Israel,	Jo̩shua fʼabo Israe̩l chaka do̩ wa, abogijo-ma kpai abo ku ma dʼoji dufu efu-ma kpai amakajo̩-ma kpai amako̩takada-ma, oñ i ka ñwu ma kakini, Omi chʼogijo, u kwojolugbo nana me̩;
And the children of Israel remembered not the	Abo Israe̩l laño̩ rewa Jihofa O̩jo̩-ma, kʼi mʼuma gba kwef o̩wo̩ ame̩nebi-ma ku ma jo̩ lʼuma daka le̩ n;
Joshua therefore sent them forth: and they went to lie in ambush, and abode between Beth-el and Ai, on the west side of Ai: but Joshua lodged that night among the people.	Taku Jo̩shua fʼuma kpe̩ lo; oñ ma nyʼakpala nyʼu le̩, ma la jo̩ agbagba Be̩te̩l kpai Ai, o̩wo̩ olane̩ Ai; Jo̩shua muda le̩ ef amone̩ le̩ odu o̩jo̩ le̩.
and thou shalt have a paddle upon thy weapon; and it shall be, when thou wilt ease thyself abroad, thou shalt dig therewith, and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh from thee:	e̩ ki la nʼuko̩che̩ ef e̩wñ ido̩na ogu-we̩; oñ e̩gba kʼe̩ nyʼagwʼe̩re̩ che̩, e̩ ki nʼuko̩che̩ le̩ gwʼura, tak e̩ dabi fʼe̩wñ ki akwʼef uwe̩ dufu gbabo.
Nevertheless David took the strong hold of Zion: the same	Ichaka dʼabe̩le̩ Defid fʼaku Zayo̩n le̩ du; oñ e-le̩ gbage̩de̩ mud ewo Defid.

On that day did the king Ahasuerus give the house of Haman the Jews' enemy unto Esther the queen. And Mordecai came before the king; for Esther had told what he	O̩jo̩ le̩ onu Ahasurus mʼunyi Heman, e̩ne̩ ki ako̩bʼamaJu le̩ ko ñw E̩sta o̩ya onu. And they called Rebekah, and said unto her, Wilt thou go with this man? And she said, I will go.	Taku ma fu Ribe̩ka do̩ wa, oñ ma ka ñw u kakini, E̩ le bʼe̩ne̩-i alo? Oñ i kakini, Nale.
They have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none goeth to the battle: for my wrath	Ma fʼo̩kakachi fa me̩; ma la fʼo̩la mu tane̩ chaka; e̩ne̩ du muda anyʼo̩ko̩-gu n; todu uwe̩do̩-mi bʼo̩wo̩ one̩-ma du oji ma me̩.
Shall I cause	Mʼu du dabi tunyʼako̩-wñ. Ugbo ku ma nyi we̩, oj ane̩ ugbo ku ma bi we̩ le̩, o̩mo̩ nakajo̩ we̩.
Then David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon's house, and dress him meat.	Taku Defid fʼonuche̩ kpe̩ nyʼunyi ugbo Temar, i kakini, Lo tʼunyi o̩maye-we̩ Amno̩n abajo̩-i kʼe̩ fʼuje̩wñ ñwo̩che ñw u.
This he said, not that he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and had the bag, and bare what was put therein.	I la ko̩la kide̩ todabu kʼame̩nale chewʼowñ eju n, chai todabu kʼi chʼajoji, kʼi la nʼakpati ku ma kʼe̩wñ nyʼu.
and ye shall keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month: and the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel shall kill it in the evening.	tak ame̩ ade gbogbo wʼo̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩le̩ ochu-i, e̩gbale̩ ujeju o̩gbadu abo Israe̩l chaka akpa e̩gba ane̩.
but we speak the wisdom of God in a mystery,	a muda ako̩la ofili O̩jo̩ ef afili, owñ chʼe-ki te̩te̩maja le̩, e-kʼO̩jo̩ fudate̩ o̩gba tak o̩kpanachi, o̩kpanachi do̩mo̩ tod ojima e-wa.
Israel	Israe̩l la fo̩ todu Jihofa,

Then commanded Belshazzar, and they clothed Daniel with scarlet, and	Taku Be̩lshaza ka, oñ ma nyi Danie̩l otogbo odufa ekpikpa, oñ ma dʼiyagba o̩jamalia tʼo̩ o̩fa, taku ma dʼo̩la-wñ takoya, kʼowñ ki chʼe̩ne̩ e̩ke̩ta ef abo̩da ojane̩ le̩.
And thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and perverteth the words of the righteous.	E̩ ki la gbʼo̩ko̩ obi n; todu o̩ko̩ obi afʼeju abo ki gane̩ chubi, i ñʼarʼo̩la abo o̩kpakpa da ge̩.
But if ye turn away, and forsake my statutes and my commandments, which I have set before you, and shall go and serve other gods, and worship them;	I muda che̩wñ kʼe̩ muna bʼo̩ te̩, kʼe̩ la hiʼe̩wñ uhio̩me̩-mi kpʼuko̩ uko̩ kʼu te̩ kʼu koj o̩gba we̩-i, tinyo̩, kʼe̩ la nyʼare̩ amo̩jo̩ omune̩ kʼe̩ dojikane̩ ñwu ma;

Oñ amonuche̩ O̩jo̩ ku ma ma fejute̩ o̩da oji o̩la e-ma n, ku ma muda hi odo e-ma tinyo̩, i la nafejute̩ ma oj igbaligba e-ogbegbele̩ ef e̩chubi gbe̩m ñw o̩jo̩ ajo̩ lile le̩.

Therefore I will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by the way will I observe	Todule̩ omi la dab idu ñw ama,
And it came to pass, that on the morrow Moses went into the tabernacle of witness; and, behold, the rod of Aaron for the house of Levi was budded, and brought forth buds, and bloomed blossoms, and yielded almonds. but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust doth corrupt, and where thieves do not break through nor steal:	Ama me̩ muda kʼe̩wñ akoko maja ñw o̩la-me̩ efojale, ugbo kʼojudu kpʼete̩kala ma aje̩ n, kpʼugbo kʼamajoji ma gwagudu n, ma la joji o̩mo̩ n.
When heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou afflictest them:	E̩gba kʼojale re, kʼomi ma ño̩ lo̩ ge̩ n, tod edure ku ma du we̩ re; iche̩wñ ku ma chʼadua rʼo̩wo̩ uña kide̩, ku ma la gogbodʼodu-we̩, ku ma rida bʼadure-ma le̩ te̩, abu kʼe̩ che ma o̩bata;
Now at	Oñ iko uje̩wñ uyo̩ igo̩bina te̩tatʼe̩namuʼka kʼi dʼo̩wo̩ amone̩ le̩ e̩do̩ no̩ ñwu ma.

But the end of all things is at hand: be ye therefore sober, and watch unto prayer.	Ama ukpoji e̩wñ du me̩ro̩wo̩ me̩: todule̩ ibe-me̩ ki chʼewane̩, eju-me̩ ki nafe̩rane̩ ñw adua eche.
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñw E̩nebi le̩ kakini, Go, e̩wñ du kʼi ne̩ jʼef o̩wo̩-we̩; chai owñ onugo oñ e̩ ma dʼo̩wo̩ akado n. Abe̩le̩ E̩nebi le̩ kwʼo̩gba Jihofa le dufu.
But I say unto you, Love your enemies, bless them that curse you, do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully use you, and persecute you;	Omi muda ka ñwu me̩ kakini, Ame̩ ki fe̩do̩ ame̩nebi-me̩, me̩ ki la chadua tod abo ku ma doli me̩,
This	Alu ku ma ko̩ nyʼef o̩takada ku ma du kpuche̩ rʼArtaze̩rksis kʼi chʼonu le̩ de̩, kakini, Amadu-we̩, kʼa chʼabo udaba ohimini, abe̩le̩ abe̩le̩.
Knowest thou	Uwe̩ mʼe-i kwʼigbelegbele n?
God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written,	O̩jo̩ ki kpo̩na: O̩jo̩ ki mud e̩nochochi, kʼone̩ du ki mud e̩nolemi; dabalu ku ma ko̩tane̩ kakini,
Then the heathen that are left round about you shall know that I the	Tak abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi kibo̩ ku ma jo̩ lʼume̩ daka ama ka kʼomi, Jihofa, fʼugbo ki chʼucho̩do̩ ne, kʼu laño̩ fʼe̩wñ gbe̩ ugbo ki chʼoku ane̩ akwoubi le̩; omi Jihofa ka me̩, omi la ache.
And in those times there shall many stand up against the king of the south: also the robbers of thy people shall exalt themselves to establish the vision; but they shall fall. Then he saith, I will return into my house from whence I came out; and when he is come, he findeth	E̩gbale̩ i akakini, Nadabi tʼunyi-mi ugbo kʼu kwo wa; oñ abu kʼi lewa o̩mo̩, i li abu kʼefu-wñ te̩ ofo, efu-wñ chʼe̩gba te̩, ane̩-wñ la jʼuña-wñ.

Moreover this they have done unto me: they have defiled my sanctuary in the same day, and have profaned my sabbaths.	E̩wñ ku ma ño̩ che mi de̩ ge̩: ma fʼuña-mi kiafo̩ daji o̩jo̩ʼkate le̩, ma la ño̩ fʼo̩jo̩ uñmi o̩jo̩ uñmi-mi kpabie̩;
Pashur, Amariah, Malchijah,	kpai Pash-hur kpʼAmaraya kpai Malkija
And these things, brethren, I have in a figure transferred to myself and	Amo̩maye-mi, u mʼe̩wñ-i rida nʼo̩la-mi kpʼApo̩lo̩s oji, todu kʼame̩ ki ko̩che̩ ef uwa ku me̩ we egu e̩wñ ki che̩ko̩tane̩ le̩ daba; todu kʼe̩ne̩ du ef ume̩ kʼi we edʼe̩ne̩ʼka ñwo̩ achagwunyu ekeji.
And the sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was rent in the midst.	olu kwodade, oñ ukpo uro̩na unyi O̩jo̩ ejefu mukpana alumeji.
And from the time	Oñ akwʼiko ku ma kʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo o̩jo̩ñwa o̩jo̩ñwa kwʼo̩mo̩, ku ma la dʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ ki agwʼe̩wñ alache̩ le̩ dago, o̩jo̩-wñ achʼicham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ nyʼoli me̩lu nyʼo̩gbo̩ meji.
So there was gathered much people together, who stopped all the fountains, and the brook that ran through the midst of the land, saying, Why should the kings of Assyria come, and find much water?	Abe̩le̩ amone̩ wewe jeju jo̩, oñ ma fʼona e̩bi omi le̩ re chaka, kpʼukpolo kʼi acha gu alumeji ane̩ le̩ du, ma kakini, Tode̩wñ amonu Asiria awa kumali omi nana?
So king Solomon was king over all Israel.	Abe̩le̩ So̩lo̩mo̩n jʼonu abo Israe̩l chaka.
Is	I chʼo̩de̩de̩ ane̩ te̩ chaka eju-we̩-i n? Nagbo̩ko̩bʼe̩ kʼe̩ mudaru bʼumi te̩. Iche̩wñ kʼuwe̩ mʼo̩wo̩ awohi du, mak u nale tʼo̩wo̩ awo̩to̩; i la che̩wñ kʼe̩ mʼo̩wo̩ awo̩to̩ du, e̩gbale̩ nalo tʼo̩wo̩ awohi.
And he said,	I ño̩ kakini,
And thou shalt not let any of thy seed pass through	E̩ ki mʼugbe̩-we̩ʼka du te̩ kʼe̩ je̩ ñw u kʼi le gu ef una du tu-gbo Mole̩k kʼe̩ la dʼe-le̩ kpa odu O̩jo̩-we̩ bie̩ n: omi, Jihofa de̩.

But they obeyed not, neither inclined their ear, but made their neck stiff, that they might not hear, nor receive instruction.	Ma muda netirʼu n, ma la hi eti wane̩ n, chai o̩lo̩-ma ma lo dago, kʼama ki we egbo̩, ku ma we egba uko̩-o̩la.
All my state shall Tychicus declare unto you,	Taikikus, o̩maye-ufe̩do̩, kʼi ache e̩wñ ñw one̩, kʼi ñʼachʼubi odu-wñ, kʼowñ kpʼomi chʼadu ef Ondu, aje̩ ñwu me̩ ma alu kʼe̩wñ du de̩ ugbo mi.

And his feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of Olives, which	Tak o̩jo̩ le̩ e̩re̩-wñ adago oj uwo O̩lif, owñ chʼe-ki dʼo̩gba Je̩rusale̩m o̩wo̩ olodudu le̩; taku ma akpʼuwo O̩lif le̩ na alumeji-wñ rʼo̩wo̩ olodudu kpai olane̩, o̩go̩-wñ atabale; ukpe̩re̩ji uwo le̩ achi rʼo̩wo̩ o̩pata ate̩, eju ekeji-wñ ale rʼo̩wo̩ o̩pata o̩gane̩.
and all Naphtali, and the land of Ephraim, and Manasseh, and all the land of Judah, unto the utmost sea,	kpai ane̩ Naftali chaka, kpai ane̩ Ifraim kpai Manasa, kpai ane̩ Juda chaka gbogbo wa ohimini o̩wo̩ olane̩,
I have confidence in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.	Omi ke̩do̩no me̩ ef Ondu, ka kʼame̩ anʼibe ojoji n: ama e̩ne̩ ki ami me̩ ejo le̩ ane̩ adu ajo̩-wñ, e̩ne̩ du ki chaka che.
And Adam called his wife's name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.	One̩ la dʼodu o̩ya-wñ ko̩ If todabu kʼowñ chʼugugu iye ñw e̩wñ du ki deju.

And the men of Ephraim said unto him, Why hast thou served us thus, that thou calledst us not, when thou wentest to fight with the Midianites? And they did chide with him sharply.	Tak aboke̩le̩ Ifraim ka ñw u kakini, E̩wñ chʼe-kʼe̩ che wa-i, kʼe̩ ma do̩ wa e̩gba kʼe̩ nyʼakogu bo̩ abo Midian n? Oñ ma dʼo̩la le̩ biʼu una una.

Yet now our flesh	Año̩la e-wa la dʼabu año̩la amo̩maye-wa, amo̩ma e-wa la dab amo̩ma e-ma; e̩ la go, awa la akʼamo̩ma-wa e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai onobule̩ jʼef adu, amo̩ma-wa onobule̩ iche̩ka la jʼef adu me̩; i la nʼe̩wñ du kʼa neke che n; todu abo omune̩ mʼane̩ uche̩-wa kpai uche̩ achiwebe̩te̩ma-wa gba me̩.
For he is gone down this day, and hath slain oxen and fat cattle and sheep in abundance, and hath called all the king's sons, and the captains of the host, and Abiathar the priest; and, behold, they eat and drink before him, and say, God save king Adonijah. And two golden rings shalt thou make to it under the crown of it, by the two corners thereof, upon the two sides of it shalt thou make	E̩ ki laño̩ che elika meji todu-wñ o̩gane̩ o̩jamalia pe̩te̩ke̩ kʼe̩ du lamʼo̩ le̩, akolo-wñ meji eji e̩ che jo̩; e-le̩ achʼugbo ku ma dʼugbo̩lo̩ oli tunyʼu ku ma ne̩.

And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, Ye	Taku Jose̩f libekado o̩na-ma kʼi na; oñ i ka ñwu ma kakini, Ame̩ chʼabo ku ma atu ane̩, me̩ wa ku me̩ go alu kʼane̩ te̩ ofofo.

And when Rehoboam was come to Jerusalem, he gathered of the house of Judah and Benjamin an hundred and fourscore thousand chosen	Oñ e̩gba ku Reho̩boam lewa Je̩rusale̩m, i fʼabo unyi Juda kpai Be̩njamin do̩ jeju, one̩ ku ma chi chʼone̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩la ku ma meju ogu, ku ma nyʼakogu bʼabo Israe̩l, ku ma dabi gba ojane̩ le̩ ñwu Reho̩boam.
behold now, thy servant hath found grace in thy sight, and thou hast magnified thy mercy, which thou hast shewed unto me in saving my life; and I cannot escape to the mountain, lest some evil take me, and I die:	go ta, adu-we̩-i mud e̩ne̩ kʼuwe̩ li eju, uwe̩ je̩ ñw ufe̩do̩-e̩nyo̩-we̩ nana me̩, owñ chʼe-kʼe̩ du ña mi ejadu kʼe̩ jadu oji-mi-i; u la neke ra tugbo uwo le̩ n, tode̩gba kʼe̩wñ bie̩ne̩ ke̩re̩bʼumi, kʼu naku.

but unto Hannah he gave a worthy portion; for he loved Hannah: but the	I muda kʼukpe̩ meji ñwu Hana, todu i afe̩do̩-wñ dagba Jihofa chaka fʼo̩na o̩ma ebi-wñ re.
Blessed	Jihofa O̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l ki nele,
In the morning sow thy seed, and in the evening withhold not thine hand: for thou knowest not whether shall prosper, either this or that, or whether they both	E̩ kʼe̩yo̩-we̩ gbe̩ odudu waa. in the morning thou shalt say, Would God it were even! and at even thou shalt say, Would God it were morning! for the fear of thine heart wherewith thou shalt fear, and for the sight of thine eyes which thou shalt see.	Odudu uwe̩ akakini, O, olu ki hika tunyane̩ ke n! e̩gba ane̩ uwe̩ la akakini, O, o̩jo̩ ki hika ñwa ke n! tod okpo ki adʼe̩do̩-we̩, kpai e̩wñ kʼeju-we̩ ali.
And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power,	Tak u gbo̩ abu kʼe̩wñ du ku ma nyi e-ki jʼefojale kpʼe-ki jʼane̩ ile̩ kpʼe-ki jʼo̩gane̩ ane̩ ile̩ kpʼe-ki jʼej o̩himini kpʼe̩wñ du ki jʼef uwñ jʼakakini, Uje̩nyu kpʼubumo̩ kpʼojima kpʼugbiñmi ogbegbele̩ nyile̩wa tugbo e̩ne̩ ki gugu oj ede le̩, kpai tugbo O̩mala.
the pure candlestick,	akete ku ma nʼo̩jamalia hiolo che kpai agege-wñ, kʼagege-wñ tala jʼoji-wñ aro̩ne aro̩ne kpai e̩wñ eku-wñ chaka, kpai ekpo todu ugane̩;
the field is the world; the good seed are the children of the kingdom; but the tares are the children of the wicked one;	Uche̩ le̩ la chʼile̩-i; e̩yo̩ o̩me̩me̩le̩ la chʼamo̩ma Ojane̩ kʼa ka le̩; e̩kwe̩ le̩ chʼamo̩ma e̩ne̩bibi le̩.
of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.	Uwe̩ onugo ki fʼo̩la-we̩ de ugbo-wñ, todu i kobʼo̩la kʼa ka nana tabale.
And whosoever shall speak a word against the Son of man, it shall be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the Holy Ghost it shall not be forgiven.	E̩ne̩ du kʼi la fʼo̩laʼka ka nyʼO̩ma One̩, ma atʼo̩ no̩ ñw u; ama e̩ne̩ ki muda achakpabie̩ Afu Kiafo̩ ma atʼo̩ no̩ ñw u n.

But if any man say unto you, This is offered in sacrifice unto idols, eat not for his sake that shewed it, and for conscience sake: for the earth	I muda che̩wñ kʼe̩ne̩ʼka ka ñw me̩ kakini, E̩wñ Iche̩bo̩ de̩, me̩ ki je̩ n, tod e̩ne̩ ki dʼoji-wñ dufu le̩, kpai akone̩ o̩la ki dʼef e̩do̩:

Yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown: yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: and he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, and the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.	Ma ko gbe̩ kpo̩kpe̩ n, ma la ko fia kpo̩kpe̩ n,

And when all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,	Oñ e̩gba kʼabo Jebe̩sh-gilead gbʼinabali e̩wñ du kʼabo Filistia che So̩l le̩,
But when Jesus saw	Ama abu ku Jisus li, i bieju nana, oñ i ka ñwu ma, kakini, Me̩ je̩ ñw abimo̩to̩ wʼugbo mi; ame̩ ki fʼuma naba n; todu kʼojane̩ O̩jo̩ chʼe-abo e̩go̩-i.
And he made the staves	I nʼoli akesia fa ugbo̩lo̩ oli ku ma du ne̩ itebulu le̩, oñ i fʼo̩jamalia wenyʼu.
And if thy brother be waxen poor, and fallen in decay with thee; then thou shalt relieve him:	I la che̩wñ kʼale fʼo̩maye-we̩ kʼi dʼugbo-we̩ mu kʼo̩wo̩-wñ nyaru e̩wñ, e̩gbale̩ uwe̩ ki gbʼo̩ nyi; i agugu ugbo we̩ dabe̩ne̩ kʼilowa abe̩k abo ane̩ omune̩.
Howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.	Awa muda awa abʼalaʼka ma tila.
As he came forth of his mother's womb, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his labour, which he may carry away in his hand.	Alu kʼi kwʼefu iye-wñ dufu ago ofo abe̩le̩ i alo alu kʼi wa le̩. I la nʼe̩wñ du kwef uko̩lo̩ akanya kʼi che kʼi adu nʼo̩wo̩ alo n.

For some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that came out of Egypt by Moses.	Todu e̩ne̩ gbo̩ kʼi ño̩ nyi e̩do̩ ulukoko wa? I la chʼo̩chaka amone̩ ku ma kwef Ijipti wa lugbo Mose̩s le̩ n?

And he took thereof in his hands, and went on eating, and came to his father and mother, and he gave them, and they did eat: but he told not them that he had taken the honey out of the carcase of the lion. And Eleazar the priest said unto the men of war which went to the battle, This	Tak E̩leaza atama ka ñw abogu ku ma nyʼoko ogu le̩ kakini, E̩wñ ki chʼuhio̩me̩ uko̩-o̩la e-ki Jihofa ñwa ñwu Mose̩s le̩ de̩:

Then they went along through the wilderness, and compassed the land of Edom, and the land of Moab, and came by the east side of the land of Moab, and pitched on the other side of Arnon, but came not within the border of Moab: for Arnon	Taku ma le ef aje̩tachi le̩, oñ ma dagbala le ej ubi ane̩ Ido̩m kpai ane̩ Moab, oñ ma lewa o̩wo̩ olodudu ane̩ Moab le̩, ma la rujʼejudaba Arno̩n le̩; ma muda le gu alo̩me̩ du tʼoj ane̩ Moab in, todu Arno̩n le̩ chʼalo̩me̩ Moab.

But the children of the murderers he slew not: according unto that which is written in the book of the law of Moses, wherein the	I muda kpa amo̩ma amakpo̩ne̩ le̩ n. For it came to pass, when David was in Edom, and Joab the captain of the host was gone up to bury the slain, after he had smitten every male in Edom;	Todu i lewatʼe̩gba ki Defid dʼIdo̩m, ki Joab kʼi chʼonu abogu, mute̩gu nyʼakʼoku abo ku ma kpa ji, i la fʼaboke̩le̩ Ido̩m okoke du kpa.
Therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.	Todu ekide̩ amaJu ño̩ feju tule ku ma fʼu kpa, i chutodabu kʼi atu o̩jo̩ uñmi kate n, i muda ño̩ ka kʼO̩jo̩ chʼAta e-wñ ge̩; kʼi dʼo̩la-wñ chʼokujo̩ kpai O̩jo̩.
Yet the number of the children of Israel shall be as the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured nor numbered; and it shall come to pass,	I chaka dʼabe̩le̩ aluka amo̩ma Israe̩l awewe dab e̩lanyi ohimini, e-ki ma jʼañwa n, kʼi ma la jʼakaluka n; oñ i awatu ka kʼugbo ku ma ka ñw ma kakini, Ama chʼabo-mi n, ma aka ñw ma kakini, Amo̩ma O̩jo̩ ki deju.

Yea, and what have ye to do with me, O Tyre, and Zidon, and all the coasts of Palestine? will ye render me a recompence? and if ye recompense me, swiftly	Ochochi, e̩wñ chʼe-mi kpai ame̩, O Taya kpai Saido̩n? kpai ane̩ Filistia chaka? And when he had thus spoken, he kneeled down, and prayed with them all.	Tak abu kʼi fʼe-kide̩ ka i mʼokuku-wñ ko nyane̩ oñ i bʼo̩chaka-ma chadua.
Now after this he built a wall without the city of David, on the west side of Gihon, in the valley, even to the entering in at the fish gate, and compassed about Ophel, and raised it up a very great height, and put captains of war in all the fenced cities of Judah.	Tak ubi le̩ i fʼaku ne ejo̩do̩da aku ewn Defid, o̩wo̩ olane̩ Giho̩n, ef o̩go̩ le̩, gbogbo wʼalaku E̩ja; i la nʼe nyʼOfe̩l daka, oñ i ne kʼi gba nana ololo: tak i kʼamagboji abogu jʼewo ewo Juda du ki nʼaku.
And he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and saith unto Peter,	Tak i lewʼugbo amako̩che̩ le̩ oñ i fʼuma li abu ku ma jo̩ alolu. Tak i ka ñwu Pita kakini, Abe̩le̩ le̩e̩, ame̩ gbiti bo̩jo̩ ku me̩ gwe̩ke̩ adide kpai omi auwa oka n?
because the creature itself also shall be delivered from the bondage of corruption into the glorious liberty of the children of God.	todu ma agba e̩wñ ki chʼe̩nyi te̩ onugo tane̩ bʼo̩wo̩ uko̩lo̩ adu uchile̩che̩ eche te̩ tef omi nʼo̩la-mi e-ojima e-amo̩ma O̩jo̩.

that the house of Israel may go no more astray from me, neither be polluted any more with all their transgressions; but that they may be my people, and I may be their God, saith the Lord	todu kʼabo unyi Israe̩l ki ño̩ la bʼumi te̩ ge̩ n; kʼama ki ño̩ nʼada du ku ma je̩ kpʼo̩la-ma bie̩ n, kʼama ki muda chʼabo-mi, kʼomi ki chʼO̩jo̩-ma, Ondu Jihofa ka-i.

For the time past of	Todu kʼiko ki lale le̩ ki bʼuko̩lo̩ kʼabo uche̩ichi neku-wñ eche jo̩, i ki ño̩ bʼule̩ ele ef e̩wñtuñ kpʼe̩ño̩ e̩wñ eche kpʼomi achiwebe̩te̩ma eñmo̩ kpʼo̩te̩ eñwo̩ kpʼe̩wñ awulu eche kpʼode ode ku ma nʼaba-wñ eche jo̩.
And one hath committed abomination with his neighbour's wife; and another hath lewdly defiled his daughter in law; and another in thee hath humbled his sister, his father's daughter.	I nʼe̩ne̩ kʼi chʼe̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ kpʼo̩ya ekeji-wñ; i la nʼe̩nomune̩ kʼi fʼe̩wñ tuñ che kpʼo̩ya o̩ma-wñ, e̩nomune̩ la fʼo̩maye-wñ onobule̩ chʼukata, owñ chʼo̩ma onobule̩ ata-wñ.

And many brought gifts unto the	Tak amone̩ wewe ko e̩wñ ele wa Je̩rusale̩m ñwu Jihofa, kpʼe̩wñ akoko ñwu He̩ze̩kaya, onu Juda ge̩; todabe̩le̩ i mud e̩ne̩lile eju abo uche̩ichi du akwʼe̩gba le̩.
Only the cattle and the spoil of that city Israel took for a prey unto themselves, according unto the word of the	Chai ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ kpai ane̩ ewo le̩ kʼogu je̩; e-le̩ kate abo Israe̩l muko chʼe-ma, likpa alu kʼo̩la de̩ ki Jihofa ñwa ñwu Jo̩shua le̩.
Not because I desire a gift: but I desire fruit that may abound to your account.	I cheka kʼu natejane̩ e̩wñ-ele le̩ n; u muda atejane̩ e̩ro ki mud o̩be̩le̩ke̩te̩ ku ma ki loru ñwu me̩.
But if a man come presumptuously upon his neighbour, to slay him with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.	I muda che̩wñ kʼone̩ gwejugede gwo̩ko̩ rʼone̩ o̩la kʼi fʼu kpa lef ugbeju, e̩ ki mʼu du bʼubo̩ iche̩bo̩-mi te̩, todu kʼi ku.

one kid of the goats for a sin offering:	o̩mobuko̩ ʼka todu iche̩bo̩ adure;
And all the people likewise cut down every man his bough, and followed Abimelech, and put	Abe̩le̩ aboke̩le̩ le̩ okoke fʼe̩to oli-wñ da wane̩, taku ma tʼAbime̩le̩k ubi, oñ ma mʼu ko yama o̩la aku le̩, ma fʼuna tʼo̩ abʼuma oji ma, todule̩ abo o̩do̩go̩ She̩ke̩m le̩ chaka ño̩ ku ge̩, aboke̩le̩ kpai abobule̩ dab one̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩.

praising God, and having favour with all the people. And the Lord added to the church daily such as should be saved.	ma jʼañwulo̩ O̩jo̩, o̩gbo̩ amone̩ du la li uma eju. Oñ Ondu na kʼabo kʼi nʼajadu le̩ manyʼuma o̩jo̩ñwa o̩jo̩ñwa.

And the blood shall be to you for a token upon the houses where ye	E̩bie̩ le̩ la achʼujiwe ñwu me̩ o̩la unyi unyi ugbo ku me̩ jo̩ le̩; oñ e̩gba kʼu fʼe̩bie̩ le̩ li nalʼume̩ oji lale tak e̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ du abʼume̩ ma kʼi kpa me̩ bie̩ e̩gba kʼu fʼabo oj ane̩ Ijipti-i gwoda n.

Mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not,	Omi aku eju-mi acha dafo,
Nevertheless the	I chaka dʼabe̩le̩ Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ ko̩ enetiru o̩la Belam; Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ muda rʼama le̩ da ki mud e̩nyo̩ ñwu me̩, todabu ki Jihofa O̩jo̩-we̩ fe̩do̩ we̩.
And whatsoever shall seem good to thee, and to thy brethren, to do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do after the will of your God.	E-du ki chenyo̩ eju-we̩ kpai amo̩maye-we̩ ku me̩ nʼajifa kpʼo̩jamalia ki bo̩ che, ame̩ ki chʼe-le̩ alu ki dʼO̩jo̩-me̩ e̩do̩.
How long shall I take counsel in my soul,	Gbogbo nyʼe̩gba oñ nanyʼo̩juju ef onugo-mi,
The	Jihofa anʼokute̩ ukpahiu-we̩ dala kwefu Zayo̩n dufu.
But while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the Lord appeared unto him in a dream, saying, Joseph, thou son of David, fear not to take unto thee Mary thy wife: for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Ghost.	Abu kʼi la nʼibe e̩wñ-i akpe̩, go, onuche̩ Ondu kwotejugede ñw u ef o̩na kʼi na. I kakini, Jose̩f, uwe̩ o̩ma Defid, e̩ ki railo Me̩ri, o̩ya-we̩ le̩ egba n; todu efu-wñ kʼi nyo̩ le̩ kwʼugbo Afu Kiafo̩.
God layeth up his iniquity for his children:	Ame̩ kakini, O̩jo̩ akʼe̩wñ ibe̩te̩-wñ jo̩ anede amo̩ma-wñ.
For I have laid upon thee the years of their iniquity, according to the number of the days, three hundred and ninety days: so shalt thou bear the iniquity of the house of Israel.	Todu omi fʼo̩do̩ kʼama te̩tafʼudu bu ñw e̩, kʼo̩do̩ʼka-wñ chʼo̩jo̩ʼka ñw e̩, owñ chʼo̩jo̩ 390, Abe̩le̩ uwe̩ ñʼanʼudu kʼabunyi Israe̩l fe̩ le̩.
Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous,	Atogwo ñw ame̩, amako̩takada kpai amaFarisi, ame̩nayechi! todabu ku me̩ fʼojinoji amakache̩ ko̩, me̩ laño̩ fʼoji abo o̩kpakpa ñwo̩che jo̩;
But what went ye out for to see? A man clothed in soft raiment? behold, they that wear soft	E̩wñ me̩ la dufu alike? One̩ kʼi kʼe̩wñ ne̩wu ne̩wu nyʼo̩la? Me̩ go, abo ku ma anyi e̩wñ ne̩wu ne̩wu jʼunyi amonu.
Bunni, Azgad, Bebai,	kpai Buni kpʼAzgad kpai Bebai
Him that is weak in the faith receive ye,	Oñ e̩ne̩gbo ef e̩do̩ ekono, me̩ mʼu gba cho̩la; i ki muda chʼutodu kʼame̩ ki ñwʼibe kʼi dʼef uwñ go n.
For they are the spirits of devils, working miracles,	todu ma chʼamafu e-amebili ku ma nʼe̩wñ ujiwe ache, kʼama le̩ ale dufu nyʼugbo amonu o̩gbo̩ ile̩ ugbo kʼone̩ dodo kade du, ku ma ko ma wa ugbo ogu e-o̩jo̩ lile e-O̩jo̩ Odobao̩gagu; me̩ go, nawa dabe̩ne̩ kʼoji.
and cried with a loud voice, as	tak i nʼomuko̩la lile akwa alu kʼidu ako̩la: oñ e̩gba kʼi kwa, akpabana mebie le̩ nʼomu-ma ako̩la.
Wherefore putting away lying, speak every man truth with his neighbour: for we are members one of another.	Lef e-le̩ me̩ nakʼolemi jane̩, kʼe̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩-me̩ ki kʼochochi kpai ekeji-wñ; todabu kʼawa chʼe̩wñ o̩la omune̩.

And he lifted up his eyes, and saw the women and the children; and said, Who	Tak i chi eju-wñ nyate̩ oñ i fʼabobule̩ kpai amo̩ma-ma li, i kakini, Abo ugbo jʼugbo-we̩-i? I kakini, Amo̩ma kʼO̩jo̩ du li adu-we̩ ejumomi le̩ de̩.
that sendeth ambassadors by the sea, even in vessels of bulrushes upon the waters,	kʼi akpʼamonuche̩-wñ le ej ohimini,

A anʼuna gu unyi-we̩ jo̩ abʼe̩ oji ma.
The beasts of the field cry also unto thee: for the rivers of waters are dried up, and the fire hath devoured the pastures of the wilderness.	Ochochi ame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ oko du jʼache fafafa ñw e̩
and I will multiply men upon you, all the house of Israel,	naje̩ ñw amone̩ ki wewe oji-we̩, owñ chʼo̩gbo̩dudu abo unyi Israe̩l, o̩chaka-wñ naka-i; one̩ la dodo ewo ewo-wñ, oñ ma akʼunyi egbili e̩lanyi kpʼokuta le̩;
and the incense altar, and his staves, and the anointing oil, and the sweet incense, and the hanging for the door at the entering in of the tabernacle,	kpai ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ e-otulale ku ma gujo kpai oli ku ma ko tunyʼu kpai ekpo ku ma du batʼo̩la kpai otulale ki akpo ku ma gujo kpai ukpo uro̩na alugbo̩na uña ugugu;
Speak unto the house of Israel, Thus saith the Lord	E̩ nako̩la ñw abo unyi Israe̩l kakini, Abu kʼOndu Jihofa aka de̩ kakini, Go, omi afʼuña-mi kiafo̩ daji, owñ chʼuba ukpahiu-me̩ kpʼe̩wñ uñeju-me̩ kpʼe̩wñ kʼonugo-me̩ ali ejumomi-wñ le̩. O̩kwo̩-chageli la akʼamo̩ma-me̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpʼonobule̩ kʼume̩ tʼuma no̩ jʼubi dajane̩.
Then laid they	E̩gbale̩ ma kʼo̩wo̩ no ma oñ ma mʼAfu Kiafo̩ gba.
For the flesh lusteth against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh: and these are contrary the one to the other: so that ye cannot do the things that ye would.	Todu e̩ño̩ e̩wñ kʼo̩re̩la ache chagwunyu Afu, Afu la chagwunyʼo̩re̩la; todu abo-i jʼako bʼo̩la-ma; todu kʼame̩ ki we eche e̩wñ ki dʼume̩ e̩do̩.
Whereof	Afu Kiafo̩ laño̩ nʼibenu agba ñw a ge̩; todu abu kʼi kakini,
And the	Oñ Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini,
And Moses went into the midst of the cloud, and gat him up into the mount: and Moses was in the mount forty days and forty nights.	Taku Mose̩s mugudu tʼalumeji akpa, oñ i mute̩gu tʼoj uwo le̩. Mose̩s la dʼoj uwo le̩ o̩jo̩ o̩gbo̩ meji kpai odu o̩gbo̩ meji.
If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father's commandments, and abide in his love.	Iche̩wñ ku me̩ dejutʼo̩la uko̩-mi ame̩ agugu ef ufe̩do̩-mi: alu kʼomi dejutʼo̩la uko̩ Ata-mi le̩, kʼu la gugu ef ufe̩do̩-wñ.
And the fish that	tak e̩ja ki jʼefu Naye̩l-i aku, omi Naye̩l-i la alu, oñ omi Naye̩l-i achʼabo Ijipti ihie̩ne̩ eñmo̩.
And he said, Whether they be come out for peace, take them alive; or whether they be come out for war, take them alive.	Tak i kakini, Ma nʼo̩lafia wa? Mu ma udeju udeju; dagba ma dufu wa ku ma jogu, mu ma udeju udeju.
And he said, My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go, then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.	Tak i kakini, O̩ma-mi ale bʼume̩ nyʼo̩gane̩ n, todu o̩maye-wñ leku me̩, owñ kate bo̩. Iche̩wñ ku me̩ alo kʼe̩wñ bie̩ne̩ ke̩re̩bʼo̩ ej o̩na, e̩gbale̩ ame̩ adʼi-loji-mi efufu tef o̩jegu kpai e̩do̩dudu.
And Elisha said,	Tak E̩laisha kakini, Oji Jihofa ki nʼe̩wñ du, e-kʼomi dago o̩gba-wñ-i, ochochi, i ma chʼeju Jiho̩shafat, onu Juda, ki wʼumi eju n, u ma rʼeju-mi da ago ugbo kʼe̩ de̩ n, u ma le li uwe̩ n.
For I bear him record, that he hath a great zeal for you, and them	Todu nagba owñ ibenu kakini, I nʼakanya nana ache todu me̩ kpai todu abo ku ma jo̩ Leode̩sia kpai todu abo ku ma jo̩ Hairo̩po̩lis ge̩.
Then the spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a voice of a great rushing,	Tak Afu mʼumi du kwane̩ oñ u gbʼekuku ubi-mi dabe̩ne̩ kʼe̩wñ ka afule gbudugbudu, i kakini, Ojima Jihofa ki nʼele akwo uña-wñ le̩;
Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.	Jisus la fe̩do̩ Marta kpʼo̩maye-wñ onobule̩ kpai Lazaro̩s.
To give subtilty to the simple,	kʼi je̩ ñw e̩nemo̩ kʼi gbeju,
And at that time came Joshua, and cut off the Anakims from the mountains, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the mountains of Judah, and from all the mountains of Israel: Joshua destroyed them utterly with their cities.	Taki Jo̩shua lewa iko le̩, oñ i fʼabo Anak ko̩da rinyo̩ bʼane̩ uwo kpai He̩bro̩n kpai Debir kpai Anab, te̩, kpai bʼane̩ uwo Juda chaka te̩, kpai bʼane̩ uwo e-Israe̩l te̩ chaka; Jo̩shua mʼama kpai ewo ewo-ma kojo̩ ñw O̩jo̩ hioko.
Therefore thus saith the Lord	Todule̩ abu kʼOndu Jihofa ka de̩, kakini, Todabu kʼame̩ che ku ma rewa udu ku ma fe̩, abu kʼada ku me̩ je̩ kwote̩ pee, todu kʼadure-me̩ kwotejugede ef e̩wñ du ku me̩ che; todabu ku ma rewa me̩, o̩wo̩ ado me̩.

And Moses was wroth with the officers of the host,	Taku Mose̩s we̩do̩ rʼabo kʼabogu le̩ jʼef o̩wo̩-ma, owñ chʼamagboji one̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ kpai amagboji one̩ ogume̩lu ku ma kwʼoko ogu le̩ wa.
I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the end, the first and the last.	Omi chʼAlfa kpai O̩me̩ga owñ chʼe̩ne̩-ejodudu kpʼe̩ne̩-ubi otitala, kpʼabakwane̩ e̩wñ kpʼukpoji e̩wñ.
But chose the tribe of Judah,	i muda chi o̩lo̩pu Juda,
Then they cry unto the	Taku ma raku do̩ Jihofa ef ihianyi-ma,
and ye shall rejoice before the	Tak ame̩ ki jo̩ o̩gba Jihofa, O̩jo̩-me̩, ayo̩, ame̩ kpai amo̩ma-me̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai amo̩ma-me̩ onobule̩ kpai amadu-me̩ e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ kpai amadu-me̩ onobule̩ kpai e̩ne̩ Lifai kʼi dʼef aku, aku-me̩ abu kʼowñ ma ne̩ ukpe̩ abe̩k e̩wñ ogu ugbo me̩ n.

Then fearing lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast four anchors out of the stern, and wished for the day.	Oñ abu kʼa railo tode̩gba kʼa awa nʼokuta ma mʼanga me̩le̩ ko lʼo̩kpu o̩ko̩ tef omi, ma gule kʼo̩jo̩ ki hika ñwa.
There go the ships:	O̩mo̩ o̩ko̩ o̩ko̩ ale, kʼuwe̩ nyi kʼi chiya ef uwñ.

Shake thyself from the dust; arise,	Kwane̩, fʼebutu o̩la-we̩ gbanyo̩;
For the eyes of the Lord	Todabu kʼeju Ondu tʼabo̩kpakpa,
Let not my lord, I pray thee, regard this man of Belial,	nagbo̩ko̩bʼe̩ odu-mi, e̩ ki nyi e̩ne̩bili le̩ eti n, owñ che Nebal le̩; todu alu kʼodu-wñ de̩, abe̩le̩ i de̩: Nebal oñ odu-wñ ko̩ ibe̩te̩ la dʼo̩la-wñ. Omi, adu-we̩ onobule̩-i, u li abokolobia odu-mi kʼe̩ kpuche̩ wa le̩ n.
And David put his hand in his bag, and took thence a stone, and slang	Taku Defid dʼo̩wo̩ tunyʼikpa-wñ, oñ i mʼokutaʼka du kwef uwñ, oñ i fʼinata gwu, i la fʼo̩gba oji e̩ne̩ Filistia le̩ mu; okuta le̩ la kwotunyʼo̩gboji-wñ, tak i lewa fʼeju bʼane̩ ma.
Make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against Jerusalem,	Me̩ ki hi alu-me̩ mʼo̩ ñw abo uche̩ichi;
be it known unto you all, and to all the people of Israel, that by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom God raised from the dead,	o̩chaka-me̩ kpʼabo Israe̩l chaka ki ma kakini, Ef odu Jisusi Kraisti e̩ne̩ Nazare̩t kʼame̩ mʼu du kamoli, kʼO̩jo̩ la mʼu du kwane̩ kwef abo ki ku, ef owñ le̩ oñ e̩ne̩-i dago o̩gba-me̩ o̩lafia-i.
And all the children of Israel murmured against Moses and against Aaron: and the whole congregation said unto them, Would God that we had died in the land of Egypt! or would God we had died in this wilderness!	Tak abo Israe̩l chaka kwokeñmini nyu Mose̩s kpai Aro̩n o̩la, o̩gbo̩ abo o̩gbadu le̩ du ka ñwu ma kakini, O, a ma leku ane̩ Ijipti! Abe̩k a ma leku aje̩tachi-i, i ma me̩!
And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.	Taku Jiho̩shafat ka ñw onu Israe̩l kakini, E̩ muda tene alu kʼo̩la Jihofa de̩ eñini-i ta, agba.
The counsel of the	O̩la ki Jihofa alo adago ogbegbele̩,
Thou	Uwe̩ chʼe̩ne̩ e̩gahi kpʼe̩ne̩ ojima
Bring forth therefore fruits meet for repentance:	Todule̩ ame̩ ki rʼe̩ro kʼi chʼeju ibe erida.
If I be wicked, woe unto me;	Iche̩wñ kʼomi chʼe̩ne̩bibi, atogwo chʼe-mi!
Go, and gather the elders of Israel together, and say unto them, The	Lo, kʼe̩ dʼabogijo Israe̩l jeju, kʼe̩ la ka ñwu ma kakini, Jihofa kʼi chʼO̩jo̩ e-amata-me̩, O̩jo̩ e-Ebraham kpai e-Aise̩k kpai e-Jeko̩b, kwotejugede ñwu mi, i kakini. Omi wa go me̩, ochochi; u la fʼe̩wñ ku ma che me̩ Ijipti li.
Who	E̩ne̩ chʼafeju ki ma chʼadu-mi n?
Better	E̩wñ ene̩ re manyʼe̩gahi Jihofa, chenyo̩
Maaziah, Bilgai, Shemaiah: these	kpai Maa-zaya kpai Bilgai kpai She̩maya; abʼe-le̩ chʼamatama.
They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up	O̩chaka-ma awa ku ma chʼe̩wñ akpulu;
All the ways of a man	O̩na du kʼone̩ ale chʼefe̩ eju-wñ onugo.
The children of Solomon's servants: the children of Sotai, the children of Sophereth, the children of Perida,	E-amo̩ma amadu So̩lo̩mo̩n de̩; amo̩ma Sotai, amo̩ma Sofe̩re̩t, amo̩ma Perida,
I have hated them that regard lying vanities:	Abo ku ma nyʼe̩wñ o̩wai eti chʼe̩wñ ulaka-mi;
All	E̩wñ duawʼugbo e̩ne̩ duokujo̩, e̩wñ okate ache e̩no̩kpakpa kpʼe̩ne̩bibi; tʼe̩ne̩nyo̩, tʼe̩ne̩ ki fe̩, tʼe̩ne̩ ki ma fe̩ n, tʼe̩ne̩ ki achʼiche̩bo̩, tʼe̩ne̩ ki ma chʼiche̩bo̩ n; alu kʼe̩ne̩nyo̩ de̩ alu le̩ e̩nadure de̩; tʼe̩ne̩ ki age̩bo̩, tʼe̩ne̩ ki acho-kpo e̩bo̩ ego̩.
And I heard a great voice out of the temple saying to the seven angels, Go your ways, and pour out the vials of the wrath of God upon the earth.	Tak u gbʼomuko̩la lile ki kwʼef unyi O̩jo̩ ejefu le, i naka ñw amonuche̩ mebie le̩ kakini, Me̩ lo, ku me̩ mʼucha mebie e-e̩do̩fulu O̩jo̩ ko da rʼef ane̩ ile̩.

And the other issued out of the city against them; so they were in the midst of Israel, some on this side, and some on that side: and they smote them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.	Oñ abo ki bo̩ kwʼef ewo le̩ dufu wa akobʼuma; abe̩le̩ ma jʼalumeji abo Israe̩l, abo iche̩ka dʼejemi, iche̩ka la dʼejano̩mo̩; ma la gwo ma dajane̩ gbogbo e̩ne̩ ma du bo̩ n, e̩ne̩ du ef uma la fʼuma o̩wo̩ n.
And the king said,	Tak onu kakini, O̩wo̩ Joab dʼef e̩wñ-i chaka kpai uwe̩? Tak onobule̩ dohi, oñ i kakini, Alu kʼonugo-we̩ deju, O odu-mi onu, e̩ne̩ du neke rida tʼawo̩to̩ abe̩k awohi bʼe̩wñ kʼodu-mi onu ka-i te̩ n; todu adu-we̩ Joab ñwa ñwu mi, owñ la kʼo̩la-i chaka nyʼadu-we̩ alu.
And the vision of the evening and the morning which was told	O̩la ane̩ kʼe̩ go e-olane̩ kpʼolodudu ku ma ka le̩ chʼochochi: e̩ muda fʼo̩wo̩ no ane̩ kʼe̩ go le̩, todu o̩jo̩-wñ chebo̩ jiji ta.
Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and	Abu kʼi ka ate̩ o̩mo̩ kakini, E̩wñ iche̩bo̩ kpʼe̩wñ eduwa kpʼiche̩bo̩ e̩gujo kpʼe̩wñ iche̩bo̩ tod adure dʼuwe̩ e̩do̩ n, i la rʼuwe̩ e̩do̩ n, (owñ chʼe-ku ma che teju o̩lo̩da).
But	Abo Israe̩l muda gu ewo okate ki dago oji otete ugbo ku ma ko unyi igbele, jo n, chai Hezo̩r kate; e-le̩ Jo̩shua fugujo.
Those that be	Abo ku ma me̩rʼuwe̩ anane̩ kpʼabo ku ma jʼona jiji akʼuwe̩ ru, uwe̩ e̩nodu e̩kpabie̩, kʼutu eda chʼe̩kʼef uwe̩.
Their heart cried unto the Lord,	E̩do̩-ma raku do̩ Ondu!
and he overthrew those cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities, and that which grew upon the ground.	oñ i fʼewo ewo le̩ gulo̩ kpai egbili le̩ du kpai amone̩ ku ma jʼewo ewo le̩ kpai e̩wñ du ki tiga ane̩pe̩te̩.
until thy brother's anger turn away from thee, and he forget	gbogbo tʼe̩gba kʼuwe̩do̩ o̩maye-we̩ rida bʼe̩ te̩, kʼi gbenyo̩ e-kʼuwe̩ chʼo̩; e̩gbale̩ tak u nakpʼone̩ wa adʼe̩ kwo o̩mo̩. E̩wñ chi kʼu nadeku ame̩ meji o̩jo̩ kate?
And their coast was from Heleph, from Allon to Zaanannim, and Adami, Nekeb, and Jabneel, unto Lakum; and the outgoings thereof were at Jordan:	Oñ alo̩me̩-ma chane̩ akwo Hele̩f, kwugbo oli ok efu Zaananim le̩ alegu Adami-nekeb kpai Jabnee̩l du gbogbo wa Lakum: oñ i kpoji o̩la Jo̩rdan;
Thus they provoked	ma nʼe̩wñ ku ma che le bi owñ eju,
Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.	Saimo̩n onugo ño̩ ke̩do̩no ge̩; oñ abu ku ma fʼu che baptism i kute̩ Filip o̩la. Abu kʼi go ujiwe kpai uko̩lo̩ ukpahiu lile ku ma che, ibe-wñ mukpatuka.
saying, This	i kakini, E-kide̩ chʼe̩bie̩ alo ekpe̩ e-kʼO̩jo̩ tuko̩ ñw me̩.
then he shall minister in the name of the	e̩gba le̩ i ache e̩wñ ef odu Jihofa O̩jo̩-wñ, alu kʼamo̩maye-wñ chaka ku ma chʼabo Lifai ache, owñ chʼabo ku ma dago ache e̩wñ o̩gba Jihofa o̩mo̩.
So I went in and saw; and behold every form of creeping things, and abominable beasts, and all the idols of the house of Israel, pourtrayed upon the wall round about.	Tak u mugudu nyʼejefu oñ u li, ina e̩wñ ki afa ane̩pe̩te̩ ojoji ojoji, kpʼame̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ ki akʼone̩ e̩do̩fulu ire̩ kpʼode ode abunyi Israe̩l chaka ku ma ko̩ nyʼo̩do̩ le daka.
And it came to pass, when he was come nigh to Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount called	Oñ i leatu, abu kʼi ame̩ru Be̩tfeji kpai Be̩tani, ugbo uwo ku ma dʼo̩ ko̩ O̩lif, i fʼamako̩che̩ meji kpuche̩,
It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.	Me̩ ki dʼu je̩ o̩jo̩ ku me̩ dʼu wa che kpai o̩jo̩ñwa-wñ; e-du ki bo̩ gbʼo̩jo̩ e̩ke̩ta-wñ ma anʼuna agujo.
And four great beasts came up from the sea, diverse one from another.	Ame̩la lile me̩le̩ la kwef ohimini dufu, año̩la-ma chʼojoji ñw omune̩.
Now the rest of the acts of Jehoahaz, and all that he did, and his might,	E̩wñ ki bo̩ ki Jihoahaz che, e̩wñ du kʼi che, kpʼukpahiu-wñ, inabali-wñ che̩ko̩ rʼef o̩takada Iko E̩wñ Amonu Israe̩l le̩ n?
Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth,	E̩ ki gwoguyo̩ e̩gba kʼe̩nebi-we̩ wane̩ n,
and others had trial of	Ma la nʼakoru kpʼedili jʼabomune̩ ojoji ma, kpʼeji kpʼemu tʼunyi uga ge̩.
And the carcase of Jezebel shall be as dung upon the face of the field in the portion of Jezreel;	oñ oku Je̩ze̩be̩l adab echu abʼeju ukpe̩ ane̩ uche̩ Je̩zree̩l ma, todu kʼama ki we eka kakini, Je̩ze̩be̩l de̩.
so likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near,	abe̩le̩ ame̩ ge̩, e̩gba ku me̩ li e̩wñ-i du me̩ ki ma ka kʼi me̩rʼalugbana anane̩ me̩.
Thus saith the	Abu ki Jihofa, Onu Israe̩l
Thy name, O	Odu-we̩, O Jihofa, chʼogbegbele̩,
But Jesus held his peace. And the high priest answered and said unto him, I adjure thee by the living God, that thou tell us whether thou be the Christ, the Son of God.	Jisus muda chechi-wñ kpo̩, Tak agboji amatama ka ñw u kakini, NakpʼO̩jo̩ kʼi deju nʼuwe̩, iche̩wñ kʼuwe̩ che Kraisti, O̩ma e-O̩jo̩, e̩ ka ñw a.
And thou shalt make the seven lamps thereof: and they shall light the lamps thereof, that they may give light over against it.	Tak e̩ fʼagege-wñ mebie che; ma la akʼo jo̩ ki chʼugane̩ o̩gba-wñ o̩mo̩.
And thy handmaid had two sons, and they two strove together in the field, and	Oñ adu-we̩-i nʼamo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ meji, tak ama meji fʼuja ja oko, e̩ne̩ du la do̩mo̩ kʼi aba ma n, ama oka fʼe̩wñ nu ekeji, oñ i mʼu du kpa.
Is his mercy clean gone for ever?	Ufe̩de̩nyo̩-wñ muda hioko?
Then David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of an hill afar off; a great space	Taku Defid le tʼo̩wo̩ʼka-wñ o̩mo̩, oñ i kwodago oj uwo o̩najiji; agbagba-ma te̩ nana;
and he said unto them, Set your hearts unto all the words which I testify among you this day, which ye shall command your children to observe to do, all the words of this law.	i ka ñwu ma kakini, Me̩ mʼe̩do̩-me̩ du tʼo̩la kʼu nakajane̩ ñwu me̩ eñini-i, kʼame̩ ki ñwa ñw amo̩ma-me̩ ku ma fejutʼo̩ ku ma che tʼeju o̩la uko̩-o̩la-i chaka.
giving thanks unto the Father, which hath made us meet to be partakers of the inheritance of the saints in light:	Me̩ nagwa Ata kʼi je̩ ñw a bʼukpe̩ e̩wñ ogu e-abo kiafo̩ jo̩ ef ugane̩.
And entering into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, clothed in a long white garment; and they were affrighted.	Abu ku ma gudu nyʼef oji, ma li okolobiaʼka ki gugu o̩wo̩ awo̩to̩, otogbo efufu dʼo̩la-wñ; tak e̩gahi-wñ fu ma mu.
And if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offering unto the	I la che̩wñ kʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩-wñ chʼe̩wñ ure̩do̩ ki aduwa kpa ñwu Jihofa kwef ame̩wño̩re̩ egini, o̩ko̩ abe̩k ole, e-ki mufu i aduwa.
And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He	Tak ade alaku le̩ kakini, Eju-mi ule e̩ne̩ ejodudu dab ule Ahimaaz, o̩ma Zedo̩k. Tak onu kakini, E̩ne̩ e̩nyo̩ de̩, i la anʼinabali e̩nyo̩ wa.
I will cry unto God most high;	Omi akwado̩ O̩jo̩ Chamachala,
And if	I la che̩wñ kʼi chʼe̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ e-elifo̩, ku ma ma du wa chʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩ ñwu Jihofa n, e̩gbale̩ i adʼe̩la abe̩re̩me̩le̩ le̩ wa o̩gba atama;
And Rehoboam made Abijah the son of Maachah the chief,	Taku Reho̩boam fʼAbaija, o̩ma Maaka, chi kʼi chʼoji, kʼi chʼe̩nuto̩gba ef amo̩maye-wñ; todu ibe dʼef uwñ kʼi adʼu jʼonu.
What	E̩wñ chʼukpahiu-mi, kʼu nakibe̩nʼe̩wñ?
And Aaron shall offer his bullock of the sin offering, which	Tak Aro̩n adʼo̩kokuno̩ chʼiche̩bo̩ adure todu onugo o̩la-wñ, oñ i ache e̩wñ e̩boma tod o̩la e-wñ, kpai tod abunyi-wñ.
And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and thou shalt put them upon the two ends of the breastplate in the border thereof, which	Tak uwe̩ ki chʼelika o̩jamalia meji kʼe̩ ko e-le̩ jʼiba e̩wñ ube̩do̩ma mejeji, e̩ ko jʼeti-wñ ejefu kʼi kado e̩fo̩d le̩.
A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment:	E̩ne̩ e̩do̩fulu tabale agba udu-wñ;
esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures in Egypt: for he had respect unto the recompence of the reward.	Ina ku ma bu Kraisti chʼe̩wñ anana eju-wñ tʼe̩wñ akoko ane̩ Ijipti le, todu i mʼeju korʼuro̩me̩-wñ.
Moreover, my father, see, yea, see the skirt of thy robe in my hand: for in that I cut off the skirt of thy robe, and killed thee not, know thou and see that	Anubi e-le̩, ata-mi, go, ochochi, go eti otogbo-we̩ ki dʼef o̩wo̩-mi-i; todu eti otogbo-we̩ kʼu ko̩da kʼu ma dʼe̩ kpa n, e̩ ki ma kʼe̩ ño̩ li ka kʼe̩bie̩ne̩ abe̩k ada kʼu je̩ dʼef o̩wo̩-mi n, u la dʼe̩ re n, dagba kʼe̩ chaka kpala jo̩ anede oji-mi kʼe̩ dʼu.
And they shall go forth, and look upon the carcases of the men that have transgressed against me: for their worm shall not die, neither shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring unto all flesh.	Taku ma adufu ago oku amone̩ ku ma ko mi; todu ide̩-ma aku n, una-ma la alu n, oñ ma achʼe̩wñ o̩lajijili ñw o̩re̩la du.
But one in a certain place testified, saying,	Ama e̩ne̩ʼka ka pee ugboʼka kakini,
And the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, I bo̩ atulubo̩ okate kʼu nadu wa abʼi Fero kpai Ijipti oji ma ta; ubi e-le̩ tak i aje̩ ñwu me̩ kwʼemi alo: e̩gba kʼi aje̩ ñwu me̩ lo le̩ ene i ane me̩ kwʼemi hioko.
If I ascend up into heaven, thou	Iche̩wñ kʼu nate̩gu nyʼefojale, uwe̩ dʼo̩mo̩!
And their brethren the sons of Merari	Oñ amo̩maye-ma ku ma chʼamo̩ma Me̩rari jʼo̩wo̩ awohi-ma; Itan o̩ma Kishai, o̩ma Abdai, o̩ma Maluk,
This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me.	E̩ne̩-i chʼe̩ne̩ kʼu kʼo̩la-wñ kakini, E̩ne̩ke̩le̩ʼka dʼubi mi awa e-kʼi mud e̩ne̩ ki tʼo̩gba ñwu mi, todu i do̩mo̩ ejodudu tak omi do̩mo̩.
And all his servants passed on beside him; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites, and all the Gittites, six hundred men which came after him from Gath, passed on before the king.	Abuko̩lo̩-wñ chaka le akolo-wñ; abo Ke̩re̩t chaka kpʼabo Pe̩le̩f chaka kpʼabo Gat chaka, owñ chʼone̩ ulo̩gwa ku ma tʼo̩ ubi kwo Gat wa le̩ lale rʼo̩gba onu.
First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for you all, that your faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.	Ejodudu nagwʼO̩jo̩-mi ugwa lefu Jisus Kraisti todu me̩ chaka, todabu ku ma jʼadʼinabali e̩do̩ ekono-me̩ kpogo ugbo du ile̩-i.

whose voice then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying, Yet once more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.	Omuko̩la-wñ fʼane̩ miejo e̩gba le̩; i muda katane̩ fa-i me̩ kakini, I bo̩ onuʼka ta, kʼomi amiʼane̩ ile̩ kate ejo n, chai efojale kpoho.
In the five and twentieth year of our captivity, in the beginning of the year, in the tenth	O̩do̩ ogu nyoke me̩lu ku ma mu wa lo, e̩gba uchane̩ o̩do̩ le̩, o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩gwa ochu, owñ chʼo̩do̩ e̩ke̩gwe̩le̩ ku ma kpʼewo le̩ fo̩, eñeñini o̩jo̩ le̩, o̩wo̩ Jihofa nʼumi oji, oñ i mʼumi du nyʼomo̩.
And as some spake of the temple, how it was adorned with goodly stones and gifts, he said,	Tak abu kʼabo iche̩ka nʼo̩la unyi O̩jo̩ le̩ aka, alu ku ma nʼokuta o̩me̩me̩le̩ kpai e̩wñ kʼamone̩ kowa chʼo̩ñwe̩ nyʼu, i kakini,
And they have gathered together the money that was found in the house of the	Ma la mʼo̩ko̩ ku ma li ef unyi Jihofa ko dajane̩, ma la mʼu ko nyʼamafejute̩, kpʼabuko̩lo̩ le̩ o̩wo̩ me̩.
And when Haman saw that Mordecai bowed not, nor did him reverence, then was Haman full of wrath.	Tak e̩gba ku Heman li ka ku Mo̩rde̩kai ma te̩kpe̩ n, kʼi ma la dojikane̩ ñw u n, e̩gbale̩ Heman che̩ko̩ ñw e̩do̩fulu.
Now the birth of Jesus Christ was on this wise: When as his mother Mary was espoused to Joseph, before they came together, she was found with child of the Holy Ghost.	Oñ alu ku ma bi Kraisti la de̩ kakini, Abu ku ma mʼiye-wñ Me̩ri du kpe̩ Jose̩f, o̩gba taku ma wa dama kpʼo̩la-ma, ma li abu kʼi defu lugbo Afu Kiafo̩.
For we dare not make ourselves of the number, or compare ourselves with some that commend themselves: but they measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves among themselves, are not wise.	Todu e̩do̩-wa gbo kʼa dʼo̩la-wa tef abo iche̩ka ku ma je̩nyu ñw o̩la-ma le̩ n, a la dʼo̩la-wa wawe e-ma n. Ama abo le̩ ku ma jo̩ kpʼo̩la-ma añwa o̩la-ma, ku ma la jo̩ adʼo̩la-ma wawe o̩la-ma, eju-ma ne̩ n.
Yea, though they have hired among the nations, now will I gather them, and they shall sorrow a little for the burden of the king of princes.	Ochochi, dagba ma chaka faya ef abo uche̩ichi,
So thou, O son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto the house of Israel; therefore thou shalt hear the word at my mouth, and warn them from me.	O̩ma one̩, omi dʼuwe̩ chʼadide abo unyi Israe̩l; todule̩ uwe̩ ki gbʼo̩la alu-mi, kʼe̩ la juka ñw ma ñw ml.

On the same day it shall be eaten up; ye shall leave none of it until the morrow: I	Me̩ aje̩ kpa o̩jo̩ le̩ gbage̩de̩; me̩ ki tʼe-du no̩ gbʼodudu n: omi Jihofa de̩.

And there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.	Añmo̩ me̩fa la nyane̩ jʼo̩mo̩, teju alu kʼamaJu ache ku ma fʼe̩wñ gwe̩ hiolo, okoke-wñ aje̩ otube̩ me̩lu abe̩k e̩fa.

and he shall put the incense upon the fire before the	kʼi mʼe̩wñ ki akpo le̩ ko nyʼuna o̩gba Jihofa kʼodudu-wñ ki lewa abʼoj ugugu unyie̩do̩ ki nʼoj akpati ibenu le̩ ma, kʼi we eku;
He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death.	E̩ne̩ ki nʼeti ki nagbʼe̩wñ kʼAfu aka ñw ujeju ujeju abudo̩ Ondu-i. I la nʼugbo du kʼuku ekeji ache e̩ne̩ ki du abu du n.
and Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimhi;	kpai Adaya kpai Be̩raya kpai Shimrat la chʼamo̩ma Shimeai.

But as they sailed he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of wind on the lake; and they were filled	Oñ abu ku ma gwʼo̩ko̩ alo, olu fʼu mu; tak afu lile chane̩ eju bʼeju oduda le̩ ma, oñ o̩ko̩ la chane̩ eko̩ ñw omi, oñ ma gbali jo̩.

And without all contradiction the less is blessed of the better.	I la nʼiñwa n, e̩ne̩ ki tule ade̩nyo̩ ñw e-ki nya.
who shall also confirm you unto the end,	e-ki año̩ fʼume̩ lonyane̩ gbogbo wʼukpoji, ki we enʼugbo ku ma akʼalu nyʼume̩ o̩la iko o̩jo̩ Ondu-wa Jisusi Kraist.
But ye	Ame̩ muda adʼabe̩le̩ n; ama e̩ne̩ ki tule ef ume̩, owñ ki dabe̩ne̩ kʼi chʼimo̩to̩; oñ e̩ne̩ ki chʼagboji kʼi dabe̩ne̩ kʼi ache e̩wñ ñw one̩.
And when he that hath an issue is cleansed of his issue; then he shall number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.	Tak e̩gba kʼe̩ne̩ kʼi rʼe̩ño̩ le̩ ache kʼi fʼo̩la-wñ gworinyo̩ bʼe̩ño̩-wñ le̩ te̩, i abʼo̩jo̩ mebie ñw o̩la-wñ todu kʼi gwʼo̩la-wñ rinyo̩, oñ i agwe̩ e̩wñ o̩la-wñ; tak i agwe̩ o̩la-wñ onugo ef omiofo ki acha, tak i afe̩.
and they shall put upon it all the vessels thereof, wherewith they minister about it,	takuma akʼe̩wñ eku-wñ chaka jʼoji-wñ, owñ chʼe-ku ma ne̩ che e̩wñ o̩la-wñ, owñ chʼaido una-wñ kpai uko̩-wñ kpai uko̩che̩-wñ kpai ugba-wñ owñ chʼe̩wñ eku ubo̩ iche̩bo̩ le̩ chaka; taku ma akʼaño̩ e̩la omi nadala bʼoji-wñ ma, taku ma akʼoli ugbo̩lo̩-wñ tunyʼu.
Not as though I had already attained, either were already perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which also I am apprehended of Christ Jesus.	I cheka kʼomi gba ta n, u la mufu kpoji ta n: u muda abʼo̩ kpe̩re̩, ukani nadʼo̩wo̩ do e-ku Kraisti Jisus la dʼo̩wo̩ do mi tod uwñ le̩.
I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to them that know me:	Narʼomu do̩ Rehab kpai Babilo̩n
and she shall put the raiment of her captivity from off her, and shall remain in thine house, and bewail her father and her mother a full month: and after that thou shalt go in unto her, and be her husband, and she shall be thy wife. But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.	E̩ne̩ ki ache e̩wñ ochochi muda awʼugbo ugane̩, todu kʼuko̩lo̩-wñ kʼi ache ki tejugede kakini, Ef O̩jo̩ oñ i achuko̩lo̩ le̩.
And if ye have not been faithful in that which is another man's, who shall give you that which is your own?	I la che̩wñ ku me̩ ma chʼamachubi one̩ ef e̩wñ e̩nomune̩ n, e̩ne̩ adʼe̩wñ ñwu me̩ ku me̩ ne̩ chʼe̩-me̩?

Then said he unto me, Son of man, these	Tak i ka ñwu mi kakini, O̩ma one̩, abo-i ku ma ñwa ibe e̩wñ ibe̩te̩, ku ma la tohi bibi ef abo̩-hiala ewo-i jo̩-i;

Then the	Taku Jihofa ka ñwu Mose̩s kakini, E̩ nyʼugbo Fero kʼe̩ ka ñw u kakini, Abu ku Jihofa, O̩jo̩ e-amaHibru, ka de̩ kakini, E̩ ki tʼamone̩-mi no̩ ku ma re̩ mi.
He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay,	I mʼumi du kwef ura ugbo kʼekuku de̩,
and that the passages are stopped, and the reeds they have burned with fire, and the men of war are affrighted.	ma fʼo̩na o̩na-wñ kpa,
The Horims also dwelt in Seir beforetime; but the children of Esau succeeded them, when they had destroyed them from before them, and dwelt in their stead; as Israel did unto the land of his possession, which the	Abo Ho̩r ño̩ dodo Seir o̩gbo̩gba, ama amo̩ma Iso̩ gbʼe̩gu-ma je̩, ma fʼuma chile̩che̩ kwʼo̩gba-ma, taku ma kwododo o̩mo̩ koji ma, alu kʼabo Israe̩l che kpai ane̩ ki Jihofa ko ñwu ma ku ma ne̩.)
The impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.	E̩ne̩gbo le̩ dohi ñw u kakini, Odu-mi, u nʼone̩ ki adu mi rikpolo tef abukpe̩ omi-i e̩gba kʼomi-wñ amiejo n; ama e̩gba du kʼu le kʼu wa e̩nomune̩ agwo̩ru o̩gba mi.
And Amram took him Jochebed his father's sister to wife; and she bare him Aaron and Moses: and the years of the life of Amram	Amram la ne̩ Jo̩kebe̩d, o̩maye ata-wñ, chʼo̩ya, owñ le̩ fʼAro̩n kpai Mose̩s bi ñw u; o̩do̩ udeju Amram la chʼo̩gbo̩ me̩fa nyoke me̩gwebie.

and all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.	Abe̩le̩ o̩jo̩ Kenan chaka du la chʼo̩do̩ icham nyʼogume̩lu nyoke me̩gwa; tak i leku.
And Isaiah said, Take a lump of figs. And they took and laid	Tak Aizaya kakini, Mʼe̩bo̩ ero o̩gbaikolo du. Taku ma mʼu du nʼikete̩ o̩ko̩-wñ oñ i muye.
And the Gentiles shall see thy righteousness, and all kings thy glory: and thou shalt be called by a new name, which the mouth of the	Tak abo uche̩ichi uche̩ichi ali o̩kpakpa-we̩,
namely	Ewo le̩ che Bize̩r ane̩ egbili chʼutod abo Rube̩n, Ramo̩t-gilead chʼutod abo Gad, Golan Beshan la chʼutod abo Manasa.

And the child Samuel ministered unto the	Oñ Samiue̩l imo̩to̩ le̩ nache e̩wñ ñwu Jihofa eju Ilai. Iko le̩ o̩la Jihofa aña; ane̩ ego chʼo̩gbe̩nugbe̩ n.
and James the	kpai Jeme̩s e-Ze̩be̩di kpai Jo̩n o̩maye Jeme̩s; i la mʼodu Boane̩rje̩s, kʼofe-wñ chʼAmo̩ma Akpabana, du manyu ma;
But unto the place which the	Me̩ ki muda tejane̩ ugbo ki Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩ adu oj ane̩ abo o̩lo̩pu olo̩pu-me̩ kʼi du odu-wñ tʼo̩mo̩, ku me̩ fʼugbo kʼi agugu che o̩mo̩;
And	I nʼe̩gba kʼakpa le̩ do̩mo̩ akwʼolane̩ nyʼodudu; tak e̩gba ku ma mʼakpa du kwʼo̩mo̩ odudu, ma kwane̩ ule̩-ma, dagba i chʼo̩ro̩kaʼka kpai oduʼka taku ma mʼakpa le̩ du, ma kwane̩ ule̩-ma.
And Isaiah said unto Hezekiah, Hear the word of the	Tak Aizaya ka ñwu He̩ze̩kaya kakini, E̩ nagbʼo̩la ki Jihofa ka.
But I	Ama omi muda chʼe̩no̩bata kpai e̩ne̩ iwo̩;
For he clave to the	Todu owñ yamo̩ Jihofa, i kwo bʼo̩ ubi te̩ n; i la ño̩ de uko̩ uko̩ kʼi te̩, owñ chʼe-ki Jihofa ñwa ñwu Mose̩s le̩.
But the multitude of the city was divided: and part held with the Jews, and part with the apostles.	Tak o̩wo̩ amone̩ ewo le̩ mukpe̩reji; iche̩ka manyu amaju, iche̩ka la manyʼame̩nukpuche̩.
And when Joshua had let the people go, the children of Israel went every man unto his inheritance to possess the land.	E̩gba ki Jo̩shua je̩ ñw amone̩ le̩ muchi, tak e̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ne̩ abo Israe̩l nyʼugbo e̩wñ ogu e-wñ, ku ma mʼane̩ le̩ gba.
choosing rather to suffer affliction with the people of God, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a season;	ebʼamone̩ O̩jo̩ li e̩bie̩ne̩ chʼe-kʼi du tʼe̩ne̩ e̩do̩ e̩bo̩ e-adure ki ma kpo̩kpe̩ n le.
And they sing the song of Moses the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying, Great and marvellous	Oñ ma nʼeli Mose̩s adu O̩jo̩ le̩ kpʼeli O̩mala ako̩, ma kakini,
he is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and strifes of words, whereof cometh envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings,	mak i fʼafu mu nyʼefu de̩, i mʼe̩wñ du n, chai o̩ga ugbo ene ete̩ kpai uja noj o̩la ki kwef alu ofo i ache le̩, e-le̩ anyʼelie̩na te̩ kpai uja eja kpai echakpabie̩ e̩wñ kpai ibe-bibi ekpe̩
Behold, it is come, and it is done, saith the Lord	Go, i awa, i la ache, Ondu Jihofa ka-i; O̩jo̩ kʼomi te̩tako̩la-wñ tane̩ le̩ de̩.
	O Jihofa, eli mi eju kʼe̩ li mi eju,
And Jonathan answered and said to Adonijah, Verily our lord king David hath made Solomon king.	Taku Jonatan dohi ka ñw Adonija kakini, Ochochi, odu-wa, onu Defid, mu So̩lo̩mo̩n du jʼonu me̩;
even	alu kʼo̩wo̩-wñ tu le̩ oka-wñ chʼutodu iche̩bo̩ adure, ekeji-wñ la chʼutodu iche̩bo̩ e̩gujo manyʼe̩wñ ele kʼi aduwa le̩; oñ atama la ache e̩wñ e̩boma o̩gba Jihofa tod e̩ne̩ ku ma che ku mu gwo̩la rinyo̩ le̩.
I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all	Ufʼuko̩lo̩ du ku ma che o̩gane̩ olu-i li me̩. Go, e̩wñ du la chʼo̩wai, enʼafu ule ofo i che.

Wherefore? because I love you not? God knoweth.	Tod e̩wñ? Todabu kʼu ma fe̩do̩ me̩ n? O̩jo̩ ma.
For they that say such things declare plainly that they seek a country.	Todu abo ku ma nʼo̩la e̩wñ abe̩-i aka adutejugede kakini, Ma tene ane̩ e-ma.
And she said, Who would have said unto Abraham, that Sarah should have given children suck? for I have born	I laño̩ kakini, E̩ne̩ ma ka ñw Ebraham ka ki Sara adʼe̩nya ñw o̩ma ñmo̩? Todu u la fʼo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ bi ñw u o̩jo̩ ogijo-wñ.
And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.	Tak i nyʼejefu ugbo Hega, oñ i fʼefunyo̩; tak e̩gba kʼi li ka kʼi fʼefunyo̩, odu-wñ ño̩ wʼo̩ eju ge̩ n.
And he received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which	oñ i mʼujiwe e̩pi-eda gba kʼi chʼuhiuko̩ o̩kpakpa e-e̩do̩ ekono kʼi ne̩ ef e̩pi-odukulu-wñ; kʼowñ ki chʼata abo du ku ma ake̩do̩no ef e̩pi-odukulu, ku ma ki fʼo̩kpakpa loru ñwu ma;
Then all the princes of the sea shall come down from their thrones, and lay away their robes, and put off their broidered garments: they shall clothe themselves with trembling; they shall sit upon the ground, and shall tremble at	E̩gbale̩ amidachi ohimini abadi chaka agwo̩ru kwʼoj ede-ma tane̩; ma la akʼotogbo-ma jʼane̩, ma la agwʼukpo-ma ku ma chiya nyʼu bʼo̩la te̩; ma ako o̩la ega bʼo̩la ma; ma aguane̩pe̩te̩, o̩la-ma agagogodo e̩gba du, oñ ugoju-we̩ amu ma da.
The caldrons also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the bowls, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.	Ma ño̩ mʼucha-wñ kpʼuko̩che̩-wñ kpʼalapa ku ma ne̩ ñw owu agege che kpʼugba-wñ kpʼuko̩de̩-wñ kpʼe̩wñ eku du ku ma nʼebije ikpa che e-ku ma ne̩ che e̩wñ ñw u ko kwʼo̩mo̩.
So he departed thence, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who	Tak i kwʼo̩mo̩ le, oñ i fʼE̩laisha, o̩ma Shafat, li abu kʼi do̩mo̩ aluche̩. Amokuno̩ kʼoli uno̩lo̩ nʼuma o̩lo̩ eji eji ugbo me̩gweji jʼo̩gba-wñ. Owñ la dʼugbo e̩ke̩gweji-ma le̩. Tak E̩laija lale ugbo-wñ, oñ i mʼukpo ko ro̩ bʼo̩ oji ma.
And they shall not sell of it, neither exchange, nor alienate the firstfruits of the land: for	Ma la adʼe-du ef uwñ ta n, ma la adʼu kpailo̩ n; ma la aje̩ ñw e̩ne̩ omune̩ ki nʼejo̩ga ane̩-i n; todu i a fo̩ todu Jihofa.
Grace	Ufe̩de̩nyo̩ ki dʼugbo abo du ku ma fe̩do̩ Ondu-wa Jisus Kraist kpʼufe̩do̩ ki ma chʼe-ekado̩na n.
And he sought God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the visions of God: and as long as he sought the	Oñ i dʼe̩do̩-wñ te̩ etene O̩jo̩ iko Ze̩karaya kʼi che̩moji ef e̩wñ O̩jo̩ e̩li. Oñ gbogbo abu kʼi atene Jihofa, O̩jo̩ je̩ ñw u ra ñw u.
Then I went to Euphrates, and digged, and took the girdle from the place where I had hid it: and, behold, the girdle was marred, it was profitable for nothing.	Tak u le tʼeti Yufretis, oñ u mʼu du gwadufu, u mʼe̩wñ ulago le̩ ko kwʼugbo kʼu du maja te̩. E̩ la go, ukpo ulago le̩ mukpabie̩; i nyo̩ e̩wñ du n.
Will he reprove thee for fear of thee?	Ukpe̩ kʼe̩ railo-wñ, oñ i adejurʼe̩,
I write unto you, fathers, because ye have known him	Nakʼo̩takada rʼume̩, abogijo, ukpe̩ kʼame̩ te̩tama e̩ne̩ ki do̩mo̩ kwʼabakwane̩ le̩. Nakʼo̩takada rʼume̩, abokolobia, ukpe̩ kʼame̩ fʼe̩ne̩bibi le̩ du me̩. U fʼo̩takada ko̩ rʼume̩, abimo̩to̩, ukpe̩ kʼame̩ te̩tama Ata.
And Moses besought the	Mose̩s muda gbo̩ko̩bo̩ Jihofa, O̩jo̩-wñ, oñ i kakini, O Jihofa, e̩wñ chi kʼuwe̩do̩-we̩ mutajo bʼamone̩-we̩ e-kʼuwe̩ nʼukpahiu ki nana kpai o̩wo̩ ki gbiti ko ma kwʼane̩ Ijipti wa ma una una-i taa?
And there was there an herd of many swine feeding on the mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter into them. And he suffered them.	Amoko wewe la dujo̩ oj uwo o̩mo̩ ajije̩; oñ ma gbo̩ko̩bʼo̩ todu kʼi je̩ ñwu ma nyʼef abʼe-le̩. Tak i je̩ ñwu ma.
For the scripture saith unto Pharaoh, Even for this same purpose have I raised thee up, that I might shew my power in thee, and that my name might be declared throughout all the earth.	Todu O̩takada O̩la O̩jo̩ ka ñwu Fero kakini, Tod e̩wñ-i gbage̩de̩ oñ u dʼuwe̩ kwane̩-i, owñ chʼutodu kʼu dʼukpahiu-mi ñe̩ña ef uwe̩, todu ku ma ki dʼodu-mi kpogo ugbo du ane̩ ile̩-i.
The new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merryhearted do sigh.	Omi achiwebe̩te̩ma etito̩ adaido̩,
Is any thing too hard for the	E̩wñʼka do̩mo̩ ki firu Jihofa? Iko kʼu da le̩ nadabi wʼugbo we̩, owñ chʼiko-i o̩do̩ omune̩ oñ Sara ane̩ o̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩.

there went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.	ma le tef o̩ko̩ ugbo Noa eji eji, o̩ko̩ kpai ole, alu kʼO̩jo̩ ñwa ñwu Noa.
