Neither hath Samaria committed half of thy sins; but thou hast multiplied thine abominations more than they, and hast justified thy sisters in all thine abominations which thou hast done.	Samaria la dure tʼukpe̩reji adure e-we̩ n. Uwe̩ muda aje̩ ñw e̩wñ ihie̩ne̩-we̩ ki wewe nyo̩gba tʼuma le, oñ e̩ dale ñw amo̩maye-we̩ onobule ugbo e̩wñ ihie̩ne̩ du kʼe̩ che le̩.
with twelve hundred chariots, and threescore thousand horsemen: and the people	I nʼo̩kogu icham nyʼulo̩ko̩, kpai amananya icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ o̩gbo̩ me̩ta. Amone̩ ku ma lebʼo̩ kwʼIjipti wa nʼaluka n: Amilibia, kpʼAmisuki kpʼabo Itio̩pia.
But the man that	Ama e̩ne̩ kʼo̩la-wñ fe̩, kʼi ma la dʼule̩ n, kʼi la we ede Elaloji, ma akʼonugo e̩ne̩ le̩ da bʼef amone̩-wñ te̩, todabu kʼi ma dʼe̩wñ O̩jo̩ wa ñwu Jihofa iko-wñ ku ma date̩ n. E̩ne̩ le̩ ane̩ adure-wñ.
who was delivered for our offences, and was raised again for our justification.	owñ ku ma mudu ñwu ma mu lef uñwanane̩-wa, ku ma la mʼu du kwane̩ lef ale ku ma da ñw a.
but bade them farewell, saying, I must by all means keep this feast that cometh in Jerusalem: but I will return again unto you, if God will. And he sailed from Ephesus.	Ama i che ma agbo, i kakini, O̩jo̩ je̩, nañʼadabi wʼugbo me̩. I tʼo̩ko̩ kwo E̩fe̩sus.
Zedekiah	O̩do̩ Ze̩de̩kaya la chʼogu nyokeʼka e̩gba kʼi chane̩ ejʼonu; oñ i je̩ o̩do̩ me̩gwaka Je̩rusale̩m. Odu iye-wñ la ko̩ Hamiutal o̩ma Je̩re̩maya e-Libna.

God judgeth the righteous,	O̩jo̩ akpʼoji ajo̩ ame̩no̩kpakpa,
now therefore let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may be before thee for ever: for thou blessest, O	Fai i ki la nyʼuwe̩ eju kʼe̩ dʼe̩nyo̩ ñw unyi adu-we̩ todu ki dʼo̩gba-we̩ ogbegbele̩: todu uwe̩, O Jihofa, mʼe̩nyo̩ du ñw u me̩, i la anʼe̩nyo̩ le̩ ogbegbele̩.

Who	E̩ne̩ du ki dʼefu-me̩ ku me̩ chʼabo-wñ chaka, O̩jo̩-wñ ki dʼugbo-wñ, kʼi la te̩gu nyi Je̩rusale̩m e-ki dʼojane̩ Juda le̩, kʼi ko̩ unyi Jihofa, O̩jo̩ e-Israe̩l, owñ le̩ chʼO̩jo̩, e-ki de̩ Je̩rusale̩m.

And this	E̩wñ ku me̩ ache de̩ kakini, Me̩ ki mʼaboke̩le̩ du kpai abobule̩ du ku ma bʼe̩ne̩ke̩le̩ dachi kojo̩ ñw O̩jo̩ hioko
Circumcise therefore the foreskin of your heart, and be no more stiffnecked.	Todule̩ me̩ nakʼaño̩ ki bʼoji e̩pi e-e̩do̩-me̩ ma da, me̩ ki ño̩ fʼo̩lo̩ lo ge̩ n.
And my God put into mine heart to gather together the nobles, and the rulers, and the people, that they might be reckoned by genealogy. And I found a register of the genealogy of them which came up at the first, and found written therein,	Oñ O̩jo-mi du tʼe̩do̩-mi kʼu fʼabo-jima kpai amachimo̩la igo̩bina kpai amone̩ do̩ jeju, ku ma fʼaluka-ma lo o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu. Tak u fʼo̩takada o̩lo̩pu o̩lo̩pu abo ku ma te̩gu wa ejodudu le̩ li, oñ u li alu ku ma ko ef uwñ kakini.
For I will punish them that dwell in the land of Egypt, as I have punished Jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence:	Todu omi abʼudu ñw abo ku ma gugu oj ane̩ Ijipti, alu kʼu bu ñwu Je̩rusale̩m, lʼalu o̩kwo̩chageli kpai ukpo̩ta kpʼe̩wñ ibi.
and caused me to pass by them round about: and, behold,	Tak i je̩ ñwu mi lale gu ef uwñ du ugbo tʼugbo du. E̩ la go, i la wewe tabale ef o̩go̩ ki te̩ gbaa le̩; e̩ la go, i la chʼe̩gbe̩ nana.
And Jephthah came to Mizpeh unto his house, and, behold, his daughter came out to meet him with timbrels and with dances: and she	Taku Je̩fta lewa Mizpe unyi-wñ le̩; e̩ la go, o̩ma-wñ onobule̩ nʼeicha kpai ido eta aledʼo; owñ la chʼo̩ma kate kʼi ne̩; i nʼo̩ma e̩ne̩ke̩le̩ abe̩k onobule̩ du tʼowñ le n.
Lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O house of Israel, saith the	Go, omi akʼabo uche̩ichiʼka kwʼo̩najiji wa
The same dealt subtilly with our kindred, and evil entreated our fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they might not live.	Owñ le̩ chʼugbeju nyʼabo̩lo̩pu-wa, i chʼamata-wa e̩bie̩ne̩ kʼama ki kʼamo̩me̩kpa-ma jo̩ ku ma ki we enʼiñmi.
And for these ye shall be unclean: whosoever toucheth the carcase of them shall be unclean until the even.	Lugbo abo e-le̩ o̩la-me̩ adaji; e̩ne̩ du kʼo̩la-wñ kado oku-ma, o̩la-wñ adaji gbogbo tak olu tunyʼane̩,
and he said, Behold now, my lords, turn in, I pray you, into your servant's house, and tarry all night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on your ways. And they said, Nay; but we will abide in the street all night.	oñ i kakini, Me̩ go ta, amodu-mi, nagbo̩ko̩bʼume̩, me̩ na tʼunyi adu-me̩-i, ku me̩ le̩, ku me̩ fʼe̩re̩-me̩ gwe̩; taku me̩ takpa kwane̩ odudu ku me̩ lo me̩. Oñ ma kakini, O̩da; a ale̩ ñw o̩jo̩ opee o̩do̩da emi.
Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and	I ño̩ we̩do̩rʼamonuku Job me̩ta le̩ ukpe̩ ku ma ma li ohi du n, ma la kpa Job abi kpo̩.
Forasmuch then as God gave them the like gift as	Todule̩ iche̩wñ kʼO̩jo̩ mʼe-ʼle̩ du ñwu ma e̩go̩ alu kʼi du ñw a kpo̩ho̩ e̩gba kʼa ke̩do̩nʼOndu Jisus Kraisti le̩, e̩ne̩ omi che kʼu neke kpo̩na nyʼO̩jo̩?
If Balak would give me his house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the commandment of the	Dagba ku Bele̩k ki kʼajifa kpai o̩jamalia e̩ko̩ unyi-wñ ñw mi, u ma neke daba o̩la ku Jihofa nʼalu-wñ ka, kʼu nache e̩nyo̩ abe̩k e̩bie̩ne̩ kpai e̩do̩ e-mi n? E̩wñ ki Jihofa ka, i chʼe-le̩ naka n?
Thus Israel dwelt in the land of the Amorites.	Abe̩le̩ Israe̩l kwogugu ane̩ abo Amo̩r.
And he measured the breadth of the entry of the gate, ten cubits;	Tak i fʼunabe̩ alu o̩na ñwa, ohibo̩wo̩ me̩gwa; kpʼujiji alaku-wñ, i chʼohibo̩wo̩ me̩gwe̩ta.
And he said, Throw her down. So they threw her down: and	Tak i kakini, Dʼonobule̩ le̩ ro̩ nʼane̩. Abe̩le̩ ma mʼu du ro nʼane̩; e̩bie̩-wñ nʼe-ki ta nyʼo̩la o̩do̩ kpʼe-ki tanyʼo̩la amanya; tak i fʼowñ kpetili mʼane̩.
Let him take his rod away from me,	I ki mʼo̩kpa-wñ du bʼumi o̩la te̩,
Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him,	Anubi e-le̩ Jisus fʼu li ef unyi O̩jo̩, oñ i ka ñw u kakini, Go, e̩ mudabi tiko me̩; e̩ ki ño̩ dure ge̩ n, tode̩gba kʼe̩wñ ki bie̩ne̩ tule ake̩re̩bʼe̩.
And now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto Jerusalem, not knowing the things that shall befall me there:	Fai, me̩ la go, nanyi Je̩rusale̩m abu kʼomi chʼe̩ji te̩ ñw afu, u la ma e̩wñ ki ake̩re̩bʼumi o̩mo̩ n:

and the graves were opened; and many bodies of the saints which slept arose,	Tak ojinoji ojinoji mʼalu chi te̩, oñ año̩la abo kiafo̩ wewe ku ma mʼolu du kwane̩;
And he said unto him, Behold now,	Tak i dohi ñw u kakini, Go ta, e̩ne̩ O̩jo̩ʼka dʼewo-i, e̩ne̩ ku ma bʼojima mʼo̩ i che; e̩wñ du kʼi aka awache̩ chuu. A ki nyʼo̩mo̩ ta; ikani i neke ka ule̩ e̩wñ kʼa ale-i ñw a.
So we boiled my son, and did eat him: and I said unto her on the next day, Give thy son, that we may eat him: and she hath hid her son.	Abe̩le̩ a fʼo̩ma-mi hi oñ a mʼu du je̩; tak o̩jo̩ñwa-wñ u ka ñw u kakini, Dʼo̩ma-we̩ wa kʼa mʼu du je̩; i la mʼo̩ma e-wñ du maja.

I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder:	U gugu to̩ko̩o̩, oñ i fʼumi guche̩ meji;
And, behold, seven thin ears and blasted with the east wind sprung up after them.	Me̩ la go, acha mebie ki chʼekwire̩ e-kʼafu olodudu fʼu gʼuna ño̩ kwane̩ tʼo̩ ubi.
And Gideon said, Therefore when the	Taku Gideon kakini, E̩gba ki Jihofa mu Zeba kpai Zalmuna ko nyʼumi o̩wo̩, e̩gba le̩ nanʼikeke kpʼiñwa aje̩tachi-i gwu me̩ año̩la alu ku ma gwu o̩ka.
Neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.	Ma la adʼuna tʼagege ku ma dʼu gugu of agba n, chai oj akete; tak i amʼane̩ ne̩ ñw abo du ku ma jʼef unyi le̩.
But thou, son of man, hear what I say unto thee; Be not thou rebellious like that rebellious house: open thy mouth, and eat that I give thee. A wise man	Anibe nʼukpahiu,
And through covetousness shall they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not, and their damnation slumbereth not. And he said unto his brethren, My money is restored; and, lo,	Tak i ka ñw amo̩maye-wñ kakini, O̩ko̩-mi mudabi wa me̩; go i dʼef akpulu-mi-i! tak e̩do̩-ma mudeji, ma rejuda go o̩la-ma, o̩la-ma aga, ma kakini, E̩wñ chʼe-kʼO̩jo̩ che wa-i?

And Saul said unto him, Why have ye conspired against me, thou and the son of Jesse, in that thou hast given him bread, and a sword, and hast enquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as at this day?	Taku So̩l ka ñw u kakini, E̩wñ chi kʼame̩ fʼalu jo̩ nyʼumi, uwe̩ kpai o̩ma Je̩si le̩? For thus saith the Lord	Todu abu kʼOndu Jihofa ka de̩ kakini, Go, omi adu we̩ tʼef o̩wo̩ abo kʼe̩ chulaka ma-i, owñ chʼef o̩wo̩ abo kʼonugo-we̩ muke̩che̩ ubi bʼo̩ te̩ le̩.
And afterward all the children of Israel came nigh: and he gave them in commandment all that the	Ubi le̩ tak amo̩ma Israe̩l chaka te̩me̩rʼu, tak i mʼo̩la du ki Jihofa ka ñw u oj uwo Sainai ko ñwu ma kʼi chʼe̩wñ kʼO̩jo̩ ñwa ñwu ma.

But the men that went up with him said, We be not able to go up against the people; for they	Ama aboke̩le̩ ku ma lebʼo̩ nyʼo̩mo̩ kakini, A neke nyʼakobʼamone̩ le̩ n; todu ama gbiti tʼuwa le.

And Uriah said unto David, The ark, and Israel, and Judah, abide in tents; and my lord Joab, and the servants of my lord, are encamped in the open fields; shall I then go into mine house, to eat and to drink, and to lie with my wife?	Tak Uraya ka ñwu Defid kakini, Akpati O̩jo̩, kpʼabo Israe̩l, kpʼabo Juda jʼef ala ala le̩; odu-mi, Joab, kpʼabuko̩lo̩ odu-mi ru jo̩ egbili gbaa; tak omi anyʼunyi-mi aje̩ e̩wñ, añmo̩, kʼu ño̩ bʼo̩ya-mi dachi? I	Omi che Jihofa, O̩jo̩-me̩, kʼu ko me̩ kwʼoj ane̩ Ijipti dufu kʼu chʼO̩jo̩-me̩: omi Jihofa O̩jo̩-me̩ de̩.

And he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.	I fʼo̩la-i ka ejugede. Taku Pita mʼu du i chane̩ edejurʼu.
Moreover thou shalt provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God, men of truth, hating covetousness; and place	Uwe̩ ki ño̩ tu amone̩ le̩ kʼe̩ chi aboke̩le̩ ku ma bʼe̩wñ-i jo̩, kʼama la bʼe̩gahi O̩jo̩, aboke̩le̩ ochochi, kʼe̩wñ e̩gbaje̩ chʼe̩wñ ulaka-ma; e̩ ki ko ma nyʼabo abe̩i o̩wo̩, kʼama ki chʼamagboji one̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩ icham nyʼo̩gwo̩ko̩, kpai amagboji ogu me̩lu, ogume̩lu, kpai amagboji one̩ ooje ooje, kpai amagboji one̩ me̩gwa e̩gwa.
And he carved all the walls of the house round about with carved figures of cherubims and palm trees and open flowers, within and without.	I la fʼina ko̩ nyu o̩lo̩do̩ unyi le̩ du daka, ejefu-wñ kpai ejo̩do̩da-wñ, ina-wñ chʼuwo̩li iche̩rub, kpai oli ki dab e̩kpe, kpai ododo ki mutu.

And they smote the Philistines that day from Michmash to Aijalon: and the people were very faint.	Ma la fʼabo Filistia kpa o̩jo̩ le̩ akwo Mikmash gbogbo wa kad Aija-lo̩n. Uhia la fʼamone̩ le̩ hia tabale;
He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap.	E̩ne̩ ki agʼej afu afiʼe̩yo̩ tuka n;
Serug, Nahor, Terah,	Sirug, Neho̩r, Te̩ra,
Whosoever abideth in him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen him, neither known him.	E̩ne̩ du ki chʼagugu ef uwñ adure n; e̩ne̩ ki chʼache e̩wñ adure li owñ mama ta n, i la mʼowñ n.
Be not hasty to go out of his sight: stand not in an evil thing; for he doeth whatsoever pleaseth him.	e̩ ki naju kʼe̩ kwo bʼeju-wñ te̩ n; e̩ ki jukutʼe̩wñ e̩bie̩ne̩ n, todu i ache e̩wñ ki rʼowñ eju.

What then? Israel hath not obtained that which he seeketh for; but the election hath obtained it, and the rest were blinded	E̩wñ le̩ ta? O̩wo̩ abo Israe̩l la tu e̩wñ ku ma tene le̩ n; o̩wo̩ abo ku ma chi le̩ tʼu, i muda chi nyʼabo ki bo̩ o̩la,
Were not the Ethiopians and the Lubims a huge host, with very many chariots and horsemen? yet, because thou didst rely on the	Abo Itiopia kpʼabo Libia chʼabogu wewe n? O̩kogu-ma kpʼamananya-ma la wewe tabale n? Oñ ukpe̩ kʼe̩ la chubiyo̩ Jihofa i mʼuma ko nyʼuwe̩ o̩wo̩.
For there is nothing covered, that shall not be revealed; neither hid, that shall not be known.	I nʼe̩wñ du ku ma kʼe̩wñ bʼo ma ku ma ma abi rʼeju ni n, kpʼe̩wñ kʼi maja ku ma ma ama ni n.

And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.	Tak O̩jo̩ do̩ agbagba le̩ ko̩ efojale. Oñ ane̩ do̩mo̩, odudu la do̩mo̩, o̩jo̩ ekeji.

Redeem Israel, O God, out of all his troubles.	O O̩jo̩ mʼIsrae̩l gba tane̩,
And there was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name	Oñ e̩ne̩ Zoraʼka do̩mo̩, abo o̩lo̩pu Dan i la che, odu-wñ ko̩ Manoa; o̩ya-wñ la chʼagaji, i la bi o̩ma n.
I have likened the daughter of Zion to a comely and delicate	Nakʼe̩ne̩ ki fe̩reju ki de̩ de̩wu de̩wu le̩,
He that is greedy of gain troubleth his own house;	E̩ne̩ ki ajakpa e̩wñ aje̩ ñw unyi-wñ onugo ñmi n,
But who may abide the day of his coming? and who shall stand when he appeareth? for he	E̩ne̩ muda abʼo̩jo̩ ewa-wñ jo̩? I kwo tejugede, e̩ne̩ adago? Todu owñ dab una utolo ki ayo̩ ebije kpai o̩che̩ ku ma du gwʼukpo;
Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we shall be saved from wrath through him.	Todule̩, abu ku ma fʼale da ñw a ef e̩bie̩-wñ fai me̩, mak ejadu ku ma ajadu wa kwo bʼuwe̩do̩ te̩ lef uwñ atule ololo.
Even so, Father: for so it seemed good in thy sight.	I-i, Ata-mi, todu abe̩le̩ i rʼuwe̩ eju.
Then went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but,	Todule̩ o̩la le̩ kwodufu tef amo̩maye le̩ kakini, Ako̩che̩ kide̩ aku n; Jisus muda aka ñw u ka kʼi aku n in, chai, Iche̩wñ ki dʼumi e̩do̩ kʼi gugu gbogbo tak u wa, o̩wo̩-we̩ do̩?
who bare record of the word of God, and of the testimony of Jesus Christ, and of all things that he saw.	kʼi gbʼo̩lO̩jo̩ Ibenu, kʼi ño̩ chʼe̩nibenu Jisusi Kraist ugbo aluka e̩wñ du kʼi li.
in that thou lovest thine enemies, and hatest thy friends. For thou hast declared this day, that thou regardest neither princes nor servants: for this day I perceive, that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it had pleased thee well.	owñ chʼabu ku we̩ fe̩do̩ abo ku ma chulaka we̩, kʼe̩ la chʼulaka abo ku ma fe̩do̩ we̩. And Hezekiah was glad of them, and shewed them the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.	Oñ He̩ze̩kaya yo̩ ñw ma, i la dʼunyi e̩wñ akoko-wñ ña ma, tʼajifa-wñ, kpʼo̩jamalia kpʼe̩wñ ido̩ro̩ kpʼekpo ki nʼaja kpʼunyi e̩wñ ido̩na ogu-wñ chaka, owñ chʼe̩wñ du ki jʼef unyi e̩wñ akoko-wñ. Now as soon as this letter cometh to you, seeing your master's sons	Fai ababa kʼo̩takada-i lewa ugbo me̩, abu kʼamo̩ma odu-me̩ jʼugbo me̩ le̩, kʼo̩ko̩ gu jʼugbo me̩ kpai amanya kpʼewo ki nʼalaku kpʼe̩wñ ido̩na ogu;
Seven days ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the	Me̩ ki ko e̩wñ wa ñwu Jihofa lugbo una gbogbo o̩jo̩ mebie; o̩jo̩ e̩ke̩jo̩-wñ ki chʼujeju kiafo̩ ñwu me̩, oñ me̩ akʼe̩wñ wa ñwu Jihofa lugbo una; ujeju eju ekpa i che; me̩ ki chʼuko̩lo̩ akanya du n.

Among the gods	I nʼe̩ne̩ du kʼi dab uwe̩ ef amo̩jo̩ n, O Ondu,
When I was a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things.	E̩gba kʼu chʼo̩me̩kpa u ko̩la o̩me̩kpa, u nibe o̩me̩kpa, u lo e̩wñ o̩me̩kpa; ama abu kʼu mud o̩kone̩ u fʼe̩wñ o̩me̩kpa gbogili te̩.
